Entities.Name: MarketRoleKind
Entities.Description: Kind of market role an organisation can have. This list is not exhausted, as other roles may exist.

Attributes.Name: energyServiceConsumer
Attributes.Description: Energy service consumer.

Attributes.Name: transmissionServiceProvider
Attributes.Description: Transmission service provider.

Attributes.Name: balancingAuthority
Attributes.Description: Balancing authority.

Attributes.Name: competitiveRetailer
Attributes.Description: Competitive retailer.

Attributes.Name: BillingAgent
Attributes.Description: The party responsible for invoicing a concerned party.

Attributes.Name: GridOperator
Attributes.Description: A party that operates one or more grids.

Attributes.Name: complianceMonitor
Attributes.Description: Compliance monitor.

Attributes.Name: InterconnectionTradeResponsible
Attributes.Description: Is a Balance Responsible Party or depends on one. They are recognized by the Nomination Validator for the nomination of already allocated capacity. Additional information: This is a type of Balance Responsible Party.

Attributes.Name: generatorOwner
Attributes.Description: Generator merchant owner.

Attributes.Name: MeteredDataCollector
Attributes.Description: A party responsible for meter reading and quality control of the reading.

Attributes.Name: MeteredDataResponsible
Attributes.Description: A party responsible for the establishment and validation of metered data based on the collected data received from the Metered Data Collector. The party is responsible for the history of metered data for a Metering Point.

Attributes.Name: BlockEnergyTrader
Attributes.Description: A party that is selling or buying energy on a firm basis (a fixed volume per market time period).

Attributes.Name: CapacityTrader
Attributes.Description:
A party that has a contract to participate in the Capacity Market to acquire capacity through a Transmission Capacity Allocator.

The capacity may be acquired on behalf of an Interconnection Trade Responsible or for sale on secondary capacity markets.

Attributes.Name: generatorOperator
Attributes.Description: Generator merchant operator.

Attributes.Name: CapacityCoordinator
Attributes.Description: A party, acting on behalf of the System Operators involved, responsible for establishing a coordinated Offered Capacity and/or Net Transfer Capacity (NTC) and/or Available Transfer Capacity (ATC) between several Market Balance Areas.

Attributes.Name: ControlAreaOperator
Attributes.Description:
Responsible for :
1. The coordination of exchange programs between its related Market Balance Areas and for the exchanges between its associated Control Areas.
2. The load frequency control for its own area.
3. The coordination of the correction of time deviations.

Attributes.Name: MeterAdministrator
Attributes.Description: A party responsible for keeping a database of meters.

Attributes.Name: transmissionOperator
Attributes.Description: Transmission operator.

Attributes.Name: Consumer
Attributes.Description: A party that consumes electricity. Additional information: This is a Type of Party Connected to the Grid.

Attributes.Name: MeteredDataAggregator
Attributes.Description: A party responsible for the establishment and qualification of metered data from the Metered Data Responsible. This data is aggregated according to a defined set of market rules.

Attributes.Name: ProductionResponsibleParty
Attributes.Description: A party who can be brought to rights, legally and financially, for any imbalance between energy nominated and produced for all associated Accounting Points. Additional information: This is a type of Balance Responsible Party.

Attributes.Name: transmissionOwner
Attributes.Description: Transmission owner.

Attributes.Name: MOLResponsible
Attributes.Description: Responsible for the management of the available tenders for all Acquiring System Operators to establish the order of the reserve capacity that can be activated.

Attributes.Name: ReserveAllocator
Attributes.Description: Informs the market of reserve requirements, receives tenders against the requirements and in compliance with the prequalification criteria, determines what tenders meet requirements and assigns tenders.

Attributes.Name: ConsumptionResponsibleParty
Attributes.Description: A party who can be brought to rights, legally and financially, for any imbalance between enegry nominated and consumed for all associated Accounting Points. Additional information: This is a type of Balance Responsible Party.

Attributes.Name: PartyConnectedToTheGrid
Attributes.Description: A party that contracts for the right to consume or produce electricity at an Accounting Point.

Attributes.Name: MarketInformationAggregator
Attributes.Description: Market Information Aggregator, A party that provides market related information that has been compiled from the figures supplied by different actors in the market. This information may also be published or distributed for general use. Note: The Market Information Aggregator may receive information from any market participant that is relevant for publication or distribution.

Attributes.Name: ControlBlockOperator
Attributes.Description:
Responsible for :
1. The coordination of exchanges between its associated Control Blocks and the organisation of the coordination of exchange programs between its related Control Areas.
2. The load frequency control within its own block and ensuring that its Control Areas respect their obligations in respect to load frequency control and time deviation.
3. The organisation of the settlement and/or compensation between its Control Areas.

Attributes.Name: loadServingEntity
Attributes.Description: Load serving entity.

Attributes.Name: interchangeAuthority
Attributes.Description: Interchange authority.

Attributes.Name: distributionProvider
Attributes.Description: Distribution provider.

Attributes.Name: ImbalanceSettlementResponsible
Attributes.Description:
A party that is responsible for settlement of the difference between the contracted quantities and the realised quantities of energy products for the Balance Responsible Parties in a Market Balance Area.
Note:
The Imbalance Settlement Responsible has not the responsibility to invoice. The Imbalance Settlement Responsible may delegate the invoicing responsibility to a more generic role such as a Billing Agent.

Attributes.Name: transmissionPlanner
Attributes.Description: Transmission planner.

Attributes.Name: CoordinationCenterOperator
Attributes.Description:
Responsible for :
1. The coordination of exchange programs between its related Control Blocks and for the exchanges between its associated Coordination Center Zones.
2. Ensuring that its Control Blocks respect their obligations in respect to load frequency control.
3. Calculating the time deviation in cooperation with the associated coordination centers.
4. Carrying out the settlement and/or compensation between its Control Blocks and against the other Coordination Center Zones.

Attributes.Name: reliabilityAuthority
Attributes.Description: Reliability authority.

Attributes.Name: NominationValidator
Attributes.Description: Has the responsibility of ensuring that all capacity nominated is within the allowed limits and confirming all valid nominations to all involved parties. They inform the Interconnection Trade Responsible of the maximum nominated capacity allowed. Depending on market rules for a given interconnection the corresponding System Operators may appoint one Nomination Validator.

Attributes.Name: GridAccessProvider
Attributes.Description: A party responsible for providing access to the grid through an Accounting Point and its use for energy consumption or production to the Party Connected to the Grid.

Attributes.Name: MarketOperator
Attributes.Description: The unique power exchange of trades for the actual delivery of energy that receives the bids from the Balance Responsible Parties that have a contract to bid. The Market Operator determines the market energy price for the Market Balance Area after applying technical constraints from the System Operator. It may also establish the price for the reconciliation within a Metering Grid Area.

Attributes.Name: BalanceSupplier
Attributes.Description: A party that markets the difference between actual metered energy consumption and the energy bought with firm energy contracts by the Party Connected to the Grid. In addition the Balance Supplier markets any difference with the firm energy contract (of the Party Connected to the Grid) and the metered production. Additional information: There is only one Balance Supplier for each Accounting Point.

Attributes.Name: ReconciliationAccountable
Attributes.Description: A party that is financially accountable for the reconciled volume of energy products for a profiled Accounting Point.

Attributes.Name: SystemOperator
Attributes.Description: A party that is responsible for a stable power system operation (including the organisation of physical balance) through a transmission grid in a geographical area. The System Operator will also determine and be responsible for cross border capacity and exchanges. If necessary they may reduce allocated capacity to ensure operational stability. Transmission as mentioned above means "the transport of electricity on the extra high or high voltage network with a view to its delivery to final customers or to distributors. Operation of transmission includes as well the tasks of system operation concerning its management of energy flows, reliability of the system and availability of all necessary system services." (definition taken from the ENTSO-E RGCE Operation handbook Glossary). Note: additional obligations may be imposed through local market rules.

Attributes.Name: ResourceProvider
Attributes.Description: A role that manages a resource object and provides the schedules for it

Attributes.Name: purchasingSellingEntity
Attributes.Description: Purchasing selling entity.

Attributes.Name: standardsDeveloper
Attributes.Description: Standards developer.

Attributes.Name: SchedulingCoordinator
Attributes.Description: A party that is responsible for the schedule information and its exchange on behalf of a Balance Responsible Party. For example in the Polish market a Scheduling Coordinator is responsible for information interchange for scheduling and settlement.

Attributes.Name: Producer
Attributes.Description: A party that produces electricity. Additional information: This is a type of Party Connected to the Grid.

Attributes.Name: planningAuthority
Attributes.Description: Planning authority.

Attributes.Name: TradeResponsibleParty
Attributes.Description: A party who can be brought to rights, legally and financially, for any imbalance between energy nominated and consumed for all associated Accounting Points. Note: A power exchange without any privileged responsibilities acts as a Trade Responsible Party. Additional information: This is a type of Balance Responsible Party.

Attributes.Name: MeterOperator
Attributes.Description: A party responsible for installing, maintaining, testing, certifying and decommissioning physical meters.

Attributes.Name: TransmissionCapacityAllocator
Attributes.Description: Manages the allocation of transmission capacity for an Allocated Capacity Area. For explicit auctions: The Transmission Capacity Allocator manages, on behalf of the System Operators, the allocation of available transmission capacity for an Allocated capacity Area. They offer the available transmission capacity to the market, allocates the available transmission capacity to individual Capacity Traders and calculates the billing amount of already allocated capacities to the Capacity Traders.

Attributes.Name: MeteringPointAdministrator
Attributes.Description: A party responsible for registering the parties linked to the metering points in a Metering Grid Area. They are also responsible for maintaining the Metering Point technical specifications. They are responsible for creating and terminating metering points.

Attributes.Name: resourcePlanner
Attributes.Description: Resource planner.

Attributes.Name: BalanceResponsibleParty
Attributes.Description: A party that has a contract proving financial security and identifying balance responsibility with the Imbalance Settlement Responsible of the Market Balance Area entitling the party to operate in the market. This is the only role allowing a party to nominate energy on a wholesale level. Additional information: The meaning of the word "balance" in this context signifies that the quantity contracted to provide or to consume shall be equal to the quantity really provided or consumed. Equivalent to "Program responsible party" in the Netherlands. Equivalent to "Balance group manager" in Germany. Equivalent to "market agent" in Spain.

Attributes.Name: ReconciliationResponsible
Attributes.Description:
A party that is responsible for reconciling, within a Metering Grid Area, the volumes used in the imbalance settlement process for profiled Accounting Points and the actual metered quantities.
Note:
The Reconciliation Responsible may delegate the invoicing responsibility to a more generic role such as a Billing Agent.

Entities.Name: SkillLevelKind
Entities.Description: Kind of skill level.

Entities.Name: OldPerson
Entities.Description: General purpose information for name and other information to contact people.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description:
Utility-specific classification for this person, according to the utility's corporate standards and practices. Examples include employee, contractor, agent, not affiliated, etc.
Note that this field is not used to indicate whether this person is a customer of the utility. Often an employee or contractor is also a customer. Customer information is gained with relationship to Organisation and CustomerData. In similar fashion, this field does not indicate the various roles this person may fill as part of utility operations.

Entities.Name: BankAccount
Entities.Description: Bank account.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpBankAccount
DerivedEntities.Description:
Relationship under a particular name, usually evidenced by a deposit against which withdrawals can be made. Types of bank accounts include: demand, time, custodial, joint, trustee, corporate, special, and regular accounts.
A statement of transactions during a fiscal period and the resulting balance is maintained on each account.
For Payment metering, the account is associated with Bank and Supplier, reflecting details of the bank account used for depositing revenue collected by TokenVendor. The name of the account holder should be specified in 'name' attribute.

Attributes.Name: bankABA
Attributes.Description: Bank ABA.

Attributes.Name: accountNumber
Attributes.Description: Account reference number.

Entities.Name: OrgOrgRole
Entities.Description:
Roles played between Organisations and other Organisations. This includes role ups for ogranisations, cost centers, profit centers, regulatory reporting, etc.
Note that the parent and child relationship is indicated by the name on each end of the association.

Attributes.Name: clientID
Attributes.Description: Identifiers of the organisation held by another organisation, such as a government agency (federal, state, province, city, county), financial institution (Dun and Bradstreet), etc.

Entities.Name: Ratio
Entities.Description: Fraction specified explicitly with a numerator and denominator, which can be used to calculate the quotient.

Attributes.Name: denominator
Attributes.Description: The part of a fraction that is below the line and that functions as the divisor of the numerator.

Attributes.Name: numerator
Attributes.Description: The part of a fraction that is above the line and signifies the number to be divided by the denominator.

Entities.Name: PersonPropertyRole
Entities.Description: The role of a person relative to a given piece of property. Examples of roles include: owner, renter, contractor, etc.

Entities.Name: PFVArType2Common1
Entities.Description:
Power factor / reactive power regulator. This model represents the power factor or reactive power controller such as the Basler SCP-250. The controller measures power factor or reactive power (PU on generator rated power) and compares it with the operator's set point.
[Footnote: Basler SCP-250 is an example of a suitable product available commercially. This information is given for the convenience of users of this document and does not constitute an endorsement by IEC of this product.]

Attributes.Name: max
Attributes.Description: Output limit (max).

Attributes.Name: ki
Attributes.Description: Reset gain (Ki).

Attributes.Name: kp
Attributes.Description: Proportional gain (Kp).

Attributes.Name: j
Attributes.Description: Selector (J). true = control mode for reactive power false = control mode for power factor.

Attributes.Name: ref
Attributes.Description: Reference value of reactive power or power factor (Ref). The reference value is initialised by this model. This initialisation can override the value exchanged by this attribute to represent a plant operator's change of the reference setting.

Entities.Name: PFVArControllerType2Dynamics
Entities.Description: Power factor or VAr controller type 2 function block whose behaviour is described by reference to a standard model <font color="#0f0f0f">or by definition of a user-defined model.</font>

DerivedEntities.Name: PFVArControllerType2UserDefined
DerivedEntities.Description: Power factor or VAr controller type 2 function block whose dynamic behaviour is described by <font color="#0f0f0f">a user-defined model.</font>

Attributes.Name: proprietary
Attributes.Description:
Behaviour is based on a proprietary model as opposed to a detailed model.
true = user-defined model is proprietary with behaviour mutually understood by sending and receiving applications and parameters passed as general attributes
false = user-defined model is explicitly defined in terms of control blocks and their input and output signals.

DerivedEntities.Name: PFVArType2IEEEPFController
DerivedEntities.Description:
IEEE PF controller type 2 which is a summing point type controller making up the outside loop of a two-loop system. This controller is implemented as a slow PI type controller. The voltage regulator forms the inner loop and is implemented as a fast controller.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 11.4.

Attributes.Name: vref
Attributes.Description: Voltage regulator reference (VREF).

Attributes.Name: exlon
Attributes.Description: Overexcitation or under excitation flag (EXLON) true = 1 (not in the overexcitation or underexcitation state, integral action is active) false = 0 (in the overexcitation or underexcitation state, so integral action is disabled to allow the limiter to play its role).

Attributes.Name: ki
Attributes.Description: Integral gain of the pf controller (KI). Typical value = 1.

Attributes.Name: vclmt
Attributes.Description: Maximum output of the pf controller (VCLMT). Typical value = 0,1.

Attributes.Name: kp
Attributes.Description: Proportional gain of the pf controller (KP). Typical value = 1.

Attributes.Name: vs
Attributes.Description: Generator sensing voltage (VS).

Attributes.Name: pfref
Attributes.Description: Power factor reference (PFREF).

DerivedEntities.Name: PFVArType2Common1
DerivedEntities.Description:
Power factor / reactive power regulator. This model represents the power factor or reactive power controller such as the Basler SCP-250. The controller measures power factor or reactive power (PU on generator rated power) and compares it with the operator's set point.
[Footnote: Basler SCP-250 is an example of a suitable product available commercially. This information is given for the convenience of users of this document and does not constitute an endorsement by IEC of this product.]

Attributes.Name: ki
Attributes.Description: Reset gain (Ki).

Attributes.Name: max
Attributes.Description: Output limit (max).

Attributes.Name: kp
Attributes.Description: Proportional gain (Kp).

Attributes.Name: j
Attributes.Description: Selector (J). true = control mode for reactive power false = control mode for power factor.

Attributes.Name: ref
Attributes.Description: Reference value of reactive power or power factor (Ref). The reference value is initialised by this model. This initialisation can override the value exchanged by this attribute to represent a plant operator's change of the reference setting.

DerivedEntities.Name: PFVArType2IEEEVArController
DerivedEntities.Description:
IEEE VAR controller type 2 which is a summing point type controller. It makes up the outside loop of a two-loop system. This controller is implemented as a slow PI type controller, and the voltage regulator forms the inner loop and is implemented as a fast controller.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 11.5.

Attributes.Name: kp
Attributes.Description: Proportional gain of the pf controller (KP).

Attributes.Name: qref
Attributes.Description: Reactive power reference (QREF).

Attributes.Name: ki
Attributes.Description: Integral gain of the pf controller (KI).

Attributes.Name: vref
Attributes.Description: Voltage regulator reference (VREF).

Attributes.Name: exlon
Attributes.Description: Overexcitation or under excitation flag (EXLON) true = 1 (not in the overexcitation or underexcitation state, integral action is active) false = 0 (in the overexcitation or underexcitation state, so integral action is disabled to allow the limiter to play its role).

Attributes.Name: vclmt
Attributes.Description: Maximum output of the pf controller (VCLMT).

Attributes.Name: vs
Attributes.Description: Generator sensing voltage (VS).

Entities.Name: HydroPlantStorageKind
Entities.Description: The type of hydro power plant.

Attributes.Name: pumpedStorage
Attributes.Description: Pumped storage.

Attributes.Name: storage
Attributes.Description: Storage.

Attributes.Name: runOfRiver
Attributes.Description: Run of river.

Entities.Name: BatteryStateKind
Entities.Description: The state of the battery unit.

Attributes.Name: waiting
Attributes.Description: Neither charging nor discharging, but able to do so.

Attributes.Name: empty
Attributes.Description: Unable to discharge, and not charging.

Attributes.Name: charging
Attributes.Description: Stored energy is increasing.

Attributes.Name: discharging
Attributes.Description: Stored energy is decreasing.

Attributes.Name: full
Attributes.Description: Unable to charge, and not discharging.

Entities.Name: GrossToNetActivePowerCurve
Entities.Description: Relationship between the generating unit's gross active power output on the X-axis (measured at the terminals of the machine(s)) and the generating unit's net active power output on the Y-axis (based on utility-defined measurements at the power station). Station service loads, when modelled, should be treated as non-conforming bus loads. There may be more than one curve, depending on the auxiliary equipment that is in service.

Entities.Name: FossilFuel
Entities.Description: The fossil fuel consumed by the non-nuclear thermal generating unit.   For example, coal, oil, gas, etc.   These are the specific fuels that the generating unit can consume.

Attributes.Name: lowBreakpointP
Attributes.Description: The active power output level of the unit at which the given type of fuel is switched off. This fuel (e.g., oil) is sometimes used to stabilize the base fuel (e.g., coal) at low active power output levels.

Attributes.Name: fuelEffFactor
Attributes.Description: The efficiency factor for the fuel (per unit) in terms of the effective energy absorbed.

Attributes.Name: highBreakpointP
Attributes.Description: The active power output level of the unit at which the given type of fuel is switched on. This fuel (e.g., oil) is sometimes used to supplement the base fuel (e.g., coal) at high active power output levels.

Attributes.Name: fuelHeatContent
Attributes.Description: The amount of heat per weight (or volume) of the given type of fuel.

Attributes.Name: fuelCost
Attributes.Description: The cost in terms of heat value for the given type of fuel.

Attributes.Name: fuelSulfur
Attributes.Description: The fuel's fraction of pollution credit per unit of heat content.

Attributes.Name: fossilFuelType
Attributes.Description: The type of fossil fuel, such as coal, oil, or gas.

Attributes.Name: fuelDispatchCost
Attributes.Description: The cost of fuel used for economic dispatching which includes: fuel cost, transportation cost,  and incremental maintenance cost.

Attributes.Name: fuelHandlingCost
Attributes.Description: Handling and processing cost associated with this fuel.

Attributes.Name: fuelMixture
Attributes.Description: Relative amount of the given type of fuel, when multiple fuels are being consumed.

Entities.Name: EmissionValueSource
Entities.Description: The source of the emission value.

Attributes.Name: measured
Attributes.Description: Measured.

Attributes.Name: calculated
Attributes.Description: Calculated.

Entities.Name: SteamSendoutSchedule
Entities.Description: The cogeneration plant's steam sendout schedule in volume per time unit.

Entities.Name: HydroPump
Entities.Description: A synchronous motor-driven pump, typically associated with a pumped storage plant.

Attributes.Name: pumpPowerAtMaxHead
Attributes.Description: The pumping power under maximum head conditions, usually at full gate.

Attributes.Name: pumpDischAtMaxHead
Attributes.Description: The pumping discharge under maximum head conditions, usually at full gate.

Attributes.Name: pumpPowerAtMinHead
Attributes.Description: The pumping power under minimum head conditions, usually at full gate.

Attributes.Name: pumpDischAtMinHead
Attributes.Description: The pumping discharge under minimum head conditions, usually at full gate.

Entities.Name: TailbayLossCurve
Entities.Description: Relationship between tailbay head loss height (Y-axis) and the total discharge into the power station's tailbay volume per time unit (X-axis) . There could be more than one curve depending on the level of the tailbay reservoir or river level.

Entities.Name: GenUnitOpCostCurve
Entities.Description: Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs.

Attributes.Name: isNetGrossP
Attributes.Description: Flag is set to true when output is expressed in net active power.

Entities.Name: GeneratorControlMode
Entities.Description: Unit control modes.

Attributes.Name: setpoint
Attributes.Description: Setpoint control mode.

Attributes.Name: pulse
Attributes.Description: Pulse control mode.

Entities.Name: GeneratorControlSource
Entities.Description: The source of controls for a generating unit.

Attributes.Name: unavailable
Attributes.Description: Not available.

Attributes.Name: offAGC
Attributes.Description: Off of automatic generation control (AGC).

Attributes.Name: onAGC
Attributes.Description: On automatic generation control (AGC).

Attributes.Name: plantControl
Attributes.Description: Plant is controlling.

Entities.Name: InflowForecast
Entities.Description: Natural water inflow to a reservoir, usually forecasted from predicted rain and snowmelt. Typically in one hour increments for up to 10 days. The forecast is given in average cubic meters per second over the time increment.

Entities.Name: HydroGeneratingEfficiencyCurve
Entities.Description:
Relationship between unit efficiency as percentage and unit output active power for a given net head in meters. The relationship between efficiency, discharge, head, and power output is expressed as follows:   E =KP/HQ
where:  E is the efficiency, as a percentage; P is the active power; H is the height; Q is the discharge, volume/time unit; K is a constant.
For example, a curve instance for a given net head could show efficiency (Y-axis) versus active power output (X-axis) or versus discharge on the X-axis.

Entities.Name: CogenerationPlant
Entities.Description: A set of thermal generating units for the production of electrical energy and process steam (usually from the output of the steam turbines). The steam sendout is typically used for industrial purposes or for municipal heating and cooling.

Attributes.Name: cogenLPSendoutRating
Attributes.Description: The low pressure steam sendout.

Attributes.Name: ratedP
Attributes.Description:
The rated output active power of the cogeneration plant.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: cogenHPSendoutRating
Attributes.Description: The high pressure steam sendout.

Attributes.Name: cogenLPSteamRating
Attributes.Description: The low pressure steam rating.

Attributes.Name: cogenHPSteamRating
Attributes.Description: The high pressure steam rating.

Entities.Name: AirCompressor
Entities.Description: Combustion turbine air compressor which is an integral part of a compressed air energy storage (CAES) plant.

Attributes.Name: airCompressorRating
Attributes.Description: Rating of the CAES air compressor.

Entities.Name: HydroPowerPlant
Entities.Description: A hydro power station which can generate or pump. When generating, the generator turbines receive water from an upper reservoir. When pumping, the pumps receive their water from a lower reservoir.

Attributes.Name: dischargeTravelDelay
Attributes.Description: Water travel delay from tailbay to next downstream hydro power station.

Attributes.Name: surgeTankCode
Attributes.Description: A code describing the type (or absence) of surge tank that is associated with the hydro power plant.

Attributes.Name: genRatedP
Attributes.Description:
The hydro plant's generating rating active power for rated head conditions.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: pumpRatedP
Attributes.Description:
The hydro plant's pumping rating active power for rated head conditions.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: penstockType
Attributes.Description: Type and configuration of hydro plant penstock(s).

Attributes.Name: hydroPlantStorageType
Attributes.Description: The type of hydro power plant water storage.

Attributes.Name: plantRatedHead
Attributes.Description:
The plant's rated gross head.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: plantDischargeCapacity
Attributes.Description: Total plant discharge capacity.

Attributes.Name: surgeTankCrestLevel
Attributes.Description: The level at which the surge tank spills.

Entities.Name: PhotoVoltaicUnit
Entities.Description: A photovoltaic device or an aggregation of such devices.

Entities.Name: HydroEnergyConversionKind
Entities.Description: Specifies the capability of the hydro generating unit to convert energy as a generator or pump.

Attributes.Name: pumpAndGenerator
Attributes.Description: Able to both generate power and pump water for energy storage.

Attributes.Name: generator
Attributes.Description: Able to generate power, but not able to pump water for energy storage.

Entities.Name: EmissionType
Entities.Description: The type of emission.

Attributes.Name: hydrogenSulfide
Attributes.Description: Hydrogen sulfide.

Attributes.Name: chlorine
Attributes.Description: Chlorine.

Attributes.Name: nitrogenOxide
Attributes.Description: Nitrogen oxide.

Attributes.Name: sulfurDioxide
Attributes.Description: Sulfur dioxide.

Attributes.Name: carbonDisulfide
Attributes.Description: Carbon disulfide.

Attributes.Name: carbonDioxide
Attributes.Description: Carbon dioxide.

Entities.Name: WindGenUnitKind
Entities.Description: Kind of wind generating unit.

Attributes.Name: onshore
Attributes.Description: The wind generating unit is located onshore.

Attributes.Name: offshore
Attributes.Description: The wind generating unit is located offshore.

Entities.Name: LevelVsVolumeCurve
Entities.Description: Relationship between reservoir volume and reservoir level. The  volume is at the Y-axis and the reservoir level at the X-axis.

Entities.Name: StartRampCurve
Entities.Description: Rate in gross active power per minute (Y-axis) at which a unit can be loaded versus the number of hours (X-axis) the unit was off line.

Attributes.Name: hotStandbyRamp
Attributes.Description: The startup ramp rate in gross for a unit that is on hot standby.

Entities.Name: FuelType
Entities.Description: Type of fuel.

Attributes.Name: lignite
Attributes.Description: The fuel is lignite coal.  Note that this is a special type of coal, so the other enum of coal is reserved for hard coal types or if the exact type of coal is not known.

Attributes.Name: gas
Attributes.Description: Natural gas.

Attributes.Name: other
Attributes.Description: Any fuel type not included in the rest of the enumerated value.

Attributes.Name: oil
Attributes.Description: Oil.

Attributes.Name: brownCoalLignite
Attributes.Description: Brown coal lignite.

Attributes.Name: coal
Attributes.Description: Generic coal, not including lignite type.

Attributes.Name: hardCoal
Attributes.Description: Hard coal.

Attributes.Name: peat
Attributes.Description: Peat.

Attributes.Name: oilShale
Attributes.Description: Oil Shale.

Attributes.Name: coalDerivedGas
Attributes.Description: Coal derived gas.

Entities.Name: TargetLevelSchedule
Entities.Description: Reservoir water level targets from advanced studies or "rule curves". Typically in one hour increments for up to 10 days.

Attributes.Name: lowLevelLimit
Attributes.Description: Low target level limit, below which the reservoir operation will be penalized.

Attributes.Name: highLevelLimit
Attributes.Description: High target level limit, above which the reservoir operation will be penalized.

Entities.Name: FuelAllocationSchedule
Entities.Description: The amount of fuel of a given type which is allocated for consumption over a specified period of time.

Attributes.Name: maxFuelAllocation
Attributes.Description: The maximum amount of fuel that is allocated for consumption for the scheduled time period.

Attributes.Name: fuelAllocationStartDate
Attributes.Description: The start time and date of the fuel allocation schedule.

Attributes.Name: minFuelAllocation
Attributes.Description: The minimum amount of fuel that is allocated for consumption for the scheduled time period, e.g., based on a "take-or-pay" contract.

Attributes.Name: fuelType
Attributes.Description: The type of fuel, which also indicates the corresponding measurement unit.

Attributes.Name: fuelAllocationEndDate
Attributes.Description: The end time and date of the fuel allocation schedule.

Entities.Name: NuclearGeneratingUnit
Entities.Description: A nuclear generating unit.

Entities.Name: TransmissionCapacity
Entities.Description: This class models the transmission (either a transmission interface or a POR/POD pair) capacity including Total Transfer Capacity (TTC), Operating Transfer Capacity (OTC), and Capacity Benefit Margin (CBM).

Attributes.Name: POD
Attributes.Description: point of delivery

Attributes.Name: totalTransmissionCapacity
Attributes.Description: Total Transmission Capacity

Attributes.Name: POR
Attributes.Description: point of receipt

Attributes.Name: startOperatingDate
Attributes.Description: Operating date & hour when the entitlement applies

Attributes.Name: OTC15min_emergency
Attributes.Description: The Operational Transmission Capacity (OTC) 15 minute Emergency Limit

Attributes.Name: OTCemergency
Attributes.Description: The Operational Transmission Capacity (OTC) Emergency Limit.

Attributes.Name: capacityBenefitMargin

Entities.Name: DefaultBid
Entities.Description:
DefaultBid is a generic class to hold Default Energy Bid, Default Startup Bid, and Default Minimum Load Bid: Default Energy Bid A Default Energy Bid is a monotonically increasing staircase function consisting at maximum 10 economic bid segments, or 10 ($/MW, MW) pairs. There are three methods for determining the Default Energy Bid:
  • Cost Based: derived from the Heat Rate or Average Cost multiplied by the Gas Price Index plus 10%.
  • LMP Based: a weighted average of LMPs in the preceding 90 days.
  • Negotiated: an amount negotiated with the designated Independent Entity.
Default Startup Bid A Default Startup Bid (DSUB) shall be calculated for each RMR unit based on the Startup Cost stored in the Master File and the applicable GPI and EPI. Default Minimum Load Bid A Default Minimum Load Bid (DMLB) shall be calculated for each RMR unit based on the Minimum Load Cost stored in the Master File and the applicable GPI.

Attributes.Name: minLoadCost
Attributes.Description: Minimum load cost in $/hr

Attributes.Name: bidType

Entities.Name: TREntitlement
Entities.Description:
A Transmission Right(TR) can be a chain of TR's or on individual. 

When a transmission right is not a chain, this is formally the ETC/TOR Entitlement for each ETC/TOR contract with the inclusion of CVR(Converted Rights) as an ETC. This is the sum of all entitlements on all related transmission interfaces for the same TR.

When TR is a chain, its entitlement is the minimum of all entitlements for the individual TRs in the chain.

Entities.Name: ReadingInterharmonic
Entities.Description: Interharmonics are represented as a rational number 'numerator' / 'denominator', and harmonics are represented using the same mechanism and identified by 'denominator'=1.

Attributes.Name: numerator
Attributes.Description: Interharmonic numerator. Value 0 means not applicable. Value 1 is used in combination with 'denominator'=2 to represent interharmonic 1/2, and with 'denominator'=1 it represents fundamental frequency. Finally, values greater than 1 indicate the harmonic of that order (e.g., 'numerator'=5 is the fifth harmonic).

Attributes.Name: denominator
Attributes.Description: Interharmonic denominator. Value 0 means not applicable. Value 2 is used in combination with 'numerator'=1 to represent interharmonic 1/2. Finally, value 1 indicates the harmonic of the order specified with 'numerator'.

Attributes.Name: supportsAutonomousDst

Attributes.Name: amrSystem

Attributes.Name: kR

Attributes.Name: kE

Attributes.Name: ptRatio

Attributes.Name: transformerRatio

Attributes.Name: enabled
Attributes.Description: Usage point is equipped with an AMI capable meter having communications capability.

Attributes.Name: amiDisabled
Attributes.Description: Usage point is equipped with an AMI capable meter; however, the AMI functionality has been disabled or is not being used.

Attributes.Name: operable
Attributes.Description: Usage point is equipped with an AMI capable meter that is functioning and communicating with the AMI network.

Attributes.Name: nonAmi
Attributes.Description: Usage point is equipped with a non AMI capable meter.

Attributes.Name: billingApproved
Attributes.Description: Usage point is equipped with an operating AMI capable meter and accuracy has been certified for billing purposes.

Attributes.Name: nonMetered
Attributes.Description: Usage point is not currently equipped with a meter.

Entities.Name: UsagePointConnectedKind
Entities.Description: State of the usage point with respect to connection to the network.

Attributes.Name: physicallyDisconnected
Attributes.Description: The usage point has been disconnected from the network at a point upstream of the meter. The usage point is unable to receive or send the applicable commodity (electricity, gas, water, etc.). A physical disconnect is often achieved by utilising a field crew.

Attributes.Name: connected
Attributes.Description: The usage point is connected to the network and able to receive or send the applicable commodity (electricity, gas, water, etc.).

Attributes.Name: logicallyDisconnected
Attributes.Description: The usage point has been disconnected through operation of a disconnect function within the meter present at the usage point.  The usage point is unable to receive or send the applicable commodity (electricity, gas, water, etc.)  A logical disconnect can often be achieved without utilising a field crew.

Entities.Name: AccumulationKind
Entities.Description: Kind of accumulation behaviour for read / measured values from individual end points.

Attributes.Name: indicating
Attributes.Description:
As if a needle is swung out on the meter face to a value to indicate the current value.
Note: An 'indicating' value is typically measured over hundreds of milliseconds or greater, or may imply a pusher mechanism to capture a value. Compare this to 'instantaneous' which is measured over a shorter period of time.

Attributes.Name: latchingQuantity
Attributes.Description:
When this description is applied to a metered value, it implies that the value is a time-independent cumulative quantity much like a 'bulkQuantity', except that it latches upon the maximum value upon reaching that value. Any additional accumulation (positive or negative) is discarded until a reset occurs. 
Note: A 'latchingQuantity' may also occur in the downward direction  upon reaching a minimum value. The terms 'maximum' or 'minimum' (for 'aggregate') will usually be included when this type of accumulation behaviour is present. 
When this description is applied to an encoded value (UOM= 'Code'), it implies that the value has one or more bits which are latching. The condition that caused the bit to be set may have long since evaporated.
In either case, the timestamp that accompanies the value may not coincide with the moment the value was initially set.
In both cases a system will need to perform an operation to clear the latched value.

Attributes.Name: bulkQuantity
Attributes.Description:
A value from a register which represents the bulk quantity of a commodity. This quantity is computed as the integral of the commodity usage rate. This value is typically used as the basis for the dial reading at the meter, and as a result, will roll over upon reaching a maximum dial value. 
Note 1: With the metering system, the roll-over behaviour typically implies a roll-under behavior so that the value presented is always a positive value (e.g. unsigned integer or positive decimal.) However, when communicating data between enterprise applications a negative value might occur in a case such as net metering.
Note 2: A 'bulkQuantity' refers primarily to the dial reading and not the consumption over a specific period of time.

Attributes.Name: timeDelay
Attributes.Description: A form of computation which introduces a time delay characteristic to the data value.

Attributes.Name: cumulative
Attributes.Description:
The sum of the previous billing period values.
Note: 'cumulative' is commonly used in conjunction with demand. Each demand reset causes the maximum demand value for the present billing period (since the last demand reset) to accumulate as an accumulative total of all maximum demands. So instead of 'zeroing' the demand register, a demand reset has the effect of adding the present maximum demand to this accumulating total.

Attributes.Name: none
Attributes.Description: Not applicable, or implied by the unit of measure.

Attributes.Name: boundedQuantity
Attributes.Description: A time-independent cumulative quantity much like a 'bulkQuantity' or a 'latchingQuantity', except that the accumulation stops at the maximum or minimum values. When the maximum is reached, any additional positive accumulation is discarded, but negative accumulation may be accepted (thus lowering the counter.) Likewise, when the negative bound is reached, any additional negative accumulation is discarded, but positive accumulation is accepted (thus increasing the counter.)

Attributes.Name: continuousCumulative
Attributes.Description:
The sum of the previous billing period values and the present period value.
Note: 'continuousCumulative' is commonly used in conjunction with 'demand', and it  would represent the cumulative sum of the previous billing period maximum demand values (as occurring with each demand reset) summed with the present period maximum demand value (which has yet to be reset.)

Attributes.Name: deltaData
Attributes.Description:
The difference between the value at the end of the prescribed interval and the beginning of the interval. This is used for incremental interval data. 
Note: One common application would be for load profile data, another use might be to report the number of events within an interval (such as the number of equipment energisations within the specified period of time.)

Attributes.Name: summation
Attributes.Description:
A form of accumulation which is selective with respect to time. 
Note : 'summation' could be considered a specialisation of 'bulkQuantity' as it selectively accumulates pulses over a timing pattern (while 'bulkQuantity' accumulates pulses all of the time).

Attributes.Name: instantaneous
Attributes.Description:
Typically measured over the fastest period of time allowed by the definition of the metric (usually milliseconds or tens of milliseconds.)
Note: 'instantaneous' was moved to attribute #3 in Ed.2 of IEC 61968-9, from attribute #1 in Ed.1 of IEC 61968-9.

Entities.Name: EndDeviceControlType
Entities.Description: Detailed description for a control produced by an end device. Values in attributes allow for creation of recommended codes to be used for identifying end device controls as follows: <type>.<domain>.<subDomain>.<eventOrAction>.

Attributes.Name: domain
Attributes.Description: High-level nature of the control.

Attributes.Name: subDomain
Attributes.Description: More specific nature of the control, as a further sub-categorisation of 'domain'.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Type of physical device from which the control was created. A value of zero (0) can be used when the source is unknown.

Entities.Name: EndDeviceControl
Entities.Description: Instructs an end device (or an end device group) to perform a specified action.

Attributes.Name: reason
Attributes.Description: Reason for the control action that allows to determine how to continue processing. For example, disconnect meter command may require different processing by the receiving system if it has been issued for a network-related reason (protection) or for a payment-related reason.

Attributes.Name: issuerID
Attributes.Description: Unique identifier of the business entity originating an end device control.

Attributes.Name: secondaryDeviceTiming
Attributes.Description: Timing for the control actions performed by devices that are responding to event related information sent to the primary device indicated in the end device control.  For example, load control actions performed by a PAN device in response to demand response event information sent to a PAN gateway server.

Attributes.Name: primaryDeviceTiming
Attributes.Description: Timing for the control actions performed on the device identified in the end device control.

Attributes.Name: issuerTrackingID
Attributes.Description: Identifier assigned by the initiator (e.g. retail electric provider) of an end device control action to uniquely identify the demand response event, text message, or other subject of the control action. Can be used when cancelling an event or text message request or to identify the originating event or text message in a consequential end device event.

Attributes.Name: drProgramLevel
Attributes.Description: Level of a demand response program request, where 0=emergency. Note: Attribute is not defined on DemandResponseProgram as it is not its inherent property (it serves to control it).

Attributes.Name: scheduledInterval
Attributes.Description: (if control has scheduled duration) Date and time interval the control has been scheduled to execute within.

Attributes.Name: priceSignal
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Price signal used as parameter for this end device control.

Attributes.Name: drProgramMandatory
Attributes.Description: Whether a demand response program request is mandatory. Note: Attribute is not defined on DemandResponseProgram as it is not its inherent property (it serves to control it).

Entities.Name: PendingCalculation
Entities.Description: When present, a scalar conversion that needs to be applied to every IntervalReading.value contained in IntervalBlock. This conversion results in a new associated ReadingType, reflecting the true dimensions of IntervalReading values after the conversion.

Attributes.Name: scalarFloat
Attributes.Description: (if scalar is floating number) When multiplied with 'IntervalReading.value', it causes a unit of measure conversion to occur, according to the 'ReadingType.unit'.

Attributes.Name: multiplyBeforeAdd
Attributes.Description: Whether scalars should be applied before adding the 'offset'.

Attributes.Name: scalarNumerator
Attributes.Description: (if scalar is integer or rational number)  When the scalar is a simple integer, and this attribute is presented alone and multiplied with 'IntervalReading.value', it causes a unit of measure conversion to occur, resulting in the 'ReadingType.unit'. It is never used in conjunction with 'scalarFloat', only with 'scalarDenominator'.

Attributes.Name: scalarDenominator
Attributes.Description: (if scalar is rational number) When 'IntervalReading.value' is multiplied by 'scalarNumerator' and divided by this value, it causes a unit of measure conversion to occur, resulting in the 'ReadingType.unit'.

Attributes.Name: offset
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Offset to be added as well as multiplication using scalars.

Attributes.Name: q2plusQ4
Attributes.Description: Quadrants 2 and 4

Attributes.Name: q3minusQ2
Attributes.Description: Q3 minus Q2

Attributes.Name: q3plusQ4
Attributes.Description: Reactive negative quadrants. (The term leading is preferred.)

Attributes.Name: totalByPhase
Attributes.Description: In polyphase metering, the total by phase energy register is incremented when the sum of the absolute values of the phase energies is greater than zero: In single phase metering, the formulas for Total and Total by phase collapse to the same expression. For communication purposes however, the Total enumeration should be used with single phase meter data.

Attributes.Name: q2minusQ3
Attributes.Description: Q2 minus Q3

Attributes.Name: q1plusQ2
Attributes.Description: Reactive positive quadrants. (The term lagging is preferred.)

Attributes.Name: q1plusQ3
Attributes.Description: Quadrants 1 and 3

Attributes.Name: q1plusQ4
Attributes.Description: Quadrants 1 and 4 usually represent forward active energy

Attributes.Name: quadrant2
Attributes.Description: Q2 only

Attributes.Name: quadrant3
Attributes.Description: Q3 only

Attributes.Name: quadrant1
Attributes.Description: Q1 only

Attributes.Name: reverse
Attributes.Description: Reverse Active Energy is equivalent to "Received," or "Exported" as defined in 61968-2. Reverse Active Energy is a positive kWh value as one would expect to find when energy is backfed by the service onto the utility network. Reverse Reactive Energy is a positive VArh value as one would expect to find in the presence of capacitive loading and a leading Power Factor. In polyphase metering, the reverse energy register is incremented when the sum of the phase energies is less than zero: Note: The value passed as a reverse value is always a positive value. It is understood by the label reverse that it represents negative flow.

Attributes.Name: leading
Attributes.Description:
Typically used to describe that a power factor is leading the reference value.
Note: Leading power factors typically indicate capacitive loading.

Attributes.Name: forward
Attributes.Description: "Delivered," or "Imported" as defined 61968-2. Forward Active Energy is a positive kWh value as one would naturally expect to find as energy is supplied by the utility and consumed at the service. Forward Reactive Energy is a positive VArh value as one would naturally expect to find in the presence of inductive loading. In polyphase metering, the forward energy register is incremented when the sum of the phase energies is greater than zero:

Attributes.Name: lagging
Attributes.Description:
Typically used to describe that a power factor is lagging the reference value. 
Note 1: When used to describe VA, lagging describes a form of measurement where reactive power is considered in all four quadrants, but real power is considered only in quadrants I and IV.
Note 2: When used to describe power factor, the term Lagging implies that the PF is negative. The term lagging in this case takes the place of the negative sign. If a signed PF value is to be passed by the data producer, then the direction of flow enumeration zero (none) should be used in order to avoid the possibility of creating an expression that employs a double negative. The data consumer should be able to tell from the sign of the data if the PF is leading or lagging. This principle is analogous to the concept that Reverse energy is an implied negative value, and to publish a negative reverse value would be ambiguous.
Note 3: Lagging power factors typically indicate inductive loading.

Attributes.Name: q1minusQ4
Attributes.Description: Q1 minus Q4

Attributes.Name: q2plusQ3
Attributes.Description: Quadrants 2 and 3 usually represent reverse active energy

Attributes.Name: quadrant4
Attributes.Description: Q4 only

Attributes.Name: total
Attributes.Description: |Forward| + |Reverse|, See 61968-2. The sum of the commodity in all quadrants Q1+Q2+Q3+Q4. In polyphase metering, the total energy register is incremented when the absolute value of the sum of the phase energies is greater than zero:

Attributes.Name: net
Attributes.Description:
|Forward| - |Reverse|, See 61968-2.

Note: In some systems, the value passed as a net value could become negative. In other systems the value passed as a net value is always a positive number, and rolls-over and rolls-under as needed.

Attributes.Name: none
Attributes.Description: Not Applicable (N/A)

Entities.Name: RandomisationKind
Entities.Description: Kind of randomisation to be applied to control the timing of end device control commands and/or the definition of demand response and load control events. Value other than 'none' is typically used to mitigate potential deleterious effects of simultaneous operation of multiple devices.

Attributes.Name: start
Attributes.Description: Start time of an event or control action affecting one or more multiple devices is randomised.

Attributes.Name: end
Attributes.Description: End time of an event or control action affecting one or more devices is randomised to prevent simultaneous operation.

Attributes.Name: startAndEnd
Attributes.Description: Both the start time and the end time of an event or control action affecting one or more devices are randomised to prevent simultaneous operation.

Attributes.Name: default
Attributes.Description: Randomisation of start and/or end times involving the operation of one or more devices is controlled by default settings for the device(s).

Attributes.Name: none
Attributes.Description: Neither the start time nor the end time of an event or control action affecting one or more devices is randomised.

Entities.Name: ReadingQuality
Entities.Description: Quality of a specific reading value or interval reading value. Note that more than one quality may be applicable to a given reading. Typically not used unless problems or unusual conditions occur (i.e., quality for each reading is assumed to be good unless stated otherwise in associated reading quality type). It can also be used with the corresponding reading quality type to indicate that the validation has been performed and succeeded.

Attributes.Name: timeStamp
Attributes.Description: Date and time at which the quality code was assigned or ascertained.

Attributes.Name: comment
Attributes.Description: Elaboration on the quality code.

Attributes.Name: source
Attributes.Description: System acting as the source of the quality code.

Entities.Name: MacroPeriodKind
Entities.Description: Kind of macro period for calculations on read / measured values.

Attributes.Name: weekly
Attributes.Description: Weekly period starting at midnight on the first day of the week and ending the instant before midnight the last day of the week. If within the current week, it specifies the period from the start of the week until "now."

Attributes.Name: daily
Attributes.Description: Daily period starting at midnight. If for the current day, this specifies the time from midnight to "now".

Attributes.Name: seasonal
Attributes.Description: A season of time spanning multiple months. E.g. "Summer," "Spring," "Fall," and "Winter" based cycle. If within the current season, it specifies the period from the start of the current season until "now."

Attributes.Name: specifiedPeriod
Attributes.Description: For the period defined by the start and end of the TimePeriod element in the message.

Attributes.Name: monthly
Attributes.Description: Monthly period starting at midnight on the first day of the month. If within the current month, this specifies the period from the start of the month until "now."

Attributes.Name: billingPeriod
Attributes.Description: Captured during the billing period starting at midnight of the first day of the billing period (as defined by the billing cycle day). If during the current billing period, it specifies a period from the start of the current billing period until "now".

Attributes.Name: none
Attributes.Description: Not applicable.

IntervalReading
Data captured at regular intervals of time. Interval data could be captured as incremental data, absolute data, or relative data. The source for the data is usually a tariff quantity or an engineering quantity. Data is typically captured in time-tagged, uniform, fixed-length intervals of 5 min, 10 min, 15 min, 30 min, or 60 min.
Note: Interval Data is sometimes also called "Interval Data Readings" (IDR).

Entities.Name: Reading

Entities.Name: EndDeviceAction
Entities.Description: Action/command performed by an end device on a device other than the end device.

DerivedEntities.Name: PanDemandResponse
DerivedEntities.Description: PAN control used to issue action/command to PAN devices during a demand response/load control event.

Attributes.Name: heatingOffset
Attributes.Description: Requested offset to apply to the normal heating setpoint at the time of the start of the event. It represents a temperature change that will be applied to the associated heating set point. The temperature offsets will be calculated per the local temperature in the thermostat. The calculated temperature will be interpreted as the number of degrees to be subtracted from the heating set point. Sequential demand response events are not cumulative. The offset shall be applied to the normal setpoint.

Attributes.Name: dutyCycle
Attributes.Description: Maximum "on" state duty cycle as a percentage of time. For example, if the value is 80, the device would be in an "on" state for 80% of the time for the duration of the action.

Attributes.Name: heatingSetpoint
Attributes.Description: Requested heating set point. Temperature set point is typically defined and calculated based on local temperature.

Attributes.Name: cancelDateTime
Attributes.Description: Timestamp when a canceling of the event is scheduled to start.

Attributes.Name: appliance
Attributes.Description: Appliance being controlled.

Attributes.Name: coolingOffset
Attributes.Description: Requested offset to apply to the normal cooling setpoint at the time of the start of the event. It represents a temperature change that will be applied to the associated cooling set point. The temperature offsets will be calculated per the local temperature in the thermostat. The calculated temperature will be interpreted as the number of degrees to be added to the cooling set point. Sequential demand response events are not cumulative. The offset shall be applied to the normal setpoint.

Attributes.Name: cancelNow
Attributes.Description: If true, a canceling of the event should start immediately.

Attributes.Name: avgLoadAdjustment
Attributes.Description:
Used to define a maximum energy usage limit as a percentage of the client implementations specific average energy usage. The load adjustment percentage is added to 100% creating a percentage limit applied to the client implementations specific average energy usage. A -10% load adjustment percentage will establish an energy usage limit equal to 90% of the client implementations specific average energy usage. Each load adjustment percentage is referenced to the client implementations specific average energy usage. There are no cumulative effects.
The range of this field is -100% to +100% with a resolution of 1. A -100% value equals a total load shed. A +100% value will limit the energy usage to the client implementations specific average energy usage.

Attributes.Name: enrollmentGroup
Attributes.Description: Provides a mechanism to direct load control actions to groups of PAN devices. It can be used in conjunction with the PAN device types.

Attributes.Name: coolingSetpoint
Attributes.Description: Requested cooling set point. Temperature set point is typically defined and calculated based on local temperature.

Attributes.Name: cancelControlMode
Attributes.Description: Encoding of cancel control.

Attributes.Name: criticalityLevel
Attributes.Description: Level of criticality for the action of this control. The action taken by load control devices for an event can be solely based on this value, or in combination with other load control event fields supported by the device.
