Entities.Description: The units defined for usage in the CIM.

Attributes.Name: VPerVA
Attributes.Description: Power factor, PF, the ratio of the active power to the apparent power. Note: The sign convention used for power factor will differ between IEC meters and EEI (ANSI) meters. It is assumed that the data consumers understand the type of meter being used and agree on the sign convention in use at any given utility.

Attributes.Name: degC
Attributes.Description:
Relative temperature in degrees Celsius.
In the SI unit system the symbol is C. Electric charge is measured in coulomb that has the unit symbol C. To distinguish degree Celsius form coulomb the symbol used in the UML is degC. Reason for not using C is the special character  is difficult to manage in software.

Attributes.Name: A
Attributes.Description: Current in Ampere.

Attributes.Name: W
Attributes.Description: Real power in Watt (J/s). Electrical power may have real and reactive components. The real portion of electrical power (IR or VIcos(phi)), is expressed in Watts. (See also apparent power and reactive power.)

Attributes.Name: V
Attributes.Description: Electric potential in Volt (W/A).

Attributes.Name: Wh
Attributes.Description: Real energy in Watt hours.

Attributes.Name: Vs
Attributes.Description: Volt second (Ws/A).

Attributes.Name: VAr
Attributes.Description:
Reactive power in Volt Ampere reactive. The reactive or imaginary component of electrical power (VIsin(phi)). (See also real power and apparent power).
Note: Different meter designs use different methods to arrive at their results. Some meters may compute reactive power as an arithmetic value, while others compute the value vectorially. The data consumer should determine the method in use and the suitability of the measurement for the intended purpose.

Attributes.Name: Ah
Attributes.Description: Ampere-hours, Ampere-hours.

Attributes.Name: Q
Attributes.Description: Quantity power, Q.

Attributes.Name: min
Attributes.Description: Time, minute  = 60 s.

Attributes.Name: onePerHz
Attributes.Description: Reciprocal of frequency (1/Hz).

Attributes.Name: Qh
Attributes.Description: Quantity energy, Qh.

Attributes.Name: s
Attributes.Description: Time in seconds.

Attributes.Name: WPerA
Attributes.Description: Active power per current flow, watt per Ampere.

Attributes.Name: ohm
Attributes.Description: Electric resistance in ohm (V/A).

Attributes.Name: VPerVAr
Attributes.Description: Power factor, PF, the ratio of the active power to the apparent power. Note: The sign convention used for power factor will differ between IEC meters and EEI (ANSI) meters. It is assumed that the data consumers understand the type of meter being used and agree on the sign convention in use at any given utility.

Attributes.Name: Btu
Attributes.Description: Energy, British Thermal Unit.

Attributes.Name: deg
Attributes.Description: Plane angle in degrees.

Attributes.Name: VA
Attributes.Description: Apparent power in Volt Ampere (See also real power and reactive power.)

Attributes.Name: As
Attributes.Description: Ampere seconds (As).

Attributes.Name: WPers
Attributes.Description: Ramp rate in Watt per second.

Attributes.Name: ohmm
Attributes.Description: resistivity, Ohm metre, (rho).

Attributes.Name: therm
Attributes.Description: Energy, Therm.

Attributes.Name: Vh
Attributes.Description: Volt-hour, Volt hours.

Attributes.Name: VArh
Attributes.Description: Reactive energy in Volt Ampere reactive hours.

Attributes.Name: Hz
Attributes.Description: Frequency in Hertz (1/s).

Attributes.Name: VAh
Attributes.Description: Apparent energy in Volt Ampere hours.

Attributes.Name: h
Attributes.Description: Time, hour = 60 min = 3600 s.

Attributes.Name: ohmPerm
Attributes.Description: Electric resistance per length in ohm per metre ((V/A)/m).

Attributes.Name: curveStyleKind
Attributes.Description: Used to specify whether the values over an interval are constant (constantYValue) or linearly interpolated (straightLineYValues)

Attributes.Name: numberOfIntervals
Attributes.Description: Used to specify the number of intervals when requesting a forecast or a dispatch.

Attributes.Name: startTime
Attributes.Description: The start time of the first interval in the dispatch schedule

Attributes.Name: timeIntervalDuration
Attributes.Description: The length of time for each interval in the dispatch schedule.

Attributes.Name: timeIntervalUnit
Attributes.Description: The unit of measure for the time axis of the dispatch schedule.

Attributes.Name: predictionCreationDate
Attributes.Description: The timestamp for when a prediction was created

Entities.Name: Version
Entities.Description: This is the version for a group of devices or objects.  This could be used to track the version for any group of objects or devices over time. For example, for a DERGroup, the requesting system may want to get the details of a specific version of a DERGroup.

Attributes.Name: major
Attributes.Description: major release level for this version

Attributes.Name: date
Attributes.Description: date of this version

Attributes.Name: revision
Attributes.Description: revision level for this version

Attributes.Name: minor
Attributes.Description: minor release level for this version

Entities.Name: Issuer
Entities.Description: Person who issued the document and is responsible for its content.

Entities.Name: FieldDispatchStep
Entities.Description: Details of the step in the field dispatch history.

Attributes.Name: dispatchStatus
Attributes.Description: The status of one or more crews dispatched to perform field work at one or more work sites

Attributes.Name: remarks
Attributes.Description: freeform comments related to the dispatch to perform field work.

Attributes.Name: occurredDateTime
Attributes.Description: The date and time at which the dispatch status occurred.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: The sequence number of the field dispatch step within the field dispatch history.  Begins with 1 and increments up.

Entities.Name: ElectronicAddress
Entities.Description: Electronic address information.

Attributes.Name: email1
Attributes.Description: Primary email address.

Attributes.Name: password
Attributes.Description: Password needed to log in.

Attributes.Name: radio
Attributes.Description: Radio address.

Attributes.Name: userID
Attributes.Description: User ID needed to log in, which can be for an individual person, an organisation, a location, etc.

Attributes.Name: mac
Attributes.Description: MAC (Media Access Control) address.

Attributes.Name: email2
Attributes.Description: Alternate email address.

Attributes.Name: web
Attributes.Description: World wide web address.

Attributes.Name: lan
Attributes.Description: Address on local area network.

Entities.Name: Status
Entities.Description: Current status information relevant to an entity.

Attributes.Name: dateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time for which status 'value' applies.

Attributes.Name: reason
Attributes.Description: Reason code or explanation for why an object went to the current status 'value'.

Attributes.Name: remark
Attributes.Description: Pertinent information regarding the current 'value', as free form text.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: Status value at 'dateTime'; prior status changes may have been kept in instances of activity records associated with the object to which this status applies.

Entities.Name: TelephoneNumber
Entities.Description: Telephone number.

Attributes.Name: localNumber
Attributes.Description: Main (local) part of this telephone number.

Attributes.Name: internationalPrefix
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Prefix used when calling an international number.

Attributes.Name: dialOut
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Dial out code, for instance to call outside an enterprise.

Attributes.Name: areaCode
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Area or region code.

Attributes.Name: countryCode
Attributes.Description: Country code.

Attributes.Name: ituPhone
Attributes.Description: Phone number according to ITU E.164.

Attributes.Name: cityCode
Attributes.Description: City code.

Attributes.Name: extension
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Extension for this telephone number.

Entities.Name: ScheduledEventData
Entities.Description: Schedule parameters for an activity that is to occur, is occurring, or has completed.

Attributes.Name: requestedWindow
Attributes.Description: Requested date and time interval for activity execution.

Attributes.Name: estimatedWindow
Attributes.Description: Estimated date and time for activity execution (with earliest possibility of activity initiation and latest possibility of activity completion).

Entities.Name: StreetDetail
Entities.Description: Street details, in the context of address.

Attributes.Name: withinTownLimits
Attributes.Description: True if this street is within the legal geographical boundaries of the specified town (default).

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Type of street. Examples include: street, circle, boulevard, avenue, road, drive, etc.

Attributes.Name: prefix
Attributes.Description: Prefix to the street name. For example: North, South, East, West.

Attributes.Name: name
Attributes.Description: Name of the street.

Attributes.Name: addressGeneral
Attributes.Description: First line of a free form address or some additional address information (for example a mail stop).

Attributes.Name: addressGeneral2
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Second line of a free form address.

Attributes.Name: suffix
Attributes.Description: Suffix to the street name. For example: North, South, East, West.

Attributes.Name: buildingName
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) In certain cases the physical location of the place of interest does not have a direct point of entry from the street, but may be located inside a larger structure such as a building, complex, office block, apartment, etc.

Attributes.Name: suiteNumber
Attributes.Description: Number of the apartment or suite.

Attributes.Name: floorIdentification
Attributes.Description: The identification by name or number, expressed as text, of the floor in the building as part of this address.

Attributes.Name: addressGeneral3
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Third line of a free form address.

Attributes.Name: number
Attributes.Description: Designator of the specific location on the street.

Attributes.Name: code
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Utilities often make use of external reference systems, such as those of the town-planner's department or surveyor general's mapping system, that allocate global reference codes to streets.

Entities.Name: Location
Entities.Description: The place, scene, or point of something where someone or something has been, is, and/or will be at a given moment in time. It can be defined with one or more position points (coordinates) in a given coordinate system.

DerivedEntities.Name: UsagePointLocation
DerivedEntities.Description: Location of an individual usage point.

Attributes.Name: remark
Attributes.Description: Remarks about this location.

Attributes.Name: siteAccessProblem
Attributes.Description: Problems previously encountered when visiting or performing work at this location. Examples include: bad dog, violent customer, verbally abusive occupant, obstructions, safety hazards, etc.

Attributes.Name: accessMethod
Attributes.Description: Method for the service person to access this usage point location. For example, a description of where to obtain a key if the facility is unmanned and secured.

DerivedEntities.Name: Zone
DerivedEntities.Description: Area divided off from other areas. It may be part of the electrical network, a land area where special restrictions apply, weather areas, etc. For weather, it is an area where a set of relatively homogenous weather measurements apply.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of this zone.

DerivedEntities.Name: WorkLocation
DerivedEntities.Description: Information about a particular location for various forms of work.

DerivedEntities.Name: InternalLocation
DerivedEntities.Description: Description of location internal to a building.

Attributes.Name: buildingName
Attributes.Description: Name of building where location is.

Attributes.Name: floor
Attributes.Description: Floor of location.

Attributes.Name: buildingNumber
Attributes.Description: Number of building where location is.

Attributes.Name: roomNumber
Attributes.Description: Room number of location.

DerivedEntities.Name: MaintenanceLocation
DerivedEntities.Description: Location where to perform maintenance work.

Attributes.Name: block
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Name, identifier, or description of the block in which work is to occur.

Attributes.Name: subdivision
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Name, identifier, or description of the subdivision in which work is to occur.

Attributes.Name: lot
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Name, identifier, or description of the lot in which work is to occur.

Attributes.Name: nearestIntersection
Attributes.Description: The names of streets at the nearest intersection to work area.

DerivedEntities.Name: ServiceLocation
DerivedEntities.Description: A real estate location, commonly referred to as premises.

Attributes.Name: needsInspection
Attributes.Description: True if inspection is needed of facilities at this service location. This could be requested by a customer, due to suspected tampering, environmental concerns (e.g., a fire in the vicinity), or to correct incompatible data.

Attributes.Name: accessMethod
Attributes.Description: Method for the service person to access this service location. For example, a description of where to obtain a key if the facility is unmanned and secured.

Attributes.Name: siteAccessProblem
Attributes.Description: Problems previously encountered when visiting or performing work on this location. Examples include: bad dog, violent customer, verbally abusive occupant, obstructions, safety hazards, etc.

Attributes.Name: electronicAddress
Attributes.Description: Electronic address.

Attributes.Name: geoInfoReference
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Reference to geographical information source, often external to the utility.

Attributes.Name: direction
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Direction that allows field crews to quickly find a given asset. For a given location, such as a street address, this is the relative direction in which to find the asset. For example, a streetlight may be located at the 'NW' (northwest) corner of the customer's site, or a usage point may be located on the second floor of an apartment building.

Attributes.Name: status
Attributes.Description: Status of this location.

Attributes.Name: phone1
Attributes.Description: Phone number.

Attributes.Name: mainAddress
Attributes.Description: Main address of the location.

Attributes.Name: phone2
Attributes.Description: Additional phone number.

Attributes.Name: secondaryAddress
Attributes.Description: Secondary address of the location. For example, PO Box address may have different ZIP code than that in the 'mainAddress'.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Classification by utility's corporate standards and practices, relative to the location itself (e.g., geographical, functional accounting, etc., not a given property that happens to exist at that location).

Entities.Name: Author
Entities.Description: Person who created document or activity record.

Entities.Name: Person
Entities.Description: General purpose information for name and other information to contact people.

DerivedEntities.Name: OldPerson
DerivedEntities.Description: General purpose information for name and other information to contact people.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description:
Utility-specific classification for this person, according to the utility's corporate standards and practices. Examples include employee, contractor, agent, not affiliated, etc.
Note that this field is not used to indicate whether this person is a customer of the utility. Often an employee or contractor is also a customer. Customer information is gained with relationship to Organisation and CustomerData. In similar fashion, this field does not indicate the various roles this person may fill as part of utility operations.

Attributes.Name: prefix
Attributes.Description: A prefix or title for the person's name, such as Miss, Mister, Doctor, etc.

Attributes.Name: lastName
Attributes.Description: Person's last (family, sir) name.

Attributes.Name: specialNeed
Attributes.Description: Special service needs for the person (contact) are described; examples include life support, etc.

Attributes.Name: mName
Attributes.Description: Middle name(s) or initial(s).

Attributes.Name: suffix
Attributes.Description: A suffix for the person's name, such as II, III, etc.

Attributes.Name: electronicAddress
Attributes.Description: Electronic address.

Attributes.Name: landlinePhone
Attributes.Description: Landline phone number.

Attributes.Name: firstName
Attributes.Description: Person's first name.

Attributes.Name: mobilePhone
Attributes.Description: Mobile phone number.

Entities.Name: StreetAddress
Entities.Description: General purpose street and postal address information.

Attributes.Name: status
Attributes.Description: Status of this address.

Attributes.Name: poBox
Attributes.Description: Post office box.

Attributes.Name: language
Attributes.Description: The language in which the address is specified, using ISO 639-1 two digit language code.

Attributes.Name: streetDetail
Attributes.Description: Street detail.

Attributes.Name: townDetail
Attributes.Description: Town detail.

Attributes.Name: postalCode
Attributes.Description: Postal code for the address.

Entities.Name: UserAttribute
Entities.Description: Generic name-value pair class, with optional sequence number and units for value; can be used to model parts of information exchange when concrete types are not known in advance.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktUserAttribute
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC61968:Domain2:UserAttribute.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: Value of an attribute, including unit information.

Attributes.Name: name
Attributes.Description: Name of an attribute.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Sequence number for this attribute in a list of attributes.

Entities.Name: Priority
Entities.Description: Priority definition.

Attributes.Name: justification
Attributes.Description: Justification for 'rank'.

Attributes.Name: rank
Attributes.Description: Priority level; usually, lower number means high priority, but the details are provided in 'type'.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Type describing 'rank'; e.g., high, emergency, etc.

Entities.Name: TimeSchedule
Entities.Description: Description of anything that changes through time. Time schedule is used to perform a single-valued function of time. Use inherited 'type' attribute to give additional information on this schedule, such as: periodic (hourly, daily, weekly, monthly, etc.), day of the month, by date, calendar (specific times and dates).

DerivedEntities.Name: WorkTimeSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: Time schedule specific to work.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of this work schedule.

Attributes.Name: disabled
Attributes.Description: True if this schedule is deactivated (disabled).

Attributes.Name: scheduleInterval
Attributes.Description: Schedule date and time interval.

Attributes.Name: offset
Attributes.Description: The offset from midnight (i.e., 0 h, 0 min, 0 s) for the periodic time points to begin. For example, for an interval meter that is set up for five minute intervals ('recurrencePeriod'=300=5 min), setting 'offset'=120=2 min would result in scheduled events to read the meter executing at 2 min, 7 min, 12 min, 17 min, 22 min, 27 min, 32 min, 37 min, 42 min, 47 min, 52 min, and 57 min past each hour.

Attributes.Name: recurrencePattern
Attributes.Description: Interval at which the scheduled action repeats (e.g., first Monday of every month, last day of the month, etc.).

Attributes.Name: recurrencePeriod
Attributes.Description: Duration between time points, from the beginning of one period to the beginning of the next period. Note that a device like a meter may have multiple interval periods (e.g., 1 min, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, or 60 min).

Entities.Name: PositionPoint
Entities.Description: Set of spatial coordinates that determine a point, defined in the coordinate system specified in 'Location.CoordinateSystem'. Use a single position point instance to describe a point-oriented location. Use a sequence of position points to describe a line-oriented object (physical location of non-point oriented objects like cables or lines), or area of an object (like a substation or a geographical zone - in this case, have first and last position point with the same values).

Attributes.Name: zPosition
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Z axis position.

Attributes.Name: yPosition
Attributes.Description: Y axis position.

Attributes.Name: xPosition
Attributes.Description: X axis position.

Attributes.Name: groupNumber
Attributes.Description: Zero-relative sequence number of this group within a series of points; used when there is a need to express disjoint groups of points that are considered to be part of a single location.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Zero-relative sequence number of this point within a series of points.

Entities.Name: TownDetail
Entities.Description: Town details, in the context of address.

Attributes.Name: country
Attributes.Description: Name of the country.

Attributes.Name: name
Attributes.Description: Town name.

Attributes.Name: section
Attributes.Description: Town section. For example, it is common for there to be 36 sections per township.

Attributes.Name: code
Attributes.Description: Town code.

Attributes.Name: stateOrProvince
Attributes.Description: Name of the state or province.

Entities.Name: CrewStatusKind
Entities.Description: Defines the current status of the Crew - assigned, arrived, etc.

Attributes.Name: enroute
Attributes.Description: the crew has been dispatched to work on an outage

Attributes.Name: arrived
Attributes.Description: the crew is on site at the outage location

Attributes.Name: awaitingCrewAssignment
Attributes.Description: Indicates that the work is awaiting one or more crews to be assigned

Attributes.Name: fieldComplete
Attributes.Description: the crew has corrected the outage in the field.  The equipment or other devices may not be energized at this time.

Attributes.Name: assigned
Attributes.Description: the crew has been assigned to work on a task

Entities.Name: CalculationIntervalUnitKind
Entities.Description: Units in which calculation interval period is defined.

Attributes.Name: milliSecond
Attributes.Description: Period expressed in milli-seconds.

Attributes.Name: perCycle
Attributes.Description: Period expressed in per-cycle.

Attributes.Name: season
Attributes.Description: Period expressed in seasons.

Attributes.Name: cycle
Attributes.Description: Period expressed in cycles.

Attributes.Name: minute
Attributes.Description: Period expressed in minutes.

Attributes.Name: week
Attributes.Description: Period expressed in weeks.

Attributes.Name: day
Attributes.Description: Period expressed in days.

Attributes.Name: year
Attributes.Description: Period expressed in years.

Attributes.Name: hour
Attributes.Description: Period expressed in hours.

Attributes.Name: second
Attributes.Description: Period expressed in seconds.

Attributes.Name: month
Attributes.Description: Period expressed in months.

Entities.Name: OilAnalysisPCBDiscrete
Entities.Description: Asset oil analysis PCB type of discrete.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of discrete representing oil PCB test analysis result.

Entities.Name: InspectionDiscreteKind
Entities.Description: Discretes representing breaker inspection result.

Attributes.Name: springPressureReadingOK
Attributes.Description: Is the spring pressure reading OK? Can apply to whole breaker or any individual pole.

Attributes.Name: visibleDamageOrLeaks
Attributes.Description: Any visible damage and/or oil/air/SF6 leaks?.

Attributes.Name: hydraulicFluidLevelOK
Attributes.Description: Hydraulic fluid level OK?

Attributes.Name: pumpMotorOperationCount
Attributes.Description: Count of pump motor operations.

Attributes.Name: controlCabinetHeaterOn
Attributes.Description: Is the control cabinet heater on?

Attributes.Name: lowToHighPressureCount
Attributes.Description: Count of ??.

Attributes.Name: checkOilLevelOK
Attributes.Description: Check oil level OK?

Attributes.Name: motorOperationsCount
Attributes.Description: Count of motor operations.

Attributes.Name: oilTankLevelsOK
Attributes.Description: Are the oil tank levels OK?

Attributes.Name: hydraulicOilLevelOK
Attributes.Description: Is the hydraulic oil level OK? Can apply to any individual pole.

Attributes.Name: bushingOilLevelsOK
Attributes.Description: Are bushing oil levels OK?

Attributes.Name: gasIndicatorNormal
Attributes.Description: Is the circuit switcher gas indicator normal?

Attributes.Name: operationCount
Attributes.Description: Count of operations.

Entities.Name: OilAnalysisParticleDiscreteKind
Entities.Description: Discretes representing oil particulate analysis result.

Attributes.Name: opacity
Attributes.Description:
Opacity of oil.
Possible values: any integer.

Entities.Name: OilAnalysisPCBAnalogKind
Entities.Description: Analogs representing oil PCB analysis result.

Attributes.Name: aroclor1016
Attributes.Description: Concentration of Aroclor 1016 (in ppm, specifically in mg/kg).

Attributes.Name: totalPCB
Attributes.Description: Total arochlor (PCB) content (in ppm, specifically in mg/kg). Is the sum of Aroclor 1221, Aroclor 1242, Aroclor 1254, Aroclor 1260, Aroclor 1016.

Attributes.Name: aroclor1242
Attributes.Description: Concentration of Aroclor 1242 (in ppm, specifically in mg/kg).

Attributes.Name: aroclor1221
Attributes.Description: Concentration of Aroclor 1221 (in ppm, specifically in mg/kg).

Attributes.Name: aroclor1260
Attributes.Description: Concentration of Aroclor 1260 (in ppm, specifically in mg/kg).

Attributes.Name: aroclor1254
Attributes.Description: Concentration of Aroclor 1254 (in ppm, specifically in mg/kg).

Entities.Name: AssetStringKind
Entities.Description: Definition of type of string useful in asset domain.

Attributes.Name: visualExamRemarks
Attributes.Description:
Remarks related to a visual exam.
Could be used for remarks on oil appearance resulting from visual examination, including sediment, appearance, free water.

Entities.Name: CalculationModeKind
Entities.Description: The mode of the calculation (total, periodic, sliding).

Attributes.Name: sliding
Attributes.Description: Calculation is for sliding period.

Attributes.Name: period
Attributes.Description: Calcuation is for fixed period.

Attributes.Name: total
Attributes.Description: Calculation is for total period.

Entities.Name: OilAnalysisFluidAnalogKind
Entities.Description: Analogs representing oil fluid test analysis result.

Attributes.Name: petroleumOrigin
Attributes.Description: Characterization of the carbon-type composition of insulating oils by petroleum origin.

Attributes.Name: passivatorContent
Attributes.Description: Total passivator content (in milligram/kilogram).

Attributes.Name: interfacialTension
Attributes.Description: Interfacial tension (in dyne/centimetre or milliNewton/metre, which are the same).

Attributes.Name: dissipationFactorPercent
Attributes.Description: Fluid dissipation factor (in percent). Commonly used in Asia. Dissipation factor is also known as loss factor or tan delta.

Attributes.Name: dissipationFactor
Attributes.Description: Fluid dissipation factor in absolute value, not a percentage. (Multiplying this value by 100 would result in dissipation factor percent).

Attributes.Name: additiveDBDS
Attributes.Description: Dibenzyl disulfide (DBDS) concentration (in ppm, specificially in milligram/kilogram).

Attributes.Name: staticElectrification
Attributes.Description: Static electrification tendency (in microcoulombs per metre3). Also called static charging tendency and electrostatic charging tendency (ECT).

Attributes.Name: flashPointClosedCup
Attributes.Description: Flash point (in C) determined via closed cup test. Flash point occurs when enough vapors have accumulated to sustain a flash. Closed cup is used in Europe.

Attributes.Name: aromatics
Attributes.Description: Concentration of aromatic compounds determined using infrared spectroscopy (in percent).

Attributes.Name: resistivity
Attributes.Description: Resistivity at 90C (in gigohm-metre).

Attributes.Name: specificGravity
Attributes.Description: Specific gravity corrected to 15C. Also known as relative density. It is a ratio of density of tested oil to density of water at a specific temperature.

Attributes.Name: passivatorTTA
Attributes.Description: Metal passivator TTA (Irgamet39 in solid form) content (in milligram/kilogram).

Attributes.Name: pourPoint
Attributes.Description: Pour point (in C). The pour point of a liquid is the temperature at which it becomes semi solid and loses its flow characteristics.

Attributes.Name: sedimentAndSludgePercent
Attributes.Description: Sediment and sludge (in percent).

Attributes.Name: carbonyl
Attributes.Description: Concentration of carbonyl compounds (aldehydes and ketones) determined using infrared spectroscopy (in percent).

Attributes.Name: oxidation
Attributes.Description: Measure of oxidation stability (in hours).

Attributes.Name: duration61125MethodC
Attributes.Description: Duration of oxidation stablity test performed according to IEC 61125, method C. This value should accompany values resulting from testing according to IEC 61125, method C to allow interpretation. Standard specified values are: 164, 332, and 500, but others can be used if agreed upon.

Attributes.Name: totalAcids
Attributes.Description: Total acids (soluble plus volatile) (in milligram of KOH/gram). Typically performed on new oil,but can be done on used oil.

Attributes.Name: acidNumber
Attributes.Description: Acid neutralization number (in milligram of KOH/gram).

Attributes.Name: solubleAcids
Attributes.Description: Soluble acids  (in milligram of KOH/gram). Typically performed on new oil,but can be done on used oil.

Attributes.Name: inductionTime
Attributes.Description: Oxidation induction time (in hours). Typically performed on new oil,but can be done on used oil.

Attributes.Name: inhibitor61125MethodC
Attributes.Description: Amount of inhibitor used in oxidation stablity test performed according to IEC 61125, method C. This value should accompany values resulting from testing according to IEC 61125, method  C to allow interpretation.

Attributes.Name: sludge
Attributes.Description: Sludge (in percent by mass). Typically performed on new oil,but can be done on used oil.

Attributes.Name: volatileAcids
Attributes.Description: Volatile acids (in milligram of KOH/gram). Typically performed on new oil,but can be done on used oil.

Attributes.Name: oxidationInhibitorDBP
Attributes.Description: 2,6-ditertiary-butyl phenol (DBP) oxidation inhibitor concentration (in percent by weight).

Attributes.Name: passivatorBTA
Attributes.Description: Metal passivator BTA content (in milligram/kilogram).

Attributes.Name: oxidationInhibitorDBPC
Attributes.Description: 2,6-ditertiarybutyl para-cresol (DBPC) oxidation inhibitor concentration (in percent by weight).

Attributes.Name: oxidationInhibitorD2668
Attributes.Description: 2,6-ditertiary-butyl para-cresol and 2,6-ditertiary-butyl phenol concentration (in percent by weight).

Attributes.Name: flashPointOpenCup
Attributes.Description: Flash point (in C) determined via open cup test. Flash point occurs when enough vapors have accumulated to sustain a flash. Open cup is used in US.

Attributes.Name: kinematicViscosity
Attributes.Description: Kinematic viscosity (in millimetre2/second). Kinematic viscosity is the ratio of - absolute (or dynamic) viscosity to density.

Attributes.Name: dielectricBreakdown
Attributes.Description: Dielectric breakdown, for electrode gap size and temperature specified by selected standard  (in kV).

Attributes.Name: firePoint
Attributes.Description: Fire point (in C). Fire point is when fire is sustained (oil catches fire). Can only be done by means of open cup test, which is commonly used in US.

Attributes.Name: powerFactorPercent
Attributes.Description: Fluid power factor at specified temperature (in percent). Commonly used in US. (Note: Fluid power factor is very similar to fluid dissapation factor, but fluid power factor is cosine of the phase angle between an AC voltage applied to oil and the resulting current (where dissipation factor is the tangent). For values up to 0.005, fluid power factor and dissapation factor are very close. There is a conversion equation between the two).

Attributes.Name: density
Attributes.Description: Density (in gram/millilitre).

Attributes.Name: pourPointAutomatic
Attributes.Description: Pour point (in C) determined by automatic method. The pour point of a liquid is the temperature at which it becomes semi solid and loses its flow characteristics.

Attributes.Name: passivatorIrgamet39
Attributes.Description: Irgamet 39 metal passivator content (in ppm, specifically milligram/kilogram).

Entities.Name: OilAnalysisMoistureAnalogKind
Entities.Description: Analogs representing oil moisture analysis result.

Attributes.Name: waterContentMonitoredViaInfrared
Attributes.Description: Water content by infrared sensor (in ppm, specifically milligram/kilogram).

Attributes.Name: waterContentMonitoredViaCapacitance
Attributes.Description: Water content by capacitance sensor (in ppm, specifically milligram/kilogram).

Attributes.Name: relativeSaturation
Attributes.Description: Relative saturation of water in fluid (in percent).

Attributes.Name: relativeSaturationCalculated
Attributes.Description: Calculated relative saturation of water in fluid (in percent).

Entities.Description: Analogs representing oil dissolved gas analysis result.

Attributes.Name: carbon3
Attributes.Description: C3 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: ethylene
Attributes.Description: C2H4 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: propene
Attributes.Description: C3H6 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: carbonDioxide
Attributes.Description: CO2 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: totalDissolvedGasPercent
Attributes.Description: Total dissolved gas in oil (in percent by volume). Derived from the total area of all the gas peaks in the chromatogram.

Attributes.Name: butane
Attributes.Description: C4H10 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: acetylene
Attributes.Description: C2H2 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: methane
Attributes.Description: CH4 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: totalCombustibleGasPercent
Attributes.Description: Total Combustible Gas (TCG) measured in headspace (in percent by volume).

Attributes.Name: totalDissolvedCombustibleGas
Attributes.Description: Total dissolved combustible gas concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre). Calculated by adding the ppm of combustible gasses: hydrogen (H2), methane (CH4), ethane (C2H6), ethylene (C2H4), acetylene (C2H2), and carbon monoxide (CO).

Attributes.Name: carbonMonoxide
Attributes.Description: CO concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: equivalentTCGPercent
Attributes.Description:
Equivalent Total Combustible Gas (ETCG) percent.
An estimate, calculated from the dissolved-gas concentrations and the oil sample temperature, of what the TCG would be in a gas space in equilibrium with the oil. ETCG reflects what the TCG would be in air spaces near the oil.

Attributes.Name: totalHeatGas
Attributes.Description: Sum of concentrations of methane, ethane, and ethylene (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre). Used in some diagnostic gas ratios, especially THG/acetylene, which compares heat gas to arcing gas.

Attributes.Name: isobutane
Attributes.Description: isoC4 (C4H10) concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre). Isobutane is also known as methylpropane.

Attributes.Name: hydran
Attributes.Description:
Measured composite of dissolved fault gas concentrations (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre). Relative sensitivity
- H2: 100 % of concentration
- CO: 15  4 % of concentration
- C2H2: 8  2 % of concentration
- C2H4: 1.5  0.5 % of concentration.

Attributes.Name: ethane
Attributes.Description: C2H6 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: propane
Attributes.Description: C3H8 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: oxygen
Attributes.Description: O2 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: carbon4
Attributes.Description: C4 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: totalPartialPressure
Attributes.Description:
Total partial pressure (in Pa).
Calculated value reflecting total of partial pressures of all combustible gasses.

Attributes.Name: nitrogen
Attributes.Description: N2 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: hydranPredicted
Attributes.Description:
Predicted hydran value (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre), calculated based on individual measured dissolved gas concentrations.
- H2: 100 % of concentration
- CO: 15  4 % of concentration
- C2H2: 8  2 % of concentration
- C2H4: 1.5  0.5 % of concentration

Attributes.Name: carbon
Attributes.Description: C? concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: hydrogen
Attributes.Description: H2 concentration (in ppm, specifically in microlitre/litre).

Attributes.Name: estimatedSafeHandlingLimit
Attributes.Description:
Estimated Safe Handling Limit (ESHL) (in percent). Estimated safe handling limit is an estimate of the lower flammability limit (LFL) of the combustible gas mixture which the dissolved gas in the oil would give off by the oil if exposed to air. 
Expressed in percent like the equivalent total combustible gas percent, it is calculated from the dissolved-gas concentrations, the oil sample temperature, and the lower flammability limits of the individual combustible gases.

Attributes.Name: colorNumber
Attributes.Description:

Possible values: 0.5, 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5, 3.0, 3.5, 4.0, 4.5, 5.0, 5.5, 6.0, 6.5, 7.0, 7.5, 8.0.

Possible values: absent, present.

Attributes.Name: sludgePrecipitation

Attributes.Name: colorNumberPlatinumCobaltScale

Attributes.Name: corrosiveSulphurBy62535
Attributes.Description:
Corrosive sulphur test result using covered (copper) conductor deposition test.
Possible values: potentiallyCorrosive, nonCorrosive.

Attributes.Name: tarnishLevel
Attributes.Description:
Tarnish level indicated by corrosive sulphur test.
Possible values: 1A, 1B, 2A, 2B, 2C, 2D, 2E, 3A, 3B, 4A, 4B, 4C.

Entities.Name: ContingencyElement
Entities.Description: An element of a system event to be studied by contingency analysis, representing a change in status of a single piece of equipment.

DerivedEntities.Description: Equipment whose in service status is to change, such as a power transformer or AC line segment.

Attributes.Name: contingentStatus
Attributes.Description: The status for the associated equipment when in the contingency state.   This status is independent of the case to which the contingency is originally applied, but defines the equipment status when the contingency is applied.

Entities.Description: Indicates the state which the contingency equipment is to be in when the contingency is applied.

Attributes.Name: inService
Attributes.Description: The equipment is to be put into service.

Attributes.Name: outOfService
Attributes.Description: The equipment is to be taken out of service.

Entities.Name: PhaseConnectedFaultKind
Entities.Description: The type of fault connection among phases.

Attributes.Name: lineToGround
Attributes.Description: The fault connects the indicated phases to ground. The line to line fault impedance is not used and assumed infinite. The full ground impedance is connected between each phase specified in the fault and ground, but not between the phases.

Attributes.Name: lineToLine
Attributes.Description: The fault connects the specified phases together without a connection to ground. The ground impedance of this fault is ignored. The line to line impedance is connected between each of the phases specified in the fault. For example three times for a three phase fault, one time for a two phase fault.  A single phase fault should not be specified.

Attributes.Name: lineOpen
Attributes.Description: The fault is when the conductor path is broken between two terminals. Additional coexisting faults may be required if the broken conductor also causes connections to grounds or other lines or phases.

Attributes.Name: lineToLineToGround
Attributes.Description: The fault connects the indicated phases to ground and to each other. The line to line impedance is connected between each of the phases specified in the fault in a full mesh. For example three times for a three phase fault, one time for a two phase fault. A single phase fault should not be specified. The full ground impedance is connected between each phase specified in the fault and ground.

Entities.Name: FaultImpedance
Entities.Description: Impedance description for the fault.

Attributes.Name: rGround
Attributes.Description: The resistance of the fault between phases and ground.

Attributes.Name: xGround
Attributes.Description: The reactance of the fault between phases and ground.

Attributes.Name: xLineToLine
Attributes.Description: The reactance of the fault between phases.

Attributes.Name: rLineToLine
Attributes.Description: The resistance of the fault between phases.

Entities.Name: Fault
Entities.Description: Abnormal condition causing current flow through conducting equipment, such as caused by equipment failure or short circuits from objects not typically modelled (for example, a tree falling on a line).

DerivedEntities.Name: LineFault
DerivedEntities.Description: A fault that occurs on an AC line segment at some point along the length.

Attributes.Name: lengthFromTerminal1
Attributes.Description: The length to the place where the fault is located starting from terminal with sequence number 1 of the faulted line segment.

DerivedEntities.Name: EquipmentFault
DerivedEntities.Description: A fault applied at the terminal, external to the equipment. This class is not used to specify faults internal to the equipment.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: The kind of phase fault.

Attributes.Name: impedance
Attributes.Description: Fault impedance. Its usage is described by 'kind'.

Attributes.Name: occurredDateTime
Attributes.Description: The date and time at which the fault occurred.

Attributes.Name: phases
Attributes.Description: The phases participating in the fault. The fault connections into these phases are further specified by the type of fault.

Entities.Description:
IEEE voltage adjuster which is used to represent the voltage adjuster in either a power factor or VAr control system.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 11.1.

Attributes.Name: taoff
Attributes.Description: Time that adjuster pulses are off (TAOFF) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,5.

Attributes.Name: vadjf
Attributes.Description: Set high to provide a continuous raise or lower (VADJF).

Attributes.Name: vadjmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum output of the adjuster (VADJMIN) (< VAdjIEEE.vadjmax). Typical value = 0,9.

Attributes.Name: vadjmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum output of the adjuster (VADJMAX) (> VAdjIEEE.vadjmin). Typical value = 1,1.

Attributes.Name: taon
Attributes.Description: Time that adjuster pulses are on (TAON) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,1.

Attributes.Name: adjslew
Attributes.Description: Rate at which output of adjuster changes (ADJ_SLEW). Unit = s / PU. Typical value = 300.

Entities.Name: PriceTypeKind
Entities.Description: Value of this enumeration for different prices include "total" for the complete/full/all-in price, "congestion" for the congestion cost associated with the total price, the "loss" for the loss price associated with the total price, "capacity" for prices related to installed or reserved capacity, "mileage" for use-based accounting, "system" for system-wide/copper-plate prices, and "delivery" for distribution-based prices.

Entities.Name: SynchrocheckRelay
Entities.Description: A device that operates when two AC circuits are within the desired limits of frequency, phase angle, and voltage, to permit or to cause the paralleling of these two circuits. Used to prevent the paralleling of non-synchronous topological islands.

Attributes.Name: maxAngleDiff
Attributes.Description: The maximum allowable voltage vector phase angle difference across the open device.

Attributes.Name: maxFreqDiff
Attributes.Description: The maximum allowable frequency difference across the open device.

Attributes.Name: maxVoltDiff
Attributes.Description: The maximum allowable difference voltage across the open device.

Entities.Name: Assignment
Entities.Description: An assignment is given to an ErpPerson, Crew, Organisation, Equipment Item, Tool, etc. and may be used to perform Work, WorkTasks, Procedures, etc. TimeSchedules may be set up directly for Assignments or indirectly via the associated WorkTask. Note that these associations are all inherited through the recursive relationship on Document.

Attributes.Name: effectivePeriod
Attributes.Description: Period between the assignment becoming effective and its expiration.

Entities.Name: TypeMaterial
Entities.Description:
Documentation for a generic material item that may be used for design, work and other purposes. Any number of MaterialItems manufactured by various vendors may be used to perform this TypeMaterial.
Note that class analagous to "AssetModel" is not used for material items. This is because in some cases, for example, a utility sets up a Master material record for a 3 inch long half inch diameter steel bolt and they do not necessarily care what specific supplier is providing the material item. As different vendors are used to supply the part, the Stock Code of the material item can stay the same. In other cases, each time the vendor changes, a new stock code is set up so they can track material used by vendor. Therefore a Material Item "Model" is not typically needed.

Attributes.Name: estUnitCost
Attributes.Description: The estimated unit cost of this type of material, either for a unit cost or cost per unit length. Cost is for material or asset only and does not include labor to install/construct or configure it.

Attributes.Name: costType
Attributes.Description: The type of cost to which this Material Item belongs.

Attributes.Name: stockItem
Attributes.Description: True if item is a stock item (default).

Attributes.Name: quantity
Attributes.Description: The value, unit of measure, and multiplier for the quantity.

Attributes.Name: wheelingTransactionReference

Attributes.Name: pumpSelfSchedMw

Attributes.Name: selfSchedSptResource
Attributes.Description: Price Taker Export Self Sched Support Resource

Attributes.Name: selfSchedType
Attributes.Description:
This attribute is used to specify if a bid includes a self sched bid. If so what self sched type is it. The possible values are shown as follow but not limited to:

'ETC' - Existing transmission contract
'TOR' - Transmission ownership right
'RMR' - Reliability must run
'RGMR' - Regulatory must run
"RMT" - Relaiability must take
"PT" - Price taker
"LPT" - Low price taker
"SP" - Self provision
"RA" - Resource adequacy

This attribute is originally defined in the BidSelfSched class

Attributes.Name: referenceType
Attributes.Description: Indication of which type of self schedule is being referenced.

Attributes.Name: priorityFlag
Attributes.Description: This is a Y/N flag for a self-schedule of a resource per market per date and hour, using a specific TR ID. It indicates whether a self-schedule using a TR has scheduling priority in DAM/RTM.

Attributes.Name: balancingFlag
Attributes.Description: This is a Y/N flag for a self-schedule of a resource per market per date and hour, using a specific TR ID. It indicates whether a self-schedule using a TR is balanced with another self-schedule using the same TR ID.

Attributes.Name: bidType
Attributes.Description: bidType has two types as the required output of requirements and qualified pre-dispatch.

Attributes.Name: selfSchedMw
Attributes.Description: Self scheduled value

Entities.Name: IEC61968CIMVersion
Entities.Description: IEC 61968 version number assigned to this UML model.

Attributes.Name: version
Attributes.Description: (const=IEC61968CIM13v09) Form is IEC61968CIMXXvYY where XX is the major CIM package version and the YY is the minor version. For example IEC61968CIM10v17.

Attributes.Name: date
Attributes.Description: (const=2016-10-31) Form is YYYY-MM-DD for example for January 5, 2009 it is 2009-01-05.

Entities.Name: DiagramObjectPoint
Entities.Description: A point in a given space defined by 3 coordinates and associated to a diagram object.  The coordinates may be positive or negative as the origin does not have to be in the corner of a diagram.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: The sequence position of the point, used for defining the order of points for diagram objects acting as a polyline or polygon with more than one point. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: xPosition
Attributes.Description: The X coordinate of this point.

Attributes.Name: zPosition
Attributes.Description: The Z coordinate of this point.

Attributes.Name: yPosition
Attributes.Description: The Y coordinate of this point.

Entities.Name: DiagramObjectStyle
Entities.Description: A reference to a style used by the originating system for a diagram object.  A diagram object style describes information such as line thickness, shape such as circle or rectangle etc, and colour.

Entities.Name: DiagramObjectGluePoint
Entities.Description: This is used for grouping diagram object points from different diagram objects that are considered to be glued together in a diagram even if they are not at the exact same coordinates.

Entities.Name: OrientationKind
Entities.Description: The orientation of the coordinate system with respect to top, left, and the coordinate number system.

Attributes.Name: negative
Attributes.Description: For 2D diagrams, a negative orientation gives the left-hand orientation (favoured by computer graphics displays) with X values increasing from left to right and Y values increasing from top to bottom.   This is also known as a left hand orientation.

Attributes.Name: positive
Attributes.Description: For 2D diagrams, a positive orientation will result in X values increasing from left to right and Y values increasing from bottom to top.  This is also known as a right hand orientation.

Entities.Name: VoltageCompensatorDynamics
Entities.Description: Voltage compensator function block whose behaviour is described by reference to a standard model <font color="#0f0f0f">or by definition of a user-defined model.</font>

DerivedEntities.Name: VCompIEEEType2
DerivedEntities.Description:
Terminal voltage transducer and load compensator as defined in IEEE 421.5-2005, 4. This model is designed to cover the following types of compensation:
  • reactive droop;
  • transformer-drop or line-drop compensation;
  • reactive differential compensation known also as cross-current compensation.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 4.

Attributes.Name: tr
Attributes.Description: Time constant which is used for the combined voltage sensing and compensation signal (Tr) (>= 0).

DerivedEntities.Name: VCompIEEEType1
DerivedEntities.Description:
Terminal voltage transducer and load compensator as defined in IEEE 421.5-2005, 4. This model is common to all excitation system models described in the IEEE Standard. Parameter details:
  1. If Rc and Xc are set to zero, the load compensation is not employed and the behaviour is as a simple sensing circuit.
  1. If all parameters (Rc, Xc and Tr) are set to zero, the standard model VCompIEEEType1 is bypassed.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005 4.

Attributes.Name: xc
Attributes.Description: Reactive component of compensation of a generator (Xc) (>= 0).

Attributes.Name: rc
Attributes.Description: Resistive component of compensation of a generator (Rc) (>= 0).

Attributes.Name: tr
Attributes.Description: Time constant which is used for the combined voltage sensing and compensation signal (Tr) (>= 0).

DerivedEntities.Name: VoltageCompensatorUserDefined
DerivedEntities.Description: Voltage compensator function block whose dynamic behaviour is described by <font color="#0f0f0f">a user-defined model.</font>

Attributes.Name: proprietary
Attributes.Description:
Behaviour is based on a proprietary model as opposed to a detailed model.
true = user-defined model is proprietary with behaviour mutually understood by sending and receiving applications and parameters passed as general attributes
false = user-defined model is explicitly defined in terms of control blocks and their input and output signals.

Entities.Name: GenICompensationForGenJ
Entities.Description: Resistive and reactive components of compensation for generator associated with IEEE type 2 voltage compensator for current flow out of another generator in the interconnection.

Attributes.Name: xcij
Attributes.Description: Reactive component of compensation of generator associated with this IEEE type 2 voltage compensator for current flow out of another generator (Xcij).

Attributes.Name: rcij
Attributes.Description: Resistive component of compensation of generator associated with this IEEE type 2 voltage compensator for current flow out of another generator (Rcij).

Entities.Name: RemoteSignalKind
Entities.Description: Type of input signal coming from remote bus.

Attributes.Name: remoteBusFrequency
Attributes.Description: Input is frequency from remote terminal bus.

Attributes.Name: remoteBusVoltageFrequency
Attributes.Description: Input is voltage frequency from remote terminal bus.

Attributes.Name: remoteBranchCurrentAmplitude
Attributes.Description: Input is branch current amplitude from remote terminal bus.

Attributes.Name: remoteBusVoltage
Attributes.Description: Input is voltage from remote terminal bus.

Attributes.Name: remoteBusVoltageAmplitude
Attributes.Description: Input is voltage amplitude from remote terminal bus.

Attributes.Name: remoteBusVoltageFrequencyDeviation
Attributes.Description: Input is voltage frequency deviation from remote terminal bus.

Attributes.Name: remoteBusVoltageAmplitudeDerivative
Attributes.Description: Input is branch current amplitude derivative from remote terminal bus.

Attributes.Name: remotePuBusVoltageDerivative
Attributes.Description: Input is PU voltage derivative from remote terminal bus.

Attributes.Name: remoteBusFrequencyDeviation
Attributes.Description: Input is frequency deviation from remote terminal bus.

Entities.Name: StaticVarCompensatorDynamics
Entities.Description: Static var compensator whose behaviour is described by reference to a standard model <font color="#0f0f0f">or by definition of a user-defined model.</font>

DerivedEntities.Name: SVCUserDefined
DerivedEntities.Description: Static var compensator (SVC) function block whose dynamic behaviour is described by <font color="#0f0f0f">a user-defined model.</font>

Attributes.Name: proprietary
Attributes.Description:
Behaviour is based on a proprietary model as opposed to a detailed model.
true = user-defined model is proprietary with behaviour mutually understood by sending and receiving applications and parameters passed as general attributes
false = user-defined model is explicitly defined in terms of control blocks and their input and output signals.

Entities.Name: CurrentLimit
Entities.Description: Operational limit on current.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: Limit on current flow. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: normalValue
Attributes.Description: The normal value for limit on current flow. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Entities.Name: BranchGroup
Entities.Description: A group of branch terminals whose directed flow summation is to be monitored. A branch group need not form a cutset of the network.

Attributes.Name: minimumActivePower
Attributes.Description: The minimum active power flow.

Attributes.Name: monitorActivePower
Attributes.Description: Monitor the active power flow.

Attributes.Name: maximumReactivePower
Attributes.Description: The maximum reactive power flow.

Attributes.Name: maximumActivePower
Attributes.Description: The maximum active power flow.

Attributes.Name: monitorReactivePower
Attributes.Description: Monitor the reactive power flow.

Attributes.Name: minimumReactivePower
Attributes.Description: The minimum reactive power flow.

Entities.Name: ActivePowerLimit
Entities.Description: Limit on active power flow.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: Value of active power limit. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: normalValue
Attributes.Description: The normal value of active power limit. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Entities.Name: BranchGroupTerminal
Entities.Description: A specific directed terminal flow for a branch group.

Attributes.Name: positiveFlowIn
Attributes.Description: The flow into the terminal is summed if set true.   The flow out of the terminal is summed if set false.

Entities.Name: OperationalLimitDirectionKind
Entities.Description: The direction attribute describes the side of  a limit that is a violation.

Attributes.Name: low
Attributes.Description: Low means a monitored value below the limit is a violation.  If applied to a terminal flow, the positive direction is into the terminal.

Attributes.Name: high
Attributes.Description: High means that a monitored value above the limit value is a violation.   If applied to a terminal flow, the positive direction is into the terminal.

Attributes.Name: absoluteValue
Attributes.Description: An absoluteValue limit means that a monitored absolute value above the limit value is a violation.

Entities.Name: ResourcePerformanceTimeSeriesFactor
Entities.Description: Represents the performance of a resource as time series data for a specified time period, time interval, and evaluation criteria.

Attributes.Name: value2Description
Attributes.Description: Description for the value2 contained within the TimeSeriesFactor.

Attributes.Name: timeSeriesDataType
Attributes.Description: Type of the time series data, e.g. baseline data, meter read data, computed performance data.

Attributes.Name: timeSeriesDescription
Attributes.Description: Optional description of the time series data, e.g. baseline data, meter read data, computed performance data.

Attributes.Name: value1Description
Attributes.Description: Description for the value1 contained within the TimeSeriesFactor.

Entities.Name: ExPostMarketRegionResults
Entities.Description: Model of expost calculation of cleared MW on a region basis.  Includes cleared price.

Entities.Name: MPMTestResults
Entities.Description: Provides the outcome and margin percent (as appropriate) result data for the MPM tests.  There are relationships to Zone for Designated Congestion Area Tests, CurveSchedData for bid segment tests, to the SubControlArea for the system wide level tests, and Pnodes for the LMPM impact tests.

Attributes.Name: outcome
Attributes.Description: The results of the test. For the Price, Impact, and Conduct tests, typical values are NA, Pass, Fail, Disable, or Skip.

Attributes.Name: marginPercent
Attributes.Description: Used to show the Margin % result of the Impact test

Entities.Name: RMRDetermination
Entities.Description: Indicates whether unit is a reliablity must run unit: required to be on to satisfy Grid Code Reliablitiy criteria, load demand, or voltage support.

Entities.Name: MarketResults
Entities.Description: This class holds elements that are single values for the entire market time horizon. That is, for the Day Ahead market, there is 1 value for each element, not hourly based.  Is a summary of the market run.

Attributes.Name: ancillarySvcCost
Attributes.Description: Total  AS Cost (i.e., payment) ($) over the time horizon

Attributes.Name: startUpCost
Attributes.Description: Total Start-up Cost ($) over the time horizon

Attributes.Name: contingentOperatingResAvail
Attributes.Description: Global Contingent Operating Reserve Availability Indicator (Yes/No)

Attributes.Name: minimumLoadCost
Attributes.Description: Total Minimum Load Cost ($) over the time horizon

Attributes.Name: energyCost
Attributes.Description: Total Energy Cost ($) over the time horizon

Attributes.Name: totalRucCost
Attributes.Description: The total RUC capacity cost for this interval

Attributes.Name: totalCost
Attributes.Description: Total Cost (Energy + AS) cost ($) by over the time horizon

Entities.Name: MitigatedBidSegment
Entities.Description: Model of mitigated bid. Indicates segment of piece-wise linear bid, that has been mitigated.

Attributes.Name: segmentMW
Attributes.Description: Mitigated bid segment MW value

Attributes.Name: segmentNumber
Attributes.Description: Mitigated Bid Segment Number

Entities.Name: Commitments
Entities.Description: Provides the necessary information (on a resource basis) to capture the Startup/Shutdown commitment results. This information is relevant to all markets.

Attributes.Name: intervalStartTime
Attributes.Description: Start time for the commitment period. This will be on an interval boundary.

Attributes.Name: instructionType
Attributes.Description: Indicator of either a Start-Up or a Shut-Down.

Attributes.Name: commitmentType
Attributes.Description: the type of UC status (self commitment, ISO commitment, or SCUC commitment)

Attributes.Name: intervalEndTime
Attributes.Description: End time for the commitment period. This will be on an interval boundary.

Attributes.Name: instructionCost
Attributes.Description: Total cost associated with changing the status of the resource.

Attributes.Name: noLoadCost
Attributes.Description: Unit no load cost in case of energy commodity

Attributes.Name: minStatusChangeTime
Attributes.Description:
SCUC commitment period start-up time. Calculated start up time based on the StartUpTimeCurve provided with the Bid.

This is a combination of StartUp time bid and Unit down time. 

Units is minutes

Entities.Name: SelfScheduleBreakdown
Entities.Description: Model of Self Schedules Results.  Includes self schedule MW,and type of self schedule for each self schedule type included in total self schedule MW value found in ResourceAwardInstruction.

Attributes.Name: selfSchedMW
Attributes.Description: Cleared value for the specific self schedule type listed.

Attributes.Name: selfSchedType
Attributes.Description: Self schedule breakdown type.

Entities.Name: CommodityPrice
Entities.Description: The CommodityPrice class is used to define the price of a commodity during a given time interval.  The interval may be long, e.g. a year, or very short, e.g. 5 minutes.  There will be many instances of the CommodityPrice class for each instance of the CommodityDefinition to which it is associated.  Note that there may be more than once price associated with a given interval and these variances are described by the association (or associations) with the PriceDescriptor class.

Attributes.Name: timeIntervalPeriod
Attributes.Description: The time interval over which the CommodityPrice is valid, using the standard conventions associated with the DateTimeInterval class.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: The price of the Commodity, expressed as a floating point value with the currency and unit of measure defined in the associated CommodityDefinition class.

Entities.Name: ResourcePerformanceEvaluation
Entities.Description: Represents an the performance evaluation of a resource deployment. Every resource deployment may have many performance evaluations, using different evaluation metrics or algorithms, or produced by different evaluation authorities.

Attributes.Name: evaluationDescription
Attributes.Description: Description of the performance evaluation, e.g. the rating classification used (any is allowed), why the evaluation was performed, anything that describes the demand response performance evaluation.

Attributes.Name: evaluationValue
Attributes.Description: The value of the performance. as a String, any rating scheme is supported (e.g. "1","2","3" or "low", "medium", "high"). The rating scheme is described in the performanceValueDescription attribute.

Entities.Name: ExPostPricingResults
Entities.Description: Model of ex-post pricing of nodes.  Includes LMP information, pnode based.

Attributes.Name: lmp
Attributes.Description:
5 min weighted average LMP; the Location Marginal Price of the Pnode for which price calculation is carried out. 
Attribute Usage: 5 min weighted average LMP  to be displayed on UI

Attributes.Name: congestLMP
Attributes.Description:
Congestion component of Location Marginal Price (LMP) in monetary units per MW; congestion component of the hourly LMP at a specific pricing node 
Attribute Usage: Result of the Security, Pricing, and Dispatch(SPD)/Simultaneous Feasibility Test(SFT) software and denotes the hourly congestion component of LMP for each pricing node.

Attributes.Name: lossLMP
Attributes.Description:
Loss component of Location Marginal Price (LMP) in monetary units per MW; loss component of the hourly LMP at a specific pricing node 
Attribute Usage: Result of the Security, Pricing, and Dispatch(SPD)/Simultaneous Feasibility Test(SFT) software and denotes the hourly loss component of LMP for each pricing node.

Entities.Name: PriceDescriptor
Entities.Description: The price of a Commodity during a given time interval may change over time.  For example, a price may be forecasted a year ahead, a month ahead, a day ahead, an hour ahead, and in real time; this is defined using the MarketType. Additionally a price may have one or more components. For example, a locational marginal energy price may be the arithmetic sum of the system price, the congestion price, and the loss price.  The priceType enumeration is used determine if the price is the complete price (priceType="total") or one of potentially many constituent components.

Attributes.Name: priceType
Attributes.Description: The "kind" of price being described.  In general, the priceType will either be "total" to signify that the price is the price paid to buy or sell the commodity, sometimes referred to as an "all-in" price, or one of potentially many components.

Attributes.Name: marketType
Attributes.Description: The time frame for the price, using the standard conventions associated with the MarketType enumeration.

Entities.Name: ResourceDispatchResults
Entities.Description: The ResourceDispatchResults class provides market results that can be provided to a SC. The specific data provided consists of several indicators such as contingency flags, blocked start up, and RMR dispatch. It also provides the projected overall and the regulating status of the resource.

Attributes.Name: limitIndicator
Attributes.Description: indicate which limit is the constraints

Attributes.Name: resourceStatus
Attributes.Description: Unit Commitment Status (On/Off/Starting)

Attributes.Name: totalSchedule
Attributes.Description: Resource total upward schedule.  total schedule = En + all AS per resource per interval

Attributes.Name: lowerLimit
Attributes.Description: resource energy ramping lower limit

Attributes.Name: contingencyFlag
Attributes.Description: Contingent Operating Reserve Indicator (Yes/No).  Resource participating with AS capacity in contingency dispatch.

Attributes.Name: penaltyDispatchIndicator
Attributes.Description: Penalty Dispatch Indicator (Yes / No) indicating an un-economic adjustment.

Attributes.Name: blockedPublishDOP
Attributes.Description: Block sending DOP to ADS (Y/N)

Attributes.Name: maxRampRate
Attributes.Description: maximum ramp rate

Attributes.Name: regulatingLimitHigh
Attributes.Description: The upper regulating limit incorporating any derate used by the RTD for the Binding Interval.

Attributes.Name: operatingLimitHigh
Attributes.Description: The upper operating limit incorporating any derate used by the RTD for the Binding Interval.

Attributes.Name: operatingLimitLow
Attributes.Description: The lower operating limit incorporating any derate used by the RTD for the Binding Interval.

Attributes.Name: blockedDispatch
Attributes.Description: Blocked Dispatch Indicator (Yes/No)

Attributes.Name: upperLimit
Attributes.Description: resource energy ramping upper limit

Attributes.Name: regulatingLimitLow
Attributes.Description: The lower regulating limit incorporating any derate used by the RTD for the Binding Interval.

Attributes.Description: The MW amount the resource can contribute for this deployment. This is from the DR provider - as a response? Or actual? Does this belong in settlement? Discuss more.

Attributes.Name: acceptStatus
Attributes.Description: Status of the resource for this deployment. Values include (full compliance, partial compliance, opt-out, etc.)

Attributes.Name: acceptComments
Attributes.Description: Commenst to explain why the acceptance status. For example, to explain why a request is accepted only partially, instead of fully.

Attributes.Name: sequence

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: The value of an interval given a profile type (amount, price, or quantity), subject to the UOM.

Attributes.Name: timeStamp
Attributes.Description: The date and time of an interval.

Entities.Name: ExPostResourceResults
Entities.Description: Model of ex-post pricing of resources contains components of LMPs: energy, congestion, loss. Resource based.

Attributes.Name: congestionLMP

Attributes.Name: minEconomicMW

Attributes.Name: desiredMW

Attributes.Name: lossLMP
Attributes.Description: loss lmp (deprecated)

Attributes.Name: lmp
Attributes.Description: LMP (Local Marginal Price) in USD at the equipment (deprecated)

Attributes.Name: status

Attributes.Name: resourceMW
Attributes.Description:
Current MW output of the equipment 
Attribute Usage: Information purposes - Information purposes - Output of LPA engine.

Attributes.Name: tempLoadFollowingUpManualCap

Attributes.Description: Congestion component of Location Marginal Price (LMP) in monetary units per MW.

Attributes.Name: costLMP

Attributes.Name: scheduledMW

Attributes.Name: marginalClearingPrice

Attributes.Description: Loss component of Location Marginal Price (LMP) in monetary units per MW.

Attributes.Description: instruction source for market quality results (INS, ACT)

Attributes.Name: instructionType
Attributes.Description: Indicator of either a Start-Up or a Shut-Down.

The binding<font color="#0f0f0f">DOD instructions are cumulative; in other words a second DOD instruction does not replace the previous DOD, instead the second DOD adds to the previous DODs.</font>

Attributes.Name: instructionCost
Attributes.Description: Total cost associated with changing the status of the resource.

Attributes.Name: instructionStartTime

Time the resource should be at Pmin (for start ups).

Time the resource is off line.

SCUC commitment period start-up time. Calculated start up time based on the StartUpTimeCurve provided with the Bid.

Units is minutes

Interval Test Status

Directs if a unit is allowed to set the price (ex-post pricing).

Attributes.Name: meterLoadFollowing

Attributes.Name: unitStatus

Attributes.Name: expectedEnergy
Attributes.Description: Expected energy.

Attributes.Name: nonRampRestrictedMW
Attributes.Description: Desired MW that is not ramp restricted. If no ramp rate limit existed for the unit, this is the MW value tha t the unit was requested to move to.

Attributes.Description: The Degree of Generator Performance (DGP) used for the unit. Measure of how a generator responds to raise /lower signals.  Calculated every five minutes.

Attributes.Description: weighted average for RTPD and RTCD and same for RTID

Entities.Name: ResourceClearing

Entities.Name: DopInstruction
Entities.Description: Provides the necessary information (on a resource basis) to capture the Dispatch Operating Point (DOP) results on a Dispatch interval. This information is only relevant to the RT interval market.

Attributes.Name: timestampDOP
Attributes.Description: DOP time stamp

Attributes.Name: runIndicatorDOP
Attributes.Description:
Indication of DOP validity. 

Shows the DOP is calculated from the latest run (YES). A NO indicator shows that the DOP is copied from a previous execution.

Up to 2 intervals can be missed.

Attributes.Name: plotPriority
Attributes.Description: A value used to establish priority of the DOP when plotting.  This is only applicable when two DOPs exist for the same time, but with different MW values.  E.g. when indicating a step in the curve.  Its used to determine if the curve steps up or down.

Attributes.Name: mwDOP
Attributes.Description: Dispatched Operating Point (MW)

Entities.Name: MitigatedBid
Entities.Description: Mitigated bid results posted for a given settlement period.

Entities.Name: ExPostLossResults
Entities.Description: Model results of ex-post calculation of MW losses. Summarizes loss in two categories losses on the the extra high voltage transmission and total losses. Calculated for each subcontrol area.

Attributes.Name: totalLossMW
Attributes.Description:
Total MW losses in the company 
Attribute Usage: Information purposes - Output of LPA engine.

Attributes.Name: ehvLossMW
Attributes.Description:
EHV MW losses in the company 
Attribute Usage: Information purposes - Output of LPA engine.

Entities.Name: RUCAwardInstruction
Entities.Description: This class models the information about the RUC awards.

Attributes.Name: RUCAward
Attributes.Description: The RUC Award of a resource is the portion of the RUC Capacity that is not under RA or RMR contracts. The RUC Award of a resource is the portion of the RUC Capacity that is eligible for RUC Availability payment.

Attributes.Name: RUCSchedule
Attributes.Description: The RUC Schedule of a resource is its output level that balances the load forecast used in RUC. The RUC Schedule in RUC is similar to the DA Schedule in DAM.

Attributes.Name: clearedPrice
Attributes.Description: Marginal Price ($/MW) for the commodity (Regulation Up, Regulation Down, Spinning Reserve, or Non-spinning reserve) for pricing run.

Attributes.Name: marketProductType
Attributes.Description:
major product type may include the following but not limited to:

Energy
Regulation Up
Regulation Dn
Spinning Reserve
Non-Spinning Reserve
Operating Reserve

Attributes.Name: RUCCapacity
Attributes.Description: The RUC Capacity of a resource is the difference between (i) the RUC Schedule and (ii) the higher of the DA Schedule and the Minimum Load.

Entities.Name: ResourcePerformanceGlobalFactor
Entities.Description: Global factors are property/value pairs that are used to adjust resource performance values. Example include scale factors (e.g. scale a baseline up or down), adders (positive or negative), etc.

Attributes.Name: factorDescription
Attributes.Description: Description (name) of the property (factor).

Attributes.Name: factorValue

Attributes.Name: isArmConnect
Attributes.Description: True if the RCD switch has to be armed before a connect action can be initiated.

Entities.Name: GovHydroFrancis
Entities.Description:
Detailed hydro unit - Francis model.  This model can be used to represent three types of governors.
A schematic of the hydraulic system of detailed hydro unit models, such as Francis and Pelton, is provided in the DetailedHydroModelHydraulicSystem diagram.

Attributes.Name: av0

Attributes.Name: etamax
Attributes.Description: Maximum efficiency (EtaMax). Typical value = 1,05.

Attributes.Name: h2
Attributes.Description: Head of surge tank water level with respect to the level of penstock (H2). Unit = km. Typical value = 0,040.

Attributes.Name: qc0
Attributes.Description: No-load turbine flow at nominal head (Qc0). Typical value = 0,1.

Attributes.Name: twng
Attributes.Description: Water tunnel and surge chamber inertia time constant (Twng) (>= 0). Typical value = 3.

Attributes.Name: vc
Attributes.Description: Maximum gate closing velocity (Vc). Unit = PU / s. Typical value = -0,06.

Attributes.Name: kt
Attributes.Description: Washout gain (Kt). Typical value = 0,25.

Attributes.Name: zsfc
Attributes.Description: Head of upper water level with respect to the level of penstock (Zsfc). Unit = km. Typical value = 0,025.

Attributes.Name: waterTunnelSurgeChamberSimulation
Attributes.Description: Water tunnel and surge chamber simulation (Tflag). true = enable of water tunnel and surge chamber simulation false = inhibit of water tunnel and surge chamber simulation. Typical value = false.

Attributes.Name: twnc
Attributes.Description: Water inertia time constant (Twnc) (>= 0). Typical value = 1.

Attributes.Name: valvmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum gate opening (ValvMin) (< GovHydroFrancis.valvmax). Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: kc
Attributes.Description: Penstock loss coefficient (due to friction) (Kc). Typical value = 0,025.

Attributes.Name: tx
Attributes.Description: Derivative feedback gain (Tx) (>= 0). Typical value = 1.

Attributes.Name: am
Attributes.Description: Opening section SEFF at the maximum efficiency (Am). Typical value = 0,7.

Attributes.Name: av1
Attributes.Description: Area of the compensation tank (AV1). Unit = m2. Typical value = 700.

Attributes.Name: ts
Attributes.Description: Gate servo time constant (Ts) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,5.

Attributes.Name: bp
Attributes.Description: Droop (Bp). Typical value = 0,05.

Attributes.Name: ta
Attributes.Description: Derivative gain (Ta) (>= 0). Typical value = 3.

Attributes.Name: db1
Attributes.Description: Intentional dead-band width (DB1). Unit = Hz. Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: valvmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum gate opening (ValvMax) (> GovHydroFrancis.valvmin). Typical value = 1,1.

Attributes.Name: va
Attributes.Description: Maximum gate opening velocity (Va). Unit = PU / s. Typical value = 0,06.

Attributes.Name: td
Attributes.Description: Washout time constant (Td) (>= 0). Typical value = 6.

Attributes.Name: governorControl
Attributes.Description: Governor control flag (Cflag). Typical value = mechanicHydrolicTachoAccelerator.

Attributes.Name: hn
Attributes.Description: Rated hydraulic head (Hn). Unit = km. Typical value = 0,250.

Attributes.Name: kg
Attributes.Description: Water tunnel and surge chamber loss coefficient (due to friction) (Kg). Typical value = 0,025.
