Attributes.Description: Water inertia time constant (Tw) (> 0). Typical value = 1.

Attributes.Name: gmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum gate opening, PU of MWbase (Gmax) (> GovHydro4.gmin). Typical value = 1.

Attributes.Name: pgv4
Attributes.Description: Nonlinear gain point 4, PU power (Pgv4) (= 0 for simple). Typical value for Francis/Pelton = 0,9, Kaplan = 0,917.

Attributes.Name: tblade
Attributes.Description: Blade servo time constant (Tblade) (>= 0). Typical value = 100.

Attributes.Name: bgv5
Attributes.Description: Kaplan blade servo point 5 (Bgv5) (= 0 for simple, = 0 for Francis/Pelton). Typical value for Kaplan = 1.

Attributes.Name: tp
Attributes.Description: Pilot servo time constant (Tp) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,1.

Attributes.Name: gmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum gate opening, PU of MWbase (Gmin) (< GovHydro4.gmax). Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: tr
Attributes.Description: Dashpot time constant (Tr) (>= 0). Typical value = 5.

Attributes.Name: at
Attributes.Description: Turbine gain (At). Typical value = 1,2.

Attributes.Name: tg
Attributes.Description: Gate servo time constant (Tg) (> 0). Typical value = 0,5.

Attributes.Name: pgv0
Attributes.Description: Nonlinear gain point 0, PU power (Pgv0) (= 0 for simple). Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: uc
Attributes.Description: Max gate closing velocity (Uc). Typical value = 0,2.

Attributes.Name: bgv1
Attributes.Description: Kaplan blade servo point 1 (Bgv1) (= 0 for simple, = 0 for Francis/Pelton). Typical value for Kaplan = 0.

Attributes.Name: rperm
Attributes.Description: Permanent droop (Rperm) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,05.

Attributes.Name: bgv3
Attributes.Description: Kaplan blade servo point 3 (Bgv3) (= 0 for simple, = 0 for Francis/Pelton). Typical value for Kaplan = 0,667.

Attributes.Name: pgv5
Attributes.Description: Nonlinear gain point 5, PU power (Pgv5) (= 0 for simple). Typical value for Francis/Pelton = 0,97, Kaplan = 0,99.

Attributes.Name: bgv4
Attributes.Description: Kaplan blade servo point 4 (Bgv4) (= 0 for simple, = 0 for Francis/Pelton). Typical value for Kaplan = 0,9.

Attributes.Name: qnl
Attributes.Description: No-load flow at nominal head (Qnl). Typical value for simple = 0,08, Francis/Pelton = 0, Kaplan = 0.

Attributes.Name: gv0
Attributes.Description: Nonlinear gain point 0, PU gv (Gv0) (= 0 for simple). Typical for Francis/Pelton = 0,1, Kaplan = 0,1.

Attributes.Name: db1
Attributes.Description: Intentional deadband width (db1). Unit = Hz. Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: bmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum blade adjustment factor (Bmax) (= 0 for simple, = 0 for Francis/Pelton). Typical value for Kaplan = 1,1276.

Attributes.Name: dturb
Attributes.Description: Turbine damping factor (Dturb). Unit = delta P (PU of MWbase) / delta speed (PU). Typical value for simple = 0,5, Francis/Pelton = 1,1, Kaplan = 1,1.

Attributes.Name: uo
Attributes.Description: Max gate opening velocity (Uo). Typical value = 0,2.

Attributes.Name: gv1
Attributes.Description: Nonlinear gain point 1, PU gv (Gv1) (= 0 for simple, > GovHydro4.gv0 for Francis/Pelton and Kaplan). Typical value for Francis/Pelton = 0,4, Kaplan = 0,4.

Attributes.Name: gv2
Attributes.Description: Nonlinear gain point 2, PU gv (Gv2) (= 0 for simple, > GovHydro4.gv1 for Francis/Pelton and Kaplan). Typical value for Francis/Pelton = 0,5, Kaplan = 0,5.

Entities.Name: GovHydroPelton
Entities.Description:
Detailed hydro unit - Pelton model.  This model can be used to represent the dynamic related to water tunnel and surge chamber.
The DetailedHydroModelHydraulicSystem diagram, located under the GovHydroFrancis class, provides a schematic of the hydraulic system of detailed hydro unit models, such as Francis and Pelton.

Attributes.Name: vc
Attributes.Description: Maximum gate closing velocity (Vc). Unit = PU / s. Typical value = -0,06.

Attributes.Name: av1
Attributes.Description: Area of the compensation tank (AV1). Unit = m2. Typical value = 700.

Attributes.Name: kg
Attributes.Description: Water tunnel and surge chamber loss coefficient (due to friction) (Kg). Typical value = 0,025.

Attributes.Name: qc0
Attributes.Description: No-load turbine flow at nominal head (Qc0). Typical value = 0,05.

Attributes.Name: ta
Attributes.Description: Derivative gain (accelerometer time constant) (Ta) (>= 0). Typical value = 3.

Attributes.Name: staticCompensating
Attributes.Description: Static compensating characteristic (Cflag). It should be true if simplifiedPelton = false. true = enable of static compensating characteristic false = inhibit of static compensating characteristic. Typical value = false.

Attributes.Name: kc
Attributes.Description: Penstock loss coefficient (due to friction) (Kc). Typical value = 0,025.

Attributes.Name: h2
Attributes.Description: Head of surge tank water level with respect to the level of penstock (H2). Unit = km. Typical value = 0,040.

Attributes.Name: vav
Attributes.Description: Maximum servomotor valve opening velocity (Vav). Typical value = 0,1.

Attributes.Name: qn
Attributes.Description: Rated flow (Qn). Unit = m3/s. Typical value = 250.

Attributes.Name: av0
Attributes.Description: Area of the surge tank (AV0). Unit = m2. Typical value = 30.

Attributes.Name: valvmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum gate opening (ValvMax) (> GovHydroPelton.valvmin). Typical value = 1,1.

Attributes.Name: tv
Attributes.Description: Servomotor integrator time constant (Tv) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,3.

Attributes.Name: valvmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum gate opening (ValvMin) (< GovHydroPelton.valvmax). Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: db1
Attributes.Description: Intentional dead-band width (DB1). Unit = Hz. Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: waterTunnelSurgeChamberSimulation
Attributes.Description: Water tunnel and surge chamber simulation (Tflag). true = enable of water tunnel and surge chamber simulation false = inhibit of water tunnel and surge chamber simulation. Typical value = false.

Attributes.Name: twng
Attributes.Description: Water tunnel and surge chamber inertia time constant (Twng) (>= 0). Typical value = 3.

Attributes.Name: vcv
Attributes.Description: Maximum servomotor valve closing velocity (Vcv). Typical value = -0,1.

Attributes.Name: tx
Attributes.Description: Electronic integrator time constant (Tx) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,5.

Attributes.Name: ts
Attributes.Description: Gate servo time constant (Ts) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,15.

Attributes.Name: db2
Attributes.Description: Intentional dead-band width of valve opening error (DB2). Unit = Hz. Typical value = 0,01.

Attributes.Name: twnc
Attributes.Description: Water inertia time constant (Twnc) (>= 0). Typical value = 1.

Attributes.Name: zsfc
Attributes.Description: Head of upper water level with respect to the level of penstock (Zsfc). Unit = km. Typical value = 0,025.

Attributes.Name: bp
Attributes.Description: Droop (bp). Typical value = 0,05.

Attributes.Name: va
Attributes.Description: Maximum gate opening velocity (Va). Unit = PU / s. Typical value = 0,06.

Attributes.Name: h1
Attributes.Description: Head of compensation chamber water level with respect to the level of penstock (H1). Unit = km. Typical value = 0,004.

Attributes.Name: hn
Attributes.Description: Rated hydraulic head (Hn). Unit = km. Typical value = 0,250.

Attributes.Name: simplifiedPelton
Attributes.Description: Simplified Pelton model simulation (Sflag). true = enable of simplified Pelton model simulation false = enable of complete Pelton model simulation (non-linear gain). Typical value = true.

Entities.Name: MarketActualEvent
Entities.Description: This class represents the actual instance of an event.

DerivedEntities.Name: DistributedResourceActualEvent
DerivedEntities.Description: A demand response event is created when there is a need to call upon resources to respond to demand adjustment requests. These events are created by ISO/RTO system operations and managed  by a demand response management system (DRMS). These events may or may not be coordinated with the Market Events and a defined Energy Market. The event will call for the deployment of a number of registered resources, or for deployment of resources within a zone (an organizational area within the power system that contains a number of resources).

Attributes.Name: totalPowerAdjustment
Attributes.Description: Total active power adjustment (e.g. load reduction) requested for this demand response event.

Attributes.Name: eventComments
Attributes.Description: Free format comments for the event, for any purpose needed.

Attributes.Description: Start time of the event.

Attributes.Name: eventType
Attributes.Description: Actual event type.

Attributes.Name: eventEndTime
Attributes.Description: End time of the event.

The market run represent the whole process. MarketRuns can be defined for markets such as Day Ahead Market, Real Time Market, Hour Ahead Market, Week Ahead Market, etc.

This is the state controlled by market defintion service.

Attributes.Name: suspect
Attributes.Description: A correlation function has detected that the value is not consistent with other values. Typically set by a network State Estimator.

Attributes.Name: badReference
Attributes.Description: Measurement value may be incorrect due to a reference being out of calibration.

Attributes.Name: failure
Attributes.Description: This identifier indicates that a supervision function has detected an internal or external failure, e.g. communication failure.

Attributes.Name: oldData
Attributes.Description: Measurement value is old and possibly invalid, as it has not been successfully updated during a specified time interval.

Attributes.Name: oscillatory
Attributes.Description: To prevent some overload of the communication it is sensible to detect and suppress oscillating (fast changing) binary inputs. If a signal changes in a defined time twice in the same direction (from 0 to 1 or from 1 to 0) then oscillation is detected and the detail quality identifier "oscillatory" is set. If it is detected a configured numbers of transient changes could be passed by. In this time the validity status "questionable" is set. If after this defined numbers of changes the signal is still in the oscillating state the value shall be set either to the opposite state of the previous stable value or to a defined default value. In this case the validity status "questionable" is reset and "invalid" is set as long as the signal is oscillating. If it is configured such that no transient changes should be passed by then the validity status "invalid" is set immediately in addition to the detail quality identifier "oscillatory" (used for status information only).

Attributes.Name: overFlow
Attributes.Description: Measurement value is beyond the capability of being  represented properly. For example, a counter value overflows from maximum count back to a value of zero.

Attributes.Name: validity
Attributes.Description: Validity of the measurement value.

Attributes.Name: estimatorReplaced
Attributes.Description: Value has been replaced by State Estimator. estimatorReplaced is not an IEC61850 quality bit but has been put in this class for convenience.

Attributes.Name: operatorBlocked
Attributes.Description: Measurement value is blocked and hence unavailable for transmission.

Attributes.Name: outOfRange
Attributes.Description: Measurement value is beyond a predefined range of value.

Attributes.Name: source
Attributes.Description: Source gives information related to the origin of a value. The value may be acquired from the process, defaulted or substituted.

Attributes.Name: test
Attributes.Description: Measurement value is transmitted for test purposes.

The actual meaning and use of a Limit instance (i.e., if it is an alarm or warning limit or if it is a high or low limit) is not captured in the Limit class. However the name of a Limit instance may indicate both meaning and use.

Attributes.Name: QUESTIONABLE
Attributes.Description: The value is marked questionable if a supervision function detects an abnormal behaviour, however the value could still be valid. The client is responsible for determining whether or not values marked "questionable" should be used.

Attributes.Name: GOOD
Attributes.Description: The value is marked good if no abnormal condition of the acquisition function or the information source is detected.

Attributes.Name: INVALID
Attributes.Description: The value is marked invalid when a supervision function recognises abnormal conditions of the acquisition function or the information source (missing or non-operating updating devices). The value is not defined under this condition. The mark invalid is used to indicate to the client that the value may be incorrect and shall not be used.

Entities.Name: ExternalCustomerAgreement
Entities.Description: A type of customer agreement involving an external agency. For example, a customer may form a contracts with an Energy Service Supplier if Direct Access is permitted.

Entities.Name: ServiceGuarantee
Entities.Description:
A service guarantee, often imposed by a regulator, defines conditions that, if not satisfied, will result in the utility making a monetary payment to the customer. Note that guarantee's identifier is in the 'name' attribute and the status of the guarantee is in the 'Status.status' attribute.
Example service requirements include:
1) If power is not restored within 24 hours, customers can claim $50 for residential customers or $100 for commercial and industrial customers. In addition for each extra period of 12 hours the customer's supply has not been activated, the customer can claim $25.
2) If a customer has a question about their electricity bill, the utility will investigate and respond to the inquiry within 15 working days. If utility fails to meet its guarantee, utility will automatically pay the customer $50.

Attributes.Name: serviceRequirement
Attributes.Description: Explanation of the requirement and conditions for satisfying it.

Attributes.Name: payAmount
Attributes.Description: Amount to be paid by the service provider to the customer for each violation of the 'serviceRequirement'.

Attributes.Name: applicationPeriod
Attributes.Description: Period in which this service guantee applies.

Attributes.Name: automaticPay
Attributes.Description: True if utility must autmatically pay the specified amount whenever the condition is not satisified, otherwise customer must make a claim to receive payment.

Entities.Name: CustomerBillingInfo
Entities.Description:
The creation of the monthly customer billing statements is the method employed to notify Customers of charges, adjustments and credits applied to their account for Services and Products. The actuall billing occurs through an ErpInvoice. The CustomerBillingInfo includes information from the payment, collection, meter reading, installed meter, service, site, customer, customer account, customer agreement, services and pricing subject areas. Each component price shows up as a separate line item on the ErpInvoice.
The Customer Billing Statement may include collection and account messages, marketing/civic event messages and bill inserts.
One Customer Billing Statement is produced for all Agreements under a CustomerAccount per billing cycle date defined in 'CustomerAccount.billingCycle'.
The history of CustomerBillingInfo, Invoices and Payments is to be maintained in associated ActivityRecords.

Attributes.Name: dueDate
Attributes.Description: Calculated date upon which a customer billing amount is due, used in the invoicing process to determine when a Customer's Payment is delinquent. It takes into consideration the regulatory criteria and the Customer's requested due date. In the absence of a Customer requested due date, the due date is typically calculated from the regulated number of days and the 'billingDate'.

Attributes.Name: lastPaymentAmt
Attributes.Description: Amount of the last payment received from the customer. It is retained in the Customer Billing system, although the details of each payment are tracked in the ERP system.

Attributes.Name: billingDate
Attributes.Description: Business date designated for the billing run which produced this CustomerBillingInfo.

Attributes.Name: pymtPlanType
Attributes.Description: Type of payment plan.

Attributes.Name: lastPaymentDate
Attributes.Description: Date of the last payment received from the customer. It is retained in the Customer Billing system, although the details of each payment are tracked in the ERP system.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of bill customer receives.

Attributes.Name: outBalance
Attributes.Description: Outstanding balance on the CustomerAccount as of the statement date.

Attributes.Name: pymtPlanAmt
Attributes.Description: Monthly amortized amount due during each billing cycle for the CustomerAccount balance for which the Payment Plan is set-up.

Actual amounts may be generated in a source application and then loaded to a specific ledger within the enterprise general ledger or budget application.

Entities.Name: FScale
Entities.Description:
Fujita scale (referred to as EF-scale starting in 2007) for tornado damage.  A set of wind estimates (not measurements) based on damage. It uses three-second gusts estimated at the point of damage based on a judgment of 8 levels of damage to 28 indicators. These estimates vary with height and exposure.  
The 3 second gust is not the same wind as in standard surface observations.
Enumerations based on NOAA conventions.

Attributes.Description: 86-110 mph 3-second gust.

Attributes.Name: four
Attributes.Description: 166-200 mph 3-second gust.

Attributes.Name: three

Attributes.Name: minusNine

Attributes.Name: two
Attributes.Description: 111-135 mph 3-second gust.

Attributes.Name: zero
Attributes.Description: 65-85 mph 3-second gust.

Attributes.Name: five
Attributes.Description: Over 200 mph 3-second gust.

Attributes.Description: Flash rate in strikes/hour/km<sup>2</sup>.

Entities.Name: SpaceAnalogKind
Entities.Description: Kinds of analogs (floats) measuring a space condition.

Entities.Name: RelativeDisplacementKind
Entities.Description: The types of relative displacement

Entities.Name: LocationKind
Entities.Description: The nature of the location being defined for an environmental entity. Possible values are center, perimeter, primary, secondary.

Attributes.Name: center
Attributes.Description: The center of a phenomenon. Will typically be used with a Location with a single PositionPoint instance.

Attributes.Name: secondary
Attributes.Description: Secondary area to which an environmental alert applies.

Attributes.Name: extent
Attributes.Description: The area or line of a phenomenon, not the center. Will typically be used with a Location with multiple PositionPoint instances.

Attributes.Name: primary
Attributes.Description: Primary area to which an environmental alert applies.

Entities.Name: AtmosphericAnalogKind
Entities.Description: Kinds of analogs (floats)  measuring an atmospheric condition.

Attributes.Name: snow
Attributes.Description: Snow amount over a specified period of time.

Attributes.Name: ambientTemperature
Attributes.Description: The temperature measured b<font color="#0f0f0f">y a thermometer exposed to the air in a place sheltered from direct solar radiation. </font>Also known as "dry bulb" because<font color="#0f0f0f"> the air temperature is indicated by a thermometer not affecte</font>d by the moisture of the air.

Attributes.Name: windSpeedInstantaneous
Attributes.Description: Wind speed at a moment in time.

Attributes.Name: windChill
Attributes.Description: The temperature of how cold it "feels like" based on the rate of heat loss from exposed skin caused by the effects of wind and cold temperatures.

Attributes.Name: windSpeedGust
Attributes.Description:
Maximum instantaneous wind speed in the 10 minute period preceding a moment in time so long as more than 10 knots of difference has been exhibited between peaks and lulls during that 10 minute time period. 
0 value means no gusts during preceding 10 minute period.

Attributes.Name: windSpeedSustained
Attributes.Description: Average instantaneous wind speed over the 2-minute time period preceding a moment in time.

Attributes.Name: heatIndex
Attributes.Description: The temperature of how hot it "feels like" for a given combination of warm air temperature and relative humidity.

Attributes.Name: windSpeedPeak
Attributes.Description:
Peak instantaneous wind speed in the 60 minutes preceding a moment in time as long as peak speed greater than 25 knots.  
0 value means speed did not exceed 25 knots during preceding 60 minutes.

Attributes.Name: dewPoint
Attributes.Description: The temperature to which air must be cooled at constant pressure and constant water-vapor content in order for saturation to occur. In other words, it is the temperature at which water vapor starts to condense out of the air.

Entities.Name: SVC
Entities.Description: SVC asset allows the capacitive and inductive ratings for each phase to be specified individually if required.

Attributes.Name: inductiveRating
Attributes.Description: Maximum inductive reactive power.

Attributes.Name: capacitiveRating
Attributes.Description: Maximum capacitive reactive power.

Entities.Name: BusNameMarker
Entities.Description: Used to apply user standard names to TopologicalNodes. Associated with one or more terminals that are normally connected with the bus name.    The associated terminals are normally connected by non-retained switches. For a ring bus station configuration, all BusbarSection terminals in the ring are typically associated.   For a breaker and a half scheme, both BusbarSections would normally be associated.  For a ring bus, all BusbarSections would normally be associated.  For a "straight" busbar configuration, normally only the main terminal at the BusbarSection would be associated.

Attributes.Name: priority
Attributes.Description: Priority of bus name marker for use as topology bus name.  Use 0 for do not care.  Use 1 for highest priority.  Use 2 as priority is less than 1 and so on.

DerivedEntities.Name: PssIEEE3B
DerivedEntities.Description:
IEEE 421.5-2005 type PSS3B power system stabilizer model. The PSS model PSS3B has dual inputs of electrical power and rotor angular frequency deviation. The signals are used to derive an equivalent mechanical power signal.
This model has 2 input signals. They have the following fixed types (expressed in terms of InputSignalKind values): the first one is of rotorAngleFrequencyDeviation type and the second one is of generatorElectricalPower type.

DerivedEntities.Name: PssIEEE4B
DerivedEntities.Description: IEEE 421.5-2005 type PSS4B power system stabilizer. The PSS4B model represents a structure based on multiple working frequency bands. Three separate bands, respectively dedicated to the low-, intermediate- and high-frequency modes of oscillations, are used in this delta omega (speed input) PSS. There is an error in the in IEEE 421.5-2005 PSS4B model: the Pe input should read Pe. This implies that the input Pe needs to be multiplied by -1. Reference: IEEE 4B 421.5-2005, 8.4. Parameter details: This model has 2 input signals. They have the following fixed types (expressed in terms of InputSignalKind values): the first one is of rotorAngleFrequencyDeviation type and the second one is of generatorElectricalPower type.

Attributes.Name: phases
Attributes.Description:
Represents the normal network phasing condition. If the attribute is missing, three phases (ABC) shall be assumed, except for terminals of grounding classes (specializations of EarthFaultCompensator, GroundDisconnector, GroundSwitch, and Ground) which will be assumed to be N. Therefore, phase code ABCN is explicitly declared when needed, e.g. for star point grounding equipment.
The phase code on terminals connecting same ConnectivityNode or same TopologicalNode as well as for equipment between two terminals shall be consistent.

Entities.Name: NameType
Entities.Description:
Type of name. Possible values for attribute 'name' are implementation dependent but standard profiles may specify types. An enterprise may have multiple IT systems each having its own local name for the same object, e.g. a planning system may have different names from an EMS. An object may also have different names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14. The definition from CIM14 is:
The localName is a human readable name of the object. It is a free text name local to a node in a naming hierarchy similar to a file directory structure. A power system related naming hierarchy may be: Substation, VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have names that typically are unique among them.

Entities.Name: PhaseCode
Entities.Description:
An unordered enumeration of phase identifiers.  Allows designation of phases for both transmission and distribution equipment, circuits and loads.   The enumeration, by itself, does not describe how the phases are connected together or connected to ground.  Ground is not explicitly denoted as a phase.
Residential and small commercial loads are often served from single-phase, or split-phase, secondary circuits. For the example of s12N, phases 1 and 2 refer to hot wires that are 180 degrees out of phase, while N refers to the neutral wire. Through single-phase transformer connections, these secondary circuits may be served from one or two of the primary phases A, B, and C. For three-phase loads, use the A, B, C phase codes instead of s12N.
The integer values are from IEC 61968-9 to support revenue metering applications.

Attributes.Name: A
Attributes.Description: Phase A.

Attributes.Name: s1N
Attributes.Description: Secondary phase 1 and neutral.

Attributes.Name: s12N
Attributes.Description: Secondary phases 1, 2, and neutral.

Attributes.Name: s2
Attributes.Description: Secondary phase 2.

Attributes.Name: X
Attributes.Description: Unknown non-neutral phase.

Attributes.Name: XYN
Attributes.Description: Two unknown non-neutral phases plus neutral.

Attributes.Name: ABN
Attributes.Description: Phases A, B, and neutral.

Attributes.Name: ABCN
Attributes.Description: Phases A, B, C, and N.

Attributes.Name: XY
Attributes.Description: Two unknown non-neutral phases.

Attributes.Name: AN
Attributes.Description: Phases A and neutral.

Attributes.Name: ABC
Attributes.Description: Phases A, B, and C.

Attributes.Name: BN
Attributes.Description: Phases B and neutral.

Attributes.Name: ACN
Attributes.Description: Phases A, C and neutral.

Attributes.Name: BCN
Attributes.Description: Phases B, C, and neutral.

Attributes.Name: N
Attributes.Description: Neutral phase.

Attributes.Name: AB
Attributes.Description: Phases A and B.

Attributes.Name: s2N
Attributes.Description: Secondary phase 2 and neutral.

Attributes.Name: AC
Attributes.Description: Phases A and C.

Attributes.Name: s1
Attributes.Description: Secondary phase 1.

Attributes.Name: BC
Attributes.Description: Phases B and C.

Attributes.Name: s12
Attributes.Description: Secondary phase 1 and 2.

Attributes.Name: CN
Attributes.Description: Phases C and neutral.

Attributes.Name: none
Attributes.Description: No phases specified.

Attributes.Name: B
Attributes.Description: Phase B.

Attributes.Name: XN
Attributes.Description: Unknown non-neutral phase plus neutral.

Attributes.Name: C
Attributes.Description: Phase C.

This attribute exists to support management of utility monitoring stations and has no direct relationship to the manner in which time is expressed in EnvironmentalValueSet.

DerivedEntities.Name: RegisteredLoad
DerivedEntities.Description:
Model of a load that is registered to participate in the market.

RegisteredLoad is used to model any load that is served by the wholesale market directly. RegisteredLoads may be dispatchable or non-dispatchable and may or may not have bid curves. Examples of RegisteredLoads would include: distribution company load, energy retailer load, large bulk power system connected facility load.

Loads that are served indirectly, for example - through an energy retailer or a vertical utility, should be modeled as RegisteredDistributedResources. Examples of RegisteredDistributedResources would include: distribution level storage, distribution level generation and distribution level demand response.

DerivedEntities.Name: RemoteUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: A remote unit can be an RTU, IED, substation control system, control centre, etc. The communication with the remote unit can be through various standard protocols (e.g. IEC 61870, IEC 61850) or non standard protocols (e.g. DNP, RP570, etc.). A remote unit contains remote data points that might be telemetered, collected or calculated. The RemoteUnit class inherits PowerSystemResource. The intention is to allow RemoteUnits to have Measurements. These Measurements can be used to model unit status as operational, out of service, unit failure, etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: ControlArea
DerivedEntities.Description:
A control area is a grouping of generating units and/or loads and a cutset of tie lines (as terminals) which may be used for a variety of purposes including automatic generation control, power flow solution area interchange control specification, and input to load forecasting. All generation and load within the area defined by the terminals on the border are considered in the area interchange control. Note that any number of overlapping control area specifications can be superimposed on the physical model. The following general principles apply to ControlArea:
1.  The control area orientation for net interchange is positive for an import, negative for an export.
2.  The control area net interchange is determined by summing flows in Terminals. The Terminals are identified by creating a set of TieFlow objects associated with a ControlArea object. Each TieFlow object identifies one Terminal.
3.  In a single network model, a tie between two control areas must be modelled in both control area specifications, such that the two representations of the tie flow sum to zero.
4.  The normal orientation of Terminal flow is positive for flow into the conducting equipment that owns the Terminal. (i.e. flow from a bus into a device is positive.) However, the orientation of each flow in the control area specification must align with the control area convention, i.e. import is positive. If the orientation of the Terminal flow referenced by a TieFlow is positive into the control area, then this is confirmed by setting TieFlow.positiveFlowIn flag TRUE. If not, the orientation must be reversed by setting the TieFlow.positiveFlowIn flag FALSE.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktControlArea
DerivedEntities.Description: Market subclass of IEC 61970:ControlArea.

Attributes.Name: pTolerance
Attributes.Description: Active power net interchange tolerance. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: netInterchange
Attributes.Description: The specified positive net interchange into the control area, i.e. positive sign means flow into the area.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: The primary type of control area definition used to determine if this is used for automatic generation control, for planning interchange control, or other purposes.   A control area specified with primary type of automatic generation control could still be forecast and used as an interchange area in power flow analysis.

DerivedEntities.Name: TapChanger
DerivedEntities.Description: Mechanism for changing transformer winding tap positions.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktTapChanger
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC 61970:Wires:TapChanger.

DerivedEntities.Name: PhaseTapChanger
DerivedEntities.Description: A transformer phase shifting tap model that controls the phase angle difference across the power transformer and potentially the active power flow through the power transformer.  This phase tap model may also impact the voltage magnitude.

DerivedEntities.Name: PhaseTapChangerLinear
DerivedEntities.Description:
Describes a tap changer with a linear relation between the tap step and the phase angle difference across the transformer. This is a mathematical model that is an approximation of a real phase tap changer.
The phase angle is computed as stepPhaseShiftIncrement times the tap position.
The voltage magnitude of both sides is the same.

Attributes.Name: stepPhaseShiftIncrement
Attributes.Description:
Phase shift per step position. A positive value indicates a positive angle variation from the Terminal at the  PowerTransformerEnd,  where the TapChanger is located, into the transformer.
The actual phase shift increment might be more accurately computed from the symmetrical or asymmetrical models or a tap step table lookup if those are available.

Attributes.Name: xMax
Attributes.Description: The reactance depends on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The maximum reactance (xMax) appears at the low and high tap positions. Depending on the u curve the attribute can be either higher or lower than PowerTransformerEnd.x.

Attributes.Name: xMin
Attributes.Description: The reactance depends on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The minimum reactance (xMin) appears at the mid tap position.  PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be consistent with PhaseTapChangerLinear.xMin and PhaseTapChangerNonLinear.xMin. In case of inconsistency, PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be used.

DerivedEntities.Name: PhaseTapChangerTabular
DerivedEntities.Description: Describes a tap changer with a table defining the relation between the tap step and the phase angle difference across the transformer.

DerivedEntities.Name: PhaseTapChangerNonLinear
DerivedEntities.Description: The non-linear phase tap changer describes the non-linear behaviour of a phase tap changer. This is a base class for the symmetrical and asymmetrical phase tap changer models. The details of these models can be found in IEC 61970-301.

DerivedEntities.Name: PhaseTapChangerSymmetrical
DerivedEntities.Description: Describes a symmetrical phase shifting transformer tap model in which the voltage magnitude of both sides is the same. The difference voltage magnitude is the base in an equal-sided triangle where the sides corresponds to the primary and secondary voltages. The phase angle difference corresponds to the top angle and can be expressed as twice the arctangent of half the total difference voltage.

DerivedEntities.Name: PhaseTapChangerAsymmetrical
DerivedEntities.Description: Describes the tap model for an asymmetrical phase shifting transformer in which the difference voltage vector adds to the in-phase winding. The out-of-phase winding is the transformer end where the tap changer is located.  The angle between the in-phase and out-of-phase windings is named the winding connection angle. The phase shift depends on both the difference voltage magnitude and the winding connection angle.

Attributes.Name: windingConnectionAngle
Attributes.Description: The phase angle between the in-phase winding and the out-of -phase winding used for creating phase shift. The out-of-phase winding produces what is known as the difference voltage.  Setting this angle to 90 degrees is not the same as a symmetrical transformer. The attribute can only be multiples of 30 degrees.  The allowed range is -150 degrees to 150 degrees excluding 0.

Attributes.Name: voltageStepIncrement
Attributes.Description:
The voltage step increment on the out of phase winding (the PowerTransformerEnd where the TapChanger is located) specified in percent of rated voltage of the PowerTransformerEnd. A positive value means a positive voltage variation from the Terminal at the PowerTransformerEnd, where the TapChanger is located, into the transformer.
When the increment is negative, the voltage decreases when the tap step increases.

Attributes.Name: xMax
Attributes.Description: The reactance depends on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The maximum reactance (xMax) appears at the low and high tap positions. Depending on the u curve the attribute can be either higher or lower than PowerTransformerEnd.x.

Attributes.Name: xMin
Attributes.Description: The reactance depend on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The minimum reactance (xMin) appear at the mid tap position.   PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be consistent with PhaseTapChangerLinear.xMin and PhaseTapChangerNonLinear.xMin. In case of inconsistency, PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be used.

DerivedEntities.Name: RatioTapChanger
DerivedEntities.Description:
A tap changer that changes the voltage ratio impacting the voltage magnitude but not the phase angle across the transformer.

Angle sign convention (general): Positive value indicates a positive phase shift from the winding where the tap is located to the other winding (for a two-winding transformer).

Attributes.Name: stepVoltageIncrement
Attributes.Description:
Tap step increment, in per cent of rated voltage of the power transformer end, per step position.
When the increment is negative, the voltage decreases when the tap step increases.

Attributes.Name: tculControlMode
Attributes.Description: Specifies the regulation control mode (voltage or reactive) of the RatioTapChanger.

Attributes.Name: neutralU
Attributes.Description:
Voltage at which the winding operates at the neutral tap setting. It is the voltage at the terminal of the PowerTransformerEnd associated with the tap changer when all tap changers on the transformer are at their neutralStep position.  Normally neutralU of the tap changer is the same as ratedU of the PowerTransformerEnd, but it can differ in special cases such as when the tapping mechanism is separate from the winding more common on lower voltage transformers.
This attribute is not relevant for PhaseTapChangerAsymmetrical, PhaseTapChangerSymmetrical and PhaseTapChangerLinear.

Attributes.Name: subsequentDelay
Attributes.Description: For an LTC, the delay for subsequent tap changer operation (second and later step changes).

Attributes.Name: initialDelay
Attributes.Description: For an LTC, the delay for initial tap changer operation (first step change).

Attributes.Name: highStep
Attributes.Description:
Highest possible tap step position, advance from neutral.
The attribute shall be greater than lowStep.

Attributes.Name: neutralStep
Attributes.Description:
The neutral tap step position for this winding.
The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal or less than highStep.
It is the step position where the voltage is neutralU when the other terminals of the transformer are at the ratedU.  If there are other tap changers on the transformer those taps are kept constant at their neutralStep.

Attributes.Name: normalStep
Attributes.Description:
The tap step position used in "normal" network operation for this winding. For a "Fixed" tap changer indicates the current physical tap setting.
The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal to or less than highStep.

Attributes.Name: step
Attributes.Description:
Tap changer position.
Starting step for a steady state solution. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous tap variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete tap changer has yet been designed, a solution where a narrow voltage band forces the tap step to oscillate or to accommodate for a continuous solution as input.
The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal to or less than highStep.

Attributes.Name: ltcFlag
Attributes.Description: Specifies whether or not a TapChanger has load tap changing capabilities.

Attributes.Name: controlEnabled
Attributes.Description: Specifies the regulation status of the equipment.  True is regulating, false is not regulating.

Attributes.Name: lowStep
Attributes.Description: Lowest possible tap step position, retard from neutral.

DerivedEntities.Name: ACLineSegmentPhase
DerivedEntities.Description: Represents a single wire of an alternating current line segment.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Number designation for this line segment phase. Each line segment phase within a line segment should have a unique sequence number. This is useful for unbalanced modelling to bind the mathematical model (PhaseImpedanceData of PerLengthPhaseImpedance) with the connectivity model (this class) and the physical model (WirePosition) without tight coupling.

Attributes.Name: phase
Attributes.Description: The phase connection of the wire at both ends.

DerivedEntities.Name: RemedialActionScheme
DerivedEntities.Description: Remedial Action Scheme (RAS), Special Protection Schemes (SPS), System Protection Schemes (SPS) or System Integrity Protection Schemes (SIPS).

Attributes.Name: normalArmed
Attributes.Description: The default/normal value used when other active signal/values are missing.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of Remedial Action Scheme (RAS).

Attributes.Name: armed
Attributes.Description: The status of the class set by operation or by signal. Optional field that will override other status fields.

DerivedEntities.Name: CombinedCyclePlant
DerivedEntities.Description: A set of combustion turbines and steam turbines where the exhaust heat from the combustion turbines is recovered to make steam for the steam turbines, resulting in greater overall plant efficiency.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktCombinedCyclePlant
DerivedEntities.Description:
Subclass of Production: CombinedCyclePlant from IEC 61970 package.
A set of combustion turbines and steam turbines where the exhaust heat from the combustion turbines is recovered to make steam for the steam turbines, resulting in greater overall plant efficiency.

Attributes.Name: combCyclePlantRating
Attributes.Description: The combined cycle plant's active power output rating.

DerivedEntities.Name: RegulatingControl
DerivedEntities.Description:
Specifies a set of equipment that works together to control a power system quantity such as voltage or flow. 
Remote bus voltage control is possible by specifying the controlled terminal located at some place remote from the controlling equipment.
The specified terminal shall be associated with the connectivity node of the controlled point.  The most specific subtype of RegulatingControl shall be used in case such equipment participate in the control, e.g. TapChangerControl for tap changers.
For flow control, load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.
The attribute minAllowedTargetValue and maxAllowedTargetValue are required in the following cases:
- For a power generating module operated in power factor control mode to specify maximum and minimum power factor values;
- Whenever it is necessary to have an off center target voltage for the tap changer regulator. For instance, due to long cables to off shore wind farms and the need to have a simpler setup at the off shore transformer platform, the voltage is controlled from the land at the connection point for the off shore wind farm. Since there usually is a voltage rise along the cable, there is typical and overvoltage of up 3-4 kV compared to the on shore station. Thus in normal operation the tap changer on the on shore station is operated with a target set point, which is in the lower parts of the dead band.
The attributes minAllowedTargetValue and maxAllowedTargetValue are not related to the attribute targetDeadband and thus they are not treated as an alternative of the targetDeadband. They are needed due to limitations in the local substation controller. The attribute targetDeadband is used to prevent the power flow from move the tap position in circles (hunting) that is to be used regardless of the attributes minAllowedTargetValue and maxAllowedTargetValue.

DerivedEntities.Name: TapChangerControl
DerivedEntities.Description: Describes behaviour specific to tap changers, e.g. how the voltage at the end of a line varies with the load level and compensation of the voltage drop by tap adjustment.

Attributes.Name: reverseLineDropR
Attributes.Description: Line drop compensator resistance setting for reverse power flow.

Attributes.Name: limitVoltage
Attributes.Description: Maximum allowed regulated voltage on the PT secondary, regardless of line drop compensation. Sometimes referred to as first-house protection.

Attributes.Name: lineDropCompensation
Attributes.Description: If true, the line drop compensation is to be applied.

Attributes.Name: lineDropR
Attributes.Description: Line drop compensator resistance setting for normal (forward) power flow.

Attributes.Name: lineDropX
Attributes.Description: Line drop compensator reactance setting for normal (forward) power flow.

Attributes.Name: reverseLineDropX
Attributes.Description: Line drop compensator reactance setting for reverse power flow.

DerivedEntities.Name: ShuntCompensatorControl
DerivedEntities.Description: Distribution capacitor bank control settings.

Attributes.Name: regBranchEnd
Attributes.Description: For VAR, amp, or power factor locally controlled shunt impedances, the end of the branch that is regulated. The field has the following values: from side, to side, and tertiary (only if the branch is a transformer).

Attributes.Name: lowVoltageOverride
Attributes.Description: For locally controlled shunt impedances which have a voltage override feature, the low voltage override value. If the voltage is below this value, the shunt impedance will be turned on regardless of the other local controller settings.

Attributes.Name: regBranch
Attributes.Description: For VAR, amp, or power factor locally controlled shunt impedances, the index of the regulation branch.

Attributes.Name: regBranchKind
Attributes.Description: (For VAR, amp, or power factor locally controlled shunt impedances) Kind of regulation branch.

Attributes.Name: controlKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of control (if any).

Attributes.Name: localControlKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of local controller.

Attributes.Name: highVoltageOverride
Attributes.Description: For locally controlled shunt impedances which have a voltage override feature, the high voltage override value. If the voltage is above this value, the shunt impedance will be turned off regardless of the other local controller settings.

Attributes.Name: sensingPhaseCode
Attributes.Description: Phases that are measured for controlling the device.

Attributes.Name: maxSwitchOperationCount
Attributes.Description: IdmsShuntImpedanceData.maxNumSwitchOps.

Attributes.Name: switchOperationCycle
Attributes.Description: Time interval between consecutive switching operations.

Attributes.Name: vRegLineLine
Attributes.Description: True if regulated voltages are measured line to line, otherwise they are measured line to ground.

Attributes.Name: cellSize
Attributes.Description: The size of the individual units that make up the bank.

Attributes.Name: localOnLevel
Attributes.Description: Lower control setting.

Attributes.Name: localOffLevel
Attributes.Description: Upper control setting.

Attributes.Name: branchDirect
Attributes.Description: For VAR, amp, or power factor locally controlled shunt impedances, the flow direction: in, out.

Attributes.Name: normalOpen
Attributes.Description: True if open is normal status for a fixed capacitor bank, otherwise normal status is closed.

Attributes.Name: localOverride
Attributes.Description: True if the locally controlled capacitor has voltage override capability.

Attributes.Name: monitoredPhase
Attributes.Description: Phase voltage controlling this regulator, measured at regulator location.

Attributes.Name: maxAllowedTargetValue
Attributes.Description: Maximum allowed target value (RegulatingControl.targetValue).

Attributes.Name: targetValue
Attributes.Description: The target value specified for case input.   This value can be used for the target value without the use of schedules. The value has the units appropriate to the mode attribute.

Attributes.Name: enabled
Attributes.Description: The flag tells if regulation is enabled.

Attributes.Name: minAllowedTargetValue
Attributes.Description: Minimum allowed target value (RegulatingControl.targetValue).

Attributes.Name: mode
Attributes.Description: The regulating control mode presently available.  This specification allows for determining the kind of regulation without need for obtaining the units from a schedule.

Attributes.Name: targetDeadband
Attributes.Description:
This is a deadband used with discrete control to avoid excessive update of controls like tap changers and shunt compensator banks while regulating.  The units of those appropriate for the mode. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero. If RegulatingControl.discrete is set to "false", the RegulatingControl.targetDeadband is to be ignored.
Note that for instance, if the targetValue is 100 kV and the targetDeadband is 2 kV the range is from 99 to 101 kV.

Attributes.Name: targetValueUnitMultiplier
Attributes.Description: Specify the multiplier for used for the targetValue.

Attributes.Name: discrete
Attributes.Description: The regulation is performed in a discrete mode. This applies to equipment with discrete controls, e.g. tap changers and shunt compensators.

DerivedEntities.Name: SwitchPhase
DerivedEntities.Description: Single phase of a multi-phase switch when its attributes might be different per phase.

Attributes.Name: closed
Attributes.Description: The attribute tells if the switch is considered closed when used as input to topology processing.

Attributes.Name: phaseSide2
Attributes.Description: Phase of this SwitchPhase on the side with terminal sequence number equal to 2.  Should be a phase contained in that terminals Terminal.phases attribute.

Attributes.Name: phaseSide1
Attributes.Description: Phase of this SwitchPhase on the side with terminal sequence number equal to 1. Should be a phase contained in that terminals phases attribute.

Attributes.Name: normalOpen
Attributes.Description: Used in cases when no Measurement for the status value is present. If the SwitchPhase has a status measurement the Discrete.normalValue is expected to match with this value.

Attributes.Name: ratedCurrent
Attributes.Description:
The maximum continuous current carrying capacity in amps governed by the device material and construction.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

DerivedEntities.Name: AirCompressor
DerivedEntities.Description: Combustion turbine air compressor which is an integral part of a compressed air energy storage (CAES) plant.

Attributes.Name: airCompressorRating
Attributes.Description: Rating of the CAES air compressor.

DerivedEntities.Name: CogenerationPlant
DerivedEntities.Description: A set of thermal generating units for the production of electrical energy and process steam (usually from the output of the steam turbines). The steam sendout is typically used for industrial purposes or for municipal heating and cooling.

Attributes.Name: cogenLPSendoutRating
Attributes.Description: The low pressure steam sendout.

Attributes.Name: cogenHPSteamRating
Attributes.Description: The high pressure steam rating.

Attributes.Name: cogenLPSteamRating
Attributes.Description: The low pressure steam rating.

Attributes.Name: ratedP
Attributes.Description:
The rated output active power of the cogeneration plant.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: cogenHPSendoutRating
Attributes.Description: The high pressure steam sendout.

DerivedEntities.Name: HydroPowerPlant
DerivedEntities.Description: A hydro power station which can generate or pump. When generating, the generator turbines receive water from an upper reservoir. When pumping, the pumps receive their water from a lower reservoir.

Attributes.Name: pumpRatedP
Attributes.Description:
The hydro plant's pumping rating active power for rated head conditions.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: plantRatedHead
Attributes.Description:
The plant's rated gross head.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: hydroPlantStorageType
Attributes.Description: The type of hydro power plant water storage.

Attributes.Name: genRatedP
Attributes.Description:
The hydro plant's generating rating active power for rated head conditions.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: surgeTankCode
Attributes.Description: A code describing the type (or absence) of surge tank that is associated with the hydro power plant.

Attributes.Name: plantDischargeCapacity
Attributes.Description: Total plant discharge capacity.

Attributes.Name: surgeTankCrestLevel
Attributes.Description: The level at which the surge tank spills.

Attributes.Name: penstockType
Attributes.Description: Type and configuration of hydro plant penstock(s).

Attributes.Name: dischargeTravelDelay
Attributes.Description: Water travel delay from tailbay to next downstream hydro power station.

DerivedEntities.Name: ShuntCompensatorPhase
DerivedEntities.Description: Single phase of a multi-phase shunt compensator when its attributes might be different per phase.

DerivedEntities.Name: NonlinearShuntCompensatorPhase
DerivedEntities.Description: A per phase non linear shunt compensator has bank or section admittance values that differ. The attributes g and b of the associated NonlinearShuntCompensatorPhasePoint describe the total conductance and admittance of a NonlinearShuntCompensatorPhasePoint at a section number specified by NonlinearShuntCompensatorPhasePoint.sectionNumber.

DerivedEntities.Name: LinearShuntCompensatorPhase
DerivedEntities.Description: A per phase linear shunt compensator has banks or sections with equal admittance values.

Attributes.Name: gPerSection
Attributes.Description: Conductance per section for this phase if shunt compensator is wye connected.  Conductance per section phase to phase if shunt compensator is delta connected.

Attributes.Name: bPerSection
Attributes.Description: Susceptance per section of the phase if shunt compensator is wye connected.   Susceptance per section phase to phase if shunt compensator is delta connected.

Attributes.Name: normalSections
Attributes.Description: For the capacitor phase, the normal number of sections switched in. The value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensatorPhase.maximumSections.

Attributes.Name: phase
Attributes.Description: Phase of this shunt compensator component.   If the shunt compensator is wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point.  If the shunt compensator is delta connected, the phase indicates a shunt compensator connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

Attributes.Name: sections
Attributes.Description:
Shunt compensator sections in use. Starting value for steady state solution. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete shunt compensators has yet been designed, a solutions where a narrow voltage band force the sections to oscillate or accommodate for a continuous solution as input.
For LinearShuntConpensator the value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensatorPhase.maximumSections. At value zero the shunt compensator conductance and admittance is zero. Linear interpolation of conductance and admittance between the previous and next integer section is applied in case of non-integer values.
For NonlinearShuntCompensator-s shall only be set to one of the NonlinearShuntCompenstorPhasePoint.sectionNumber. There is no interpolation between NonlinearShuntCompenstorPhasePoint-s.

Attributes.Name: maximumSections
Attributes.Description: The maximum number of sections that may be switched in for this phase.

Attributes.Name: powerVariationByTemp

Attributes.Name: timeConstant

Attributes.Name: auxPowerVersusVoltage
Attributes.Description: Off-nominal voltage effect on turbine auxiliaries. Per unit reduction in auxiliary active power consumption versus per unit reduction in auxiliary bus voltage (from a specified voltage level).

Attributes.Description: Coefficient for modelling the effect of off-nominal frequency and voltage on recirculation and core flow, which affects the BWR power output.

Attributes.Name: proportionalGain

Attributes.Name: rfAux4
Attributes.Description: Coefficient for modelling the effect of off-nominal frequency and voltage on recirculation and core flow, which affects the BWR power output.

Attributes.Name: rfAux5
Attributes.Description: Coefficient for modelling the effect of off-nominal frequency and voltage on recirculation and core flow, which affects the BWR power output.

Attributes.Name: upperLimit
Attributes.Description: Initial upper limit.

Attributes.Name: steamSupplyRating
Attributes.Description: Rating of steam supply.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnergySourcePhase
DerivedEntities.Description: Represents the single phase information of an unbalanced energy source.

Attributes.Name: phase
Attributes.Description: Phase of this energy source component.   If the energy source wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point.  If the energy source is delta connected, the phase indicates an energy source connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnergyConsumerPhase
DerivedEntities.Description: A single phase of an energy consumer.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description:
Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Attributes.Name: pfixed
Attributes.Description: Active power of the load that is a fixed quantity. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: phase
Attributes.Description: Phase of this energy consumer component.   If the energy consumer is wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point.  If the energy consumer is delta connected, the phase indicates an energy consumer connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description:
Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Attributes.Name: qfixed
Attributes.Description: Reactive power of the load that is a fixed quantity. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: qfixedPct
Attributes.Description: Fixed reactive power as per cent of load group fixed reactive power. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: pfixedPct
Attributes.Description: Fixed active power as per cent of load group fixed active power. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

DerivedEntities.Name: WireSegmentPhase
DerivedEntities.Description: Represents a single wire of an alternating current wire segment.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Number designation for this wire segment phase. Each wire segment phase within a wire segment should have a unique sequence number.

Attributes.Name: phase
Attributes.Description: The phase connection of the wire at both ends.

DerivedEntities.Name: VoltageControlZone
DerivedEntities.Description: An area of the power system network which is defined for secondary voltage control purposes. A voltage control zone consists of a collection of substations with a designated bus bar section whose voltage will be controlled.

DerivedEntities.Name: PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase
DerivedEntities.Description: A single phase of a power electronics connection.

Attributes.Name: phase
Attributes.Description: Phase of this energy producer component.   If the energy producer is wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point.  If the energy producer is delta connected, the phase indicates an energy producer connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description: Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow into the equipment from the network.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description: Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow into the equipment from the network.

DerivedEntities.Name: ConnectivityNodeContainer
DerivedEntities.Description: A base class for all objects that may contain connectivity nodes or topological nodes.

DerivedEntities.Name: EquipmentContainer
DerivedEntities.Description: A modelling construct to provide a root class for containing equipment.

DerivedEntities.Name: Line
DerivedEntities.Description: Contains equipment beyond a substation belonging to a power transmission line.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktLine
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass for IEC61970:Wires:Line.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCEquipmentContainer
DerivedEntities.Description: A modelling construct to provide a root class for containment of DC as well as AC equipment. The class differ from the EquipmentContaner for AC in that it may also contain DCNode-s. Hence it can contain both AC and DC equipment.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCConverterUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: Indivisible operative unit comprising all equipment between the point of common coupling on the AC side and the point of common coupling  DC side, essentially one or more converters, together with one or more converter transformers, converter control equipment, essential protective and switching devices and auxiliaries, if any, used for conversion.

Attributes.Name: operationMode
Attributes.Description: The operating mode of an HVDC bipole (bipolar, monopolar metallic return, etc).

DerivedEntities.Name: DCLine
DerivedEntities.Description: Overhead lines and/or cables connecting two or more HVDC substations.

DerivedEntities.Name: Plant
DerivedEntities.Description: A Plant is a collection of equipment for purposes of generation.

DerivedEntities.Name: VoltageLevel
DerivedEntities.Description: A collection of equipment at one common system voltage forming a switchgear. The equipment typically consists of breakers, busbars, instrumentation, control, regulation and protection devices as well as assemblies of all these.

Attributes.Name: lowVoltageLimit
Attributes.Description:
The bus bar's low voltage limit.
The limit applies to all equipment and nodes contained in a given VoltageLevel. It is not required that it is exchanged in pair with highVoltageLimit. It is preferable to use operational VoltageLimit, which prevails, if present.

Attributes.Name: highVoltageLimit
Attributes.Description:
The bus bar's high voltage limit.
The limit applies to all equipment and nodes contained in a given VoltageLevel. It is not required that it is exchanged in pair with lowVoltageLimit. It is preferable to use operational VoltageLimit, which prevails, if present.

DerivedEntities.Name: Substation
DerivedEntities.Description: A collection of equipment for purposes other than generation or utilization, through which electric energy in bulk is passed for the purposes of switching or modifying its characteristics.

DerivedEntities.Name: Feeder
DerivedEntities.Description:
A collection of equipment for organizational purposes, used for grouping distribution resources.
The organization a feeder does not necessarily reflect connectivity or current operation state.

DerivedEntities.Name: Bay
DerivedEntities.Description: A collection of power system resources (within a given substation) including conducting equipment, protection relays, measurements, and telemetry.  A bay typically represents a physical grouping related to modularization of equipment.

Attributes.Name: bayPowerMeasFlag
Attributes.Description: Indicates the presence/absence of active/reactive power measurements.

Attributes.Name: bayEnergyMeasFlag
Attributes.Description: Indicates the presence/absence of energy measurements.

Attributes.Name: busBarConfiguration
Attributes.Description: Busbar configuration.

Attributes.Name: breakerConfiguration
Attributes.Description: Breaker configuration.

DerivedEntities.Name: EquivalentNetwork
DerivedEntities.Description: A class that groups electrical equivalents, including internal nodes, of a network that has been reduced. The ConnectivityNodes contained in the equivalent are intended to reflect internal nodes of the equivalent. The boundary Connectivity nodes where the equivalent connects outside itself are not contained by the equivalent.

DerivedEntities.Name: Equipment
DerivedEntities.Description: The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanical.

DerivedEntities.Name: ConductingEquipment
DerivedEntities.Description: The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnergyConnection
DerivedEntities.Description: A connection of energy generation or consumption on the power system model.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnergyConsumer
DerivedEntities.Description:
Generic user of energy - a  point of consumption on the power system model.
EnergyConsumer.pfixed, .qfixed, .pfixedPct and .qfixedPct have meaning only if there is no LoadResponseCharacteristic associated with EnergyConsumer or if LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is set to False.

DerivedEntities.Name: ConformLoad
DerivedEntities.Description: ConformLoad represent loads that follow a daily load change pattern where the pattern can be used to scale the load with a system load.

DerivedEntities.Name: StationSupply
DerivedEntities.Description: Station supply with load derived from the station output.

DerivedEntities.Name: NonConformLoad
DerivedEntities.Description: NonConformLoad represents loads that do not follow a daily load change pattern and whose changes are not correlated with the daily load change pattern.

Attributes.Name: qfixedPct
Attributes.Description: Fixed reactive power as a percentage of load group fixed reactive power. Used to represent the time-varying components.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: customerCount
Attributes.Description: Number of individual customers represented by this demand.

Attributes.Name: pfixed
Attributes.Description: Active power of the load that is a fixed quantity and does not vary as load group value varies. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: pfixedPct
Attributes.Description: Fixed active power as a percentage of load group fixed active power. Used to represent the time-varying components.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description:
Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Attributes.Name: grounded
Attributes.Description: Used for Yn and Zn connections. True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

Attributes.Name: phaseConnection
Attributes.Description: The type of phase connection, such as wye or delta.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description:
Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Attributes.Name: qfixed
Attributes.Description: Reactive power of the load that is a fixed quantity and does not vary as load group value varies. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnergySource
DerivedEntities.Description: A generic equivalent for an energy supplier on a transmission or distribution voltage level.

Attributes.Name: pMin
Attributes.Description: This is the minimum active power that can be produced by the source. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.

Attributes.Name: r0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence Thevenin resistance.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence Thevenin reactance.

Attributes.Name: rn
Attributes.Description: Negative sequence Thevenin resistance.

Attributes.Name: xn
Attributes.Description: Negative sequence Thevenin reactance.

Attributes.Name: reactivePower
Attributes.Description:
High voltage source reactive injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

Attributes.Name: activePower
Attributes.Description:
High voltage source active injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

Attributes.Name: nominalVoltage
Attributes.Description: Phase-to-phase nominal voltage.

Attributes.Name: voltageMagnitude
Attributes.Description: Phase-to-phase open circuit voltage magnitude used when voltage characteristics need to be imposed at the node associated with the terminal of the energy source, such as when voltages and angles from the transmission level are used as input to the distribution network. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: voltageAngle
Attributes.Description: Phase angle of a-phase open circuit used when voltage characteristics need to be imposed at the node associated with the terminal of the energy source, such as when voltages and angles from the transmission level are used as input to the distribution network. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: x0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence Thevenin reactance.

Attributes.Name: pMax
Attributes.Description: This is the maximum active power that can be produced by the source. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence Thevenin resistance.

DerivedEntities.Name: RegulatingCondEq
DerivedEntities.Description: A type of conducting equipment that can regulate a quantity (i.e. voltage or flow) at a specific point in the network.

DerivedEntities.Name: ShuntCompensator
DerivedEntities.Description: A shunt capacitor or reactor or switchable bank of shunt capacitors or reactors. A section of a shunt compensator is an individual capacitor or reactor.  A negative value for reactivePerSection indicates that the compensator is a reactor. ShuntCompensator is a single terminal device.  Ground is implied.

DerivedEntities.Name: LinearShuntCompensator
DerivedEntities.Description: A linear shunt compensator has banks or sections with equal admittance values.

Attributes.Name: b0PerSection
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

Attributes.Name: bPerSection
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

Attributes.Name: g0PerSection
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence shunt (charging) conductance per section.

Attributes.Name: gPerSection
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence shunt (charging) conductance per section.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktShuntCompensator
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC 61970:Wires:ShuntCompensator.

DerivedEntities.Name: SVC
DerivedEntities.Description: SVC asset allows the capacitive and inductive ratings for each phase to be specified individually if required.

Attributes.Name: inductiveRating
Attributes.Description: Maximum inductive reactive power.

Attributes.Name: capacitiveRating
Attributes.Description: Maximum capacitive reactive power.

DerivedEntities.Name: NonlinearShuntCompensator
DerivedEntities.Description: A non linear shunt compensator has bank or section admittance values that differ. The attributes g, b, g0 and b0 of the associated NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint describe the total conductance and admittance of a NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint at a section number specified by NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint.sectionNumber.

Attributes.Name: switchOnDate
Attributes.Description: The date and time when the capacitor bank was last switched on.

Attributes.Name: maximumSections
Attributes.Description: The maximum number of sections that may be switched in.

Attributes.Name: aVRDelay
Attributes.Description: An automatic voltage regulation delay (AVRDelay) which is the time delay from a change in voltage to when the capacitor is allowed to change state. This filters out temporary changes in voltage.

Attributes.Name: voltageSensitivity
Attributes.Description: Voltage sensitivity required for the device to regulate the bus voltage, in voltage/reactive power.

Attributes.Name: switchOnCount
Attributes.Description: The switch on count since the capacitor count was last reset or initialized.

Attributes.Name: normalSections
Attributes.Description: The normal number of sections switched in. The value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensator.maximumSections.

Attributes.Name: grounded
Attributes.Description: Used for Yn and Zn connections. True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

Attributes.Name: nomU
Attributes.Description: The voltage at which the nominal reactive power may be calculated. This should normally be within 10% of the voltage at which the capacitor is connected to the network.

Attributes.Name: sections
Attributes.Description:
Shunt compensator sections in use. Starting value for steady state solution. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete shunt compensators has yet been designed, a solutions where a narrow voltage band force the sections to oscillate or accommodate for a continuous solution as input. 
For LinearShuntConpensator the value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensator.maximumSections. At value zero the shunt compensator conductance and admittance is zero. Linear interpolation of conductance and admittance between the previous and next integer section is applied in case of non-integer values.
For NonlinearShuntCompensator-s shall only be set to one of the NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint.sectionNumber. There is no interpolation between NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint-s.

Attributes.Name: phaseConnection
Attributes.Description: The type of phase connection, such as wye or delta.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExternalNetworkInjection
DerivedEntities.Description: This class represents the external network and it is used for IEC 60909 calculations.

Attributes.Name: minP
Attributes.Description: Minimum active power of the injection.

Attributes.Name: governorSCD
Attributes.Description: Power Frequency Bias. This is the change in power injection divided by the change in frequency and negated.  A positive value of the power frequency bias provides additional power injection upon a drop in frequency.

Attributes.Name: minR1ToX1Ratio
Attributes.Description: Minimum ratio of positive sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its positive sequence reactance (R(1)/X(1) min). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: minInitialSymShCCurrent
Attributes.Description: Minimum initial symmetrical short-circuit currents (Ik" min) in A (Ik" = Sk"/(SQRT(3) Un)). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: minZ0ToZ1Ratio
Attributes.Description: Minimum ratio of zero sequence impedance to its positive sequence impedance (Z(0)/Z(1) min). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: maxR0ToX0Ratio
Attributes.Description: Maximum ratio of zero sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its zero sequence reactance (R(0)/X(0) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: voltageFactor
Attributes.Description: Voltage factor in pu, which was used to calculate short-circuit current Ik" and power Sk".  Used only if short circuit calculations are done according to superposition method.

Attributes.Name: maxZ0ToZ1Ratio
Attributes.Description: Maximum ratio of zero sequence impedance to its positive sequence impedance (Z(0)/Z(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description:
Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

Attributes.Name: ikSecond
Attributes.Description: Indicates whether initial symmetrical short-circuit current and power have been calculated according to IEC (Ik").  Used only if short circuit calculations are done according to superposition method.

Attributes.Name: minR0ToX0Ratio
Attributes.Description: Indicates whether initial symmetrical short-circuit current and power have been calculated according to IEC (Ik"). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 6090.

Attributes.Name: referencePriority
Attributes.Description: Priority of unit for use as powerflow voltage phase angle reference bus selection. 0 = don t care (default) 1 = highest priority. 2 is less than 1 and so on.

Attributes.Name: maxInitialSymShCCurrent
Attributes.Description: Maximum initial symmetrical short-circuit currents (Ik" max) in A (Ik" = Sk"/(SQRT(3) Un)). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: maxP
Attributes.Description: Maximum active power of the injection.

Attributes.Name: maxQ
Attributes.Description: Maximum reactive power limit. It is used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange and not for short circuit modelling.

Attributes.Name: maxR1ToX1Ratio
Attributes.Description: Maximum ratio of positive sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its positive sequence reactance (R(1)/X(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: minQ
Attributes.Description: Minimum reactive power limit. It is used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange and not for short circuit modelling.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description:
Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

DerivedEntities.Name: PowerElectronicsConnection
DerivedEntities.Description: A connection to the AC network for energy production or consumption that uses power electronics rather than rotating machines.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description:
Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description:
Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Equivalent resistance (RG) of generator. RG is considered for the calculation of all currents, except for the calculation of the peak current ip. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: rn
Attributes.Description: Negative sequence Thevenin resistance.

Attributes.Name: minQ
Attributes.Description: Minimum reactive power limit for the unit. This is the minimum (nameplate) limit for the unit.

Attributes.Name: maxIFault
