Attributes.Description: Phase code. Number of wires and specific nominal phases can be deduced from enumeration literal values. For example, ABCN is three-phase, four-wire, s12n (splitSecondary12N) is single-phase, three-wire, and s1n and s2n are single-phase, two-wire.

Attributes.Name: serviceDeliveryRemark
Attributes.Description: Remarks about this usage point, for example the reason for it being rated with a non-nominal priority.

Attributes.Name: amiBillingReady
Attributes.Description: Tracks the lifecycle of the metering installation at a usage point with respect to readiness for billing via advanced metering infrastructure reads.

Attributes.Name: readRoute
Attributes.Description: Identifier of the route to which this usage point is assigned for purposes of meter reading. Typically used to configure hand held meter reading systems prior to collection of reads.

Attributes.Name: physicalConnectionCapacity
Attributes.Description: Quantitative information about the maximum physical capacity of the connection for the usage point.

Attributes.Name: checkBilling
Attributes.Description: True if as a result of an inspection or otherwise, there is a reason to suspect that a previous billing may have been performed with erroneous data. Value should be reset once this potential discrepancy has been resolved.

Attributes.Name: servicePriority
Attributes.Description: Priority of service for this usage point. Note that usage points at the same service location can have different priorities.

Attributes.Name: ratedCurrent
Attributes.Description: Current flow that this usage point is configured to deliver.

Attributes.Name: ratedPower
Attributes.Description: Active power that this usage point is configured to deliver.

Attributes.Name: readCycle
Attributes.Description: Cycle day on which the meter for this usage point will normally be read.  Usually correlated with the billing cycle.

Attributes.Name: connectionState
Attributes.Description: State of the usage point with respect to connection to the network.

Attributes.Name: connectionCategory
Attributes.Description: A code used to specify the connection category, e.g., low voltage or low pressure, where the usage point is defined.

Attributes.Name: phaseCount
Attributes.Description: Number of potential phases the Usage Point supports, typically 0, 1 or 3.

Attributes.Name: estimatedLoad
Attributes.Description: Estimated load.

Attributes.Name: grounded
Attributes.Description: True if grounded.

Attributes.Name: isSdp
Attributes.Description: If true, this usage point is a service delivery point, i.e., a usage point where the ownership of the service changes hands.

Attributes.Name: minimalUsageExpected
Attributes.Description: If true, minimal or zero usage is expected at this usage point for situations such as premises vacancy, logical or physical disconnect. It is used for readings validation and estimation.

Attributes.Name: nominalServiceVoltage
Attributes.Description: Nominal service voltage.

DerivedEntities.Name: BaseVoltage
DerivedEntities.Description: Defines a system base voltage which is referenced.

Attributes.Name: nominalVoltage
Attributes.Description: The power system resource's base voltage.  Shall be a positive value and not zero.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransformerStarImpedance
DerivedEntities.Description:
Transformer star impedance (Pi-model) that accurately reflects impedance for transformers with 2 or 3 windings. For transformers with 4 or more windings, TransformerMeshImpedance class shall be used.
For transmission networks use PowerTransformerEnd impedances (r, r0, x, x0, b, b0, g and g0).

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence series reactance of the transformer end.

Attributes.Name: r0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence series resistance of the transformer end.

Attributes.Name: x0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence series reactance of the transformer end.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Resistance of the transformer end.

DerivedEntities.Name: DemandResponseProgram
DerivedEntities.Description: Demand response program.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Type of demand response program; examples are CPP (critical-peak pricing), RTP (real-time pricing), DLC (direct load control), DBP (demand bidding program), BIP (base interruptible program). Note that possible types change a lot and it would be impossible to enumerate them all.

Attributes.Name: validityInterval
Attributes.Description: Interval within which the program is valid.

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketStatementLineItem
DerivedEntities.Description: An individual line item on an ISO settlement statement.

Attributes.Name: currentPrice
Attributes.Description: Current settlement price.

Attributes.Name: currentAmount
Attributes.Description: Current settlement amount.

Attributes.Name: currentISOAmount
Attributes.Description: Current ISO settlement amount.

Attributes.Name: netISOQuantity
Attributes.Description: Net ISO settlement quantity.

Attributes.Name: intervalDate
Attributes.Description: The date of which the settlement is run.

Attributes.Name: currentISOQuantity
Attributes.Description: Current ISO settlement quantity.

Attributes.Name: previousISOAmount
Attributes.Description: Previous ISO settlement amount.

Attributes.Name: previousISOQuantity
Attributes.Description: Previous ISO settlement quantity.

Attributes.Name: netPrice
Attributes.Description: Net settlement price.

Attributes.Name: previousAmount
Attributes.Description: Previous settlement amount.

Attributes.Name: netISOAmount
Attributes.Description: Net ISO settlement amount.

Attributes.Name: previousPrice
Attributes.Description: Previous settlement price.

Attributes.Name: currentQuantity
Attributes.Description: Current settlement quantity, subject to the UOM.

Attributes.Name: previousQuantity
Attributes.Description: Previous settlement quantity, subject to the UOM.

Attributes.Name: quantityUOM
Attributes.Description: The unit of measure for the quantity element of the line item.

Attributes.Name: netQuantity
Attributes.Description: Net settlement quantity, subject to the UOM.

Attributes.Name: netAmount
Attributes.Description: Net settlement amount.

Attributes.Name: intervalNumber
Attributes.Description: The number of intervals.

DerivedEntities.Name: ModelToBeDeleted
DerivedEntities.Description: A Model is a collection of Datasets.

DerivedEntities.Name: ModelPartVersion
DerivedEntities.Description: This is a version of a part of a model.  New instances of this class with new identity are instantiated upon changes to the content of this class or changes to the associated data set.  Instances of this class are considered immutable.  The case audit trail can reference this immutable data to exactly reproduce a case.

DerivedEntities.Name: CompleteModelToBeDeleted
DerivedEntities.Description: A complete model can be used in applications to perform meaningful calculations, e.g. a study case in offline tools or a real time model in a SCADA/EMS.

DerivedEntities.Name: ModelAuthority
DerivedEntities.Description: A Modeling Authority is an entity responsible for supplying and maintaining the data defining a specific set of objects in a network model.

DerivedEntities.Name: ResourcePerformanceEvaluation
DerivedEntities.Description: Represents an the performance evaluation of a resource deployment. Every resource deployment may have many performance evaluations, using different evaluation metrics or algorithms, or produced by different evaluation authorities.

Attributes.Name: evaluationValue
Attributes.Description: The value of the performance. as a String, any rating scheme is supported (e.g. "1","2","3" or "low", "medium", "high"). The rating scheme is described in the performanceValueDescription attribute.

Attributes.Name: evaluationDescription
Attributes.Description: Description of the performance evaluation, e.g. the rating classification used (any is allowed), why the evaluation was performed, anything that describes the demand response performance evaluation.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCTopologicalIsland
DerivedEntities.Description:
An electrically connected subset of the network. DC topological islands can change as the current network state changes, e.g. due to: 
- disconnect switches or breakers changing state in a SCADA/EMS.
- manual creation, change or deletion of topological nodes in a planning tool.
Only energised TopologicalNode-s shall be part of the topological island.

DerivedEntities.Name: MajorChargeGroup
DerivedEntities.Description: A Major Charge Group is the same as Invoice Type which provides the highest level of grouping for charge types configuration. Examples: Market, FERC, RMR.

Attributes.Name: revisionNumber
Attributes.Description: Revision number for the major charge group

DerivedEntities.Name: UnitInitialConditions
DerivedEntities.Description: Resource status at the end of a given clearing period.

Attributes.Name: numberOfStartups
Attributes.Description: Number of start ups in the Operating Day until the end of previous hour.

Attributes.Name: cumEnergy
Attributes.Description: Cumulative energy production over trading period.

Attributes.Name: onlineStatus
Attributes.Description: 'true' if the GeneratingUnit is currently On-Line

Attributes.Name: cumStatusChanges
Attributes.Description: Cumulative number of status changes of the resource.

Attributes.Name: resourceMW
Attributes.Description: Resource MW output at the end of previous clearing period.

Attributes.Name: timeInStatus
Attributes.Description: Time in market trading intervals the resource is in the state as of the end of the previous clearing period.

Attributes.Name: statusDate
Attributes.Description: Time and date for resourceStatus

Attributes.Name: timeInterval
Attributes.Description: Time interval

Attributes.Name: resourceStatus
Attributes.Description:
Resource status at the end of previous clearing period:
0 - off-line
1 - on-line production
2 - in shutdown process
3 - in startup process

DerivedEntities.Name: Appointment
DerivedEntities.Description: Meeting time and location.

Attributes.Name: callAhead
Attributes.Description: True if requested to call customer when someone is about to arrive at their premises.

Attributes.Name: meetingInterval
Attributes.Description: Date and time reserved for appointment.

DerivedEntities.Name: TestStandard
DerivedEntities.Description: The precise standard used in executing a lab test, including the standard, and standard version, test method and variant, if needed.

Attributes.Name: testMethod
Attributes.Description: Identification of test method used if multiple methods specified by test standard.

Attributes.Name: testStandardCIGRE
Attributes.Description: Which CIGRE standard used to determine analog value result. Applies only if CIGRE standard used.

Attributes.Name: testStandardDIN
Attributes.Description: Which DIN standard used to determine analog value result. Applies only if DIN standard used.

Attributes.Name: testStandardDoble
Attributes.Description: Which Doble standard used to determine analog value result. Applies only if Doble standard used.

Attributes.Name: testStandardISO
Attributes.Description: Which ISO standard used to determine analog value result. Applies only if ISO standard used.

Attributes.Name: testStandardUKMinistryOfDefence
Attributes.Description: Which UK Ministry of Defence standard used to determine analog value result. Applies only if UK Ministry of Defence standard used.

Attributes.Name: testStandardASTM
Attributes.Description: Which ASTM standard used to determine analog value result. Applies only if ASTM standard used.

Attributes.Name: testStandardEPA
Attributes.Description: Which EPA standard used to determine analog value result. Applies only if EPA standard used.

Attributes.Name: testStandardIEEE
Attributes.Description: Which IEEE standard used to determine analog value result. Applies only if IEEE standard used.

Attributes.Name: testStandardLaborelec
Attributes.Description: Which Laborelec standard used to determine analog value result. Applies only if Laborelec standard used.

Attributes.Name: testStandardTAPPI
Attributes.Description: Which TAPPI standard used to determine analog value result. Applies only if TAPPI standard used.

Attributes.Name: testStandardWEP
Attributes.Description: Which WEP standard used to determine analog value result. Applies only if WEP standard used.

Attributes.Name: testVariant
Attributes.Description: Identification of variant of test method or standard if one is specified by the standard.

Attributes.Name: testStandardIEC
Attributes.Description: Which IEC standard used to determine analog value result. Applies only if IEC standard used.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetDeployment
DerivedEntities.Description: Deployment of asset deployment in a power system resource role.

Attributes.Name: deploymentState
Attributes.Description: Current deployment state of asset.

Attributes.Name: transformerApplication
Attributes.Description: Type of network role transformer is playing in this deployment (applies to transformer assets only).

Attributes.Name: facilityKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of facility (like substation or pole or building or plant or service center) at which asset deployed.

Attributes.Name: deploymentDate
Attributes.Description: Dates of asset deployment.

Attributes.Name: likelihoodOfFailure
Attributes.Description: Likelihood of asset failure on a scale of 1(low) to 100 (high).

Attributes.Name: breakerApplication
Attributes.Description: Type of network role breaker is playing in this deployment (applies to breaker assets only).

DerivedEntities.Name: BidError
DerivedEntities.Description: This class represent the error information for a bid that is detected during bid validation.

Attributes.Name: errPriority
Attributes.Description: Priority number for the error message

Attributes.Name: endTime
Attributes.Description: hour wihthin the bid for which the error applies

Attributes.Name: startTime
Attributes.Description: hour wihthin the bid for which the error applies

Attributes.Name: errMessage
Attributes.Description: error message

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetFunction
DerivedEntities.Description: Function performed by an asset.

DerivedEntities.Name: EndDeviceFunction
DerivedEntities.Description: Function performed by an end device such as a meter, communication equipment, controllers, etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: ComFunction
DerivedEntities.Description: Communication function of communication equipment or a device such as a meter.

Attributes.Name: amrRouter
Attributes.Description: Communication ID number (e.g. port number, serial number, data collector ID, etc.) of the parent device associated to this AMR module.

Attributes.Name: direction
Attributes.Description: Kind of communication direction.

Attributes.Name: technology

Attributes.Name: amrAddress
Attributes.Description: Communication ID number (e.g. serial number, IP address, telephone number, etc.) of the AMR module which serves this meter.

DerivedEntities.Name: ConnectDisconnectFunction
DerivedEntities.Description: A function that will disconnect and reconnect the customer's load under defined conditions.

Attributes.Name: isRemoteAutoDisconOp
Attributes.Description: If set true and if disconnection can be operated remotely, then the operation happens automatically. If set false and if disconnection can be operated remotely, then the operation happens manually.

Attributes.Name: isDelayedDiscon
Attributes.Description: If set true, the switch may disconnect the service at the end of a specified time delay after the disconnect signal has been given. If set false, the switch may disconnect the service immediately after the disconnect signal has been given. This is typically the case for over current circuit-breakers which are classified as either instantaneous or slow acting.

Attributes.Name: isConnected
Attributes.Description: True if this function is in the connected state.

Attributes.Name: isLocalAutoReconOp
Attributes.Description: If set true and if reconnection can be operated locally, then the operation happens automatically. Otherwise, it happens manually.

Attributes.Name: eventCount
Attributes.Description: Running cumulative count of connect or disconnect events, for the lifetime of this function or until the value is cleared.

Attributes.Name: rcdInfo
Attributes.Description: Information on remote connect disconnect switch.

Attributes.Name: isLocalAutoDisconOp
Attributes.Description: If set true and if disconnection can be operated locally, the operation happens automatically. Otherwise it happens manually.

Attributes.Name: isRemoteAutoReconOp
Attributes.Description: If set true and if reconnection can be operated remotely, then the operation happens automatically. If set false and if reconnection can be operated remotely, then the operation happens manually.

DerivedEntities.Name: SimpleEndDeviceFunction
DerivedEntities.Description: Simple end device function distinguished by 'kind'. Use this class for instances that cannot be represented by another end device function specialisations.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of this function.

Attributes.Name: enabled
Attributes.Description: True if the function is enabled.

Attributes.Name: hardwareID
Attributes.Description: Hardware version.

Attributes.Name: firmwareID

Attributes.Name: password

Attributes.Name: configID
Attributes.Description: Configuration specified for this function.

Attributes.Name: programID
Attributes.Description: Name of program.

Attributes.Name: steam

Attributes.Name: primary

Attributes.Name: submitFromTimeStamp

Attributes.Name: submitToTimeStamp

Attributes.Name: dependOnTradeName

Attributes.Name: submitToUser

Attributes.Name: counterTradeQuantity

Attributes.Name: stopTime

Attributes.Name: adjustedTradeQuantity
Attributes.Description: The validated and current market accepted trade amount of a physical energy trade.

Attributes.Name: lastModified

Attributes.Name: tradeQuantity
Attributes.Description:
tradeQuantity: 
If tradeType = IST, The amount of an Energy Trade.  
If tradeType = AST, The amount of an Ancillary Service Obligation Trade.  
If tradeType = UCT, The amount of a Unit Commitment Obligation Trade.

Attributes.Name: submitFromUser

DerivedEntities.Name: TradeError
DerivedEntities.Description: Trade error and warning messages associated with the rule engine processing of the submitted trade.

Attributes.Name: startTime
Attributes.Description: hour wihthin the trade for which the error applies

Attributes.Name: endTime
Attributes.Description: hour wihthin the trade for which the error applies

Attributes.Name: errMessage
Attributes.Description: error message

Attributes.Name: ruleID
Attributes.Description: Rule identifier which triggered the error/warning message

Attributes.Name: errPriority
Attributes.Description: Priority number for the error message

Attributes.Name: logTimeStamp
Attributes.Description: Timestamp of logged error/warning message

DerivedEntities.Name: EndDeviceEventType
DerivedEntities.Description: Detailed description for an event produced by an end device. Values in attributes allow for creation of recommended codes to be used for identifying end device events as follows: <type>.<domain>.<subDomain>.<eventOrAction>.

Attributes.Name: subDomain
Attributes.Description: More specific nature of the event, as a further sub-categorisation of 'domain'.

Attributes.Name: domain
Attributes.Description: High-level nature of the event. By properly classifying events by a small set of domain codes, a system can more easily run reports based on the types of events that have occurred or been received.

Attributes.Name: eventOrAction
Attributes.Description: The most specific part of this event type. It is mainly in the form of a verb that gives action to the event that just occurred.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Type of physical device from which the event was created. A value of zero (0) can be used when the source is unknown.

DerivedEntities.Name: OrgPnodeAllocation
DerivedEntities.Description: This class models the allocation between asset owners and pricing nodes.

Attributes.Name: maxMWAllocation
Attributes.Description: Maximum MW for the Source/Sink for the Allocation

DerivedEntities.Name: FlowgatePartner
DerivedEntities.Description: Flowgate defined partner.

DerivedEntities.Name: DimensionsInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: As applicable, the basic linear, area, or volume dimensions of an asset, asset type (AssetModel) or other type of object (such as land area). Units and multipliers are specified per dimension.

Attributes.Name: orientation
Attributes.Description: A description of the orientation of the object relative to the dimensions. As an example, a vault may have north-south orientation for the sizeLength measurement and sizeDepth may be the height of the vault.

Attributes.Name: sizeDiameter
Attributes.Description: Diameter measurement.

Attributes.Name: sizeDepth
Attributes.Description: Depth measurement.

Attributes.Name: sizeLength
Attributes.Description: Length measurement.

Attributes.Name: sizeWidth
Attributes.Description: Width measurement.

DerivedEntities.Name: FaultCauseType
DerivedEntities.Description: Type of cause of the fault.

DerivedEntities.Description:
Bushing insulation power factor condition as a result of a test.
Typical status values are: Acceptable, Minor Deterioration or Moisture Absorption, Major Deterioration or Moisture Absorption, Failed.

Attributes.Name: testKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of test for this bushing.

DerivedEntities.Name: Charge
DerivedEntities.Description: A charge element associated with other entities such as tariff structures, auxiliary agreements or other charge elements. The total charge amount applicable to this instance of charge is the sum of fixed and variable portion.

Attributes.Name: fixedPortion
Attributes.Description: The fixed portion of this charge element.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: The kind of charge to be applied.

Attributes.Name: variablePortion
Attributes.Description: The variable portion of this charge element, calculated as a percentage of the total amount of a parent charge.

DerivedEntities.Name: FormerReference
DerivedEntities.Description: Used to indicate former references to the same piece of equipment. The ID, name, and effectivity dates are utilized.

DerivedEntities.Name: ReliabilityInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Information regarding the experienced and expected reliability of a specific asset, type of asset, or asset model.

Attributes.Name: momFailureRate
Attributes.Description: Momentary failure rate (temporary failures/kft-year).

Attributes.Name: mTTR
Attributes.Description: Mean time to repair (MTTR - hours).

DerivedEntities.Name: Shift
DerivedEntities.Description:
Generally referring to a period of operation or work performed. Whether the shift is open/closed can be derived from attributes 'activityInterval.start' and 'activityInterval.end'.
The grand total for receipts (i.e., cumulative total of all actual receipted amounts during this shift; bankable + non-bankable; excludes rounding error totals) can be derived from receipt:
=sum('Receipt.receiptAmount'); includes bankable and non-bankable receipts.
It also has to be reconciled against:
=sum('receiptsGrandTotalBankable' + 'receiptsGrandTotalNonBankable')
and against receipt summary:
=sum('ReceiptSummary.receiptsTotal').
The attributes with "GrandTotal" defined in this class may need to be used when the source data is periodically flushed from the system and then these cannot be derived.

DerivedEntities.Name: VendorShift
DerivedEntities.Description: The operating shift for a vendor during which the vendor may transact against the merchant's account. It aggregates transactions and receipts during the shift and periodically debits a merchant account. The totals in vendor shift should always be the sum of totals aggregated in all cashier shifts that were open under the particular vendor shift.

Attributes.Name: merchantDebitAmount
Attributes.Description: The amount that is to be debited from the merchant account for this vendor shift. This amount reflects the sum(PaymentTransaction.transactionAmount).

Attributes.Name: posted
Attributes.Description: If true, merchantDebitAmount has been debited from MerchantAccount; typically happens at the end of VendorShift when it closes.

DerivedEntities.Name: CashierShift
DerivedEntities.Description: The operating shift for a cashier, during which the cashier may transact against the cashier shift, subject to vendor shift being open.

Attributes.Name: cashFloat
Attributes.Description: The amount of cash that the cashier brings to start the shift and that will be taken away at the end of the shift; i.e. the cash float does not get banked.

Attributes.Name: receiptsGrandTotalNonBankable
Attributes.Description:
Total of amounts receipted during this shift that cannot be manually banked (card payments for example). Values are obtained from Receipt attributes:
=sum(Receipt.receiptAmount) for all Receipt.bankable = false.

Attributes.Name: transactionsGrandTotalRounding
Attributes.Description:
Cumulative amount in error due to process rounding not reflected in transactionsGandTotal. Values are obtained from Transaction attributes:
=sum(Transaction.transactionRounding).

Attributes.Name: receiptsGrandTotalBankable
Attributes.Description:
Total of amounts receipted during this shift that can be manually banked (cash and cheques for example). Values are obtained from Receipt attributes:
=sum(Receipt.receiptAmount) for all Receipt.bankable = true.

Attributes.Name: activityInterval
Attributes.Description: Interval for activity of this shift.

Attributes.Name: receiptsGrandTotalRounding
Attributes.Description:
Cumulative amount in error due to process rounding not reflected in receiptsGrandTotal. Values are obtained from Receipt attributes:
=sum(Receipt.receiptRounding).

Attributes.Name: transactionsGrandTotal
Attributes.Description:
Cumulative total of transacted amounts during this shift. Values are obtained from transaction:
=sum('Transaction.transactionAmount'). It also has to be reconciled against transaction summary:
=sum('TransactionSummary.transactionsTotal').

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketScheduledEvent
DerivedEntities.Description: Signifies an event to trigger one or more activities, such as reading a meter, recalculating a bill, requesting work, when generating units shall be scheduled for maintenance, when a transformer is scheduled to be refurbished, etc.

Attributes.Name: category

Attributes.Name: duration
Attributes.Description: Duration of the scheduled event, for example, the time to ramp between values.

DerivedEntities.Name: LocalReliabilityArea
DerivedEntities.Description: Allows definition of reliability areas (e.g.. load pockets) within the ISO/RTO.

DerivedEntities.Name: FuelRegion

Attributes.Name: lastModified

DerivedEntities.Name: ForbiddenRegion
DerivedEntities.Description: Forbbiden region is operating ranges where the units are unable to maintain steady operation without causing equipment damage.  The four attributes that define a forbidden region are the low MW, the High MW, the crossing time, and the crossing cost.

Attributes.Name: crossingCost
Attributes.Description: Cost associated with crossing the forbidden region

Attributes.Name: lowMW
Attributes.Description: Low end of the region definition.

Attributes.Name: highMW

Attributes.Description: Type of the transmission product. This could be a transmission service class (firm, total transmission capability, or non-firm), transmission service period (on-peak, full-period, off-peak), transmission service increments (yearly extended, hourly fixed, monthly sliding, etc.), transmission service type (network, available transmission capability, or point-to-point, or a transmission service window (fixed hourly, sliding weekly, extended monthly, etc.).

DerivedEntities.Name: CurtailmentProfile

Generic constraints can represent secure areas, voltage profile, transient stability and voltage collapse limits.

a)	Thermal MW limit constraints type
b)	Group line flow constraint type

IEC type 3A generator set model.

Attributes.Description: Current PI controller integration time constant (TIc) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

DerivedEntities.Name: WindGenType3bIEC

IEC type 3B generator set model.

Attributes.Name: mwtcwp

Attributes.Name: tg

Attributes.Name: two

Attributes.Name: xs

For transmission lines, the interchange area boundary is usually at a designated point such as the middle of the line. Line end metering is then corrected for line losses.

Attributes.Name: tiePointMWRating

CRRSegment represents a segment of a CRR in a particular time frame. 

The segment class contains amount, clearing price, start date and time, end date and time.

Attributes.Description: The status of the class set by operation or by signal. Optional field that will override other status fields.

Attributes.Name: normalArmed
Attributes.Description: The default/normal value used when other active signal/values are missing.

Attributes.Name: priority
Attributes.Description: Priority of trigger. 0 = don t care (default) 1 = highest priority. 2 is less than 1 and so on. A trigger with the highest priority will trigger first.

DerivedEntities.Name: Crew

Attributes.Name: status

Attributes.Name: status

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Type of this group.

DerivedEntities.Name: CoordinateSystem
DerivedEntities.Description: Coordinate reference system.

Attributes.Name: crsUrn
Attributes.Description:
A Uniform Resource Name (URN) for the coordinate reference system (crs) used to define 'Location.PositionPoints'.
An example would be the European Petroleum Survey Group (EPSG) code for a coordinate reference system, defined in URN under the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) namespace as: urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::XXXX, where XXXX is an EPSG code (a full list of codes can be found at the EPSG Registry web site http://www.epsg-registry.org/). To define the coordinate system as being WGS84 (latitude, longitude) using an EPSG OGC, this attribute would be urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::4236.
A profile should limit this code to a set of allowed URNs agreed to by all sending and receiving parties.

DerivedEntities.Name: Transaction
DerivedEntities.Description: The record of details of payment for service or token sale.

Attributes.Name: serviceUnitsError
Attributes.Description: Number of service units not reflected in 'serviceUnitsEnergy' due to process rounding or truncating errors.

Attributes.Name: receiverReference
Attributes.Description: Reference to the entity that is the recipient of 'amount' (for example, supplier for service charge payment; or tax receiver for VAT).

Attributes.Name: line
Attributes.Description: Transaction amount, rounding, date and note for this transaction line.

Attributes.Name: serviceUnitsEnergy
Attributes.Description: Actual amount of service units that is being paid for.

Attributes.Name: reversedId
Attributes.Description: (if 'kind' is transactionReversal) Reference to the original transaction that is being reversed by this transaction.

Attributes.Name: donorReference
Attributes.Description: Reference to the entity that is the source of 'amount' (for example: customer for token purchase; or supplier for free issue token).

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of transaction.

Attributes.Name: diverseReference
Attributes.Description: Formal reference for use with diverse payment (traffic fine for example).

DerivedEntities.Name: Participation
DerivedEntities.Description: Participation level of a given Pnode in a given AggregatePnode.

Attributes.Name: factor
Attributes.Description: Used to calculate "participation" of Pnode in an AggregatePnode. For example, for regulation region this factor is 1 and total sum of all factors for a specific regulation region does not have to be 1. For pricing zone the total sum of all factors has to be 1.

DerivedEntities.Name: Ownership
DerivedEntities.Description: Ownership of e.g. asset.

Attributes.Name: share

DerivedEntities.Name: OperationsSafetySupervisor
DerivedEntities.Description: Operator with responsibility that the work in high voltage installation is executed in a safe manner and according to safety regulation.

DerivedEntities.Name: CrewMember

DerivedEntities.Name: FieldSafetySupervisor
DerivedEntities.Description: Crew member on work site responsible for all local safety measures for the work crew doing maintenance, construction and repair in a substation or on a power line/cable.

DerivedEntities.Name: ProvidedBilateralPoint
DerivedEntities.Description: Allows declaration of ICCP points to be provided through a Bilateral Table agreement.

DerivedEntities.Name: ICCPProvidedPoint
DerivedEntities.Description: The IdentifiedObject.name attribute must have a value.  The name attribute shall be used as the DataValue name used for the exchange.

Attributes.Name: scope
Attributes.Description: Indicates if the Point is global scoped (e.g. VCC) or accessible only to the Bilateral table peer (e.g. ICC).

Attributes.Name: accessPriviledge
Attributes.Description: Provides information regarding the access privileges allowed to the ICCP Point.

Attributes.Name: pointQuality
Attributes.Description: Specifies the type of ICCP quality that will be conveyed as part of the ICCP Point.

Attributes.Name: pointType
Attributes.Description:
Indicates the ICCP Point type that is to be conveyed.

A CIM AccumlatorValue  shall be mapped to an ICCP real.
A CIM AnalogValue shall be mapped to an ICCP real.
A CIM DiscreteValue shall be mapped to either an ICCP real, state, stateSupplemental, or either protection event type.
A CIM StringMeasurementValue does not have a standardized mapping.
