DerivedEntities.Name: CurrentEmergencyScheduledInterchange
DerivedEntities.Description: Control area emergency schedules

Attributes.Name: emergencyScheduleMW
Attributes.Description: Net tie MW. These are three entries, the current emergency schedule interchange and the two future schedules if they exist.

Attributes.Name: emergencyScheduleRampTime
Attributes.Description: Ramp time, the ramping time for a schedule. This is calculated as the remaining time to ramp if a schedule is ramping. Measured in seconds, but can be negattive.

Attributes.Name: emergencyScheduleStartTime
Attributes.Description: Net tie time,  the start time for a schedule. This is calculated as the current time if a schedule is ramping.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransformerTest
DerivedEntities.Description: Test result for transformer ends, such as short-circuit, open-circuit (excitation) or no-load test.

DerivedEntities.Name: NoLoadTest
DerivedEntities.Description: No-load test results determine core admittance parameters. They include exciting current and core loss measurements from applying voltage to one winding. The excitation may be positive sequence or zero sequence. The test may be repeated at different voltages to measure saturation.

Attributes.Name: energisedEndVoltage
Attributes.Description: Voltage applied to the winding (end) during test.

Attributes.Name: loss
Attributes.Description: Losses measured from a positive-sequence or single-phase excitation test.

Attributes.Name: excitingCurrentZero
Attributes.Description: Exciting current measured from a zero-sequence open-circuit excitation test.

Attributes.Name: lossZero
Attributes.Description: Losses measured from a zero-sequence excitation test.

Attributes.Name: excitingCurrent
Attributes.Description: Exciting current measured from a positive-sequence or single-phase excitation test.

DerivedEntities.Name: OpenCircuitTest
DerivedEntities.Description: Open-circuit test results verify winding turn ratios and phase shifts. They include induced voltage and phase shift measurements on open-circuit windings, with voltage applied to the energised end. For three-phase windings, the excitation can be a positive sequence (the default) or a zero sequence.

Attributes.Name: energisedEndStep
Attributes.Description: Tap step number for the energised end of the test pair.

Attributes.Name: openEndStep
Attributes.Description: Tap step number for the open end of the test pair.

Attributes.Name: energisedEndVoltage
Attributes.Description: Voltage applied to the winding (end) during test.

Attributes.Name: phaseShift
Attributes.Description: Phase shift measured at the open end with the energised end set to rated voltage and all other ends open.

Attributes.Name: openEndVoltage
Attributes.Description: Voltage measured at the open-circuited end, with the energised end set to rated voltage and all other ends open.

DerivedEntities.Name: ShortCircuitTest
DerivedEntities.Description: Short-circuit test results determine mesh impedance parameters. They include load losses and leakage impedances. For three-phase windings, the excitation can be a positive sequence (the default) or a zero sequence. There shall be at least one grounded winding.

Attributes.Name: leakageImpedanceZero
Attributes.Description: Leakage impedance measured from a zero-sequence short-circuit test.

Attributes.Name: current
Attributes.Description: Short circuit current..

Attributes.Name: energisedEndStep
Attributes.Description: Tap step number for the energised end of the test pair.

Attributes.Name: lossZero
Attributes.Description: Load losses from a zero-sequence short-circuit test.

Attributes.Name: loss
Attributes.Description: Load losses from a positive-sequence or single-phase short-circuit test.

Attributes.Name: leakageImpedance
Attributes.Description: Leakage impedance measured from a positive-sequence or single-phase short-circuit test.

Attributes.Name: power
Attributes.Description: Short circuit apparent power.

Attributes.Name: voltage
Attributes.Description: Short circuit voltage..

Attributes.Name: groundedEndStep
Attributes.Description: Tap step number for the grounded end of the test pair.

Attributes.Name: temperature
Attributes.Description: Temperature at which the test is conducted.

Attributes.Name: basePower
Attributes.Description: Base power at which the tests are conducted, usually equal to the rateds of one of the involved transformer ends.

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketPerson
DerivedEntities.Description: General purpose information for name and other information to contact people.

Attributes.Name: governmentID
Attributes.Description: Unique identifier for person relative to its governing authority, for example a federal tax identifier (such as a Social Security number in the United States).

Attributes.Name: firstName
Attributes.Description: Person's first name.

Attributes.Name: userID
Attributes.Description: The user name for the person; required to log in.

Attributes.Name: category
Attributes.Description:
Category of this person relative to utility operations, classified according to the utility's corporate standards and practices. Examples include employee, contractor, agent, not affiliated, etc.
This field is not used to indicate whether this person is a customer of the utility. Often an employee or contractor is also a customer. Customer information is gained with relationship to Organisation and CustomerData. In similar fashion, this field does not indicate the various roles this person may fill as part of utility operations.

Attributes.Name: lastName
Attributes.Description: Person's last (family, sir) name.

Attributes.Name: mName
Attributes.Description: Middle name(s) or initial(s).

Attributes.Name: landlinePhone
Attributes.Description: Landline phone number.

Attributes.Name: electronicAddressAlternate
Attributes.Description: Alternate Electronic address.

Attributes.Name: mobilePhone
Attributes.Description: Mobile phone number.

Attributes.Name: electronicAddressPrimary
Attributes.Description: Primary Electronic address.

Attributes.Name: prefix
Attributes.Description: A prefix or title for the person's name, such as Miss, Mister, Doctor, etc.

Attributes.Name: specialNeed
Attributes.Description: Special service needs for the person (contact) are described; examples include life support, etc.

Attributes.Name: suffix
Attributes.Description: A suffix for the person's name, such as II, III, etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: BasicIntervalSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: Schedule of values at points in time.

DerivedEntities.Name: DynamicSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: A continuously variable component of a control area's MW net interchange schedule. Dynamic schedules are sent and received by control areas.

Attributes.Name: dynSchedStatus
Attributes.Description: The "active" or "inactive" status of the dynamic schedule

Attributes.Name: dynSchedSignRev
Attributes.Description: Dynamic schedule sign reversal required (true/false)

DerivedEntities.Name: RegularIntervalSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: The schedule has time points where the time between them is constant.

DerivedEntities.Name: BidSelfSched
DerivedEntities.Description: Defines self schedule values to be used for specified time intervals.

Attributes.Name: referenceType
Attributes.Description: Indication of which type of self schedule is being referenced.

Attributes.Name: selfSchedSptResource
Attributes.Description: Price Taker Export Self Sched Support Resource

Attributes.Name: pumpSelfSchedMw
Attributes.Description: Contains the PriceTaker, ExistingTransmissionContract, TransmissionOwnershipRights pumping self schedule quantity. If this value is not null, then the unit is in pumping mode.

Attributes.Name: bidType
Attributes.Description: bidType has two types as the required output of requirements and qualified pre-dispatch.

Attributes.Name: selfSchedType
Attributes.Description:
This attribute is used to specify if a bid includes a self sched bid. If so what self sched type is it. The possible values are shown as follow but not limited to:

'ETC' - Existing transmission contract
'TOR' - Transmission ownership right
'RMR' - Reliability must run
'RGMR' - Regulatory must run
"RMT" - Relaiability must take
"PT" - Price taker
"LPT" - Low price taker
"SP" - Self provision
"RA" - Resource adequacy

This attribute is originally defined in the BidSelfSched class

Attributes.Name: wheelingTransactionReference
Attributes.Description: A unique identifier of a wheeling transaction. A wheeling transaction is a balanced Energy exchange among Supply and Demand Resources.

Attributes.Name: balancingFlag
Attributes.Description: This is a Y/N flag for a self-schedule of a resource per market per date and hour, using a specific TR ID. It indicates whether a self-schedule using a TR is balanced with another self-schedule using the same TR ID.

Attributes.Name: priorityFlag
Attributes.Description: This is a Y/N flag for a self-schedule of a resource per market per date and hour, using a specific TR ID. It indicates whether a self-schedule using a TR has scheduling priority in DAM/RTM.

Attributes.Name: selfSchedMw
Attributes.Description: Self scheduled value

DerivedEntities.Name: SeasonDayTypeSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: A time schedule covering a 24 hour period, with curve data for a specific type of season and day.

DerivedEntities.Name: NonConformLoadSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: An active power (Y1-axis) and reactive power (Y2-axis) schedule (curves) versus time (X-axis) for non-conforming loads, e.g., large industrial load or power station service (where modelled).

DerivedEntities.Name: SwitchSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: A schedule of switch positions.  If RegularTimePoint.value1 is 0, the switch is open.  If 1, the switch is closed.

DerivedEntities.Name: RegulationSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: A pre-established pattern over time for a controlled variable, e.g., busbar voltage.

DerivedEntities.Name: TapSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: A pre-established pattern over time for a tap step.

DerivedEntities.Name: ConformLoadSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: A curve of load  versus time (X-axis) showing the active power values (Y1-axis) and reactive power (Y2-axis) for each unit of the period covered. This curve represents a typical pattern of load over the time period for a given day type and season.

DerivedEntities.Name: SteamSendoutSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: The cogeneration plant's steam sendout schedule in volume per time unit.

DerivedEntities.Name: GenUnitOpSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: The generating unit's Operator-approved current operating schedule (or plan), typically produced with the aid of unit commitment type analyses. The X-axis represents absolute time. The Y1-axis represents the status (0=off-line and unavailable: 1=available: 2=must run: 3=must run at fixed power value: etc.). The Y2-axis represents the must run fixed power value where required.

DerivedEntities.Name: AreaLoadCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Area load curve definition.

Attributes.Name: forecastType
Attributes.Description: Load forecast area type.

DerivedEntities.Name: BidPriceSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: Defines bid schedules to allow a product bid to use specified bid price curves for different time intervals.

Attributes.Name: mitigationStatus
Attributes.Description:
Mitigation Status:

'S' - Mitigated by SMPM because of "misconduct"
'L; - Mitigated by LMPM because of "misconduct"
'R' - Modified by LMPM because of RMR rules
'M' - Mitigated because of "misconduct" both by SMPM and LMPM
'B' - Mitigated because of "misconduct" both by SMPM and modified by LMLM because of RMR rules
'O' - original

Attributes.Name: bidType

DerivedEntities.Name: BidHourlyProductSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: Containment for bid parameters that are dependent on a market product type.

DerivedEntities.Name: PumpingShutDownCostSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description:
The cost to shutdown a Pump Storage Hydro Unit (in pump mode) or a pump.

This schedule is assocated with the hourly parameters in a resource bid associated with a specific product within the bid.

DerivedEntities.Name: PumpingLevelSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description:
The fixed operating level of a Pump Storage Hydro Unit operating as a hydro pump. Associated with the energy market product type.

This schedule is assocated with the hourly parameters in a resource bid associated with a specific product within the bid.

DerivedEntities.Name: PumpingCostSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description:
The operating cost of a Pump Storage Hydro Unit operating as a hydro pump.

This schedule is assocated with the hourly parameters in a resource bid associated with a specific product within the bid.

DerivedEntities.Name: InflowForecast
DerivedEntities.Description: Natural water inflow to a reservoir, usually forecasted from predicted rain and snowmelt. Typically in one hour increments for up to 10 days. The forecast is given in average cubic meters per second over the time increment.

DerivedEntities.Name: BidHourlySchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: Containment for bid hourly parameters that are not product dependent.

DerivedEntities.Name: WheelingReferenceSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description:
A unique identifier of a wheeling transaction. A wheeling transaction is a balanced Energy exchange among Supply and Demand Resources.

This schedule is assocated with the hourly parameters in a resource bid.

DerivedEntities.Name: HourlyPreDispatchSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description:
An indicator specifying that a resource shall have an Hourly Pre-Dispatch. The resource could be a RegisteredGenerator or a RegisteredInterTie.

This schedule is assocated with the hourly parameters in a resource bid.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: Flag defining that for this hour in the resource bid the resource shall have an hourly pre-dispatch.

DerivedEntities.Name: OpenTieSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description:
Result of bid validation against conditions that may exist on an interchange that becomes disconnected or is heavily discounted with respect the MW flow.

This schedule is assocated with the hourly parameters in a resource bid.

DerivedEntities.Name: ResourcePerformanceTimeSeriesFactor
DerivedEntities.Description: Represents the performance of a resource as time series data for a specified time period, time interval, and evaluation criteria.

Attributes.Name: timeSeriesDescription
Attributes.Description: Optional description of the time series data, e.g. baseline data, meter read data, computed performance data.

Attributes.Name: timeSeriesDataType
Attributes.Description: Type of the time series data, e.g. baseline data, meter read data, computed performance data.

Attributes.Name: value2Description
Attributes.Description: Description for the value2 contained within the TimeSeriesFactor.

Attributes.Name: value1Description
Attributes.Description: Description for the value1 contained within the TimeSeriesFactor.

DerivedEntities.Name: HydroPumpOpSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: The hydro pump's Operator-approved current operating schedule (or plan), typically produced with the aid of unit commitment type analyses. The unit's operating schedule status is typically given as: (0=unavailable) (1=available to startup or shutdown)  (2=must pump).

Attributes.Name: timeStep
Attributes.Description: The time between each pair of subsequent regular time points in sequence order.

Attributes.Name: endTime
Attributes.Description: The time for the last time point.  The value can be a time of day, not a specific date.

DerivedEntities.Name: IrregularIntervalSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: The schedule has time points where the time between them varies.

Attributes.Name: startTime
Attributes.Description: The time for the first time point.  The value can be a time of day, not a specific date.

Attributes.Name: value1Multiplier
Attributes.Description: Multiplier for value1.

Attributes.Name: value2Unit
Attributes.Description: Value2 units of measure.

Attributes.Name: value1Unit
Attributes.Description: Value1 units of measure.

Attributes.Name: value2Multiplier
Attributes.Description: Multiplier for value2.

DerivedEntities.Name: Register
DerivedEntities.Description: A device that indicates or records units of the commodity or other quantity measured.

Attributes.Name: touTier
Attributes.Description: Clock time interval for register to beging/cease accumulating time of usage (e.g., start at 8:00 am, stop at 5:00 pm).

Attributes.Name: isVirtual
Attributes.Description: If true, the data it produces is  calculated or measured by a device other than a physical end device/meter. Otherwise, any data streams it produces are measured by the hardware of the end device/meter itself.

Attributes.Name: rightDigitCount
Attributes.Description: Number of digits (dials on a mechanical meter) to the right of the decimal place.

Attributes.Name: leftDigitCount
Attributes.Description: Number of digits (dials on a mechanical meter) to the left of the decimal place; default is normally 5.

Attributes.Name: touTierName
Attributes.Description: Name used for the time of use tier (also known as bin or bucket).  For example, "peak", "off-peak", "TOU Category A", etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: ResponseMethod
DerivedEntities.Description: Specifies a category of energy usage that the demand response applies for; e.g. energy from lighting, HVAC, other.

Attributes.Name: siteMultiplier
Attributes.Description: This value provides for scaling of a response method's active power. For example, a response method of air conditioning could utilize a small amount of active power from each air conditioning unit (e.g. 0.1 kiloWatt), but the site multiplier could be used to produce a the total active power adjustment by multiplying the response method active power by this value (e.g. a building with 100 window air conditioning  units, so 100 * 0.1 kW = 10 kW).

Attributes.Name: activePowerUOM
Attributes.Description: The unit of measure of active power, e.g. kiloWatts (kW), megaWatts (mW), etc.

Attributes.Name: activePower
Attributes.Description: The active power value for the demand adjustment type. This supports requests to be made to a resource for some amount of active power provided by a particular response method, as specified by the method attribute (e.g. lighting, HVAC, wall mounted air conditioners, etc.).

Attributes.Name: method
Attributes.Description: The response method (e.g. lighting, HVAC, wall mounted air conditioners, etc.).

DerivedEntities.Name: ConnectivityNode
DerivedEntities.Description: Connectivity nodes are points where terminals of AC conducting equipment are connected together with zero impedance.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktConnectivityNode
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC61970:Topology:ConnectivityNode.

DerivedEntities.Name: ACDCTerminal
DerivedEntities.Description: An electrical connection point (AC or DC) to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCBaseTerminal
DerivedEntities.Description: An electrical connection point at a piece of DC conducting equipment. DC terminals are connected at one physical DC node that may have multiple DC terminals connected. A DC node is similar to an AC connectivity node. The model requires that DC connections are distinct from AC connections.

DerivedEntities.Name: ACDCConverterDCTerminal
DerivedEntities.Description: A DC electrical connection point at the AC/DC converter. The AC/DC converter is electrically connected also to the AC side. The AC connection is inherited from the AC conducting equipment in the same way as any other AC equipment. The AC/DC converter DC terminal is separate from generic DC terminal to restrict the connection with the AC side to AC/DC converter and so that no other DC conducting equipment can be connected to the AC side.

Attributes.Name: polarity
Attributes.Description:
Represents the normal network polarity condition. Depending on the converter configuration the value shall be set as follows:
- For a monopole with two converter terminals use DCPolarityKind positive and negative.
- For a bi-pole or symmetric monopole with three converter terminals use DCPolarityKind positive, middle and negative.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCTerminal
DerivedEntities.Description: An electrical connection point to generic DC conducting equipment.

DerivedEntities.Name: Terminal
DerivedEntities.Description: An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktTerminal
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC61970:Core:Terminal.

Attributes.Name: phases
Attributes.Description:
Represents the normal network phasing condition. If the attribute is missing, three phases (ABC) shall be assumed, except for terminals of grounding classes (specializations of EarthFaultCompensator, GroundDisconnector, GroundSwitch, and Ground) which will be assumed to be N. Therefore, phase code ABCN is explicitly declared when needed, e.g. for star point grounding equipment.
The phase code on terminals connecting same ConnectivityNode or same TopologicalNode as well as for equipment between two terminals shall be consistent.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: The orientation of the terminal connections for a multiple terminal conducting equipment.  The sequence numbering starts with 1 and additional terminals should follow in increasing order.   The first terminal is the "starting point" for a two terminal branch.

Attributes.Name: connected
Attributes.Description:
The connected status is related to a bus-branch model and the topological node to terminal relation.  True implies the terminal is connected to the related topological node and false implies it is not. 
In a bus-branch model, the connected status is used to tell if equipment is disconnected without having to change the connectivity described by the topological node to terminal relation. A valid case is that conducting equipment can be connected in one end and open in the other. In particular for an AC line segment, where the reactive line charging can be significant, this is a relevant case.

DerivedEntities.Name: ActivityRecord
DerivedEntities.Description: Records activity for an entity at a point in time; activity may be for an event that has already occurred or for a planned activity.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktActivityRecord
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC61968: Common:ActivityRecord.

DerivedEntities.Name: WorkActivityRecord
DerivedEntities.Description: Records information about the status of work or work task at a point in time.

Attributes.Name: percentComplete
Attributes.Description: Estimated percentage of completion of this individual work task or overall work order.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnvironmentalAlert
DerivedEntities.Description: An environmental alert issued by a provider or system.

Attributes.Name: alertType
Attributes.Description: The type of the issued alert which is drawn from the specified alert type list.

Attributes.Name: cancelledDateTime
Attributes.Description: Time and date alert cancelled. Used only if alert is cancelled before it expires.

Attributes.Name: headline
Attributes.Description:
An abbreviated textual description of the alert issued. 
Note: the full text of the alert appears in the .description attribute (inherited from IdentifiedObject).

Attributes.Name: inEffect
Attributes.Description: The interval for which this weather alert is in effect.

DerivedEntities.Name: ComplianceEvent
DerivedEntities.Description:
Compliance events are used for reporting regulatory or contract compliance issues and/or variances. These might be created as a consequence of local business processes and associated rules. It is anticipated that this class will be customised extensively to meet local implementation needs.
Use inherited 'type' to indicate that, for example, expected performance will not be met or reported as mandated.

Attributes.Name: deadline
Attributes.Description: The deadline for compliance.

DerivedEntities.Name: ConfigurationEvent
DerivedEntities.Description: Used to report details on creation, change or deletion of an entity or its configuration.

Attributes.Name: effectiveDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time this event has or will become effective.

Attributes.Name: remark
Attributes.Description: Free text remarks.

Attributes.Name: modifiedBy
Attributes.Description: Source/initiator of modification.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetHealthEvent
DerivedEntities.Description: An asset health-related event that is created by an analytic. The event is a record of a change in asset health.

Attributes.Name: actionRecommendation
Attributes.Description: Recommendation for action.

Attributes.Name: actionTimeline
Attributes.Description: Time horizon for action.

Attributes.Name: effectiveDateTime
Attributes.Description: The date and time when the event is effective.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnvironmentalEvent
DerivedEntities.Description:
An environmental event to which one or more forecasts or observations may be tied and which may relate to or affect one or more assets. This class is intended to be used as a means of grouping forecasts and/or observations and could be used for a variety of purposes, including:
  • to define a 'named' event like Hurricane Katrina and allow the historic (or forecast) values for phenomena and measurements (precipitation, temperature) across time to be associated with it
  • to identify assets that were (or are forecast to be) affected by a phenomenon or set of measurements

DerivedEntities.Name: EndDeviceEvent
DerivedEntities.Description: Event detected by a device function associated with the end device.

Attributes.Name: issuerID
Attributes.Description: Unique identifier of the business entity originating an end device control.

Attributes.Name: issuerTrackingID
Attributes.Description: Identifier assigned by the initiator (e.g. retail electric provider) of an end device control action to uniquely identify the demand response event, text message, or other subject of the control action. Can be used when cancelling an event or text message request or to identify the originating event or text message in a consequential end device event.

Attributes.Name: userID
Attributes.Description: (if user initiated) ID of user who initiated this end device event.

DerivedEntities.Name: SwitchingEvent
DerivedEntities.Description: Event indicating the completion (success or fail) of any switching action (jumper action, cut action, tag action, etc).  The switching action may or may not be a consequential event in response to a request to complete the action.

DerivedEntities.Name: PSREvent
DerivedEntities.Description: Event recording the change in operational status of a power system resource; may be for an event that has already occurred or for a planned activity.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of event.

DerivedEntities.Name: FailureEvent
DerivedEntities.Description: An event where an asset has failed to perform its functions within specified parameters. This class is intended to reflect the failure itself. Additional information resulting from forensic analysis could be captured by a diagnosis data set.

Attributes.Name: breakerFailureReason
Attributes.Description: Reason for breaker failure.

Attributes.Name: corporateCode
Attributes.Description: Code for asset failure.

Attributes.Name: failureMode
Attributes.Description: What asset failed to be able to do.

Attributes.Name: location
Attributes.Description: Failure location on an object.

Attributes.Name: failureClassification
Attributes.Description: Classification of failure.

Attributes.Name: transformerFailureReason
Attributes.Description: Reason for transformer failure.

Attributes.Name: faultLocatingMethod
Attributes.Description: The method used for locating the faulted part of the asset. For example, cable options include: Cap Discharge-Thumping, Bridge Method, Visual Inspection, Other.

Attributes.Name: failureDateTime
Attributes.Description: Time and date of asset failure.

Attributes.Name: rootCause
Attributes.Description: Root cause of asset failure.

Attributes.Name: failureIsolationMethod
Attributes.Description: How the asset failure was isolated from the system.

Attributes.Name: createdDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time this activity record has been created (different from the 'status.dateTime', which is the time of a status change of the associated object, if applicable).

Attributes.Name: severity
Attributes.Description: Severity level of event resulting in this activity record.

Attributes.Name: reason
Attributes.Description: Reason for event resulting in this activity record, typically supplied when user initiated.

Attributes.Name: status
Attributes.Description: Information on consequence of event resulting in this activity record.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Type of event resulting in this activity record.

DerivedEntities.Name: ModelAuthoritySet
DerivedEntities.Description:
A Modeling Authority Set is a group of objects in a network model where the data is supplied and maintained by the same Modeling Authority.
This class is typically not included in instance data exchange as this information is tracked by other mechanisms in the exchange.

DerivedEntities.Name: FrameworkPart
DerivedEntities.Description: The type of alternate model frame.  For example, it could be generator group used to represent generators in state estimator, planning, planning dynamics, short circuit, or real-time dynamics etc., but does not specifically represent any one alternative model. This need to know what objects to be removed in the realization of any one alternate model.

DerivedEntities.Name: NetworkFrame
DerivedEntities.Description: A region isolated by boundaries.

DerivedEntities.Name: NetworkBoundary
DerivedEntities.Description: A framework part that is a boundary between 2 frames.

DerivedEntities.Name: CrewType
DerivedEntities.Description: Custom description of the type of crew. This may be used to determine the type of work the crew can be assigned to. Examples include repair, tree trimming, switching, etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: ConstraintResults
DerivedEntities.Description: Provides the Market results for the constraint processing for either the DAM or RTM. The data includes the constraint type (binding or violated), the solved value for the constraint, and the associated shadow price.

Attributes.Name: shadowPrice
Attributes.Description: Shadow Price ($/MW) for the commodity.  Shadow price for the corresponding constraint.

Attributes.Name: baseFlow
Attributes.Description: Branch base Power Flow.

Attributes.Name: constraintType
Attributes.Description: Type of constraint.

Attributes.Name: overloadMW
Attributes.Description: Transmission overload MW.

Attributes.Name: BGTRResCap
Attributes.Description: Branch Group TR Reservation Capacity - This value is determined in DA and RTM. It is the amount of spare transmission capacity that is left for the TR holder to use.

Attributes.Name: bindingLimit
Attributes.Description: MW Limit.

Attributes.Name: clearedValue
Attributes.Description: Cleared MW.

Attributes.Name: competitivePathConstraint
Attributes.Description: Non-competitive path constraint Flag"(Y/N)  indicating whether the shadow price on a non-competitive path was non-zero.

Attributes.Name: limitFlag
Attributes.Description: Limit flag ('Maximum', 'Minimum').

Attributes.Name: updateUser
Attributes.Description: Updated user.

Attributes.Name: updateTimeStamp
Attributes.Description: Update time stamp.

Attributes.Name: updateType
Attributes.Description: MQS change type.

Attributes.Name: optimizationFlag
Attributes.Description: Included in optimization Y/N.

Attributes.Name: BGLimit
Attributes.Description: This value is determined in DA and RTM. The SCUC optimization ensures that the MW flow on the Branch Group will not exceed this limit in the relevant direction.

Attributes.Name: percentMW
Attributes.Description: Actual MW flow as percent of limit.

DerivedEntities.Name: ModelPartSpecification
DerivedEntities.Description: The type of model.  For example,  state estimator, planning, planning dynamics, short circuit, or real-time dynamics etc.     The model must conform to a profile.

DerivedEntities.Name: MutualCoupling
DerivedEntities.Description: This class represents the zero sequence line mutual coupling.

Attributes.Name: b0ch
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence mutual coupling shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

Attributes.Name: distance22
Attributes.Description: Distance to the end of coupled region from the second line's terminal with sequence number equal to 1.

Attributes.Name: r0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence branch-to-branch mutual impedance coupling, resistance.

Attributes.Name: g0ch
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence mutual coupling shunt (charging) conductance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

Attributes.Name: distance11
Attributes.Description: Distance to the start of the coupled region from the first line's terminal having sequence number equal to 1.

Attributes.Name: x0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence branch-to-branch mutual impedance coupling, reactance.

Attributes.Name: distance12
Attributes.Description: Distance to the end of the coupled region from the first line's terminal with sequence number equal to 1.

Attributes.Name: distance21
Attributes.Description: Distance to the start of coupled region from the second line's terminal with sequence number equal to 1.

DerivedEntities.Name: Document
DerivedEntities.Description: Parent class for different groupings of information collected and managed as a part of a business process. It will frequently contain references to other objects, such as assets, people and power system resources.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetModelCatalogueItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Provides pricing and other relevant information about a specific manufacturer's product (i.e., AssetModel), and its price from a given supplier. A single AssetModel may be availble from multiple suppliers. Note that manufacturer and supplier are both types of organisation, which the association is inherited from Document.

Attributes.Name: unitCost
Attributes.Description: Unit cost for an asset model from a specific supplier, either for a unit cost or cost per unit length. Cost is for material or asset only and does not include labor to install/construct or configure it.

DerivedEntities.Name: Agreement
DerivedEntities.Description: Formal agreement between two parties defining the terms and conditions for a set of services. The specifics of the services are, in turn, defined via one or more service agreements.

DerivedEntities.Name: IntSchedAgreement
DerivedEntities.Description: A type of agreement that provides the default method by which interchange schedules are to be integrated to obtain hourly MWh schedules for accounting.

Attributes.Name: defaultIntegrationMethod
Attributes.Description: The default method by which interchange schedules are to be integrated to obtain hourly MWh schedules for accounting. Method #1 is to integrate the instantaneous schedule between the hourly boundaries. Method #2 compensates for any up/down ramping that occurs across the hourly boundary (this is called block accounting).

DerivedEntities.Name: OpenAccessProduct
DerivedEntities.Description: Contracts for services offered commercially.

DerivedEntities.Name: MerchantAgreement
DerivedEntities.Description: A formal controlling contractual agreement between supplier and merchant, in terms of which the merchant is authorised to vend tokens and receipt payments on behalf of the supplier. The merchant is accountable to the supplier for revenue collected at point of sale.

DerivedEntities.Name: RightOfWay
DerivedEntities.Description: A right-of-way (ROW) is for land where it is lawful to use for a public road, an electric power line, etc. Note that the association to Location, Asset, Organisation, etc. for the Grant is inherited from Agreement, a type of Document.

Attributes.Name: propertyData
Attributes.Description: Property related information that describes the ROW's land parcel. For example, it may be a deed book number, deed book page number, and parcel number.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnergyProduct
DerivedEntities.Description: An EnergyProduct is offered commercially as a ContractOrTariff.

DerivedEntities.Name: FTR
DerivedEntities.Description: Financial Transmission Rights (FTR) regarding transmission capacity at a flowgate.

Attributes.Name: class
Attributes.Description: Peak, Off-peak, 24-hour

Attributes.Name: action
Attributes.Description: Buy, Sell

Attributes.Name: baseEnergy
Attributes.Description: Quantity, typically MWs - Seller owns all rights being offered, MWs over time on same Point of Receipt, Point of Delivery, or Resource.

Attributes.Name: ftrType
Attributes.Description: Type of rights being offered (product) allowed to be auctioned (option, obligation).

Attributes.Name: optimized
Attributes.Description: Fixed (covers re-configuration, grandfathering) or Optimized (up for sale/purchase

DerivedEntities.Name: AuxiliaryAgreement
DerivedEntities.Description:
An ad-hoc auxiliary account agreement associated with a customer agreement, not part of the customer's account, but typically subject to formal agreement between customer and supplier (utility). Typically this is used to collect revenue owed by the customer for other services or arrears accrued with the utility for other services. It is typically linked to a prepaid token purchase transaction, thus forcing the customer to make a payment towards settlement of the auxiliary account balance whenever the customer needs to purchase a prepaid token for electricity.
The present status of the auxiliary agreement can be defined in the context of the utility's business rules, for example: enabled, disabled, pending, over recovered, under recovered, written off, etc.

Attributes.Name: auxPriorityCode
Attributes.Description: The coded priority indicating the priority that this auxiliary agreement has above other auxiliary agreements (associated with the same customer agreement) when it comes to competing for settlement from a payment transaction or token purchase.

Attributes.Name: auxCycle
Attributes.Description: The frequency for automatically recurring auxiliary charges, where 'AuxiliaryAccount.initialCharge' is recursively added to 'AuxiliaryAccount.dueCurrent' at the start of each 'auxCycle'. For example: on a specified date and time; hourly; daily; weekly; monthly; 3-monthly; 6-monthly; 12-monthly; etc.

Attributes.Name: payCycle
Attributes.Description: The contractually expected payment frequency (by the customer). Examples are: ad-hoc; on specified date; hourly, daily, weekly, monthly. etc.

Attributes.Name: fixedAmount
Attributes.Description: The fixed amount that has to be collected from each vending transaction towards settlement of this auxiliary agreement. Note that there may be multiple tokens vended per vending transaction, but this is not relevant.

Attributes.Name: arrearsInterest
Attributes.Description: The interest per annum to be charged prorata on 'AuxiliaryAccount.dueArrears' at the end of each 'payCycle'.

Attributes.Name: subType
Attributes.Description: Sub-classification of the inherited 'type' for this AuxiliaryAgreement.

Attributes.Name: minAmount
Attributes.Description: The minimum amount that has to be paid at any transaction towards settling this auxiliary agreement or reducing the balance.

Attributes.Name: vendPortion
Attributes.Description: The percentage of the transaction amount that has to be collected from each vending transaction towards settlement of this auxiliary agreement when payments are not in arrears. Note that there may be multiple tokens vended per vending transaction, but this is not relevant.

Attributes.Name: vendPortionArrear
Attributes.Description: The percentage of the transaction amount that has to be collected from each vending transaction towards settlement of this auxiliary agreement when payments are in arrears. Note that there may be multiple tokens vended per vending transaction, but this is not relevant.

DerivedEntities.Name: LocationGrant
DerivedEntities.Description: A grant provides a right, as defined by type, for a parcel of land. Note that the association to Location, Asset, Organisation, etc. for the Grant is inherited from Agreement, a type of Document.

Attributes.Name: propertyData
Attributes.Description: Property related information that describes the Grant's land parcel. For example, it may be a deed book number, deed book page number, and parcel number.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExternalCustomerAgreement
DerivedEntities.Description: A type of customer agreement involving an external agency. For example, a customer may form a contracts with an Energy Service Supplier if Direct Access is permitted.

DerivedEntities.Name: CustomerAgreement
DerivedEntities.Description: Agreement between the customer and the service supplier to pay for service at a specific service location. It records certain billing information about the type of service provided at the service location and is used during charge creation to determine the type of service.

Attributes.Name: loadMgmt
Attributes.Description: Load management code.

Attributes.Name: shutOffDateTime
Attributes.Description: Final date and time the service will be billed to the previous customer.

Attributes.Name: isPrePay
Attributes.Description: If true, the customer is a pre-pay customer for the specified service.

Attributes.Name: signDate
Attributes.Description: Date this agreement was consummated among associated persons and/or organisations.

Attributes.Name: validityInterval
Attributes.Description: Date and time interval this agreement is valid (from going into effect to termination).

DerivedEntities.Name: Tariff
DerivedEntities.Description: Document, approved by the responsible regulatory agency, listing the terms and conditions, including a schedule of prices, under which utility services will be provided. It has a unique number within the state or province. For rate schedules it is frequently allocated by the affiliated Public utilities commission (PUC).

Attributes.Name: endDate
Attributes.Description: (if tariff became inactive) Date tariff was terminated.

Attributes.Name: startDate
Attributes.Description: Date tariff was activated.

Attributes.Name: multiplePremises
Attributes.Description: Set to true if the outage report indicated that other neighbors are also out of power.

Attributes.Name: dateTimeOfReport
Attributes.Description: Date and time the trouble has been reported.

Attributes.Name: troubleCode
Attributes.Description: Trouble code (e.g., power down, flickering lights, partial power, etc).

Attributes.Name: reportingKind
Attributes.Description: Indicates how the customer reported trouble.

Attributes.Name: resolvedDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time this trouble ticket has been resolved.

Attributes.Name: comment
Attributes.Description: Free-form comment associated with the trouble call for example, "customer reported a large flash", etc.

Attributes.Name: firstResponderStatus
Attributes.Description: Indicates whether the first responder such as police, fire department etc.has been notified and whether they are on site or en route.

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketStatement
DerivedEntities.Description: A statement is a roll up of statement line items. Each statement along with its line items provide the details of specific charges at any given time.  Used by Billing and Settlement.

Attributes.Name: end
Attributes.Description: The end of a bill period.

Attributes.Name: start
Attributes.Description: The start of a bill period.

Attributes.Name: tradeDate
Attributes.Description: The date of which Settlement is run.

Attributes.Name: transactionDate
Attributes.Description: The date of which this statement is issued.

Attributes.Name: referenceNumber
Attributes.Description: The version number of previous statement (in the case of true up).

DerivedEntities.Name: Specification
DerivedEntities.Description: Specification can be used for various purposes relative to an asset, a logical device (PowerSystemResource), location, etc. Examples include documents supplied by manufacturers such as asset installation instructions, asset maintenance instructions, etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: ChargeType
DerivedEntities.Description: Charge Type is the basic level configuration for settlement to process specific charges for invoicing purpose. Examples such as: Day Ahead Spinning Reserve Default Invoice Interest Charge, etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: CongestionRevenueRight
DerivedEntities.Description:
Congestion Revenue Rights (CRR) class that is inherited from a Document class.

A CRR is a financial concept that is used to hedge congestion charges.

The CRR is usually settled based on the Locational Marginal Prices (LMPs) that are calculated in the day-ahead market. These LMPs are determined by the Day-ahead resource schedules/bids. CRRs will not hedge against marginal losses. If the congestion component of LMP at the sink is greater than at the source, then the CRR owner is entitled to receive a portion of congestion revenues. If the congestion component at the sink is less than at the source, then an obligation-type CRR owner will be charged, but an option-type CRR owner will not.

Attributes.Name: cRRcategory
Attributes.Description: CRR category represents 'PTP' for a point-to-point CRR, or 'NSR' for a Network Service Right. If CRR category is 'PTP', both Source ID and Sink ID fields are required. If CRR category is 'NSR' only one field, either Source ID or Sink ID, shall be not null and the other shall be null. However, the 'NSR' category will include at least three records.

Attributes.Name: cRRtype
Attributes.Description: Type of the CRR, from the possible type definitions in the CRR System (e.g. 'LSE', 'ETC').

Attributes.Name: timeOfUse
Attributes.Description: Time of Use flag of the CRR - Peak (ON), Offpeak (OFF) or all 24 hours (24HR).

Attributes.Name: hedgeType
Attributes.Description: Hedge type Obligation or Option. An obligation type requires the holder to receive or pay the congestion rent. An option type gives the holder the option of receiving or paying the congestion rent.

Attributes.Name: tradeSliceID
Attributes.Description: Segment of the CRR described in the current record.

DerivedEntities.Name: TroubleOrder
DerivedEntities.Description: Trouble order sends an incident to a crew to initiate a response to an unplanned outage.

Attributes.Name: plannedExecutionInterval
Attributes.Description: The planned start and end time for the trouble order.

Attributes.Name: comment
Attributes.Description: Free-form comment associated with the trouble order.

DerivedEntities.Name: SwitchingPlan
DerivedEntities.Description:
A sequence of grouped or atomic steps intended to:
- de-energise equipment or part of the network for safe work, and/or
- bring back in service previously de-energised equipment or part of the network.

Attributes.Name: cancelledDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and Time the switching plan was cancelled.

Attributes.Name: approvedDateTime
Attributes.Description: The date and time the switching plan was approved

Attributes.Name: purpose
Attributes.Description: Purpose of  this plan, such as whether it is to move the state from normal to some abnormal condition, or to restore the normal state after an abnormal condition, or to perform some kind of optimisation such as correction of overload, voltage control, etc.

Attributes.Name: plannedPeriod
Attributes.Description: the planned start and end times for the switching plan.

Attributes.Name: rank
Attributes.Description: Ranking in comparison to other switching plans.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpDocument
DerivedEntities.Description: Shadow class for Document, to isolate subclassing from this package. If any subclass gets normative and needs inheritance, it will inherit directly from Document.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpJournal
DerivedEntities.Description:
Book for recording accounting transactions as they occur. Transactions and adjustments are first recorded in a journal, which is like a diary of instructions, advising which account to be charged and by how much.
A journal represents a change in the balances of a business's financial accounts. Many tasks or transactions throughout an enterprise will result in the creation of a journal. Some examples are creating a customer invoice, paying a vendor, transferring inventory, or paying employees.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpReceivable
DerivedEntities.Description: Transaction representing an invoice, credit memo or debit memo to a customer. It is an open (unpaid) item in the Accounts Receivable ledger.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpInvoiceLineItem
DerivedEntities.Description: An individual line item on an invoice.

Attributes.Name: lineNumber
Attributes.Description: Line item number on invoice statement.

Attributes.Name: netAmount
Attributes.Description: Net line item charge amount.

Attributes.Name: previousAmount
Attributes.Description: Previous line item charge amount.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of line item.

Attributes.Name: lineVersion
Attributes.Description: Version number of the bill run.

Attributes.Name: lineAmount
Attributes.Description: Amount due for this line item.

Attributes.Name: billPeriod
Attributes.Description: Bill period for the line item.

Attributes.Name: glDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time line item will be posted to the General Ledger.

Attributes.Name: glAccount
Attributes.Description: General Ledger account code, must be a valid combination.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpPOLineItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Of an ErpPurchaseOrder, this is an individually ordered item or product along with the quantity, price and other descriptive information.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpLedgerBudget
DerivedEntities.Description: Information for utility Ledger Budgets. They support the transfer budget amounts between all possible source applications throughout an enterprise and a general ledger or budget application.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpPayable
DerivedEntities.Description: A transaction that represents an invoice from a supplier. A payable (or voucher) is an open item, approved and ready for payment, in the Accounts Payable ledger.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpProjectAccounting
DerivedEntities.Description: Utility Project Accounting information, used by ERP applications to enable all relevant sub-systems that submit single sided transactions to transfer information with a Project Accounting Application. This would include, but not necessarily be limited to: Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Budget, Order Management, Purchasing, Time and Labor, Travel and Expense.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpTimeSheet
DerivedEntities.Description: Time sheet for employees and contractors. Note that ErpTimeSheet inherits the relationship to ErpPerson from Document.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpReceiveDelivery
DerivedEntities.Description: Transaction for an Organisation receiving goods or services that may be used to indicate receipt of goods in conjunction with a purchase order. A receivable is an open (unpaid) item in the Accounts Receivable ledger.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpInvoice
DerivedEntities.Description: A roll up of invoice line items. The whole invoice has a due date and amount to be paid, with information such as customer, banks etc. being obtained through associations. The invoice roll up is based on individual line items that each contain amounts and descriptions for specific services or products.

Attributes.Name: transferType
Attributes.Description: Type of invoice transfer.

Attributes.Name: amount
Attributes.Description: Total amount due on this invoice based on line items and applicable adjustments.

Attributes.Name: transactionDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time when the invoice is issued.

Attributes.Name: billMediaKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of media by which the CustomerBillingInfo was delivered.

Attributes.Name: proForma
Attributes.Description: True if payment is to be paid by a Customer to accept a particular ErpQuote (with associated Design) and have work initiated, at which time an associated ErpInvoice should automatically be generated. EprPayment.subjectStatus satisfies terms specificed in the ErpQuote.

Attributes.Name: dueDate
Attributes.Description: Calculated date upon which the Invoice amount is due.

Attributes.Name: referenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Number of an invoice to be reference by this invoice.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of invoice (default is 'sales').

Attributes.Name: mailedDate
Attributes.Description: Date on which the customer billing statement/invoice was printed/mailed.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpPayment
DerivedEntities.Description: Payment infromation and status for any individual line item of an ErpInvoice (e.g., when payment is from a customer). ErpPayable is also updated when payment is to a supplier and ErpReceivable is updated when payment is from a customer. Multiple payments can be made against a single line item and an individual payment can apply to more that one line item.

Attributes.Name: termsPayment
Attributes.Description: Payment terms (e.g., net 30).

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpEngChangeOrder
DerivedEntities.Description: General Utility Engineering Change Order information.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpBOM
DerivedEntities.Description:
Information that generally describes the Bill of Material Structure and its contents for a utility.

This is used by ERP systems to transfer Bill of Material information between two business applications.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpQuote
DerivedEntities.Description: Document describing the prices of goods or services provided by a supplier. It includes the terms of the purchase, delivery proposals, identification of goods or services ordered, as well as their quantities.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpSalesOrder
DerivedEntities.Description:
General purpose Sales Order is used for utility service orders, etc.
As used by the OAG, the SalesOrder is a step beyond a PurchaseOrder in that the receiving entity of the order also communicates SalesInformoration about the Order along with the Order itself.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpChartOfAccounts
DerivedEntities.Description: Accounting structure of a business. Each account represents a financial aspect of a business, such as its Accounts Payable, or the value of its inventory, or its office supply expenses.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpPurchaseOrder
DerivedEntities.Description: A document that communicates an order to purchase goods from a buyer to a supplier. The PurchaseOrder carries information to and from the buyer and supplier. It is a legally binding document once both Parties agree to the contents and the specified terms and conditions of the order.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpLedger
DerivedEntities.Description: In accounting transactions, a ledger is a book containing accounts to which debits and credits are posted from journals, where transactions are initially recorded. Journal entries are periodically posted to the ledger. Ledger Actual represents actual amounts by account within ledger within company or business area. Actual amounts may be generated in a source application and then loaded to a specific ledger within the enterprise general ledger or budget application.

DerivedEntities.Name: PassThroughBill
DerivedEntities.Description:
Pass Through Bill is used for:
1)Two sided charge transactions with or without ISO involvement
2) Specific direct charges or payments that are calculated outside or provided directly to settlements
3) Specific charge bill determinants that are externally supplied and used in charge calculations

Attributes.Name: providedBy
Attributes.Description: The company by which the PTB transaction service is provided.

Attributes.Name: isProfiled
Attributes.Description: A flag indicating whether there is a profile data associated with the PTB.

Attributes.Name: isDisputed
Attributes.Description: Disputed transaction indicator

Attributes.Name: billedTo
Attributes.Description: The company to which the PTB transaction is billed.

Attributes.Name: effectiveDate

DerivedEntities.Name: DefaultBid
DerivedEntities.Description:
DefaultBid is a generic class to hold Default Energy Bid, Default Startup Bid, and Default Minimum Load Bid: Default Energy Bid A Default Energy Bid is a monotonically increasing staircase function consisting at maximum 10 economic bid segments, or 10 ($/MW, MW) pairs. There are three methods for determining the Default Energy Bid:
  • Cost Based: derived from the Heat Rate or Average Cost multiplied by the Gas Price Index plus 10%.
  • LMP Based: a weighted average of LMPs in the preceding 90 days.
  • Negotiated: an amount negotiated with the designated Independent Entity.
Default Startup Bid A Default Startup Bid (DSUB) shall be calculated for each RMR unit based on the Startup Cost stored in the Master File and the applicable GPI and EPI. Default Minimum Load Bid A Default Minimum Load Bid (DMLB) shall be calculated for each RMR unit based on the Minimum Load Cost stored in the Master File and the applicable GPI.

Attributes.Name: bidType
Attributes.Description: Default bid type such as Default Energy Bid, Default Minimum Load Bid, and Default Startup Bid

Attributes.Description: on-peak, off-peak, or all

Attributes.Name: minLoadCost
Attributes.Description: Minimum load cost in $/hr

Attributes.Description: Stop time and date for which bid is applicable.

Attributes.Name: marketType
Attributes.Description: The market type, DAM or RTM.

Attributes.Name: startTime
Attributes.Description: Start time and date for which bid applies.

DerivedEntities.Name: Outage
DerivedEntities.Description:
Document describing details of an active or planned outage in a part of the electrical network.
A non-planned outage may be created upon:
- a breaker trip,
- a fault indicator status change,
- a meter event indicating customer outage,
- a reception of one or more customer trouble calls, or
- an operator command, reflecting information obtained from the field crew.
Outage restoration may be performed using a switching plan which complements the outage information with detailed switching activities, including the relationship to the crew and work.
A planned outage may be created upon:
- a request for service, maintenance or construction work in the field, or
- an operator-defined outage for what-if/contingency network analysis.

DerivedEntities.Name: UnplannedOutage
DerivedEntities.Description:
Document describing the consequence of an unplanned outage in a part of the electrical network. For the purposes of this model, an unplanned outage refers to a state where energy is not delivered; such as, customers out of service, a street light is not served, etc.
A unplanned outage may be created upon:
- impacts the SAIDI calculation
- a breaker trip,
- a fault indicator status change,
- a meter event indicating customer outage,
- a reception of one or more customer trouble calls, or
- an operator command, reflecting information obtained from the field crew.
Outage restoration may be performed using a switching plan which complements the outage information with detailed switching activities, including the relationship to the crew and work.

Attributes.Name: cause
Attributes.Description:
The cause of this outage.  This is the cause that is used to present to external entities.  That is, the cause is weather, equipment failure, etc.

Note: At present, this is a free text; could be replaced with a separate associated class in case we have multiple causes (e.g. OutageCauseType, inheriting from IdentifiedObject).

Attributes.Description: The earliest start time of the Outage - as reported by some system or individual

Attributes.Description: The reason for the planned outage.

Attributes.Name: statusKind
Attributes.Description: defines the status of the crew as in dispatched or arrived, etc.

Attributes.Name: estimatedPeriod
Attributes.Description: Estimated outage period for a planned outage. The start of the period is the start of the planned outage and the end of the period corresponds to the end of the planned outage.

Attributes.Name: customersRestored
Attributes.Description: number of customers that have been restored in the area.

Attributes.Description: Summary counts of service points (customers) affected by this outage.

Attributes.Description: the total number of customers that are served in the area (both outaged and not outaged).

Attributes.Name: outageKind
Attributes.Description: Defines if the outage has been verified or is only estimated

DerivedEntities.Name: SecurityConstraintSum
DerivedEntities.Description:
Typically provided by RTO systems, constraints identified in both base case and critical contingency cases have to be transferred.
A constraint has N (>=1) constraint terms. A term is represented by an instance of TerminalConstraintTerm. 
The constraint expression is:
minValue <= c1*x1 + c2*x2 + .... cn*xn + k <= maxValue
where:
- cn is ConstraintTerm.factor 
- xn is the flow at the terminal
Flow into the associated equipment is positive for the purpose of ConnectivityNode NodeConstraintTerm.

k is SecurityConstraintsLinear.resourceMW.
The units of k are assumed to be same as the units of the flows, xn.  The constants, cn, are dimensionless.
With these conventions, cn and k are all positive for a typical constraint such as "weighted sum of generation shall be less than limit". Furthermore, cn are all 1.0 for a case such as "interface flow shall be less than limit", assuming the terminals are chosen on the importing side of the interface.
