Attributes.Description: The start of the time interval for which requirement is defined.

DerivedEntities.Name: AuxiliaryAccount
DerivedEntities.Description: Variable and dynamic part of auxiliary agreement, generally representing the current state of the account related to the outstanding balance defined in auxiliary agreement.

Attributes.Name: due
Attributes.Description: Current amounts now due for payment on this account.

Attributes.Name: lastCredit
Attributes.Description: Details of the last credit transaction performed on this account.

Attributes.Name: lastDebit
Attributes.Description: Details of the last debit transaction performed on this account.

Attributes.Name: principleAmount
Attributes.Description: The initial principle amount, with which this account was instantiated.

Attributes.Name: balance
Attributes.Description: The total amount currently remaining on this account that is required to be paid in order to settle the account to zero. This excludes any due amounts not yet paid.

DerivedEntities.Name: BusinessPlan
DerivedEntities.Description: A BusinessPlan is an organized sequence of predetermined actions required to complete a future organizational objective. It is a type of document that typically references a schedule, physical and/or logical resources (assets and/or PowerSystemResources), locations, etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: WorkDocument
DerivedEntities.Description: Shadow class for Document, to isolate subclassing from this package. If any subclass gets normative and needs inheritance, it will inherit directly from Document.

DerivedEntities.Name: NonStandardItem
DerivedEntities.Description: This document provides information for non-standard items like customer contributions (e.g., customer digs trench), vouchers (e.g., credit), and contractor bids.

Attributes.Name: amount
Attributes.Description: The projected cost for this item.

DerivedEntities.Name: AccessPermit
DerivedEntities.Description: A permit is sometimes needed to provide legal access to land or equipment. For example, local authority permission for road works.

Attributes.Name: applicationNumber
Attributes.Description: Permit application number that is used by municipality, state, province, etc.

Attributes.Name: permitID
Attributes.Description: Permit identifier.

Attributes.Name: effectiveDate
Attributes.Description: Date that permit became official.

Attributes.Name: payment
Attributes.Description: Total cost of permit.

Attributes.Name: expirationDate
Attributes.Description: Permit expiration date.

DerivedEntities.Name: WorkCostSummary
DerivedEntities.Description: A roll up by cost type for the entire cost of a work order. For example, total labor.

DerivedEntities.Name: Regulation
DerivedEntities.Description: Special requirements and/or regulations may pertain to certain types of assets or work. For example, fire protection and scaffolding.

Attributes.Name: referenceNumber
Attributes.Description: External reference to regulation, if applicable.

DerivedEntities.Name: TypeMaterial
DerivedEntities.Description:
Documentation for a generic material item that may be used for design, work and other purposes. Any number of MaterialItems manufactured by various vendors may be used to perform this TypeMaterial.
Note that class analagous to "AssetModel" is not used for material items. This is because in some cases, for example, a utility sets up a Master material record for a 3 inch long half inch diameter steel bolt and they do not necessarily care what specific supplier is providing the material item. As different vendors are used to supply the part, the Stock Code of the material item can stay the same. In other cases, each time the vendor changes, a new stock code is set up so they can track material used by vendor. Therefore a Material Item "Model" is not typically needed.

Attributes.Name: costType
Attributes.Description: The type of cost to which this Material Item belongs.

Attributes.Name: estUnitCost
Attributes.Description: The estimated unit cost of this type of material, either for a unit cost or cost per unit length. Cost is for material or asset only and does not include labor to install/construct or configure it.

Attributes.Name: quantity
Attributes.Description: The value, unit of measure, and multiplier for the quantity.

Attributes.Name: stockItem
Attributes.Description: True if item is a stock item (default).

DerivedEntities.Name: BusinessCase
DerivedEntities.Description: Business justification for capital expenditures, usually addressing operations and maintenance costs as well.

Attributes.Name: corporateCode
Attributes.Description: A codified representation of the business case (i.e., codes for highway relocation, replace substation transformers, etc.).

DerivedEntities.Name: OneCallRequest
DerivedEntities.Description: A request for other utilities to mark their underground facilities prior to commencement of construction and/or maintenance.

Attributes.Name: markedIndicator
Attributes.Description: True if work location has been marked, for example for a dig area.

Attributes.Name: explosivesUsed
Attributes.Description: True if explosives have been or are planned to be used.

Attributes.Name: markingInstruction
Attributes.Description: Instructions for marking a dig area, if applicable.

DerivedEntities.Name: WorkCostDetail
DerivedEntities.Description: A collection of all of the individual cost items collected from multiple sources.

Attributes.Name: transactionDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time that 'amount' is posted to the work.

Attributes.Name: amount
Attributes.Description: Amount in designated currency for work, either a total or an individual element. As defined in the attribute "type," multiple instances are applicable to each work for: planned cost, actual cost, authorized cost, budgeted cost, forecasted cost, other.

Attributes.Name: isDebit
Attributes.Description: True if 'amount' is a debit, false if it is a credit.

DerivedEntities.Name: Project
DerivedEntities.Description: A collection of related work. For construction projects and maintenance projects, multiple phases may be performed.

Attributes.Name: budget
Attributes.Description: Overall project budget.

DerivedEntities.Name: Assignment
DerivedEntities.Description: An assignment is given to an ErpPerson, Crew, Organisation, Equipment Item, Tool, etc. and may be used to perform Work, WorkTasks, Procedures, etc. TimeSchedules may be set up directly for Assignments or indirectly via the associated WorkTask. Note that these associations are all inherited through the recursive relationship on Document.

Attributes.Name: effectivePeriod
Attributes.Description: Period between the assignment becoming effective and its expiration.

DerivedEntities.Name: CompatibleUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: A pre-planned job model containing labor, material, and accounting requirements for standardized job planning.

Attributes.Name: estCost
Attributes.Description: Estimated total cost for perfoming CU.

Attributes.Name: quantity
Attributes.Description: The quantity, unit of measure, and multiplier at the CU level that applies to the materials.

DerivedEntities.Name: Design
DerivedEntities.Description:
A design for consideration by customers, potential customers, or internal work.
Note that the Version of design is the revision attribute that is inherited from Document.

Attributes.Name: price
Attributes.Description: Price to customer for implementing design.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of this design.

Attributes.Name: costEstimate
Attributes.Description: Estimated cost (not price) of design.

DerivedEntities.Name: Incident
DerivedEntities.Description: Description of a problem in the field that may be reported in a trouble ticket or come from another source. It may have to do with an outage.

Attributes.Name: cause
Attributes.Description: Cause of this incident.

DerivedEntities.Name: PlannedOutageNotification
DerivedEntities.Description: This class will be used to generate call ahead lists for customers who will be affected by a planned outage.

DerivedEntities.Name: CustomerAccount
DerivedEntities.Description: Assignment of a group of products and services purchased by the customer through a customer agreement, used as a mechanism for customer billing and payment. It contains common information from the various types of customer agreements to create billings (invoices) for a customer and receive payment.

Attributes.Name: budgetBill
Attributes.Description: Budget bill code.

Attributes.Name: billingCycle
Attributes.Description: Cycle day on which the associated customer account will normally be billed, used to determine when to produce the billing.

Attributes.Name: lastBillAmount
Attributes.Description: The last amount that will be billed to the customer prior to shut off of the account.

DerivedEntities.Name: ServiceGuarantee
DerivedEntities.Description:
A service guarantee, often imposed by a regulator, defines conditions that, if not satisfied, will result in the utility making a monetary payment to the customer. Note that guarantee's identifier is in the 'name' attribute and the status of the guarantee is in the 'Status.status' attribute.
Example service requirements include:
1) If power is not restored within 24 hours, customers can claim $50 for residential customers or $100 for commercial and industrial customers. In addition for each extra period of 12 hours the customer's supply has not been activated, the customer can claim $25.
2) If a customer has a question about their electricity bill, the utility will investigate and respond to the inquiry within 15 working days. If utility fails to meet its guarantee, utility will automatically pay the customer $50.

Attributes.Name: applicationPeriod
Attributes.Description: Period in which this service guantee applies.

Attributes.Name: serviceRequirement
Attributes.Description: Explanation of the requirement and conditions for satisfying it.

Attributes.Name: payAmount
Attributes.Description: Amount to be paid by the service provider to the customer for each violation of the 'serviceRequirement'.

Attributes.Name: automaticPay
Attributes.Description: True if utility must autmatically pay the specified amount whenever the condition is not satisified, otherwise customer must make a claim to receive payment.

DerivedEntities.Name: WorkBillingInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Billing information for work performed for the customer. The history of Work Billing Info, Invoices, and Payments is to be maintained in associated ActivityRecords.

Attributes.Name: workPrice
Attributes.Description: Amount of bill.

Attributes.Name: costEstimate
Attributes.Description: Estimated cost for work.

Attributes.Name: deposit
Attributes.Description: Amount of price on deposit.

Attributes.Name: dueDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time by which payment for bill is expected from client.

Attributes.Name: discount
Attributes.Description: Discount from standard price.

Attributes.Name: issueDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time bill was issued to client.

Attributes.Name: receivedDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date payment was received from client.

DerivedEntities.Name: StandardIndustryCode
DerivedEntities.Description:
The Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) are the codes that identify the type of products/service an industry is involved in, and used for statutory reporting purposes. For example, in the USA these codes are located by the federal government, and then published in a book entitled "The Standard Industrial Classification Manual". The codes are arranged in a hierarchical structure.
Note that Residential Service Agreements are not classified according to the SIC codes.

Attributes.Name: code
Attributes.Description: Standard alphanumeric code assigned to a particular product/service within an industry.

DerivedEntities.Name: CustomerBillingInfo
DerivedEntities.Description:
The creation of the monthly customer billing statements is the method employed to notify Customers of charges, adjustments and credits applied to their account for Services and Products. The actuall billing occurs through an ErpInvoice. The CustomerBillingInfo includes information from the payment, collection, meter reading, installed meter, service, site, customer, customer account, customer agreement, services and pricing subject areas. Each component price shows up as a separate line item on the ErpInvoice.
The Customer Billing Statement may include collection and account messages, marketing/civic event messages and bill inserts.
One Customer Billing Statement is produced for all Agreements under a CustomerAccount per billing cycle date defined in 'CustomerAccount.billingCycle'.
The history of CustomerBillingInfo, Invoices and Payments is to be maintained in associated ActivityRecords.

Attributes.Name: billingDate
Attributes.Description: Business date designated for the billing run which produced this CustomerBillingInfo.

Attributes.Name: dueDate
Attributes.Description: Calculated date upon which a customer billing amount is due, used in the invoicing process to determine when a Customer's Payment is delinquent. It takes into consideration the regulatory criteria and the Customer's requested due date. In the absence of a Customer requested due date, the due date is typically calculated from the regulated number of days and the 'billingDate'.

Attributes.Name: lastPaymentAmt
Attributes.Description: Amount of the last payment received from the customer. It is retained in the Customer Billing system, although the details of each payment are tracked in the ERP system.

Attributes.Name: lastPaymentDate
Attributes.Description: Date of the last payment received from the customer. It is retained in the Customer Billing system, although the details of each payment are tracked in the ERP system.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of bill customer receives.

Attributes.Name: pymtPlanType
Attributes.Description: Type of payment plan.

Attributes.Name: outBalance
Attributes.Description: Outstanding balance on the CustomerAccount as of the statement date.

Attributes.Name: pymtPlanAmt
Attributes.Description: Monthly amortized amount due during each billing cycle for the CustomerAccount balance for which the Payment Plan is set-up.

DerivedEntities.Name: Procedure
DerivedEntities.Description: Documented procedure for various types of work or work tasks on assets.

Attributes.Name: instruction
Attributes.Description: Textual description of this procedure.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of procedure.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Sequence number in a sequence of procedures being performed.

DerivedEntities.Name: OperationalRestriction
DerivedEntities.Description:
A document that can be associated with equipment to describe any sort of restrictions compared with the original manufacturer's specification or with the usual operational practice e.g. temporary maximum loadings, maximum switching current, do not operate if bus couplers are open, etc.
In the UK, for example, if a breaker or switch ever mal-operates, this is reported centrally and utilities use their asset systems to identify all the installed devices of the same manufacturer's type. They then apply operational restrictions in the operational systems to warn operators of potential problems. After appropriate inspection and maintenance, the operational restrictions may be removed.

DerivedEntities.Name: OperationalUpdatedRating
DerivedEntities.Description: Lowered capability because of deterioration or inadequacy (sometimes referred to as derating or partial outage) or other kind of operational rating change.

Attributes.Name: changeType
Attributes.Description: Type of operational updated rating, e.g. a derate, a rerate or a return to normal.

Attributes.Name: activePeriod
Attributes.Description: Interval during which this restriction is applied.

Attributes.Name: restrictedValue
Attributes.Description: Restricted (new) value; includes unit of measure and potentially multiplier.

DerivedEntities.Name: PricingStructure
DerivedEntities.Description: Grouping of pricing components and prices used in the creation of customer charges and the eligibility criteria under which these terms may be offered to a customer. The reasons for grouping include state, customer classification, site characteristics, classification (i.e. fee price structure, deposit price structure, electric service price structure, etc.) and accounting requirements.

Attributes.Name: code
Attributes.Description: Unique user-allocated key for this pricing structure, used by company representatives to identify the correct price structure for allocating to a customer. For rate schedules it is often prefixed by a state code.

Attributes.Name: dailyEstimatedUsage
Attributes.Description: Used in place of actual computed estimated average when history of usage is not available, and typically manually entered by customer accounting.

Attributes.Name: taxExemption
Attributes.Description: True if this pricing structure is not taxable.

Attributes.Name: dailyCeilingUsage
Attributes.Description: Absolute maximum valid non-demand usage quantity used in validating a customer's billed non-demand usage.

Attributes.Name: revenueKind
Attributes.Description: (accounting) Kind of revenue, often used to determine the grace period allowed, before collection actions are taken on a customer (grace periods vary between revenue classes).

Attributes.Name: dailyFloorUsage
Attributes.Description: Absolute minimum valid non-demand usage quantity used in validating a customer's billed non-demand usage.

DerivedEntities.Name: TimeSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: Description of anything that changes through time. Time schedule is used to perform a single-valued function of time. Use inherited 'type' attribute to give additional information on this schedule, such as: periodic (hourly, daily, weekly, monthly, etc.), day of the month, by date, calendar (specific times and dates).

DerivedEntities.Name: WorkTimeSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: Time schedule specific to work.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of this work schedule.

Attributes.Name: recurrencePattern
Attributes.Description: Interval at which the scheduled action repeats (e.g., first Monday of every month, last day of the month, etc.).

Attributes.Name: scheduleInterval
Attributes.Description: Schedule date and time interval.

Attributes.Name: disabled
Attributes.Description: True if this schedule is deactivated (disabled).

Attributes.Name: recurrencePeriod
Attributes.Description: Duration between time points, from the beginning of one period to the beginning of the next period. Note that a device like a meter may have multiple interval periods (e.g., 1 min, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, or 60 min).

Attributes.Name: offset
Attributes.Description: The offset from midnight (i.e., 0 h, 0 min, 0 s) for the periodic time points to begin. For example, for an interval meter that is set up for five minute intervals ('recurrencePeriod'=300=5 min), setting 'offset'=120=2 min would result in scheduled events to read the meter executing at 2 min, 7 min, 12 min, 17 min, 22 min, 27 min, 32 min, 37 min, 42 min, 47 min, 52 min, and 57 min past each hour.

DerivedEntities.Name: ProcedureDataSet
DerivedEntities.Description: A data set recorded each time a procedure is executed. Observed results are captured in associated measurement values and/or values for properties relevant to the type of procedure performed.

DerivedEntities.Name: MaintenanceDataSet
DerivedEntities.Description: The result of a maintenance activity, a type of Procedure, for a given attribute of an asset.

Attributes.Name: conditionAfter
Attributes.Description: Condition of asset just following maintenance procedure.

Attributes.Name: conditionBefore
Attributes.Description: Description of the condition of the asset just prior to maintenance being performed.

Attributes.Name: maintCode
Attributes.Description: Code for the type of maintenance performed.

DerivedEntities.Name: InspectionDataSet
DerivedEntities.Description: Documents the result of one inspection, for a given attribute of an asset.

Attributes.Name: locationCondition
Attributes.Description: Description of the conditions of the location where the asset resides.

DerivedEntities.Name: TestDataSet
DerivedEntities.Description: Test results, usually obtained by a lab or other independent organisation.

Attributes.Name: conclusion
Attributes.Description: Conclusion drawn from test results.

Attributes.Name: specimenID
Attributes.Description: Identifier of specimen used in inspection or test.

Attributes.Name: specimenToLabDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time the specimen was received by the lab.

DerivedEntities.Name: DiagnosisDataSet
DerivedEntities.Description: The result of a problem (typically an asset failure) diagnosis. Contains complete information like what might be received from a lab doing forensic analysis of a failed asset.

Attributes.Name: finalCause
Attributes.Description: Cause of problem determined during diagnosis.

Attributes.Name: finalOrigin
Attributes.Description: Origin of problem determined during diagnosis.

Attributes.Name: finalCode
Attributes.Description: Code for diagnosed probem type.

Attributes.Name: preliminaryDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time preliminary assessment of problem was performed.

Attributes.Name: rootCause
Attributes.Description: Root cause of problem determined during diagnosis.

Attributes.Name: failureMode
Attributes.Description: Failuer mode, for example: Failure to Insulate; Failure to conduct; Failure to contain oil; Failure to provide ground plane; Other.

Attributes.Name: rootOrigin
Attributes.Description: Root origin of problem determined during diagnosis.

Attributes.Name: phaseCode
Attributes.Description: Phase(s) diagnosed.

Attributes.Name: preliminaryCode
Attributes.Description: Code for problem type determined during preliminary assessment.

Attributes.Name: preliminaryRemark
Attributes.Description: Remarks pertaining to preliminary assessment of problem.

Attributes.Name: finalRemark
Attributes.Description: Remarks pertaining to findings during problem diagnosis.

Attributes.Name: rootRemark
Attributes.Description: Remarks pertaining to root cause findings during problem diagnosis.

Attributes.Name: effect
Attributes.Description: Effect of problem.

DerivedEntities.Name: LabTestDataSet
DerivedEntities.Description: Results of testing done by a lab.

Attributes.Name: conclusionConfidence
Attributes.Description: Description of confidence in conclusion.

Attributes.Name: conclusion
Attributes.Description: Conclusion drawn from test results.

Attributes.Name: reasonForTest
Attributes.Description: Reason for performing test.

Attributes.Name: testEquipmentID
Attributes.Description: Identity of lab equipment used to perform test.

Attributes.Name: completedDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time procedure was completed.

DerivedEntities.Name: Settlement
DerivedEntities.Description: Specifies a settlement run.

Attributes.Name: tradeDate
Attributes.Description: The trade date on which the settlement is run.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetGroup
DerivedEntities.Description: A grouping of assets created for a purpose such as fleet analytics, inventory or compliance management.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of asset group this asset group is.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnergyTransaction
DerivedEntities.Description: Specifies the schedule for energy transfers between interchange areas that are necessary to satisfy the associated interchange transaction.

Attributes.Name: firmInterchangeFlag
Attributes.Description: Firm interchange flag indicates whether or not this energy transaction can be changed without potential financial consequences.

Attributes.Name: capacityBacked
Attributes.Description: Interchange capacity flag. When the flag is set to true, it indicates a transaction is capacity backed.

Attributes.Name: payCongestion
Attributes.Description: Willing to Pay congestion flag

Attributes.Name: state
Attributes.Description: { Approve | Deny | Study }

Attributes.Name: congestChargeMax
Attributes.Description: Maximum congestion charges in monetary units.

Attributes.Name: reason
Attributes.Description: Reason for energy transaction.

Attributes.Name: deliveryPointP
Attributes.Description: Delivery point active power.

Attributes.Name: energyMin
Attributes.Description: Transaction minimum active power if dispatchable.

Attributes.Name: receiptPointP
Attributes.Description: Receipt point active power.

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketDocument
DerivedEntities.Description: Electronic document containing the information necessary to satisfy a given business process set of requirements.

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketAgreement
DerivedEntities.Description: An identification  or eventually the contents of an agreement between two or more parties.

Attributes.Name: status
Attributes.Description: Status of subject matter (e.g., Agreement, Work) this document represents. For status of the document itself, use 'docStatus' attribute.

Attributes.Name: comment
Attributes.Description: Free text comment.

Attributes.Name: authorName
Attributes.Description: Name of the author of this document.

Attributes.Name: lastModifiedDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time this document was last modified. Documents may potentially be modified many times during their lifetime.

Attributes.Name: title
Attributes.Description: Document title.

Attributes.Name: electronicAddress
Attributes.Description: Electronic address.

Attributes.Name: createdDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time that this document was created.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Utility-specific classification of this document, according to its corporate standards, practices, and existing IT systems (e.g., for management of assets, maintenance, work, outage, customers, etc.).

Attributes.Name: revisionNumber
Attributes.Description: Revision number for this document.

Attributes.Name: docStatus
Attributes.Description:
Status of this document. For status of subject matter this document represents (e.g., Agreement, Work), use 'status' attribute.
Example values for 'docStatus.status' are draft, approved, cancelled, etc.

Attributes.Name: subject
Attributes.Description: Document subject.

DerivedEntities.Name: ChargeGroup
DerivedEntities.Description: Charge Group is the grouping of Charge Types for settlement invoicing purpose.  Examples such as Ancillary Services, Interests, etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: StartupModel
DerivedEntities.Description: Unit start up characteristics depending on how long the unit has been off line.

Attributes.Name: fixedMaintCost
Attributes.Description: Fixed maintenance cost.

Attributes.Name: minimumDownTime
Attributes.Description: The minimum number of hours the unit must be down before restart.

Attributes.Name: incrementalMaintCost
Attributes.Description: Incremental maintenance cost.

Attributes.Name: riskFactorCost
Attributes.Description: The opportunity cost associated with the return in monetary unit. This represents the restart's "share" of the unit depreciation and risk of an event which would damage the unit.

Attributes.Name: minimumRunTime
Attributes.Description: The minimum number of hours the unit must be operating before being allowed to shut down.

Attributes.Name: startupCost
Attributes.Description: Total miscellaneous start up costs.

Attributes.Name: stbyAuxP
Attributes.Description: The unit's auxiliary active power consumption to maintain standby mode.

Attributes.Name: startupPriority
Attributes.Description: Startup priority within control area where lower numbers indicate higher priorities.  More than one unit in an area may be assigned the same priority.

Attributes.Name: hotStandbyHeat
Attributes.Description: The amount of heat input per time unit required for hot standby operation.

Attributes.Name: startupDate
Attributes.Description: The date and time of the most recent generating unit startup.

DerivedEntities.Name: Measurement
DerivedEntities.Description:
A Measurement represents any measured, calculated or non-measured non-calculated quantity. Any piece of equipment may contain Measurements, e.g. a substation may have temperature measurements and door open indications, a transformer may have oil temperature and tank pressure measurements, a bay may contain a number of power flow measurements and a Breaker may contain a switch status measurement. 
The PSR - Measurement association is intended to capture this use of Measurement and is included in the naming hierarchy based on EquipmentContainer. The naming hierarchy typically has Measurements as leaves, e.g. Substation-VoltageLevel-Bay-Switch-Measurement.
Some Measurements represent quantities related to a particular sensor location in the network, e.g. a voltage transformer (VT) or potential transformer (PT) at a busbar or a current transformer (CT) at the bar between a breaker and an isolator. The sensing position is not captured in the PSR - Measurement association. Instead it is captured by the Measurement - Terminal association that is used to define the sensing location in the network topology. The location is defined by the connection of the Terminal to ConductingEquipment. 
If both a Terminal and PSR are associated, and the PSR is of type ConductingEquipment, the associated Terminal should belong to that ConductingEquipment instance.
When the sensor location is needed both Measurement-PSR and Measurement-Terminal are used. The Measurement-Terminal association is never used alone.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktMeasurement
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC61970:Meas:Measurement.

DerivedEntities.Name: Accumulator
DerivedEntities.Description: Accumulator represents an accumulated (counted) Measurement, e.g. an energy value.

Attributes.Name: maxValue
Attributes.Description: Normal value range maximum for any of the MeasurementValue.values. Used for scaling, e.g. in bar graphs or of telemetered raw values.

DerivedEntities.Name: StringMeasurement
DerivedEntities.Description: StringMeasurement represents a measurement with values of type string.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetStringMeasurement
DerivedEntities.Description: Definition of type of string measurement useful in asset domain.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of string useful in asset domain.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnvironmentalStringMeasurement
DerivedEntities.Description: String measurement of relevance in the environmental domain.

DerivedEntities.Name: Discrete
DerivedEntities.Description: Discrete represents a discrete Measurement, i.e. a Measurement representing discrete values, e.g. a Breaker position.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetDiscrete
DerivedEntities.Description: Definition of type of discrete useful in asset domain.

DerivedEntities.Name: OilAnalysisFluidDiscrete
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset oil analysis fluid type of discrete.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of discrete representing oil fluid test analysis result.

DerivedEntities.Name: OilAnalysisPCBDiscrete
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset oil analysis PCB type of discrete.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of discrete representing oil PCB test analysis result.

DerivedEntities.Name: OilAnalysisParticleDiscrete
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset oil analysis particle type of discrete.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of discrete representing oil particulate analysis result.

DerivedEntities.Name: InspectionDiscrete
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset inspection type of discrete.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of discrete representing inspection result.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnvironmentalDiscrete
DerivedEntities.Description: Discrete (integer) measurement of relevance in the environmental domain.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of environmental discrete (integer).

Attributes.Name: maxValue
Attributes.Description: Normal value range maximum for any of the MeasurementValue.values. Used for scaling, e.g. in bar graphs or of telemetered raw values.

Attributes.Name: normalValue
Attributes.Description: Normal measurement value, e.g., used for percentage calculations.

Attributes.Name: minValue
Attributes.Description: Normal value range minimum for any of the MeasurementValue.values. Used for scaling, e.g. in bar graphs or of telemetered raw values.

DerivedEntities.Name: Analog
DerivedEntities.Description: Analog represents an analog Measurement.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Definition of type of analog useful in asset domain.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetTemperaturePressureAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Temperature or pressure type of asset analog.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of analog representing temperature or pressure related to an asset.

DerivedEntities.Name: OilAnalysisGasAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset oil analysis gas type of analog.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of analog representing oil dissolved gases analysis result.

DerivedEntities.Name: OilAnalysisMoistureAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset oil analysis moisture type of analog.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of analog representing oil moisture analysis result.

DerivedEntities.Name: OilAnalysisPaperAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset oil inspection paper type of analog.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of analog representing oil paper degradation analysis result.

DerivedEntities.Name: OilAnalysisFluidAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset oil analysis fluid test type of analog.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of analog representing oil fluid test analysis result.

DerivedEntities.Name: InspectionAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset inspection type of analog.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of analog representing inspection result.

DerivedEntities.Name: OilAnalysisPCBAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset oil analysis PCB type of analog.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of analog representing oil PCB analysis result.

DerivedEntities.Name: OilAnalysisMetalsAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset oil analysis metals type of analog.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of analog representing oil metals elements analysis result.

DerivedEntities.Name: OilAnalysisParticleAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset oil analysis particle type of analog.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of analog representing oil particulate analysis result.

Attributes.Name: reportingTemperature
Attributes.Description: Reporting temperature of related analog value if different from reporting temperature of test standard or if there is no test standard. Reporting temperature is what gas volumes are normalized to. Different reporting temperatures are used by different sources. For example, ASTM specifies 0C, whereas IEC specifies 20C. Online monitors often have their own unique reporting temperatures.

Attributes.Name: precision
Attributes.Description: Precision of related analog value if different from precision of test standard or if there is no test standard. Precision is a measure of how closely individual measurements agree with one another. Expressed as 'plus or minus' the value of this attribute.

Attributes.Name: detectionLimit
Attributes.Description: Detection limit of related analog value if different from detection limit of test standard or if there is no test standard. The detection limit (also known as lower limit of detection or limit of detection (LOD), is the lowest quantity of a substance that can be distinguished from the absence of that substance (a blank value) within a stated confidence limit (generally 1%).

DerivedEntities.Name: EnvironmentalAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Analog (float) measurement of relevance in the environmental domain.

DerivedEntities.Name: HydrosphericAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Analog (float) measuring a hydrospheric condition.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of hydrospheric analog.

DerivedEntities.Name: AtmosphericAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Analog (float) measuring an atmospheric condition.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of atmospheric analog.

DerivedEntities.Name: GeosphericAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Analog (float) measuring a geospheric condition.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of geospheric analog.

DerivedEntities.Name: SpaceAnalog
DerivedEntities.Description: Analog (float) measuring a space (extra-terrestrial) condition.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of space analog.

Attributes.Name: normalValue
Attributes.Description: Normal measurement value, e.g., used for percentage calculations.

Attributes.Name: maxValue
Attributes.Description: Normal value range maximum for any of the MeasurementValue.values. Used for scaling, e.g. in bar graphs or of telemetered raw values.

Attributes.Name: minValue
Attributes.Description: Normal value range minimum for any of the MeasurementValue.values. Used for scaling, e.g. in bar graphs or of telemetered raw values.

Attributes.Name: positiveFlowIn
Attributes.Description: If true then this measurement is an active power, reactive power or current with the convention that a positive value measured at the Terminal means power is flowing into the related PowerSystemResource.

Attributes.Name: unitMultiplier
Attributes.Description: The unit multiplier of the measured quantity.

Attributes.Name: measurementType
Attributes.Description:
Specifies the type of measurement.  For example, this specifies if the measurement represents an indoor temperature, outdoor temperature, bus voltage, line flow, etc.
When the measurementType is set to "Specialization", the type of Measurement is defined in more detail by the specialized class which inherits from Measurement.

Attributes.Name: unitSymbol
Attributes.Description: The unit of measure of the measured quantity.

Attributes.Name: phases
Attributes.Description:
Indicates to which phases the measurement applies and avoids the need to use 'measurementType' to also encode phase information (which would explode the types). The phase information in Measurement, along with 'measurementType' and 'phases' uniquely defines a Measurement for a device, based on normal network phase. Their meaning will not change when the computed energizing phasing is changed due to jumpers or other reasons.
If the attribute is missing three phases (ABC) shall be assumed.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransformerObservation
DerivedEntities.Description: Common information captured during transformer inspections and/or diagnostics. Note that some properties may be measured through other means and therefore have measurement values in addition to the observed values recorded here.

Attributes.Name: bushingTemp
Attributes.Description: Bushing temperature.

Attributes.Name: oilDielectricStrength
Attributes.Description: Oil Quality Analysis-Dielectric Strength.

Attributes.Name: topOilTemp
Attributes.Description: Top oil temperature.

Attributes.Name: waterContent
Attributes.Description: Water Content expressed in parts per million.

Attributes.Name: dga
Attributes.Description: Dissolved Gas Analysis. Typical values are: Acceptable, Overheating, Corona, Sparking, Arcing.

Attributes.Name: furfuralDP
Attributes.Description: Overall measure of furfural in oil and mechanical strength of paper. DP, the degree of polymerization, is the strength of the paper. Furfural is a measure of furfural compounds, often expressed in parts per million.

Attributes.Name: oilLevel
Attributes.Description: The level of oil in the transformer.

Attributes.Name: oilNeutralizationNumber
Attributes.Description: Oil Quality Analysis-Neutralization Number - Number - Mg KOH.

Attributes.Name: freqResp
Attributes.Description: Frequency Response Analysis. Typical values are: acceptable, slight movement, significant movement, failed, near failure. A graphic of the response diagram, which is a type of document, may be associated with this analysis through the recursive document relationship of the ProcedureDataSet.

Attributes.Name: hotSpotTemp
Attributes.Description: Hotspot oil temperature.

Attributes.Name: oilIFT
Attributes.Description: Oil Quality Analysis- inter facial tension (IFT) - number-Dynes/CM.

Attributes.Name: pumpVibration
Attributes.Description: Pump vibration, with typical values being: nominal, high.

Attributes.Name: oilColor
Attributes.Description: Oil Quality Analysis-Color.

DerivedEntities.Name: ValueAliasSet
DerivedEntities.Description: Describes the translation of a set of values into a name and is intendend to facilitate custom translations. Each ValueAliasSet has a name, description etc. A specific Measurement may represent a discrete state like Open, Closed, Intermediate etc. This requires a translation from the MeasurementValue.value number to a string, e.g. 0->"Invalid", 1->"Open", 2->"Closed", 3->"Intermediate". Each ValueToAlias member in ValueAliasSet.Value describe a mapping for one particular value to a name.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcIEEEAC3A
DerivedEntities.Description: IEEE 421.5-2005 type AC3A model. The model represents the field-controlled alternator-rectifier excitation systems designated type AC3A. These excitation systems include an alternator main exciter with non-controlled rectifiers. The exciter employs self-excitation, and the voltage regulator power is derived from the exciter output voltage. Therefore, this system has an additional nonlinearity, simulated by the use of a multiplier whose inputs are the voltage regulator command signal, Va, and the exciter output voltage, Efd, times KR. This model is applicable to excitation systems employing static voltage regulators. Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 6.3.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcIEEEDC3A
DerivedEntities.Description:
IEEE 421.5-2005 type DC3A model. This model represents older systems, in particular those DC commutator exciters with non-continuously acting regulators that were commonly used before the development of the continuously acting varieties.  These systems respond at basically two different rates, depending upon the magnitude of voltage error. For small errors, adjustment is made periodically with a signal to a motor-operated rheostat. Larger errors cause resistors to be quickly shorted or inserted and a strong forcing signal applied to the exciter. Continuous motion of the motor-operated rheostat occurs for these larger error signals, even though it is bypassed by contactor action.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 5.3.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcIEEEDC2A
DerivedEntities.Description: IEEE 421.5-2005 type DC2A model. This model represents field-controlled DC commutator exciters with continuously acting voltage regulators having supplies obtained from the generator or auxiliary bus. It differs from the type DC1A model only in the voltage regulator output limits, which are now proportional to terminal voltage VT. It is representative of solid-state replacements for various forms of older mechanical and rotating amplifier regulating equipment connected to DC commutator exciters. Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 5.2.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcIEEEAC8B
DerivedEntities.Description: IEEE 421.5-2005 type AC8B model. This model represents a PID voltage regulator with either a brushless exciter or DC exciter. The AVR in this model consists of PID control, with separate constants for the proportional (KPR), integral (KIR), and derivative (KDR) gains. The representation of the brushless exciter (TE, KE, SE, KC, KD) is similar to the model type AC2A. The type AC8B model can be used to represent static voltage regulators applied to brushless excitation systems. Digitally based voltage regulators feeding DC rotating main exciters can be represented with the AC type AC8B model with the parameters KC and KD set to 0. For thyristor power stages fed from the generator terminals, the limits VRMAX and VRMIN should be a function of terminal voltage: VT x VRMAX and VT x VRMIN. Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 6.8.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcIEEEAC7B
DerivedEntities.Description: IEEE 421.5-2005 type AC7B model. The model represents excitation systems which consist of an AC alternator with either stationary or rotating rectifiers to produce the DC field requirements. It is an upgrade to earlier AC excitation systems, which replace only the controls but retain the AC alternator and diode rectifier bridge. Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 6.7. Note, however, that in IEEE 421.5-2005, the [1 / sTE] block is shown as [1 / (1 + sTE)], which is incorrect.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcIEEEDC1A

IEEE 421.5-2005 type DC1A model. This model represents field-controlled DC commutator exciters with continuously acting voltage regulators (especially the direct-acting rheostatic, rotating amplifier, and magnetic amplifier types).  Because this model has been widely implemented by the industry, it is sometimes used to represent other types of systems when detailed data for them are not available or when a simplified model is required.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcIEEEAC2A

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcIEEEAC4A
DerivedEntities.Description:
IEEE 421.5-2005 type AC4A model. The model represents type AC4A alternator-supplied controlled-rectifier excitation system which is quite different from the other types of AC systems. This high initial response excitation system utilizes a full thyristor bridge in the exciter output circuit.  The voltage regulator controls the firing of the thyristor bridges. The exciter alternator uses an independent voltage regulator to control its output voltage to a constant value. These effects are not modelled; however, transient loading effects on the exciter alternator are included.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 6.4.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcIEEEST3A
DerivedEntities.Description:
IEEE 421.5-2005 type ST3A model.  Some static systems utilize a field voltage control loop to linearize the exciter control characteristic. This also makes the output independent of supply source variations until supply limitations are reached.  These systems utilize a variety of controlled-rectifier designs: full thyristor complements or hybrid bridges in either series or shunt configurations. The power source can consist of only a potential source, either fed from the machine terminals or from internal windings. Some designs can have compound power sources utilizing both machine potential and current. These power sources are represented as phasor combinations of machine terminal current and voltage and are accommodated by suitable parameters in model type ST3A which is represented by ExcIEEEST3A.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 7.3.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcIEEEST7B
DerivedEntities.Description:
IEEE 421.5-2005 type ST7B model. This model is representative of static potential-source excitation systems. In this system, the AVR consists of a PI voltage regulator. A phase lead-lag filter in series allows the introduction of a derivative function, typically used with brushless excitation systems. In that case, the regulator is of the PID type. In addition, the terminal voltage channel includes a phase lead-lag filter.  The AVR includes the appropriate inputs on its reference for overexcitation limiter (OEL1), underexcitation limiter (UEL), stator current limiter (SCL), and current compensator (DROOP). All these limitations, when they work at voltage reference level, keep the PSS (VS signal from PSS) in operation. However, the UEL limitation can also be transferred to the high value (HV) gate acting on the output signal. In addition, the output signal passes through a low value (LV) gate for a ceiling overexcitation limiter (OEL2).
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 7.7.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcELIN1
DerivedEntities.Description: Static PI transformer fed excitation system ELIN (VATECH) - simplified model.  This model represents an all-static excitation system. A PI voltage controller establishes a desired field current set point for a proportional current controller. The integrator of the PI controller has a follow-up input to match its signal to the present field current.  A power system stabilizer with power input is included in the model.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcIEEEST4B
DerivedEntities.Description:
IEEE 421.5-2005 type ST4B model. This model is a variation of the type ST3A model, with a proportional plus integral (PI) regulator block replacing the lag-lead regulator characteristic that is in the ST3A model. Both potential and compound source rectifier excitation systems are modelled.  The PI regulator blocks have non-windup limits that are represented. The voltage regulator of this model is typically implemented digitally.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 7.4.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExcIEEEAC5A
DerivedEntities.Description:
IEEE 421.5-2005 type AC5A model. The model represents a simplified model for brushless excitation systems. The regulator is supplied from a source, such as a permanent magnet generator, which is not affected by system disturbances.  Unlike other AC models, this model uses loaded rather than open circuit exciter saturation data in the same way as it is used for the DC models.  Because the model has been widely implemented by the industry, it is sometimes used to represent other types of systems when either detailed data for them are not available or simplified models are required.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 6.5.

DerivedEntities.Name: OverexcLimIEEE
DerivedEntities.Description:
The over excitation limiter model is intended to represent the significant features of OELs necessary for some large-scale system studies. It is the result of a pragmatic approach to obtain a model that can be widely applied with attainable data from generator owners. An attempt to include all variations in the functionality of OELs and duplicate how they interact with the rest of the excitation systems would likely result in a level of application insufficient for the studies for which they are intended.
Reference: IEEE OEL 421.5-2005, 9.

Attributes.Name: ifdmax
Attributes.Description: OEL instantaneous field current limit (IFDMAX). Typical value = 1,5.

Attributes.Name: ifdlim
Attributes.Description: OEL timed field current limit (IFDLIM). Typical value = 1,05.

Attributes.Name: hyst
Attributes.Description: OEL pickup/drop-out hysteresis (HYST). Typical value = 0,03.

Attributes.Name: kramp
Attributes.Description: OEL ramped limit rate (KRAMP). Unit = PU / s. Typical value = 10.

Attributes.Name: kcd
Attributes.Description: OEL cooldown gain (KCD). Typical value = 1.

Attributes.Name: itfpu
Attributes.Description: OEL timed field current limiter pickup level (ITFPU). Typical value = 1,05.

DerivedEntities.Name: VoltageCompensatorDynamics
DerivedEntities.Description: Voltage compensator function block whose behaviour is described by reference to a standard model <font color="#0f0f0f">or by definition of a user-defined model.</font>

DerivedEntities.Name: VCompIEEEType2
DerivedEntities.Description:
Terminal voltage transducer and load compensator as defined in IEEE 421.5-2005, 4. This model is designed to cover the following types of compensation:
  • reactive droop;
  • transformer-drop or line-drop compensation;
  • reactive differential compensation known also as cross-current compensation.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 4.

Attributes.Name: tr
Attributes.Description: Time constant which is used for the combined voltage sensing and compensation signal (Tr) (>= 0).

DerivedEntities.Name: VCompIEEEType1
DerivedEntities.Description:
Terminal voltage transducer and load compensator as defined in IEEE 421.5-2005, 4. This model is common to all excitation system models described in the IEEE Standard. Parameter details:
  1. If Rc and Xc are set to zero, the load compensation is not employed and the behaviour is as a simple sensing circuit.
  1. If all parameters (Rc, Xc and Tr) are set to zero, the standard model VCompIEEEType1 is bypassed.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005 4.

Attributes.Name: rc
Attributes.Description: Resistive component of compensation of a generator (Rc) (>= 0).

Attributes.Name: xc
Attributes.Description: Reactive component of compensation of a generator (Xc) (>= 0).

Attributes.Name: tr
Attributes.Description: Time constant which is used for the combined voltage sensing and compensation signal (Tr) (>= 0).

DerivedEntities.Name: TurbineGovernorUserDefined
DerivedEntities.Description: Turbine-governor function block whose dynamic behaviour is described by <font color="#0f0f0f">a user-defined model.</font>

Attributes.Name: proprietary
Attributes.Description:
Behaviour is based on a proprietary model as opposed to a detailed model.
true = user-defined model is proprietary with behaviour mutually understood by sending and receiving applications and parameters passed as general attributes
false = user-defined model is explicitly defined in terms of control blocks and their input and output signals.

Attributes.Name: flim2
Attributes.Description: Frequency threshold 2 (Flim2). Unit = Hz. Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: dm
Attributes.Description: Speed sensitivity coefficient (Dm). Dm can represent either the variation of the engine power with the shaft speed or the variation of maximum power capability with shaft speed. If it is positive it describes the falling slope of the engine speed verses power characteristic as speed increases. A slightly falling characteristic is typical for reciprocating engines and some aero-derivative turbines. If it is negative the engine power is assumed to be unaffected by the shaft speed, but the maximum permissible fuel flow is taken to fall with falling shaft speed. This is characteristic of single-shaft industrial turbines due to exhaust temperature limits. Typical value = 0.

DerivedEntities.Name: GovHydroPelton
DerivedEntities.Description:
Detailed hydro unit - Pelton model.  This model can be used to represent the dynamic related to water tunnel and surge chamber.
The DetailedHydroModelHydraulicSystem diagram, located under the GovHydroFrancis class, provides a schematic of the hydraulic system of detailed hydro unit models, such as Francis and Pelton.

Attributes.Name: hn
Attributes.Description: Rated hydraulic head (Hn). Unit = km. Typical value = 0,250.

Attributes.Name: db2
Attributes.Description: Intentional dead-band width of valve opening error (DB2). Unit = Hz. Typical value = 0,01.

Attributes.Name: staticCompensating

DerivedEntities.Name: GovCT1
DerivedEntities.Description:
General model for any prime mover with a PID governor, used primarily for combustion turbine and combined cycle units. This model can be used to represent a variety of prime movers controlled by PID governors. It is suitable, for example, for the representation of:
  • gas turbine and single shaft combined cycle turbines
  • diesel engines with modern electronic or digital governors
  • steam turbines where steam is supplied from a large boiler drum or a large header whose pressure is substantially constant over the period under study
  • simple hydro turbines in dam configurations where the water column length is short and water inertia effects are minimal.
Additional information on this model is available in the 2012 IEEE report, Dynamic Models for Turbine-Governors in Power System Studies, 3.1.2.3 pages 3-4 (GGOV1).

Attributes.Name: kpload
Attributes.Description: Load limiter proportional gain for PI controller (Kpload). Typical value = 2.

Attributes.Name: ka
Attributes.Description: Acceleration limiter gain (Ka). Typical value = 10.

Attributes.Name: db
Attributes.Description: Speed governor deadband in PU speed (db). In the majority of applications, it is recommended that this value be set to zero. Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: maxerr
Attributes.Description: Maximum value for speed error signal (maxerr) (> GovCT1.minerr). Typical value = 0,05.

Attributes.Name: kigov
Attributes.Description: Governor integral gain (Kigov). Typical value = 2.

Attributes.Name: vmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum valve position limit (Vmin) (< GovCT1.vmax). Typical value = 0,15.

Attributes.Name: dm
Attributes.Description: Speed sensitivity coefficient (Dm). Dm can represent either the variation of the engine power with the shaft speed or the variation of maximum power capability with shaft speed. If it is positive it describes the falling slope of the engine speed verses power characteristic as speed increases. A slightly falling characteristic is typical for reciprocating engines and some aero-derivative turbines. If it is negative the engine power is assumed to be unaffected by the shaft speed, but the maximum permissible fuel flow is taken to fall with falling shaft speed. This is characteristic of single-shaft industrial turbines due to exhaust temperature limits. Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: kiload
Attributes.Description: Load limiter integral gain for PI controller (Kiload). Typical value = 0,67.

Attributes.Name: minerr

Attributes.Description: Governor proportional gain (Kpgov). Typical value = 10.

Attributes.Name: teng
Attributes.Description: Transport time delay for diesel engine used in representing diesel engines where there is a small but measurable transport delay between a change in fuel flow setting and the development of torque (Teng) (>= 0). Teng should be zero in all but special cases where this transport delay is of particular concern. Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Description: Load limiter reference value (Ldref). Typical value = 1.

Attributes.Description: Governor derivative controller time constant (Tdgov) (>= 0). Typical value = 1.

Attributes.Name: kturb
Attributes.Description: Turbine gain (Kturb) (> 0). Typical value = 1,5.

Attributes.Name: rdown
Attributes.Description: Maximum rate of load limit decrease (Rdown). Typical value = -99.

Attributes.Name: vmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum valve position limit (Vmax) (> GovCT1.vmin). Typical value = 1.

Attributes.Name: mwbase
Attributes.Description: Base for power values (MWbase) (> 0). Unit = MW.

Attributes.Name: tfload
Attributes.Description: Load-limiter time constant (Tfload) (> 0). Typical value = 3.

Attributes.Description: Switch for fuel source characteristic to recognize that fuel flow, for a given fuel valve stroke, can be proportional to engine speed (Wfspd). true = fuel flow proportional to speed (for some gas turbines and diesel engines with positive displacement fuel injectors) false = fuel control system keeps fuel flow independent of engine speed. Typical value = true.

DerivedEntities.Name: PFVArType2IEEEPFController

IEEE PF controller type 2 which is a summing point type controller making up the outside loop of a two-loop system. This controller is implemented as a slow PI type controller. The voltage regulator forms the inner loop and is implemented as a fast controller.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 11.4.

DerivedEntities.Name: PowerSystemStabilizerUserDefined

Attributes.Name: proprietary
Attributes.Description:
Behaviour is based on a proprietary model as opposed to a detailed model.
true = user-defined model is proprietary with behaviour mutually understood by sending and receiving applications and parameters passed as general attributes
false = user-defined model is explicitly defined in terms of control blocks and their input and output signals.

DerivedEntities.Name: PssIEEE3B
DerivedEntities.Description:
IEEE 421.5-2005 type PSS3B power system stabilizer model. The PSS model PSS3B has dual inputs of electrical power and rotor angular frequency deviation. The signals are used to derive an equivalent mechanical power signal.
This model has 2 input signals. They have the following fixed types (expressed in terms of InputSignalKind values): the first one is of rotorAngleFrequencyDeviation type and the second one is of generatorElectricalPower type.
Reference: IEEE 3B 421.5-2005, 8.3.

DerivedEntities.Name: PssIEEE4B
DerivedEntities.Description: IEEE 421.5-2005 type PSS4B power system stabilizer. The PSS4B model represents a structure based on multiple working frequency bands. Three separate bands, respectively dedicated to the low-, intermediate- and high-frequency modes of oscillations, are used in this delta omega (speed input) PSS. There is an error in the in IEEE 421.5-2005 PSS4B model: the Pe input should read Pe. This implies that the input Pe needs to be multiplied by -1. Reference: IEEE 4B 421.5-2005, 8.4. Parameter details: This model has 2 input signals. They have the following fixed types (expressed in terms of InputSignalKind values): the first one is of rotorAngleFrequencyDeviation type and the second one is of generatorElectricalPower type.

DerivedEntities.Name: TurbLCFB1
DerivedEntities.Description: Turbine load controller model developed by WECC.  This model represents a supervisory turbine load controller that acts to maintain turbine power at a set value by continuous adjustment of the turbine governor speed-load reference. This model is intended to represent slow reset 'outer loop' controllers managing the action of the turbine governor.

DerivedEntities.Description: Abstract parent class for all synchronous and asynchronous machine standard models.

DerivedEntities.Name: AsynchronousMachineDynamics
DerivedEntities.Description:
Asynchronous machine whose behaviour is described by reference to a standard model expressed in either time constant reactance form or equivalent circuit form or by definition of a user-defined model. Parameter details:
  1. Asynchronous machine parameters such as Xl, Xs, etc. are actually used as inductances in the model, but are commonly referred to as reactances since, at nominal frequency, the PU values are the same. However, some references use the symbol L instead of X.

DerivedEntities.Description: Asynchronous machine whose dynamic behaviour is described by a user-defined model.

Attributes.Name: proprietary
Attributes.Description:
Behaviour is based on a proprietary model as opposed to a detailed model.
true = user-defined model is proprietary with behaviour mutually understood by sending and receiving applications and parameters passed as general attributes
false = user-defined model is explicitly defined in terms of control blocks and their input and output signals.

DerivedEntities.Name: AsynchronousMachineEquivalentCircuit
DerivedEntities.Description: The electrical equations of all variations of the asynchronous model are based on the AsynchronousEquivalentCircuit diagram for the direct- and quadrature- axes, with two equivalent rotor windings in each axis. Equations for conversion between equivalent circuit and time constant reactance forms: Xs = Xm + Xl X' = Xl + Xm x Xlr1 / (Xm + Xlr1) X'' = Xl + Xm x Xlr1 x Xlr2 / (Xm x Xlr1 + Xm x Xlr2 + Xlr1 x Xlr2) T'o = (Xm + Xlr1) / (omega0 x Rr1) T''o = (Xm x Xlr1 + Xm x Xlr2 + Xlr1 x Xlr2) / (omega0 x Rr2 x (Xm + Xlr1) Same equations using CIM attributes from AsynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance class on left of "=" and AsynchronousMachineEquivalentCircuit class on right (except as noted): xs = xm + RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance xp = RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance + xm x xlr1 / (xm + xlr1) xpp = RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance + xm x xlr1 x xlr2 / (xm x xlr1 + xm x xlr2 + xlr1 x xlr2) tpo = (xm + xlr1) / (2 x pi x nominal frequency x rr1) tppo = (xm x xlr1 + xm x xlr2 + xlr1 x xlr2) / (2 x pi x nominal frequency x rr2 x (xm + xlr1).

Attributes.Name: rr1
Attributes.Description: Damper 1 winding resistance.

Attributes.Name: xm
Attributes.Description: Magnetizing reactance.

Attributes.Description: Damper 2 winding leakage reactance.

Attributes.Description: Damper 2 winding resistance.

Attributes.Description: Damper 1 winding leakage reactance.

DerivedEntities.Name: SynchronousMachineDynamics
DerivedEntities.Description:
Synchronous machine whose behaviour is described by reference to a standard model expressed in one of the following forms: - simplified (or classical), where a group of generators or motors is not modelled in detail; - detailed, in equivalent circuit form; - detailed, in time constant reactance form; or - by definition of a user-defined model. It is a common practice to represent small generators by a negative load rather than by a dynamic generator model when performing dynamics simulations. In this case, a SynchronousMachine in the static model is not represented by anything in the dynamics model, instead it is treated as an ordinary load. Parameter details:
  1. Synchronous machine parameters such as Xl, Xd, Xp etc. are actually used as inductances in the models, but are commonly referred to as reactances since, at nominal frequency, the PU values are the same. However, some references use the symbol L instead of X.

DerivedEntities.Name: SynchronousMachineDetailed
SynchronousMachineEquivalentCircuit
DerivedEntities.Description: The electrical equations for all variations of the synchronous models are based on the SynchronousEquivalentCircuit diagram for the direct- and quadrature- axes. Equations for conversion between equivalent circuit and time constant reactance forms: Xd = Xad + Xl Xd = Xl + Xad x Xfd / (Xad + Xfd) Xd = Xl + Xad x Xfd x X1d / (Xad x Xfd + Xad x X1d + Xfd x X1d) Xq = Xaq + Xl Xq = Xl + Xaq x X1q / (Xaq + X1q) Xq = Xl + Xaq x X1q x X2q / (Xaq x X1q + Xaq x X2q + X1q x X2q) Tdo = (Xad + Xfd) / (omega0 x Rfd) Tdo = (Xad x Xfd + Xad x X1d + Xfd x X1d) / (omega0 x R1d x (Xad + Xfd) Tqo = (Xaq + X1q) / (omega0 x R1q) Tqo = (Xaq x X1q + Xaq x X2q + X1q x X2q) / (omega0 x R2q x (Xaq + X1q) Same equations using CIM attributes from SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance class on left of "=" and SynchronousMachineEquivalentCircuit class on right (except as noted): xDirectSync = xad + RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance xDirectTrans = RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance + xad x xfd / (xad + xfd) xDirectSubtrans = RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance + xad x xfd x x1d / (xad x xfd + xad x x1d + xfd x x1d) xQuadSync = xaq + RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance xQuadTrans = RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance + xaq x x1q / (xaq+ x1q) xQuadSubtrans = RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance + xaq x x1q x x2q / (xaq x x1q + xaq x x2q + x1q x x2q) tpdo = (xad + xfd) / (2 x pi x nominal frequency x rfd) tppdo = (xad x xfd + xad x x1d + xfd x x1d) / (2 x pi x nominal frequency x r1d x (xad + xfd) tpqo = (xaq + x1q) / (2 x pi x nominal frequency x r1q) tppqo = (xaq x x1q + xaq x x2q + x1q x x2q) / (2 x pi x nominal frequency x r2q x (xaq + x1q) These are only valid for a simplified model where "Canay" reactance is zero.

Attributes.Name: xDirectSync
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis synchronous reactance (Xd) (>= SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance.xDirectTrans). The quotient of a sustained value of that AC component of armature voltage that is produced by the total direct-axis flux due to direct-axis armature current and the value of the AC component of this current, the machine running at rated speed. Typical value = 1,8.

Attributes.Name: xQuadSync
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis synchronous reactance (Xq) (>= SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance.xQuadTrans). The ratio of the component of reactive armature voltage, due to the quadrature-axis component of armature current, to this component of current, under steady state conditions and at rated frequency. Typical value = 1,6.

Attributes.Name: modelType
Attributes.Description: Type of synchronous machine model used in dynamic simulation applications.

Attributes.Name: tppdo
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis subtransient rotor time constant (T''do) (> 0). Typical value = 0,03.

Attributes.Name: xQuadTrans
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis transient reactance (X'q) (>= SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance.xQuadSubtrans). Typical value = 0,3.

Attributes.Name: tpqo
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis transient rotor time constant (T'qo) (> SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance.tppqo). Typical value = 0,5.

Attributes.Name: tppqo
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis subtransient rotor time constant (T''qo) (> 0). Typical value = 0,03.

Attributes.Name: rotorType
Attributes.Description: Type of rotor on physical machine.

Attributes.Name: xDirectSubtrans
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis subtransient reactance (unsaturated) (X''d) (> RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance). Typical value = 0,2.

Attributes.Name: saturationFactorQAxis
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis saturation factor at rated terminal voltage (S1q) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,02.

Attributes.Name: ifdBaseType
Attributes.Description: Excitation base system mode. It should be equal to the value of WLMDV given by the user. WLMDV is the PU ratio between the field voltage and the excitation current: Efd = WLMDV x Ifd. Typical value = ifag.

Attributes.Name: saturationFactor120QAxis
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis saturation factor at 120% of rated terminal voltage (S12q) (>= SynchonousMachineDetailed.saturationFactorQAxis). Typical value = 0,12.

Attributes.Name: efdBaseRatio
Attributes.Description: Ratio (exciter voltage/generator voltage) of Efd bases of exciter and generator models (> 0). Typical value = 1.

DerivedEntities.Name: SynchronousMachineUserDefined
DerivedEntities.Description: Synchronous machine whose dynamic behaviour is described by a user-defined model.

Attributes.Name: proprietary
Attributes.Description:
Behaviour is based on a proprietary model as opposed to a detailed model.
true = user-defined model is proprietary with behaviour mutually understood by sending and receiving applications and parameters passed as general attributes
false = user-defined model is explicitly defined in terms of control blocks and their input and output signals.

DerivedEntities.Name: SynchronousMachineSimplified

Attributes.Name: damping
Attributes.Description: Damping torque coefficient (D) (>= 0). A proportionality constant that, when multiplied by the angular velocity of the rotor poles with respect to the magnetic field (frequency), results in the damping torque. This value is often zero when the sources of damping torques (generator damper windings, load damping effects, etc.) are modelled in detail. Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: statorResistance
Attributes.Description: Stator (armature) resistance (Rs) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,005.

Attributes.Name: inertia
Attributes.Description: Inertia constant of generator or motor and mechanical load (H) (> 0). This is the specification for the stored energy in the rotating mass when operating at rated speed. For a generator, this includes the generator plus all other elements (turbine, exciter) on the same shaft and has units of MW x s. For a motor, it includes the motor plus its mechanical load. Conventional units are PU on the generator MVA base, usually expressed as MW x s / MVA or just s. This value is used in the accelerating power reference frame for operator training simulator solutions. Typical value = 3.

Attributes.Name: saturationFactor120
Attributes.Description: Saturation factor at 120% of rated terminal voltage (S12) (>= RotatingMachineDynamics.saturationFactor). Not used by the simplified model, defined by S(E2) in the SynchronousMachineSaturationParameters diagram. Typical value = 0,12.

Attributes.Name: statorLeakageReactance
Attributes.Description: Stator leakage reactance (Xl) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,15.

Attributes.Name: saturationFactor
Attributes.Description: Saturation factor at rated terminal voltage (S1) (>= 0). Not used by simplified model. Defined by defined by S(E1) in the SynchronousMachineSaturationParameters diagram. Typical value = 0,02.

DerivedEntities.Name: CoolingPowerRating
DerivedEntities.Description:
There are often stages of power which are associated with stages of cooling. For instance, a transformer may be rated 121kV on the primary, 15kV on the secondary and 4kV on the tertiary winding. These are voltage ratings and the power ratings are generally the same for all three windings and independent of the voltage ratings, there are instances where the tertiary may have a lower power rating.
For example, for three stages, the power rating may be 15/20/25 MVA and the cooling is OA/FA/FOA. The 15 MVA rating goes with the OA cooling (Oil and Air cooling). This is called the self cooled rating as there are no external cooling enhancements. The 20 MVA rating goes with the FA cooling (Forced Air cooling), this means that when the fans are running and thus enhancing the cooling characteristics, the transformer can operate at a power level of 20 MVA. The 25 MVA rating goes with the FOA cooling (Forced Oil and Air cooling), this means that when the fans and pumps are running and thus enhancing the cooling characteristics even more than before, the transformer can operate at a power level of 25 MVA. This 15/20/25 MVA does not state how the power is split between the various windings. It may be 25 MVA input on the primary, 25 MVA output on the secondary and 0 MVA output on the tertiary. It may also operate at 25 MVA input on the primary, 17 MVA output on the secondary and 8 MVA output on the tertiary.

Attributes.Name: coolingKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of cooling system.

Attributes.Name: powerRating
Attributes.Description: The power rating associated with type of cooling specified for this stage.

Attributes.Name: stage
Attributes.Description: Stage of cooling and associated power rating.

DerivedEntities.Name: ReadingType
DerivedEntities.Description: Detailed description for a type of a reading value. Values in attributes allow for the creation of recommended codes to be used for identifying reading value types as follows: <macroPeriod>.<aggregate>.<measuringPeriod>.<accumulation>.<flowDirection>.<commodity>.<measurementKind>.<interharmonic.numerator>.<interharmonic.denominator>.<argument.numerator>.<argument.denominator>.<tou>.<cpp>.<consumptionTier>.<phases>.<multiplier>.<unit>.<currency>.

Attributes.Name: multiplier
Attributes.Description: Metering-specific multiplier.

Attributes.Name: unit
Attributes.Description: Metering-specific unit.

Attributes.Name: currency
Attributes.Description: Metering-specific currency.

Attributes.Name: consumptionTier
Attributes.Description:
In case of common flat-rate pricing for power, in which all purchases are at a given rate, 'consumptionTier'=0. Otherwise, the value indicates the consumption tier, which can be used in conjunction with TOU or CPP pricing.
Consumption tier pricing refers to the method of billing in which a certain "block" of energy is purchased/sold at one price, after which the next block of energy is purchased at another price, and so on, all throughout a defined period. At the start of the defined period, consumption is initially zero, and any usage is measured against the first consumption tier ('consumptionTier'=1). If this block of energy is consumed before the end of the period, energy consumption moves to be reconed against the second consumption tier ('consumptionTier'=2), and so on. At the end of the defined period, the consumption accumulator is reset, and usage within the 'consumptionTier'=1 restarts.

Attributes.Name: cpp
Attributes.Description: Critical peak period (CPP) bucket the reading value is attributed to. Value 0 means not applicable. Even though CPP is usually considered a specialised form of time of use 'tou', this attribute is defined explicitly for flexibility.

Attributes.Name: phases
Attributes.Description: Metering-specific phase code.

Attributes.Name: aggregate
Attributes.Description: Salient attribute of the reading data aggregated from individual endpoints. This is mainly used to define a mathematical operation carried out over 'macroPeriod', but may also be used to describe an attribute of the data when the 'macroPeriod' is not defined.

Attributes.Name: accumulation
Attributes.Description: Accumulation behaviour of a reading over time, usually 'measuringPeriod', to be used with individual endpoints (as opposed to 'macroPeriod' and 'aggregate' that are used to describe aggregations of data from individual endpoints).

Attributes.Name: macroPeriod
Attributes.Description: Time period of interest that reflects how the reading is viewed or captured over a long period of time.

Attributes.Name: commodity
Attributes.Description: Commodity being measured.

Attributes.Name: interharmonic
Attributes.Description: Indication of a "harmonic" or "interharmonic" basis for the measurement. Value 0 in 'numerator' and 'denominator' means not applicable.

Attributes.Name: tou
Attributes.Description: Time of use (TOU) bucket the reading value is attributed to. Value 0 means not applicable.

Attributes.Name: measuringPeriod
Attributes.Description:
Time attribute inherent or fundamental to the reading value (as opposed to 'macroPeriod' that supplies an "adjective" to describe aspects of a time period with regard to the measurement). It refers to the way the value was originally measured and not to the frequency at which it is reported or presented. For example, an hourly interval of consumption data would have value 'hourly' as an attribute. However in the case of an hourly sampled voltage value, the meterReadings schema would carry the 'hourly' interval size information.
It is common for meters to report demand in a form that is measured over the course of a portion of an hour, while enterprise applications however commonly assume the demand (in kW or kVAr) normalised to 1 hour. The system that receives readings directly from the meter therefore shall perform this transformation before publishing readings for use by the other enterprise systems. The scalar used is chosen based on the block size (not any sub-interval size).

Attributes.Name: argument
Attributes.Description:
Argument used to introduce numbers into the unit of measure description where they are needed (e.g., 4 where the measure needs an argument such as CEMI(n=4)). Most arguments used in practice however will be integers (i.e., 'denominator'=1).
Value 0 in 'numerator' and 'denominator' means not applicable.

Attributes.Name: flowDirection
Attributes.Description: Flow direction for a reading where the direction of flow of the commodity is important (for electricity measurements this includes current, energy, power, and demand).

Attributes.Name: measurementKind
Attributes.Description: Identifies "what" is being measured, as refinement of 'commodity'. When combined with 'unit', it provides detail to the unit of measure. For example, 'energy' with a unit of measure of 'kWh' indicates to the user that active energy is being measured, while with 'kVAh' or 'kVArh', it indicates apparent energy and reactive energy, respectively. 'power' can be combined in a similar way with various power units of measure: Distortion power ('distortionVoltAmperes') with 'kVA' is different from 'power' with 'kVA'.

Attributes.Name: insulationResistance
