Attributes.Description: A prefix or title for the person's name, such as Miss, Mister, Doctor, etc.

Attributes.Name: suffix
Attributes.Description: A suffix for the person's name, such as II, III, etc.

Attributes.Name: specialNeed
Attributes.Description: Special service needs for the person (contact) are described; examples include life support, etc.

Attributes.Name: landlinePhone
Attributes.Description: Landline phone number.

DerivedEntities.Name: Curve
DerivedEntities.Description: A multi-purpose curve or functional relationship between an independent variable (X-axis) and dependent (Y-axis) variables.

DerivedEntities.Name: VsCapabilityCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: The P-Q capability curve for a voltage source converter, with P on X-axis and Qmin and Qmax on Y1-axis and Y2-axis.

DerivedEntities.Name: StartUpTimeCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Startup time curve as a function of down time, where time is specified in minutes.  Relationship between unit startup time (Y1-axis) vs. unit elapsed down time (X-axis).

DerivedEntities.Name: BidPriceCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Relationship between unit operating price in $/hour (Y-axis) and unit output in MW (X-axis).

DerivedEntities.Name: RMRStartUpTimeCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Model to support processing of reliability must run units.

DerivedEntities.Name: FuelCostCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Relationship between unit fuel cost in $/kWh(Y-axis) and  unit output in MW (X-axis).

DerivedEntities.Name: StartUpEnergyCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: The energy consumption of a generating resource to complete a start-up from the StartUpEnergyCurve. Definition of the StartUpEnergyCurve includes, xvalue as the cooling time and y1value as the MW value.

DerivedEntities.Name: RMRStartUpCostCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Model to support processing of reliability must run units.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetPropertyCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: An Asset Property that is described through curves rather than as a data point. The relationship is to be defined between an independent variable (X-axis) and one or two dependent variables (Y1-axis and Y2-axis).

DerivedEntities.Name: StartUpFuelCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: The fuel consumption of a Generating Resource to complete a Start-Up.(x=cooling time) Form Startup Fuel Curve. xAxisData -> cooling time, y1AxisData -> MBtu.

DerivedEntities.Name: BaseCaseConstraintLimit
DerivedEntities.Description: Possibly time-varying max MW or MVA and optionally Min MW limit or MVA limit (Y1 and Y2, respectively) assigned to a contingency analysis base case. Use CurveSchedule XAxisUnits to specify MW or MVA. To be used only if the BaseCaseConstraintLimit differs from the DefaultConstraintLimit.

DerivedEntities.Name: MaxStartUpCostCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: The maximum Startup costs and time as a function of down time.  Relationship between unit startup cost (Y1-axis) vs. unit elapsed down time (X-axis). This is used to validate the information provided in the Bid.

DerivedEntities.Name: ContingencyConstraintLimit
DerivedEntities.Description: Possibly time-varying max MW or MVA and optionally Min MW limit or MVA limit (Y1 and Y2, respectively) assigned to a constraint for a specific contingency. Use CurveSchedule XAxisUnits to specify MW or MVA.

DerivedEntities.Name: ReserveReqCurve
DerivedEntities.Description:
A curve relating  reserve requirement versus time, showing the values of a specific reserve requirement for each unit of the period covered. The  curve can be based on "absolute" time or on "normalized' time. 
X is time, typically expressed in absolute time
Y1 is reserve requirement, typically expressed in MW

DerivedEntities.Name: RMRStartUpFuelCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Model to support processing of reliability must run units.

DerivedEntities.Name: ResourceOperationMaintenanceCost
DerivedEntities.Description: To model the Operation and Maintenance (O and M) costs of a generation resource.

Attributes.Name: omCostIntermediateStartup
Attributes.Description: Verifiable O&M Cost ($), Intermediate Startup

Attributes.Name: solidfuelPercentAboveLowSustainedLimit
Attributes.Description: Percentage of Solid Fuel for operating above Low Sustained Limit (LSL)

Attributes.Name: omCostLowSustainedLimit
Attributes.Description: Verifiable O&M Cost ($/MWh), LSL

Attributes.Name: gasPercentAboveLowSustainedLimit
Attributes.Description: Percentage of Fuel Index Price (gas) for operating above Low Sustained Limit (LSL)

Attributes.Name: oilPercentAboveLowSustainedLimit
Attributes.Description: Percentage of Fuel Oil Price (FOP) for operating above Low Sustained Limit (LSL)

Attributes.Name: omCostColdStartup
Attributes.Description: Verifiable O&M Cost ($), Cold Startup

Attributes.Name: omCostHotStartup
Attributes.Description: Verifiable O&M Cost ($), Hot Startup

DerivedEntities.Name: RMRStartUpEnergyCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Model to support processing of reliability must run units.

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadReductionTimeCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: This is the cureve that describes the load reduction time. Relationship between time (Y1-axis) vs. MW (X-axis).

Attributes.Name: loadReductionTimeCurveType
Attributes.Description:
type of the curve: Possible values are but not limited to:

Max, Min,

DerivedEntities.Name: HeatRateCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Relationship between unit heat rate per active power (Y-axis) and  unit output (X-axis). The heat input is from all fuels.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktHeatRateCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC 61970: Generation: Production:HeatRateCurve.

Attributes.Name: isNetGrossP
Attributes.Description: Flag is set to true when output is expressed in net active power.

DerivedEntities.Name: GenUnitOpCostCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Relationship between unit operating cost (Y-axis) and unit output active power (X-axis). The operating cost curve for thermal units is derived from heat input and fuel costs. The operating cost curve for hydro units is derived from water flow rates and equivalent water costs.

Attributes.Name: isNetGrossP
Attributes.Description: Flag is set to true when output is expressed in net active power.

DerivedEntities.Name: TailbayLossCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Relationship between tailbay head loss height (Y-axis) and the total discharge into the power station's tailbay volume per time unit (X-axis) . There could be more than one curve depending on the level of the tailbay reservoir or river level.

DerivedEntities.Name: FuelAllocationSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: The amount of fuel of a given type which is allocated for consumption over a specified period of time.

Attributes.Name: minFuelAllocation
Attributes.Description: The minimum amount of fuel that is allocated for consumption for the scheduled time period, e.g., based on a "take-or-pay" contract.

Attributes.Name: maxFuelAllocation
Attributes.Description: The maximum amount of fuel that is allocated for consumption for the scheduled time period.

Attributes.Name: fuelType
Attributes.Description: The type of fuel, which also indicates the corresponding measurement unit.

Attributes.Name: fuelAllocationEndDate
Attributes.Description: The end time and date of the fuel allocation schedule.

Attributes.Name: fuelAllocationStartDate
Attributes.Description: The start time and date of the fuel allocation schedule.

DerivedEntities.Name: StartIgnFuelCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: The quantity of ignition fuel (Y-axis) used to restart and repay the auxiliary power consumed versus the number of hours (X-axis) the unit was off line.

Attributes.Name: ignitionFuelType
Attributes.Description: Type of ignition fuel.

DerivedEntities.Name: GrossToNetActivePowerCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Relationship between the generating unit's gross active power output on the X-axis (measured at the terminals of the machine(s)) and the generating unit's net active power output on the Y-axis (based on utility-defined measurements at the power station). Station service loads, when modelled, should be treated as non-conforming bus loads. There may be more than one curve, depending on the auxiliary equipment that is in service.

DerivedEntities.Name: HeatInputCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Relationship between unit heat input in energy per time for main fuel (Y1-axis) and supplemental fuel (Y2-axis) versus unit output in active power (X-axis). The quantity of main fuel used to sustain generation at this output level is prorated for throttling between definition points. The quantity of supplemental fuel used at this output level is fixed and not prorated.

Attributes.Name: heatInputEff
Attributes.Description: Heat input - efficiency multiplier adjustment factor.

Attributes.Name: auxPowerMult
Attributes.Description: Power output - auxiliary power multiplier adjustment factor.

Attributes.Name: isNetGrossP
Attributes.Description: Flag is set to true when output is expressed in net active power.

Attributes.Name: heatInputOffset
Attributes.Description: Heat input - offset adjustment factor.

Attributes.Name: auxPowerOffset
Attributes.Description: Power output - auxiliary power offset adjustment factor.

DerivedEntities.Name: InterchangeSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: Interchange schedule class to hold information for interchange schedules such as import export type, energy type, and etc.

Attributes.Name: energyType
Attributes.Description: Energy product type.

Attributes.Name: directionType
Attributes.Description: Import or export.

Attributes.Name: checkOutType
Attributes.Description: To indicate a check out type such as adjusted capacity or dispatch capacity.

Attributes.Name: operatingDate
Attributes.Description: Operating date, hour.

Attributes.Name: outOfMarketType
Attributes.Description: To indicate an out-of-market (OOM) schedule.

Attributes.Name: scheduleType
Attributes.Description: Schedule type.

Attributes.Name: intervalLength
Attributes.Description: Interval length.

Attributes.Name: marketType
Attributes.Description: Market type.

Attributes.Name: wcrID
Attributes.Description: Wheeling Counter-Resource ID (required when Schedule Type=Wheel).

DerivedEntities.Name: StartRampCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Rate in gross active power per minute (Y-axis) at which a unit can be loaded versus the number of hours (X-axis) the unit was off line.

Attributes.Name: hotStandbyRamp
Attributes.Description: The startup ramp rate in gross for a unit that is on hot standby.

DerivedEntities.Name: HydroGeneratingEfficiencyCurve
DerivedEntities.Description:
Relationship between unit efficiency as percentage and unit output active power for a given net head in meters. The relationship between efficiency, discharge, head, and power output is expressed as follows:   E =KP/HQ
where:  E is the efficiency, as a percentage; P is the active power; H is the height; Q is the discharge, volume/time unit; K is a constant.
For example, a curve instance for a given net head could show efficiency (Y-axis) versus active power output (X-axis) or versus discharge on the X-axis.

DerivedEntities.Name: NotificationTimeCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Notification time curve as a function of down time.  Relationship between crew notification time (Y1-axis) and unit startup time (Y2-axis) vs. unit elapsed down time (X-axis).

DerivedEntities.Name: StartUpCostCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Startup costs and time as a function of down time.  Relationship between unit startup cost (Y1-axis) vs. unit elapsed down time (X-axis).

DerivedEntities.Name: ReserveDemandCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Reserve demand curve.  Models maximum quantities of reserve required per Market Region and models a reserve demand curve for the minimum quantities of reserve. The ReserveDemandCurve is a relationship between unit operating reserve price in $/MWhr (Y-axis) and unit reserves in MW (X-axis).

Attributes.Name: reqMaxMW
Attributes.Description: Region requirement maximum limit

Attributes.Name: reserveRequirementType
Attributes.Description: Reserve requirement type that the max and curve apply to. For example, operating reserve, regulation and contingency.

DerivedEntities.Name: DefaultBidCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Default bid curve for default energy bid curve and default startup curves (cost and time).

Attributes.Name: curveType
Attributes.Description: To indicate a type used for a default energy bid curve, such as LMP, cost or consultative based.

Attributes.Name: debAdderFlag
Attributes.Description: Default energy bid adder flag

DerivedEntities.Name: RampRateCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Ramp rate as a function of resource MW output.

Attributes.Name: rampRateType
Attributes.Description: How ramp rate is applied (e.g. raise or lower, as when applied to a generation resource)

Attributes.Name: constraintRampType
Attributes.Description:
The condition that identifies whether a Generating Resource should be constrained from Ancillary Service provision if its Schedule or Dispatch change across Trading Hours or Trading Intervals requires more than a specified fraction of the duration of the Trading Hour or Trading Interval. 

Valid values are Fast/Slow

Attributes.Name: condition
Attributes.Description: condition for the ramp rate

DerivedEntities.Name: RMRHeatRateCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Model to support processing of reliability must run units.

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadReductionPriceCurve

DerivedEntities.Name: TargetLevelSchedule
DerivedEntities.Description: Reservoir water level targets from advanced studies or "rule curves". Typically in one hour increments for up to 10 days.

Attributes.Name: lowLevelLimit
Attributes.Description: Low target level limit, below which the reservoir operation will be penalized.

Attributes.Name: highLevelLimit
Attributes.Description: High target level limit, above which the reservoir operation will be penalized.

DerivedEntities.Name: CTTempActivePowerCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Relationship between the combustion turbine's power output rating in gross active power (X-axis) and the ambient air temperature (Y-axis).

DerivedEntities.Name: IncrementalHeatRateCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Relationship between unit incremental heat rate in (delta energy/time) per (delta active power) and unit output in active power. The IHR curve represents the slope of the HeatInputCurve. Note that the "incremental heat rate" and the "heat rate" have the same engineering units.

Attributes.Name: isNetGrossP
Attributes.Description: Flag is set to true when output is expressed in net active power.

DerivedEntities.Name: LevelVsVolumeCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Relationship between reservoir volume and reservoir level. The  volume is at the Y-axis and the reservoir level at the X-axis.

DerivedEntities.Name: PenstockLossCurve

DerivedEntities.Name: EmissionAccount

Attributes.Name: emissionType

DerivedEntities.Name: EmissionCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Relationship between the unit's emission rate in units of mass per hour (Y-axis) and output active power (X-axis) for a given type of emission. This curve applies when only one type of fuel is being burned.

Attributes.Name: isNetGrossP
Attributes.Description: Flag is set to true when output is expressed in net active power.

Attributes.Name: emissionType
Attributes.Description: The type of emission, which also gives the production rate measurement unit. The y1AxisUnits of the curve contains the unit of measure (e.g. kg) and the emissionType is the type of emission (e.g. sulfur dioxide).

Attributes.Name: emissionContent

DerivedEntities.Name: ShutdownCurve

Attributes.Name: shutdownCost

DerivedEntities.Name: SubscribePowerCurve

DerivedEntities.Name: DefaultConstraintLimit
DerivedEntities.Description: Possibly time-varying max MW or MVA and optionally Min MW limit or MVA limit (Y1 and Y2, respectively) applied as a default value if no specific constraint limits are specified for a contingency analysis. Use CurveSchedule XAxisUnits to specify MW or MVA.

DerivedEntities.Name: ReactiveCapabilityCurve
DerivedEntities.Description: Reactive power rating envelope versus the synchronous machine's active power, in both the generating and motoring modes. For each active power value there is a corresponding high and low reactive power limit  value. Typically there will be a separate curve for each coolant condition, such as hydrogen pressure.  The Y1 axis values represent reactive minimum and the Y2 axis values represent reactive maximum.

DerivedEntities.Name: SensitivityPriceCurve

Optionally, this curve expresses elasticity of the associated requirement.  For example, used to reduce requirements when clearing price exceeds reasonable values when the supply quantity becomes scarce. For example, a single point value of $1000/MW for a spinning reserve will cause a reduction in the required spinning reserve. 
X axis is constrained quantity (e.g., MW)
Y1 axis is money per constrained quantity

Attributes.Name: y3Multiplier

Attributes.Description: The Y1-axis units of measure.

Attributes.Name: xUnit

Attributes.Name: y3Unit
Attributes.Description: The Y3-axis units of measure.

DerivedEntities.Description: General static load. This model represents the sensitivity of the real and reactive power consumed by the load to the amplitude and frequency of the bus voltage.

Attributes.Name: kq3
Attributes.Description: Third term voltage coefficient for reactive power (Kq3). Not used when .staticLoadModelType = constantZ.

Attributes.Name: eq2
Attributes.Description: Second term voltage exponent for reactive power (Eq2). Used only when .staticLoadModelType = exponential.

Attributes.Name: kp2
Attributes.Description: Second term voltage coefficient for active power (Kp2). Not used when .staticLoadModelType = constantZ.

Attributes.Name: staticLoadModelType
Attributes.Description: Type of static load model.  Typical value = constantZ.

Attributes.Name: kp1
Attributes.Description: First term voltage coefficient for active power (Kp1). Not used when .staticLoadModelType = constantZ.

Attributes.Name: kqf
Attributes.Description: Frequency deviation coefficient for reactive power (Kqf). Not used when .staticLoadModelType = constantZ.

Attributes.Name: kp4
Attributes.Description: Frequency coefficient for active power (Kp4) (not = 0 if .staticLoadModelType = zIP2). Used only when .staticLoadModelType = zIP2.

Attributes.Name: eq1
Attributes.Description: First term voltage exponent for reactive power (Eq1). Used only when .staticLoadModelType = exponential.

Attributes.Name: ep3
Attributes.Description: Third term voltage exponent for active power (Ep3). Used only when .staticLoadModelType = exponential.

Attributes.Name: kq1
Attributes.Description: First term voltage coefficient for reactive power (Kq1). Not used when .staticLoadModelType = constantZ.

Attributes.Name: ep2
Attributes.Description: Second term voltage exponent for active power (Ep2). Used only when .staticLoadModelType = exponential.

Attributes.Name: kp3
Attributes.Description: Third term voltage coefficient for active power (Kp3). Not used when .staticLoadModelType = constantZ.

Attributes.Name: eq3
Attributes.Description: Third term voltage exponent for reactive power (Eq3). Used only when .staticLoadModelType = exponential.

Attributes.Name: kq2
Attributes.Description: Second term voltage coefficient for reactive power (Kq2). Not used when .staticLoadModelType = constantZ.

Attributes.Name: kq4

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadMotor
DerivedEntities.Description: Aggregate induction motor load. This model is used to represent a fraction of an ordinary load as "induction motor load". It allows a load that is treated as an ordinary constant power in power flow analysis to be represented by an induction motor in dynamic simulation. This model is intended for representation of aggregations of many motors dispersed through a load represented at a high voltage bus but where there is no information on the characteristics of individual motors. Either a "one-cage" or "two-cage" model of the induction machine can be modelled. Magnetic saturation is not modelled. This model treats a fraction of the constant power part of a load as a motor. During initialisation, the initial power drawn by the motor is set equal to Pfrac times the constant P part of the static load. The remainder of the load is left as a static load. The reactive power demand of the motor is calculated during initialisation as a function of voltage at the load bus. This reactive power demand can be less than or greater than the constant Q component of the load. If the motor's reactive demand is greater than the constant Q component of the load, the model inserts a shunt capacitor at the terminal of the motor to bring its reactive demand down to equal the constant Q reactive load. If an induction motor load model and a static load model are both present for a load, the motor Pfrac is assumed to be subtracted from the power flow constant P load before the static load model is applied. The remainder of the load, if any, is then represented by the static load model.

Attributes.Name: ra
Attributes.Description: Stator resistance (Ra). Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: lfac
Attributes.Description: Loading factor (Lfac). The ratio of initial P to motor MVA base. Typical value = 0,8.

Attributes.Name: ls
Attributes.Description: Synchronous reactance (Ls). Typical value = 3,2.

Attributes.Name: tppo
Attributes.Description: Subtransient rotor time constant (Tppo) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,02.

Attributes.Name: d
Attributes.Description: Damping factor (D). Unit = delta P/delta speed. Typical value = 2.

Attributes.Name: lpp
Attributes.Description: Subtransient reactance (Lpp). Typical value = 0,15.

Attributes.Name: pfrac
Attributes.Description: Fraction of constant-power load to be represented by this motor model (Pfrac) (>= 0,0 and <= 1,0). Typical value = 0,3.

Attributes.Name: vt
Attributes.Description: Voltage threshold for tripping (Vt). Typical value = 0,7.

Attributes.Name: tbkr
Attributes.Description: Circuit breaker operating time (Tbkr) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,08.

Attributes.Name: h
Attributes.Description: Inertia constant (H) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,4.

Attributes.Name: lp
Attributes.Description: Transient reactance (Lp). Typical value = 0,15.

Attributes.Name: tv
Attributes.Description: Voltage trip pickup time (Tv) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,1.

Attributes.Name: tpo
Attributes.Description: Transient rotor time constant (Tpo) (>= 0). Typical value = 1.

Attributes.Name: predictionCreationDate
Attributes.Description: The timestamp for when a prediction was created

DerivedEntities.Name: PinGate

Attributes.Name: negate

DerivedEntities.Name: OrganisationRole
DerivedEntities.Description: Identifies a way in which an organisation may participate in the utility enterprise (e.g., customer, manufacturer, etc).

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketRole
DerivedEntities.Description: The external intended behavior played by a party within the electricity market.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: The kind of market roles that can be played by parties for given domains within the electricity market. Types are flexible using dataType of string for free-entry of role types.

DerivedEntities.Name: CRROrgRole

Attributes.Name: status

DerivedEntities.Name: OrgOrgRole

Roles played between Organisations and other Organisations. This includes role ups for ogranisations, cost centers, profit centers, regulatory reporting, etc.
Note that the parent and child relationship is indicated by the name on each end of the association.

Attributes.Name: clientID

DerivedEntities.Name: BusinessRole

DerivedEntities.Name: Bank
DerivedEntities.Description: Organisation that is a commercial bank, agency, or other institution that offers a similar service.

Attributes.Name: bic
Attributes.Description: Bank identifier code as defined in ISO 9362; for use in countries wher IBAN is not yet in operation.

Attributes.Name: iban
Attributes.Description: International bank account number defined in ISO 13616; for countries where IBAN is not in operation, the existing BIC or SWIFT codes may be used instead (see ISO 9362).

DerivedEntities.Name: Manufacturer
DerivedEntities.Description: Organisation that manufactures asset products.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnvironmentalDataAuthority
DerivedEntities.Description: An entity defining classifications or categories of environmental information, like phenomena or alerts.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetOrganisationRole
DerivedEntities.Description: Role an organisation plays with respect to asset.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetTestLab
DerivedEntities.Description: Test lab that performs various types of testing related to assets.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetOwner
DerivedEntities.Description: Owner of the asset.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetTestSampleTaker
DerivedEntities.Description: Identity of person/organization that took sample.

DerivedEntities.Name: Maintainer

DerivedEntities.Name: Tender
DerivedEntities.Description:
Tender is what is "offered" by the customer towards making a payment and is often more than the required payment (hence the need for 'change'). The payment is thus that part of the Tender that goes towards settlement of a particular transaction.
Tender is modelled as an aggregation of Cheque and Card. Both these tender types can exist in a single tender bid thus 'accountHolderName' has to exist separately in each of Cheque and Card as each could have a different account holder name.

Attributes.Name: amount
Attributes.Description: Amount tendered by customer.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of tender from customer.

Attributes.Name: change
Attributes.Description: Difference between amount tendered by customer and the amount charged by point of sale.

DerivedEntities.Name: PhaseTapChangerTable
DerivedEntities.Description: Describes a tabular curve for how the phase angle difference and impedance varies with the tap step.

DerivedEntities.Name: PointOfSale
DerivedEntities.Description: Logical point where transactions take place with operational interaction between cashier and the payment system; in certain cases the point of sale interacts directly with the end customer, in which case the cashier might not be a real person: for example a self-service kiosk or over the internet.

Attributes.Name: location
Attributes.Description: Local description for where this point of sale is physically located.

DerivedEntities.Name: Asset
DerivedEntities.Description: Tangible resource of the utility, including power system equipment, various end devices, cabinets, buildings, etc. For electrical network equipment, the role of the asset is defined through PowerSystemResource and its subclasses, defined mainly in the Wires model (refer to IEC61970-301 and model package IEC61970::Wires). Asset description places emphasis on the physical characteristics of the equipment fulfilling that role.

When used for planning purposes, a transmission tower carrying two 3-phase circuits will have 2 instances of Connection, each of which will have 3 MountingPoint instances, one for each phase all with coordinates relative to a common origin on the tower. (It may also have a 3rd Connection with a single MountingPoint for the Neutral line).

DerivedEntities.Name: EndDevice
DerivedEntities.Description:
Asset container that performs one or more end device functions. One type of end device is a meter which can perform metering, load management, connect/disconnect, accounting functions, etc. Some end devices, such as ones monitoring and controlling air conditioners, refrigerators, pool pumps may be connected to a meter. All end devices may have communication capability defined by the associated communication function(s). An end device may be owned by a consumer, a service provider, utility or otherwise.
There may be a related end device function that identifies a sensor or control point within a metering application or communications systems (e.g., water, gas, electricity).
Some devices may use an optical port that conforms to the ANSI C12.18 standard for communications.

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadResponseCharacteristic
DerivedEntities.Description:
Models the characteristic response of the load demand due to changes in system conditions such as voltage and frequency. It is not related to demand response.
If LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is True, the exponential voltage or frequency dependent models are specified and used as to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model.
The equations to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model are internal to the power flow calculation, hence they use different quantities depending on the use case of the data exchange. 
The equations for exponential voltage dependent load model injected power are: 
pInjection= Pnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.pVoltageExponent
qInjection= Qnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.qVoltageExponent
Where: 
1) * means "multiply" and ** is "raised to power of";
2) Pnominal and Qnominal represent the active power and reactive power at nominal voltage as any load described by the voltage exponential model shall be given at nominal voltage.  This means that EnergyConsumer.p and EnergyConsumer.q  are at nominal voltage.
3) After power flow is solved: 
-pInjection and qInjection correspond to SvPowerflow.p and SvPowerflow.q respectively.  
- Voltage corresponds to SvVoltage.v at the TopologicalNode where the load is connected.

Attributes.Name: qFrequencyExponent
Attributes.Description: Exponent of per unit frequency effecting reactive power.

Attributes.Name: qVoltageExponent
Attributes.Description: Exponent of per unit voltage effecting reactive power.

Attributes.Name: exponentModel
Attributes.Description:
Indicates the exponential voltage dependency model is to be used. If false, the coefficient model is to be used.
The exponential voltage dependency model consist of the attributes:
- pVoltageExponent
- qVoltageExponent
- pFrequencyExponent
- qFrequencyExponent.
The coefficient model consist of the attributes:
- pConstantImpedance
- pConstantCurrent
- pConstantPower
- qConstantImpedance
- qConstantCurrent
- qConstantPower.
The sum of pConstantImpedance, pConstantCurrent and pConstantPower shall equal 1.
The sum of qConstantImpedance, qConstantCurrent and qConstantPower shall equal 1.

Attributes.Name: pConstantCurrent
Attributes.Description: Portion of active power load modelled as constant current.

Attributes.Name: pFrequencyExponent
Attributes.Description: Exponent of per unit frequency effecting active power.

Attributes.Name: pConstantPower
Attributes.Description: Portion of active power load modelled as constant power.

Attributes.Name: qConstantCurrent
Attributes.Description: Portion of reactive power load modelled as constant current.

Attributes.Name: qConstantImpedance
Attributes.Description: Portion of reactive power load modelled as constant impedance.

Attributes.Name: pVoltageExponent
Attributes.Description: Exponent of per unit voltage effecting real power.

Attributes.Name: qConstantPower
Attributes.Description: Portion of reactive power load modelled as constant power.

Attributes.Name: pConstantImpedance
Attributes.Description: Portion of active power load modelled as constant impedance.

Attributes.Name: ratingDescription

DerivedEntities.Description: A grouping of network model change descriptions.  Primarily used to organize the phases of an overall project.

DerivedEntities.Name: NetworkModelProjectChange
DerivedEntities.Description: Network model project change described by versions of an associated change set.  Has persistent identity over multiple versions of the associated change set.

DerivedEntities.Name: AggregateNode
DerivedEntities.Description: An aggregated node can define a typed grouping further defined by the AnodeType enumeratuion. Types range from System Zone/Regions to Market Energy Regions to Aggregated Loads and Aggregated Generators.

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketRegion
DerivedEntities.Description: A specialized class of AggregatedNode type. Defines the MarketRegions. Regions could be system Market Regions, Energy Regions or Ancillary Service Regions.

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadAggregationPoint
DerivedEntities.Description: A specialized class of type AggregatedNode type. Defines Load Aggregation Points.

DerivedEntities.Name: RUCZone
DerivedEntities.Description: A specialized class of type AggregatedNode type. Defines RUC Zones. A forecast region represents a collection of Nodes for which the Market operator has developed sufficient historical demand and relevant weather data to perform a demand forecast for such area. The Market Operator may further adjust this forecast to ensure that the Reliability Unit Commitment produces adequate local capacity procurement.

DerivedEntities.Name: MSSZone
DerivedEntities.Description: Model to define a zone within a Metered Sub System.

Attributes.Name: lossFactor
Attributes.Description: This is the default loss factor for the Metered Sub-System (MSS) zone. The actual losses are calculated during the RT market.

Attributes.Name: ignoreLosses
Attributes.Description: Provides an indication if losses are to be ignored for this metered subsystem zone.

Attributes.Name: rucGrossSettlement
Attributes.Description: Metered Sub-System (MSS) Load Following may select Net vs. Gross settlement.  Net Settlement requires the net Demand settled at the Metered Sub-Sustem (MSS) Load Aggregation Point (LAP) and Net Supply needs to settle at the equivalent to the weighted average price of the MSS generation.  Gross load will be settled at the System LAP and the Gross supply will be settled at the LMP.  MSS Aggregation that elects gross settlement shall have to identify if its resources are Load Following or not.

Attributes.Name: qualifASOrder
Attributes.Description: Processing Order for AS self-provisions for this region. The priority of this attribute directs the awards of any resource that resides in overlapping regions. The regions are processed in priority manner.

Attributes.Name: anodeType
Attributes.Description: Type of aggregated node

Attributes.Name: tpfiltq

Attributes.Description:
Market product type examples:

EN (Energy)
RU (Regulation Up)
RD (Regulation Dn)
SR (Spinning Reserve)
NR (Non-Spinning Reserve)
RC (RUC)

DerivedEntities.Name: TimeSeries
DerivedEntities.Description: A set of regular time-ordered measurements or values of quantitative nature of an individual or collective phenomenon taken at successive, in most cases equidistant, periods / points of time.

DerivedEntities.Name: BidTimeSeries
DerivedEntities.Description: The formal specification of specific characteristics related to a bid.

Attributes.Name: priority
Attributes.Description: The numeric local priority given to a bid. Lower numeric values will have higher priority.

Attributes.Name: direction
Attributes.Description: The coded identification of the energy flow.

Attributes.Name: stepIncrementQuantity
Attributes.Description: The minimum increment that can be applied for an increase in an activation request.

Attributes.Name: blockBid
Attributes.Description: Indication that  the values in the period are considered as a whole. They cannot be changed or subdivided.

Attributes.Name: divisible
Attributes.Description: An indication whether or not each element of the bid may be partially accepted or not.

Attributes.Name: minimumActivationQuantity
Attributes.Description: The minimum quantity of energy that can be activated at a given time interval.

Attributes.Name: exclusiveBidsIdentification
Attributes.Description:
Unique identification associated with all linked tenders.
The identification of a set of tenders that are linked together signifying that only one can be accepted. 
This identification is defined by the tenderer and must be unique for a given auction.

Attributes.Name: status
Attributes.Description: The information about the status of the bid, such as "shared", "restricted", ...

Attributes.Name: linkedBidsIdentification
Attributes.Description: Unique identification associated with all linked bids.

DerivedEntities.Name: Series
DerivedEntities.Description: A set of similar physical or conceptual objects defined for the same period or point of time.

Attributes.Name: lastUpdateDate
Attributes.Description: The date of the last update related to this market object.

Attributes.Name: methodType
Attributes.Description: Type of method used in the business process related to this Series, e.g. metering method.

Attributes.Name: registrationDate
Attributes.Description: For a market object, the date of registration of a contract, e.g. the date of change of supplier for a customer.

Attributes.Name: curveType
Attributes.Description: The coded representation of the type of curve being described.

Attributes.Name: businessType
Attributes.Description: The identification of the nature of the time series.

Attributes.Name: product
Attributes.Description: The type of the product such as Power, energy, reactive power, transport capacity that is the subject of the time series.

Attributes.Name: objectAggregation
Attributes.Description: Identification of the object that is the common denominator used to aggregate a time series.

Attributes.Name: cancelledTS
Attributes.Description: An indicator stating that the TimeSeries, identified by the mRID, is cancelled as well as all the values sent in a previous version of the TimeSeries in a previous document.

Attributes.Name: version
Attributes.Description: Version of the time series.

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketActualEvent
DerivedEntities.Description: This class represents the actual instance of an event.

DerivedEntities.Name: DistributedResourceActualEvent
DerivedEntities.Description: A demand response event is created when there is a need to call upon resources to respond to demand adjustment requests. These events are created by ISO/RTO system operations and managed  by a demand response management system (DRMS). These events may or may not be coordinated with the Market Events and a defined Energy Market. The event will call for the deployment of a number of registered resources, or for deployment of resources within a zone (an organizational area within the power system that contains a number of resources).

Attributes.Name: totalPowerAdjustment
Attributes.Description: Total active power adjustment (e.g. load reduction) requested for this demand response event.

Attributes.Name: eventComments
Attributes.Description: Free format comments for the event, for any purpose needed.

Attributes.Name: eventStartTime
Attributes.Description: Start time of the event.

Attributes.Name: eventStatus
Attributes.Description: Event status, e.g. active, canceled, expired, etc.

Attributes.Name: eventType
Attributes.Description: Actual event type.

Attributes.Name: eventEndTime
Attributes.Description: End time of the event.

DerivedEntities.Name: CommodityDefinition
DerivedEntities.Description: Commodities in the context of IEC 62325 are MarketProducts (energy, regulation, reserve, etc) traded at a specific location, which in this case is a Pnode (either a specific pricing node or a pricing area or zone defined as a collection of pricing nodes).  The CommodityDefinition is a container for these two parameters, plus the unit of measure and the currency in which the Commodity is traded.  Each CommodityDefinition should be relatively static; defined once and rarely changed.

Attributes.Name: commodityUnit
Attributes.Description: The unit of measure in which the Commodity is traded, using the standard conventions associated with the UnitSymbol enumeration.

Attributes.Name: commodityUnitMultiplier
Attributes.Description: The unit multiplier, e.g. "k" to convert the unit "W-h" to "kW-h", using the standard conventions associated with the UnitMultiplier enumeration.

Attributes.Name: commodityCurrency
Attributes.Description: The currency in which the Commodity is traded, using the standard conventions associated with the Currency enumeration.

DerivedEntities.Name: TieFlow
DerivedEntities.Description: Defines the structure (in terms of location and direction) of the net interchange constraint for a control area. This constraint may be used by either AGC or power flow.

Attributes.Name: positiveFlowIn
Attributes.Description: Specifies the sign of the tie flow associated with a control area. True if positive flow into the terminal (load convention) is also positive flow into the control area.  See the description of ControlArea for further explanation of how TieFlow.positiveFlowIn is used.

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketPlan
DerivedEntities.Description: This class identifies a set of planned markets.

Attributes.Name: tradingDay
Attributes.Description: Planned market trading day.

DerivedEntities.Name: FieldDispatchHistory
DerivedEntities.Description: The history of field dispatch statuses for this work.

DerivedEntities.Name: ControlAreaGeneratingUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: A control area generating unit. This class is needed so that alternate control area definitions may include the same generating unit.   It should be noted that only one instance within a control area should reference a specific generating unit.

DerivedEntities.Name: Limit
DerivedEntities.Description: Specifies one limit value for a Measurement. A Measurement typically has several limits that are kept together by the LimitSet class. The actual meaning and use of a Limit instance (i.e., if it is an alarm or warning limit or if it is a high or low limit) is not captured in the Limit class. However the name of a Limit instance may indicate both meaning and use.

DerivedEntities.Name: ViolationLimit
DerivedEntities.Description: A type of limit that indicates if it is enforced and, through association, the organisation responsible for setting the limit.

Attributes.Name: enforced
Attributes.Description: True if limit is enforced.

DerivedEntities.Name: AccumulatorLimit
DerivedEntities.Description: Limit values for Accumulator measurements.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: The value to supervise against. The value is positive.

DerivedEntities.Name: AnalogLimit
DerivedEntities.Description: Limit values for Analog measurements.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktAnalogLimit
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC 61970:Meas:AnalogLimit.

Attributes.Name: limitType
Attributes.Description:
The type of limit the value represents
Branch Limit Types:
Short Term
Medium Term
Long Term
Voltage Limits:
High
Low

Attributes.Name: exceededLimit
Attributes.Description: true if limit exceeded

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: The value to supervise against.

DerivedEntities.Name: BidSet
DerivedEntities.Description:
As set of mutually exclusive bids for which a maximum of one may be scheduled.
Of these generating bids, only one generating bid can be scheduled at a time.

DerivedEntities.Name: MeterReading
DerivedEntities.Description: Set of values obtained from the meter.

Attributes.Name: valuesInterval
Attributes.Description: Date and time interval of the data items contained within this meter reading.

Attributes.Name: isCoincidentTrigger
Attributes.Description: If true, this meter reading is the meter reading for which other coincident meter readings are requested or provided.

DerivedEntities.Name: BasePower
DerivedEntities.Description: The BasePower class defines the base power used in the per unit calculations.

Attributes.Name: basePower
Attributes.Description: Value used as base power.

DerivedEntities.Name: OperationalLimitSet
DerivedEntities.Description: A set of limits associated with equipment.  Sets of limits might apply to a specific temperature, or season for example. A set of limits may contain different severities of limit levels that would apply to the same equipment. The set may contain limits of different types such as apparent power and current limits or high and low voltage limits  that are logically applied together as a set.

DerivedEntities.Name: SubGeographicalRegion
DerivedEntities.Description: A subset of a geographical region of a power system network model.

DerivedEntities.Name: ChargeComponent
DerivedEntities.Description: A Charge Component is a list of configurable charge quality items to feed into settlement calculation and/or bill determinants.

DerivedEntities.Name: WorkIdentifiedObject
DerivedEntities.Description: Shadow class for IdentifiedObject, to isolate subclassing from this package. If any subclass gets normative and needs inheritance, it will inherit directly from IdentifiedObject.

DerivedEntities.Name: CULaborCode
DerivedEntities.Description: Labor code associated with various compatible unit labor items.

Attributes.Name: code
Attributes.Description: Labor code.

DerivedEntities.Name: OverheadCost
DerivedEntities.Description: Overhead cost applied to work order.

Attributes.Name: code
Attributes.Description: Overhead code.

Attributes.Name: cost
Attributes.Description: The overhead cost to be applied.

DerivedEntities.Name: MiscCostItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Various cost items that are not associated with compatible units. Examples include rental equipment, labor, materials, contractor costs, permits - anything not covered in a CU.

Attributes.Name: account
Attributes.Description: This drives the accounting treatment for this misc. item.

Attributes.Name: quantity
Attributes.Description: The quantity of the misc. item being assigned to this location.

Attributes.Name: costPerUnit
Attributes.Description: The cost per unit for this misc. item.

Attributes.Name: externalRefID
Attributes.Description: External reference identifier (e.g. purchase order number, serial number) .

Attributes.Name: costType
Attributes.Description: The cost type for accounting, such as material, labor, vehicle, contractor, equipment, overhead.

DerivedEntities.Name: WorkFlowStep
DerivedEntities.Description: A pre-defined set of work steps for a given type of work.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Used to define dependencies of each work flow step, which is for the instance of WorkTask associated with a given instance of WorkFlow.

DerivedEntities.Name: PropertyUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: Unit of property for reporting purposes.

Attributes.Name: propertyAccount
Attributes.Description: Used for property record accounting. For example, in the USA, this would be a FERC account.

Attributes.Name: activityCode
Attributes.Description: Activity code identifies a specific and distinguishable work action.

Attributes.Name: accountingUsage
Attributes.Description: A code that identifies appropriate type of property accounts such as distribution, streetlgihts, communications.

DerivedEntities.Name: CostType
DerivedEntities.Description: A categorization for resources, often costs, in accounting transactions. Examples include: material components, building in service, coal sales, overhead, etc.

Attributes.Name: code
Attributes.Description: A codified representation of the resource element.

Attributes.Name: amountAssignable
Attributes.Description: True if an amount can be assigned to the resource element (e.g., building in service, transmission plant, software development capital); false otherwise (e.g., internal labor, material components).

Attributes.Name: level
Attributes.Description: The level of the resource element in the hierarchy of resource elements (recursive relationship).

Attributes.Name: stage
Attributes.Description: The stage for which this costType applies: estimated design, estimated actual or actual actual.

DerivedEntities.Name: QualificationRequirement
DerivedEntities.Description: Certain skills are required and must be certified in order for a person (typically a member of a crew) to be qualified to work on types of equipment.

Attributes.Name: qualificationID
Attributes.Description: Qualification identifier.

DerivedEntities.Name: CUWorkEquipmentItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Compatible unit for various types of WorkEquipmentAssets, including vehicles.

Attributes.Name: equipCode
Attributes.Description: The equipment type code.

Attributes.Name: rate
Attributes.Description: Standard usage rate for the type of vehicle.

DerivedEntities.Name: ContractorItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Contractor information for work task.

Attributes.Name: cost
Attributes.Description: The total amount charged.

Attributes.Name: activityCode
Attributes.Description: Activity code identifies a specific and distinguishable unit of work.

Attributes.Name: bidAmount
Attributes.Description: The amount that a given contractor will charge for performing this unit of work.

DerivedEntities.Name: ShiftPattern
DerivedEntities.Description: The patterns of shifts worked by people or crews.

Attributes.Name: assignmentType
Attributes.Description: Type of assignement intended to be worked on this shift, for example, temporary, standard, etc.

Attributes.Name: cycleCount
Attributes.Description: Number of cycles for a temporary shift.

Attributes.Name: validityInterval
Attributes.Description: Date and time interval for which this shift pattern is valid (when it became effective and when it expires).

DerivedEntities.Name: CULaborItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Compatible unit labor item.

Attributes.Name: laborRate
Attributes.Description: The labor rate applied for work.

Attributes.Name: activityCode
Attributes.Description: Activity code identifies a specific and distinguishable unit of work.

Attributes.Name: laborDuration
Attributes.Description: Estimated time to perform work.

DerivedEntities.Name: Capability
DerivedEntities.Description: Capabilities of a crew.

Attributes.Name: performanceFactor
Attributes.Description: Capability performance factor.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Classification by utility's work management standards and practices.

Attributes.Name: validityInterval
Attributes.Description: Date and time interval for which this capability is valid (when it became effective and when it expires).

DerivedEntities.Name: CUAllowableAction
DerivedEntities.Description: Allowed actions: Install, Remove, Transfer, Abandon, etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: CUGroup
DerivedEntities.Description: A Compatible Unit Group identifies a set of compatible units which may be jointly utilized for estimating and designating jobs.

DerivedEntities.Name: CUMaterialItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Compatible unit of a consumable supply item. For example, nuts, bolts, brackets, glue, etc.

Attributes.Name: quantity
Attributes.Description: Quantity of the TypeMaterial for this CU, used to determine estimated costs based on a per unit cost or a cost per unit length specified in the TypeMaterial.

Attributes.Name: corporateCode
Attributes.Description: Code for material.

DerivedEntities.Name: LaborItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Labor used for work order.

Attributes.Name: activityCode
Attributes.Description: Activity code identifies a specific and distinguishable unit of work.

Attributes.Name: cost
Attributes.Description: Total cost for labor. Note that this may not be able to be derived from labor rate and time charged.

Attributes.Name: laborDuration
Attributes.Description: Time required to perform work.

Attributes.Name: laborRate
Attributes.Description: The labor rate applied for work.

DerivedEntities.Name: Usage
DerivedEntities.Description: The way material and assets are used to perform a certain type of work task. The way is described in text in the inheritied description attribute.

DerivedEntities.Name: DesignLocationCU
DerivedEntities.Description: Compatible unit at a given design location.

Attributes.Name: cuUsage
Attributes.Description: As the same CU can be used for different purposes and accounting purposes, usage must be specified. Examples include: distribution, transmission, substation.

Attributes.Name: cuQuantity
Attributes.Description: The quantity of the CU being assigned to this location.

Attributes.Name: cuAccount
Attributes.Description: A code that helps direct accounting (capital, expense, or accounting treatment).

Attributes.Name: removalDate
Attributes.Description: Year when a CU that represents an asset is removed.

Attributes.Name: cuAction
Attributes.Description: A code that instructs the crew what action to perform.

Attributes.Name: toBeEnergised
Attributes.Description: True if associated electrical equipment is intended to be energized while work is being performed.

DerivedEntities.Name: ConditionFactor
DerivedEntities.Description: This is to specify the various condition factors for a design that may alter the cost estimate or the allocation.

Attributes.Name: cfValue
Attributes.Description: The actual value of the condition factor, such as labor flat fee or percentage.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of this condition factor.

DerivedEntities.Name: CUContractorItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Compatible unit contractor item.

Attributes.Name: activityCode
Attributes.Description: Activity code identifies a specific and distinguishable unit of work.

Attributes.Name: bidAmount
Attributes.Description: The amount that a given contractor will charge for performing this unit of work.

DerivedEntities.Name: DesignLocation
DerivedEntities.Description: A logical part of the design (e.g., pole and all equipment on a pole). This includes points and spans.

Attributes.Name: spanLength
Attributes.Description: The legth of the span from the previous pole to this pole.

DerivedEntities.Name: OperationalLimitType
DerivedEntities.Description: The operational meaning of a category of limits.

Attributes.Name: acceptableDuration
Attributes.Description: The nominal acceptable duration of the limit. Limits are commonly expressed in terms of the time limit for which the limit is normally acceptable. The actual acceptable duration of a specific limit may depend on other local factors such as temperature or wind speed. The attribute has meaning only if the flag isInfiniteDuration is set to false, hence it shall not be exchanged when isInfiniteDuration is set to true.

Attributes.Name: isInfiniteDuration
Attributes.Description: Defines if the operational limit type has infinite duration. If true, the limit has infinite duration. If false, the limit has definite duration which is defined by the attribute acceptableDuration.

Attributes.Name: direction
Attributes.Description: The direction of the limit.

DerivedEntities.Name: GeographicalRegion
DerivedEntities.Description: A geographical region of a power system network model.

DerivedEntities.Name: ResourcePerformanceGlobalFactor
DerivedEntities.Description: Global factors are property/value pairs that are used to adjust resource performance values. Example include scale factors (e.g. scale a baseline up or down), adders (positive or negative), etc.

Attributes.Name: factorValue
Attributes.Description: Value of the property (factor).

Attributes.Name: factorDescription
Attributes.Description: Description (name) of the property (factor).

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketQualificationRequirement
DerivedEntities.Description: Certain skills are required and shall be certified in order for a person (typically a member of a crew) to be qualified to work on types of equipment.

Attributes.Name: effectiveDate
Attributes.Description: Effective date of the privilege, terminate date of the privilege, or effective date of the application for the organization

Attributes.Name: statusType
Attributes.Description: This is the name of the status of the qualification and is used to display the status of the user's or organization's status.

Attributes.Name: qualificationID
Attributes.Description: Qualification identifier.

Attributes.Name: expirationDate
Attributes.Description:
This is the terminate date of the application for the organization
The specific organization can no longer access the application as of the terminate date

Attributes.Name: status
Attributes.Description:
The status of the privilege. Shows the status of the users qualification. 
The current statuses are: 1=New, 2=Active, 3=Refused, 4=Terminated, 5=Withdrawn
and it is subject to update.

DerivedEntities.Name: WheelingCounterParty
DerivedEntities.Description: Counter party in a wheeling transaction.

DerivedEntities.Name: AltTieMeas
DerivedEntities.Description: A prioritized measurement to be used for the tie flow as part of the control area specification.

Attributes.Name: priority
Attributes.Description: Priority of a measurement usage.   Lower numbers have first priority.

DerivedEntities.Name: WindContPitchAngleIEC
DerivedEntities.Description:
Pitch angle control model.
Reference: IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.5.2.

Attributes.Name: kpx
Attributes.Description: Pitch cross coupling gain (KPX). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: ttheta
Attributes.Description: Pitch time constant (ttheta) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: thetamin
Attributes.Description: Minimum pitch angle (thetamin) (< WindContPitchAngleIEC.thetamax). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kpc
Attributes.Description: Power PI controller proportional gain (KPc). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kiomega
Attributes.Description: Speed PI controller integration gain (KIomega). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dthetamax
Attributes.Description: Maximum pitch positive ramp rate (dthetamax) (> WindContPitchAngleIEC.dthetamin). It is a type-dependent parameter. Unit = degrees / s.

Attributes.Name: dthetamin
Attributes.Description: Maximum pitch negative ramp rate (dthetamin) (< WindContPitchAngleIEC.dthetamax). It is a type-dependent parameter. Unit = degrees / s.

Attributes.Name: kic
Attributes.Description: Power PI controller integration gain (KIc). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kpomega
Attributes.Description: Speed PI controller proportional gain (KPomega). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: thetamax
Attributes.Description: Maximum pitch angle (thetamax) (> WindContPitchAngleIEC.thetamin). It is a type-dependent parameter.

DerivedEntities.Name: TACArea
DerivedEntities.Description: Transmission Access Charge Area. Charges assessed, on behalf of the Participating Transmission Owner, to parties who require access to the controlled grid.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransactionBidResults
DerivedEntities.Description: Contains the cleared results for each TransactionBid submitted to and accepted by the market.

Attributes.Name: clearedPrice
Attributes.Description: The price of the market transaction

Attributes.Name: clearedMW
Attributes.Description: The market transaction megawatt

DerivedEntities.Name: Seal
DerivedEntities.Description: Physically controls access to AssetContainers.

Attributes.Name: appliedDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time this seal has been applied.

Attributes.Name: sealNumber
Attributes.Description: (reserved word) Seal number.

Attributes.Name: condition
Attributes.Description: Condition of seal.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of seal.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransmissionRightChain
DerivedEntities.Description: Allows chaining of TransmissionContractRights. Many individual contract rights can be included in the definition of a TransmissionRightChain. A TransmissionRightChain is also defined as a TransmissionContractRight itself.

DerivedEntities.Name: MeteredSubSystem
DerivedEntities.Description: A metered subsystem.

DerivedEntities.Name: WindContQPQULimIEC
DerivedEntities.Description:
QP and QU limitation model.
Reference: IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.5.10.

Attributes.Name: tufiltql
Attributes.Description: Voltage measurement filter time constant for Q capacity (Tufiltql) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tpfiltql
Attributes.Description: Power measurement filter time constant for Q capacity (Tpfiltql) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

DerivedEntities.Name: CnodeDistributionFactor
DerivedEntities.Description: Participation factors per Cnode.  Used to calculate "participation" of Cnode in an AggregateNode. Each Cnode associated to an AggregateNode would be assigned a participation factor for its participation within the AggregateNode.

Attributes.Name: factor
Attributes.Description: Used to calculate "participation" of Cnode in an AggregateNode

Attributes.Name: podLossFactor
Attributes.Description: Point of delivery loss factor

DerivedEntities.Name: UnavailabilitySwitchAction
DerivedEntities.Description: Relevant switching action for supporting the availability (or unavailability) plans.  This could open or close a switch that is not directly connected to the unavailable equipment .

Attributes.Name: open
Attributes.Description: The switch is to be open during the scheduled period.

DerivedEntities.Name: AnalyticScore
DerivedEntities.Description: An indicative scoring by an analytic that can be used to characterize the health of or the risk associated with one or more assets.  The analytic score reflects the results of an execution of an analytic against an asset or group of assets.

DerivedEntities.Name: AggregateScore
DerivedEntities.Description: An aggregated indicative scoring by an analytic, which is based on other analytic scores, that can be used to characterize the health of or the risk associated with one or more assets.

DerivedEntities.Name: HealthScore
DerivedEntities.Description: Score that is indicative of the health of one or more assets.

DerivedEntities.Name: RiskScore
DerivedEntities.Description: Score that is indicative of the risk associated with one or more assets.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: The risk kind, such as CustomerRisk, FinancialRisk, SafetyRisk, etc.

Attributes.Name: effectiveDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date-time for when the score applies.

Attributes.Name: calculationDateTime
Attributes.Description: Timestamp of when the score was calculated.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: Asset health score value.

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketRun
DerivedEntities.Description: This class represents an actual instance of a planned market. For example, a Day Ahead market opens with the Bid Submission, ends with the closing of the Bid Submission. The market run represent the whole process. MarketRuns can be defined for markets such as Day Ahead Market, Real Time Market, Hour Ahead Market, Week Ahead Market, etc.

Attributes.Name: executionType
Attributes.Description: The execution type; Day Ahead, Intra Day, Real Time Pre-Dispatch, Real Time Dispatch

Attributes.Name: marketApprovedStatus
Attributes.Description: Set to true when the plan is approved by authority and becomes the official plan for the day ahead market. Identifies the approved case for the market for the specified time interval.

Attributes.Name: marketApprovalTime
Attributes.Description: Approved time for case. Identifies the time that the dispatcher approved a specific real time unit dispatch case

Attributes.Name: runState
Attributes.Description:
This is the state controlled by market defintion service.
Possible values could be but not limited by: Open, Close.

Attributes.Name: marketStartTime
Attributes.Description: The start time defined as the beginning of the market, market start time.

Attributes.Name: marketEndTime
Attributes.Description: The end time defined as the end of the market, market end time.

Attributes.Name: marketType
Attributes.Description: The market type, Day Ahead Market or Real Time Market.

Attributes.Name: reportedState
Attributes.Description: This is the state of market run activity as reported by market systems to the market definition services.

DerivedEntities.Name: CatalogAssetType
DerivedEntities.Description: a Assets that may be used for planning, work or design purposes.

DerivedEntities.Name: GeneratorTypeAsset
DerivedEntities.Description: Generic generation equipment that may be used for various purposes such as work planning. It defines both the Real and Reactive power properties (modelled at the PSR level as a GeneratingUnit + SynchronousMachine).

Attributes.Name: rQuadSubtrans
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis subtransient resistance.

Attributes.Name: xDirectSync
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis synchronous reactance.

Attributes.Name: rDirectTrans
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis transient resistance.

Attributes.Name: xQuadSubtrans
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis subtransient reactance.

Attributes.Name: maxP
Attributes.Description: Maximum real power limit.

Attributes.Name: rDirectSync
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis synchronous resistance.

Attributes.Name: minQ
Attributes.Description: Minimum reactive power generated.

Attributes.Name: minP
Attributes.Description: Minimum real power generated.

Attributes.Name: rQuadTrans
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis transient resistance.

Attributes.Name: xQuadTrans
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis transient reactance.

Attributes.Name: rQuadSync
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis synchronous resistance.

Attributes.Name: xQuadSync
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis synchronous reactance.

Attributes.Name: xDirectTrans
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis transient reactance.

Attributes.Name: rDirectSubtrans
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis subtransient resistance.

Attributes.Name: xDirectSubtrans
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis subtransient reactance.

Attributes.Name: maxQ
Attributes.Description: Maximum reactive power limit.

Attributes.Name: quantity
Attributes.Description: The value, unit of measure, and multiplier for the quantity.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of asset (from enumerated list).

Attributes.Name: stockItem
Attributes.Description: True if item is a stock item (default).

Attributes.Name: estimatedUnitCost
Attributes.Description: Estimated unit cost (or cost per unit length) of this type of asset. It does not include labor to install, construct or configure it.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Description of type of asset.

DerivedEntities.Name: Vendor
DerivedEntities.Description: The entity that owns the point of sale and contracts with the cashier to receipt payments and vend tokens using the payment system. The vendor has a private contract with and is managed by the merchant which is a type of organisation. The vendor is accountable to the merchant for revenue collected, and the merchant is in turn accountable to the supplier.

DerivedEntities.Name: CombinedCycleLogicalConfiguration
DerivedEntities.Description:
Logical Configuration of a Combined Cycle plant.

Operating Combined Cycle Plant (CCP) configurations are represented as Logical CCP Resources. Logical representation shall be used for Market applications to optimize and control Market Operations. Logical representation is also necessary for controlling the number of CCP configurations and to temper performance issues that may otherwise occur. 

For example,(2CT configuration),(1CT + 1ST configuration) are examples of logical configuration, without specifying the specific CT and ST participating in the configuration.

DerivedEntities.Name: SwitchOperationSummary
DerivedEntities.Description: Up-to-date, of-record summary of switch operation information, distilled from a variety of sources (real-time data or real-time data historian, field inspections, etc.) of use to asset health analytics.

Attributes.Name: lifetimeFaultOperations
Attributes.Description: Total breaker fault operations to date.

Attributes.Name: lifetimeMotorStarts
Attributes.Description: Total motor starts to date.

Attributes.Name: lifetimeTotalOperations
Attributes.Description: Total breaker operations to date (including fault and non-fault).

Attributes.Name: mostRecentFaultOperationDate
Attributes.Description: Date of most recent breaker fault operation.

Attributes.Name: mostRecentMotorStartDate
Attributes.Description: Date of most recent motor start.

Attributes.Name: mostRecentOperationDate
Attributes.Description: Date of most recent breaker operation (fault or non-fault).

DerivedEntities.Name: WindRefFrameRotIEC
DerivedEntities.Description:
Reference frame rotation model.
Reference: IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.3.5.

Attributes.Name: upll2
Attributes.Description: Voltage (uPLL2) below which the angle of the voltage is frozen if uPLL2 is smaller or equal to uPLL1 . It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tpll
Attributes.Description: Time constant for PLL first order filter model (TPLL) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: upll1
Attributes.Description: Voltage below which the angle of the voltage is filtered and possibly also frozen (uPLL1). It is a type-dependent parameter.

DerivedEntities.Name: InternalControlArea
DerivedEntities.Description: There is one internal control area in the system, which is the single control area in the primary network company. Real time generation control affects only the internal control area.

DerivedEntities.Name: Pnode
DerivedEntities.Description: A pricing node is directly associated with a connectivity node.  It is a pricing location for which market participants submit their bids, offers, buy/sell CRRs, and settle.

DerivedEntities.Name: IndividualPnode
DerivedEntities.Description: Individual pricing node based on Pnode.

DerivedEntities.Name: AggregatedPnode
DerivedEntities.Description: An aggregated pricing node is a specialized type of pricing node used to model items such as System Zone, Default Price Zone, Custom Price Zone, Control Area, Aggregated Generation, Aggregated Particpating Load, Aggregated Non-Participating Load, Trading Hub, Designated Control Area(DCA) Zone.

DerivedEntities.Name: CongestionArea
DerivedEntities.Description: Designated Congestion Area Definition (DCA).

Attributes.Name: apnodeType
Attributes.Description: Aggregate Price Node Types

Attributes.Name: participationCategory
Attributes.Description:
Designated Control Area participation in LMP price measurement

'Y' - Participates in both Local Market Power Mitigation (LMPM) and System Market Power Mitigation (SMPM)
'N' - Not included in LMP price measures
'S' - Participatesin SMPM price measures
'L' - Participatesin LMPM price measures

Attributes.Name: isPublic
Attributes.Description: If true, this Pnode is public (prices are published for DA/RT and FTR markets), otherwise it is private (location is not usable by market for bidding/FTRs/transactions).

DerivedEntities.Name: WindContPType3IEC
DerivedEntities.Description:
P control model type 3.
Reference: IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.5.4.

Attributes.Name: omegadtd
Attributes.Description: Active drive train damping frequency (omegaDTD). It can be calculated from two mass model parameters. It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dthetamax
Attributes.Description: Ramp limitation of torque, required in some grid codes (dtmax). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dprefmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum ramp rate of wind turbine reference power (dprefmin). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dthetamaxuvrt
Attributes.Description: Limitation of torque rise rate during UVRT (dthetamaxUVRT). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tpfiltp3
Attributes.Description: Filter time constant for power measurement (Tpfiltp3) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kip
Attributes.Description: PI controller integration parameter (KIp). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: zeta
Attributes.Description: Coefficient for active drive train damping (zeta). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dprefmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum ramp rate of wind turbine reference power (dprefmax). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tomegafiltp3
Attributes.Description: Filter time constant for generator speed measurement (Tomegafiltp3) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kpp
Attributes.Description: PI controller proportional gain (KPp). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tomegaref
Attributes.Description: Time constant in speed reference filter (Tomega,ref) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: udvs
Attributes.Description: Voltage limit for hold UVRT status after deep voltage sags (uDVS). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: mpuvrt
Attributes.Description: Enable UVRT power control mode (MpUVRT). It is a project-dependent parameter. true = voltage control (1 in the IEC model) false = reactive power control (0 in the IEC model).

Attributes.Name: thetauscale
Attributes.Description: Voltage scaling factor of reset-torque (tuscale). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tdvs
Attributes.Description: Time delay after deep voltage sags (TDVS) (>= 0). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: thetaemin
Attributes.Description: Minimum electrical generator torque (temin). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: omegaoffset
Attributes.Description: Offset to reference value that limits controller action during rotor speed changes (omegaoffset). It is a case-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dpmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum wind turbine power ramp rate (dpmax). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: pdtdmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum active drive train damping power (pDTDmax). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tufiltp3
Attributes.Description: Filter time constant for voltage measurement (Tufiltp3) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: updip
Attributes.Description: Voltage dip threshold for P-control (uPdip). Part of turbine control, often different (e.g 0.8) from converter thresholds. It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tpord
Attributes.Description: Time constant in power order lag (Tpord). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kdtd
Attributes.Description: Gain for active drive train damping (KDTD). It is a type-dependent parameter.

DerivedEntities.Name: PlannedMarketEvent
DerivedEntities.Description: This class represents planned events. Used to model the various planned events in a market (closing time, clearing time, etc.)

Attributes.Name: eventType
Attributes.Description: Planned event type.

Attributes.Name: plannedTime
Attributes.Description: This is relative time so that this attribute can be used by more than one planned market. For example the bid submission is 10am everyday.

DerivedEntities.Name: Season
DerivedEntities.Description: A specified time period of the year.

Attributes.Name: endDate
Attributes.Description: Date season ends.

Attributes.Name: startDate
Attributes.Description: Date season starts.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssemblyManifest
DerivedEntities.Description: A collection of model parts when combined form a case or part of a case.

DerivedEntities.Name: WindProtectionIEC
DerivedEntities.Description:
The grid protection model includes protection against over- and under-voltage, and against over- and under-frequency.
Reference: IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.6.

Attributes.Name: uunder
Attributes.Description: Wind turbine under voltage protection activation threshold (uunder). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: fover
Attributes.Description: Wind turbine over frequency protection activation threshold (fover). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: mzc
Attributes.Description: Zero crossing measurement mode (Mzc). It is a type-dependent parameter. true = WT protection system uses zero crossings to detect frequency (1 in the IEC model) false = WT protection system does not use zero crossings to detect frequency (0 in the IEC model).

Attributes.Name: funder
Attributes.Description: Wind turbine under frequency protection activation threshold (funder). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dfimax
Attributes.Description: Maximum rate of change of frequency (dFmax). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tfma
Attributes.Description: Time interval of moving average window (TfMA) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: uover
Attributes.Description: Wind turbine over voltage protection activation threshold (uover). It is a project-dependent parameter.

DerivedEntities.Name: ProductBid
DerivedEntities.Description: Component of a bid that pertains to one market product.

DerivedEntities.Name: MaterialItem
DerivedEntities.Description: The physical consumable supply used for work and other purposes. It includes items such as nuts, bolts, brackets, glue, etc.

Attributes.Name: quantity
Attributes.Description: Quantity of material used.

DerivedEntities.Name: UsagePointGroup
DerivedEntities.Description: Abstraction for management of group communications within a two-way AMR system or the data for a group of related usage points. Commands can be issued to all of the usage points that belong to a usage point group using a defined group address and the underlying AMR communication infrastructure.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Type of this group.

DerivedEntities.Name: DispatchInstReply
DerivedEntities.Description: Response from registered resource acknowledging receipt of dispatch instructions.

Attributes.Name: clearedMW
Attributes.Description: MW amount associated with instruction.  For 5 minute binding dispatches, this is the Goto MW or DOT

Attributes.Name: startTime
Attributes.Description: start time

Attributes.Name: instructionType
Attributes.Description:
instruction type:

commitment
out of sequence
dispatch

Attributes.Name: certificationName
Attributes.Description:
The Subject DN is the X509 Certificate Subject DN. This is the essentially the certificate name presented by the client. In the case of ADS Certificates, this will be the user name. It may be from an API Client or the MP Client (GUI).

The Subject ID normally includes more than just the user name (Common Name), it can also contain information such as City, Company ID, etc.

Attributes.Name: acceptStatus
Attributes.Description: The accept status submitted by the responder. enumeration type needs to be defined

Attributes.Name: receivedTime
Attributes.Description: Timestamp indicating the time at which the instruction was received.

Attributes.Name: passIndicator
Attributes.Description: The type of run for the market clearing.

Attributes.Name: instructionTime
Attributes.Description: The target date/time for the received instruction.

Attributes.Name: acceptMW
Attributes.Description: The accepted mw amount by the responder. aka response mw.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransformerEnd
DerivedEntities.Description: A conducting connection point of a power transformer. It corresponds to a physical transformer winding terminal.  In earlier CIM versions, the TransformerWinding class served a similar purpose, but this class is more flexible because it associates to terminal but is not a specialization of ConductingEquipment.

DerivedEntities.Name: PowerTransformerEnd
DerivedEntities.Description:
A PowerTransformerEnd is associated with each Terminal of a PowerTransformer.
The impedance values r, r0, x, and x0 of a PowerTransformerEnd represents a star equivalent as follows.
1) for a two Terminal PowerTransformer the high voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=1) PowerTransformerEnd has non zero values on r, r0, x, and x0 while the low voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=2) PowerTransformerEnd has zero values for r, r0, x, and x0.  Parameters are always provided, even if the PowerTransformerEnds have the same rated voltage.
