In this case, the parameters are provided at the PowerTransformerEnd which has TransformerEnd.endNumber equal to 1.
2) for a three Terminal PowerTransformer the three PowerTransformerEnds represent a star equivalent with each leg in the star represented by r, r0, x, and x0 values.
3) For a three Terminal transformer each PowerTransformerEnd shall have g, g0, b and b0 values corresponding to the no load losses distributed on the three PowerTransformerEnds. The total no load loss shunt impedances may also be placed at one of the PowerTransformerEnds, preferably the end numbered 1, having the shunt values on end 1.  This is the preferred way.
4) for a PowerTransformer with more than three Terminals the PowerTransformerEnd impedance values cannot be used. Instead use the TransformerMeshImpedance or split the transformer into multiple PowerTransformers.
Each PowerTransformerEnd must be contained by a PowerTransformer. Because a PowerTransformerEnd (or any other object) can not be contained by more than one parent, a PowerTransformerEnd can not have an association to an EquipmentContainer (Substation, VoltageLevel, etc).

Attributes.Name: g
Attributes.Description: Magnetizing branch conductance.

Attributes.Name: ratedS
Attributes.Description:
Normal apparent power rating.
The attribute shall be a positive value. For a two-winding transformer the values for the high and low voltage sides shall be identical.

Attributes.Name: g0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence magnetizing branch conductance (star-model).

Attributes.Name: b0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence magnetizing branch susceptance.

Attributes.Name: phaseAngleClock
Attributes.Description: Terminal voltage phase angle displacement where 360 degrees are represented with clock hours. The valid values are 0 to 11. For example, for the secondary side end of a transformer with vector group code of 'Dyn11', specify the connection kind as wye with neutral and specify the phase angle of the clock as 11.  The clock value of the transformer end number specified as 1, is assumed to be zero.  Note the transformer end number is not assumed to be the same as the terminal sequence number.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence series reactance (star-model) of the transformer end.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description:
Resistance (star-model) of the transformer end.
The attribute shall be equal to or greater than zero for non-equivalent transformers.

Attributes.Name: r0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence series resistance (star-model) of the transformer end.

Attributes.Name: x0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence series reactance of the transformer end.

Attributes.Name: connectionKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of connection.

Attributes.Name: ratedU
Attributes.Description:
Rated voltage: phase-phase for three-phase windings, and either phase-phase or phase-neutral for single-phase windings.
A high voltage side, as given by TransformerEnd.endNumber, shall have a ratedU that is greater than or equal to ratedU for the lower voltage sides.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: b
Attributes.Description: Magnetizing branch susceptance (B mag).  The value can be positive or negative.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransformerTankEnd
DerivedEntities.Description: Transformer tank end represents an individual winding for unbalanced models or for transformer tanks connected into a bank (and bank is modelled with the PowerTransformer).

Attributes.Name: phases
Attributes.Description: Describes the phases carried by a conducting equipment.

Attributes.Name: rground
Attributes.Description: (for Yn and Zn connections) Resistance part of neutral impedance where 'grounded' is true.

Attributes.Name: magBaseU
Attributes.Description: The reference voltage at which the magnetizing saturation measurements were made.

Attributes.Name: grounded
Attributes.Description: (for Yn and Zn connections) True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

Attributes.Name: bmagSat
Attributes.Description: Core shunt magnetizing susceptance in the saturation region.

Attributes.Name: endNumber
Attributes.Description: Number for this transformer end, corresponding to the end's order in the power transformer vector group or phase angle clock number.  Highest voltage winding should be 1.  Each end within a power transformer should have a unique subsequent end number.   Note the transformer end number need not match the terminal sequence number.

Attributes.Name: xground
Attributes.Description: (for Yn and Zn connections) Reactive part of neutral impedance where 'grounded' is true.

Attributes.Name: magSatFlux
Attributes.Description: Core magnetizing saturation curve knee flux level.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnvironmentalInformation
DerivedEntities.Description: Abstract class (with concrete child classes of Observation and Forecast) that groups phenomenon and/or environmental value sets.

DerivedEntities.Name: Observation
DerivedEntities.Description: Observed (actual non-forecast) values sets and/or phenomena characteristics.

DerivedEntities.Name: Forecast
DerivedEntities.Description: A forecast group of value sets and/or phenomena characteristics.

Attributes.Name: validFor
Attributes.Description: The interval for which the forecast is valid.  For example, a forecast issued now for tomorrow might be valid for the next 2 hours.

Attributes.Name: created
Attributes.Description: The timestamp of when the forecast was created

DerivedEntities.Name: EndDeviceControlType
DerivedEntities.Description: Detailed description for a control produced by an end device. Values in attributes allow for creation of recommended codes to be used for identifying end device controls as follows: <type>.<domain>.<subDomain>.<eventOrAction>.

Attributes.Name: domain
Attributes.Description: High-level nature of the control.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Type of physical device from which the control was created. A value of zero (0) can be used when the source is unknown.

Attributes.Name: eventOrAction
Attributes.Description: The most specific part of this control type. It is mainly in the form of a verb that gives action to the control that just occurred.

Attributes.Name: subDomain
Attributes.Description: More specific nature of the control, as a further sub-categorisation of 'domain'.

DerivedEntities.Name: NetworkModelProjectChangeVersion
DerivedEntities.Description: Describes the status and the planned implementation of the associated change set into the as-built model.    New instances of this class with new identity are instantiated upon changes to the content of this class or changes to the associated change set.  Instances of this class are considered immutable.  The case audit trail can reference this immutable data to exactly reproduce a case.

Attributes.Name: comment
Attributes.Description: A user provided comment describing the changes in this version from the previous version.

Attributes.Name: effectiveDateTime
Attributes.Description: The date/time the change set is included in the model.

Attributes.Name: timeStamp
Attributes.Description: The date/time this version was finalized and thus made immutable.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnergyArea
DerivedEntities.Description: Describes an area having energy production or consumption.  Specializations are intended to support the load allocation function as typically required in energy management systems or planning studies to allocate hypothesized load levels to individual load points for power flow analysis.  Often the energy area can be linked to both measured and forecast load levels.

DerivedEntities.Name: SubLoadArea
DerivedEntities.Description: The class is the second level in a hierarchical structure for grouping of loads for the purpose of load flow load scaling.

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadArea
DerivedEntities.Description: The class is the root or first level in a hierarchical structure for grouping of loads for the purpose of load flow load scaling.

DerivedEntities.Name: VisibilityLayer
DerivedEntities.Description:
Layers are typically used for grouping diagram objects according to themes and scales. Themes are used to display or hide certain information (e.g., lakes, borders), while scales are used for hiding or displaying information depending on the current zoom level (hide text when it is too small to be read, or when it exceeds the screen size). This is also called de-cluttering.
CIM based graphics exchange supports an m:n relationship between diagram objects and layers. The importing system shall convert an m:n case into an appropriate 1:n representation if the importing system does not support m:n.

Attributes.Name: drawingOrder
Attributes.Description: The drawing order for this layer.  The higher the number, the later the layer and the objects within it are rendered.

DerivedEntities.Name: MeterMultiplier
DerivedEntities.Description: Multiplier applied at the meter.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of multiplier.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: Multiplier value.

DerivedEntities.Name: FossilFuel
DerivedEntities.Description: The fossil fuel consumed by the non-nuclear thermal generating unit.   For example, coal, oil, gas, etc.   These are the specific fuels that the generating unit can consume.

Attributes.Name: fuelCost
Attributes.Description: The cost in terms of heat value for the given type of fuel.

Attributes.Name: highBreakpointP
Attributes.Description: The active power output level of the unit at which the given type of fuel is switched on. This fuel (e.g., oil) is sometimes used to supplement the base fuel (e.g., coal) at high active power output levels.

Attributes.Name: fossilFuelType
Attributes.Description: The type of fossil fuel, such as coal, oil, or gas.

Attributes.Name: fuelDispatchCost
Attributes.Description: The cost of fuel used for economic dispatching which includes: fuel cost, transportation cost,  and incremental maintenance cost.

Attributes.Name: fuelEffFactor
Attributes.Description: The efficiency factor for the fuel (per unit) in terms of the effective energy absorbed.

Attributes.Name: fuelHandlingCost
Attributes.Description: Handling and processing cost associated with this fuel.

Attributes.Name: fuelHeatContent
Attributes.Description: The amount of heat per weight (or volume) of the given type of fuel.

Attributes.Name: fuelSulfur
Attributes.Description: The fuel's fraction of pollution credit per unit of heat content.

Attributes.Name: lowBreakpointP
Attributes.Description: The active power output level of the unit at which the given type of fuel is switched off. This fuel (e.g., oil) is sometimes used to stabilize the base fuel (e.g., coal) at low active power output levels.

Attributes.Name: fuelMixture
Attributes.Description: Relative amount of the given type of fuel, when multiple fuels are being consumed.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransformerMeshImpedance
DerivedEntities.Description:
Transformer mesh impedance (Delta-model) between transformer ends.
The typical case is that this class describes the impedance between two transformer ends pair-wise, i.e. the cardinalities at both transformer end associations are 1. However, in cases where two or more transformer ends are modelled the cardinalities are larger than 1.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Resistance between the 'from' and the 'to' end, seen from the 'from' end.

Attributes.Name: r0
Attributes.Description: Zero-sequence resistance between the 'from' and the 'to' end, seen from the 'from' end.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Reactance between the 'from' and the 'to' end, seen from the 'from' end.

Attributes.Name: x0
Attributes.Description: Zero-sequence reactance between the 'from' and the 'to' end, seen from the 'from' end.

DerivedEntities.Name: ProtectiveActionCollection
DerivedEntities.Description: A collection of protective actions to protect the integrity of the power system.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransmissionPath
DerivedEntities.Description: An electrical connection, link, or line consisting of one or more parallel transmission elements between two areas of the interconnected electric systems, or portions thereof. TransmissionCorridor and TransmissionRightOfWay refer to legal aspects. The TransmissionPath refers to the segments between a TransmissionProvider's ServicePoints.

Attributes.Name: availTransferCapability
Attributes.Description: The available transmission capability of a transmission path for the reference direction.

Attributes.Name: totalTransferCapability
Attributes.Description: The total transmission capability of a transmission path in the reference direction.

Attributes.Name: parallelPathFlag
Attributes.Description: Flag which indicates if the transmission path is also a designated interconnection "parallel path".

DerivedEntities.Name: EndDeviceControl
DerivedEntities.Description: Instructs an end device (or an end device group) to perform a specified action.

Attributes.Name: primaryDeviceTiming
Attributes.Description: Timing for the control actions performed on the device identified in the end device control.

Attributes.Name: drProgramLevel
Attributes.Description: Level of a demand response program request, where 0=emergency. Note: Attribute is not defined on DemandResponseProgram as it is not its inherent property (it serves to control it).

Attributes.Name: scheduledInterval
Attributes.Description: (if control has scheduled duration) Date and time interval the control has been scheduled to execute within.

Attributes.Name: reason
Attributes.Description: Reason for the control action that allows to determine how to continue processing. For example, disconnect meter command may require different processing by the receiving system if it has been issued for a network-related reason (protection) or for a payment-related reason.

Attributes.Name: drProgramMandatory
Attributes.Description: Whether a demand response program request is mandatory. Note: Attribute is not defined on DemandResponseProgram as it is not its inherent property (it serves to control it).

Attributes.Name: issuerID
Attributes.Description: Unique identifier of the business entity originating an end device control.

Attributes.Name: priceSignal
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Price signal used as parameter for this end device control.

Attributes.Name: issuerTrackingID
Attributes.Description: Identifier assigned by the initiator (e.g. retail electric provider) of an end device control action to uniquely identify the demand response event, text message, or other subject of the control action. Can be used when cancelling an event or text message request or to identify the originating event or text message in a consequential end device event.

Attributes.Name: secondaryDeviceTiming
Attributes.Description: Timing for the control actions performed by devices that are responding to event related information sent to the primary device indicated in the end device control.  For example, load control actions performed by a PAN device in response to demand response event information sent to a PAN gateway server.

DerivedEntities.Name: ICCPInformationMessage
DerivedEntities.Description: This class represents the TASE.2 Information Message Object.  The IdentifiedObject.name attribute must be non-null.  The value of the attribute shall be used as the TASE.2 Information Reference, as specified by 60870-6-503.

Attributes.Name: localReference
Attributes.Description: The Local Reference attribute specifies a value agreed upon between sender and receiver of the Information Message. It further identifies the Information Message.

Attributes.Name: scope
Attributes.Description: Indicates if the Point is global scoped (e.g. VCC) or accessible only to the Bilateral table peer (e.g. ICC).

DerivedEntities.Name: ProtectiveAction
DerivedEntities.Description: A protective action for supporting the integrity of the power system.

DerivedEntities.Name: ProtectiveActionAdjustment
DerivedEntities.Description: Protective actions on non-switching equipment. The operating condition is adjusted.

Attributes.Name: byValue
Attributes.Description: The adjustment is given in value of the active value.

Attributes.Name: byPercentage
Attributes.Description: The adjustment is given in percent of the active value.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Defines the kind of adjustment that should be done. With this value the correct attribute containing the value needs to be used.

Attributes.Name: reduce
Attributes.Description: If true, the adjusted value is an reduction. Other wise it is an increase in the value.

Attributes.Name: setValue
Attributes.Description: The adjustment is given by a new active value.

DerivedEntities.Name: ProtectiveActionRegulation
DerivedEntities.Description: Protective action to change regulation to Equipment.

Attributes.Name: isRegulating
Attributes.Description: If true the regulator is put in-service, otherwise out-of-service (no regulation).

Attributes.Name: targetValue
Attributes.Description: The target value specified the new case input for the regulator.  The value has the units appropriate to the mode attribute. The protective action does not change the mode attribute.

DerivedEntities.Name: ProtectiveActionEquipment
DerivedEntities.Description: Protective action to put an Equipment in-service/out-of-service.

Attributes.Name: inService
Attributes.Description: If true the equipment is put in-service, otherwise out-of-service.

Attributes.Name: normalEnabled
Attributes.Description: The default/normal value used when other active signal/values are missing.

Attributes.Name: enabled
Attributes.Description: The status of the class set by operation or by signal. Optional field that will override other status fields.

DerivedEntities.Name: EndDeviceGroup
DerivedEntities.Description: Abstraction for management of group communications within a two-way AMR system or the data for a group of related end devices. Commands can be issued to all of the end devices that belong to the group using a defined group address and the underlying AMR communication infrastructure. A DERGroup and a PANDeviceGroup is an EndDeviceGroup.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Type of this group.

DerivedEntities.Name: WirePosition
DerivedEntities.Description: Identification, spacing and configuration of the wires of a conductor with respect to a structure.

Attributes.Name: xCoord
Attributes.Description: Signed horizontal distance from the wire at this position to a common reference point.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Numbering for wires on a WireSpacingInfo. Neutrals should be numbered last.

Attributes.Name: yCoord
Attributes.Description: Signed vertical distance from the wire at this position: above ground (positive value) or burial depth below ground (negative value).

DerivedEntities.Name: EnergySchedulingType
DerivedEntities.Description: Used to define the type of generation for scheduling purposes.

DerivedEntities.Name: OperationalLimit
DerivedEntities.Description:
A value and normal value associated with a specific kind of limit. 
The sub class value and normalValue attributes vary inversely to the associated OperationalLimitType.acceptableDuration (acceptableDuration for short).  
If a particular piece of equipment has multiple operational limits of the same kind (apparent power, current, etc.), the limit with the greatest acceptableDuration shall have the smallest limit value and the limit with the smallest acceptableDuration shall have the largest limit value.  Note: A large current can only be allowed to flow through a piece of equipment for a short duration without causing damage, but a lesser current can be allowed to flow for a longer duration.

DerivedEntities.Name: ApparentPowerLimit
DerivedEntities.Description: Apparent power limit.

Attributes.Name: normalValue
Attributes.Description: The normal apparent power limit. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: The apparent power limit. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

DerivedEntities.Name: CurrentLimit
DerivedEntities.Description: Operational limit on current.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: Limit on current flow. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: normalValue
Attributes.Description: The normal value for limit on current flow. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

DerivedEntities.Name: ActivePowerLimit
DerivedEntities.Description: Limit on active power flow.

Attributes.Name: normalValue
Attributes.Description: The normal value of active power limit. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: Value of active power limit. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

DerivedEntities.Name: VoltageLimit
DerivedEntities.Description:
Operational limit applied to voltage.
The use of operational VoltageLimit is preferred instead of limits defined at VoltageLevel. The operational VoltageLimits are used, if present.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: Limit on voltage. High or low limit nature of the limit depends upon the properties of the operational limit type. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: normalValue
Attributes.Description: The normal limit on voltage. High or low limit nature of the limit depends upon the properties of the operational limit type. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

DerivedEntities.Name: TopologicalIsland
DerivedEntities.Description:
An electrically connected subset of the network. Topological islands can change as the current network state changes, e.g. due to: 
- disconnect switches or breakers changing state in a SCADA/EMS.
- manual creation, change or deletion of topological nodes in a planning tool.
Only energised TopologicalNode-s shall be part of the topological island.

DerivedEntities.Name: Medium
DerivedEntities.Description: A substance that either (1) provides the means of transmission of a force or effect, such as hydraulic fluid, or (2) is used for a surrounding or enveloping substance, such as oil in a transformer or circuit breaker.

Attributes.Name: volumeSpec
Attributes.Description: The volume of the medium specified for this application. Note that the actual volume is a type of measurement associated witht the asset.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of this medium.

DerivedEntities.Name: MeasurementValueSource
DerivedEntities.Description: MeasurementValueSource describes the alternative sources updating a MeasurementValue. User conventions for how to use the MeasurementValueSource attributes are defined in IEC 61970-301.

DerivedEntities.Name: IOPointSource
DerivedEntities.Description: Indicates the point source for an IO Point.

DerivedEntities.Name: AltGeneratingUnitMeas
DerivedEntities.Description: A prioritized measurement to be used for the generating unit in the control area specification.

Attributes.Name: priority
Attributes.Description: Priority of a measurement usage.   Lower numbers have first priority.

DerivedEntities.Name: Contingency
DerivedEntities.Description: An event threatening system reliability, consisting of one or more contingency elements.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktContingency
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC 61970:Contingency.

Attributes.Name: participationFactorSet
Attributes.Description:
Participation Factor flag 
An indication which set of generator participation factors should be used to re-allocate generation in this contingency

Attributes.Name: loadRolloverFlag
Attributes.Description:
load change flag 
Flag that indicates whether load rollover and load pickup should be processed for this contingency

Attributes.Name: screeningFlag
Attributes.Description:
sceening flag for outage 
Flag that indicated whether screening is bypassed for the contingency

Attributes.Name: ltcControlFlag
Attributes.Description:
ltc enable flag 
Flag that indicates if LTCs regulate voltage during the solution of the contingency

Attributes.Name: mustStudy
Attributes.Description: Set true if must study this contingency.

DerivedEntities.Name: WindPlantReactiveControlIEC
DerivedEntities.Description:
Simplified plant voltage and reactive power control model for use with type 3 and type 4 wind turbine models.
Reference: IEC 61400-27-1:2015, Annex D.

Attributes.Name: kiwpxmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum reactive power/voltage reference from integration (KIWPxmax) (> WindPlantReactiveControlIEC.kiwpxmin). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kiwpx
Attributes.Description: Plant Q controller integral gain (KIWPx). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kiwpxmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum reactive power/voltage reference from integration (KIWPxmin) (< WindPlantReactiveControlIEC.kiwpxmax). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: twpqfiltq
Attributes.Description: Filter time constant for reactive power measurement (TWPqfiltq) (>= 0). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: windPlantQcontrolModesType
Attributes.Description: Reactive power/voltage controller mode (MWPqmode). It is a case-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dxrefmin
Attributes.Description: Maximum negative ramp rate for wind turbine reactive power/voltage reference (dxrefmin) (< WindPlantReactiveControlIEC.dxrefmax). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kwpqref
Attributes.Description: Reactive power reference gain (KWPqref). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: twpufiltq
Attributes.Description: Filter time constant for voltage measurement (TWPufiltq) (>= 0). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kwpqu
Attributes.Description: Plant voltage control droop (KWPqu). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: txfv
Attributes.Description: Lag time constant in reference value transfer function (Txfv) (>= 0). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: uwpqdip
Attributes.Description: Voltage threshold for UVRT detection in Q control (uWPqdip). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kpwpx
Attributes.Description: Plant Q controller proportional gain (KPWPx). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: txft
Attributes.Description: Lead time constant in reference value transfer function (Txft) (>= 0). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: xrefmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum xWTref (qWTref or delta uWTref) request from the plant controller (xrefmin) (< WindPlantReactiveControlIEC.xrefmax). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: twppfiltq
Attributes.Description: Filter time constant for active power measurement (TWPpfiltq) (>= 0). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dxrefmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum positive ramp rate for wind turbine reactive power/voltage reference (dxrefmax) (> WindPlantReactiveControlIEC.dxrefmin). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tuqfilt
Attributes.Description: Filter time constant for voltage-dependent reactive power (Tuqfilt) (>= 0). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: xrefmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum xWTref (qWTref or delta uWTref) request from the plant controller (xrefmax) (> WindPlantReactiveControlIEC.xrefmin). It is a case-dependent parameter.

DerivedEntities.Name: OperatingParticipant
DerivedEntities.Description: An operator of multiple power system resource objects. Note multple operating participants may operate the same power system resource object.   This can be used for modeling jointly owned units where each owner operates as a contractual share.

DerivedEntities.Name: BaseFrequency
DerivedEntities.Description: The BaseFrequency class describes a base frequency for a power system network. In case of multiple power networks with different frequencies, e.g. 50 Hz or 60 Hz each network will have its own base frequency class. Hence it is assumed that power system objects having different base frequencies appear in separate documents where each document has a single base frequency instance.

Attributes.Name: frequency
Attributes.Description: The base frequency.

DerivedEntities.Name: Organisation
DerivedEntities.Description: Organisation that might have roles as utility, contractor, supplier, manufacturer, customer, etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: MarketParticipant
DerivedEntities.Description: An identification of a party acting in a electricity market business process. This class is used to identify organizations that can participate in market management and/or market operations.

DerivedEntities.Name: SchedulingCoordinator
DerivedEntities.Description: Market participants could be represented by Scheduling Coordinators (SCs) that are registered with the RTO/ISO. One participant could register multiple SCs with the RTO/ISO. Many market participants can do business with the RTO/ISO using a single SC. One SC could schedule multiple generators. A load scheduling point could be used by multiple SCs. Each SC could schedule load at multiple scheduling points. An inter-tie scheduling point can be used by multiple SCs. Each SC can schedule interchange at multiple inter-tie scheduling points.

Attributes.Name: creditFlag
Attributes.Description: Flag to indicate creditworthiness (Y, N)

Attributes.Name: creditStartEffectiveDate
Attributes.Description: Date that the scheduling coordinator becomes creditworthy.

Attributes.Name: lastModified
Attributes.Description: Indication of the last time this scheduling coordinator information was modified.

Attributes.Name: scid
Attributes.Description: This is the short name or Scheduling Coordinator ID field.

Attributes.Name: qualificationStatus
Attributes.Description: Scheduling coordinator qualification status, Qualified, Not Qualified, or Disqualified.

DerivedEntities.Name: RTO
DerivedEntities.Description: Regional transmission operator.

DerivedEntities.Name: ControlAreaOperator
DerivedEntities.Description: Operates the Control Area. Approves and implements energy transactions. Verifies both Inter-Control Area and Intra-Control Area transactions for the power system  before granting approval (and implementing) the transactions.

DerivedEntities.Name: GenerationProvider
DerivedEntities.Description: The energy seller in the energy marketplace.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransmissionProvider
DerivedEntities.Description: Provider of  the transmission capacity (interconnecting wires between Generation and Consumption) required  to fulfill and Energy Transaction's energy exchange. Posts information for transmission paths and AvailableTransmissionCapacities  on a reservation node.  Buys and sells its products and services on the same reservation node.

DerivedEntities.Name: CustomerConsumer
DerivedEntities.Description: The energy buyer in the energy marketplace.

DerivedEntities.Name: Marketer
DerivedEntities.Description: Matches buyers and sellers, and secures transmission (and other ancillary services) needed to complete the energy transaction.

Attributes.Name: postalAddress
Attributes.Description: Postal address, potentially different than 'streetAddress' (e.g., another city).

Attributes.Name: phone2
Attributes.Description: Additional phone number.

Attributes.Name: phone1
Attributes.Description: Phone number.

Attributes.Name: electronicAddress
Attributes.Description: Electronic address.

Attributes.Name: streetAddress
Attributes.Description: Street address.

DerivedEntities.Name: ProductAssetModel
DerivedEntities.Description: Asset model by a specific manufacturer.

Attributes.Name: corporateStandardKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of corporate standard for this asset model.

Attributes.Name: usageKind
Attributes.Description: Intended usage for this asset model.

Attributes.Name: modelVersion
Attributes.Description: Version number for product model, which indicates vintage of the product.

Attributes.Name: catalogueNumber
Attributes.Description: Catalogue number for asset model.

Attributes.Name: modelNumber
Attributes.Description: Manufacturer's model number.

Attributes.Name: weightTotal
Attributes.Description: Total manufactured weight of asset.

Attributes.Name: styleNumber
Attributes.Description: Style number of asset model.

Attributes.Name: overallLength
Attributes.Description: Overall length of this asset model.

Attributes.Name: drawingNumber
Attributes.Description: Drawing number for asset model.

Attributes.Name: instructionManual
Attributes.Description: Reference manual or instruction book for this asset model.

DerivedEntities.Name: Profile
DerivedEntities.Description: Describes the existence of a profile.  The MRID is usually defined as a static value by the document or artifact that defines the contents of the profile and the rules for using the profile.

DerivedEntities.Name: ConstraintTerm
DerivedEntities.Description: A constraint term is one element of a linear constraint.

DerivedEntities.Name: NodeConstraintTerm
DerivedEntities.Description: To be used only to constrain a quantity that cannot be associated with a terminal. For example, a registered generating unit that is not electrically connected to the network.

DerivedEntities.Name: TerminalConstraintTerm
DerivedEntities.Description: A constraint term associated with a specific terminal on a physical piece of equipment.

Attributes.Name: function
Attributes.Description: The function is an enumerated value that can be 'active', 'reactive', or 'VA' to indicate the type of flow.

DerivedEntities.Name: TopologicalNode
DerivedEntities.Description:
For a detailed substation model a topological node is a set of connectivity nodes that, in the current network state, are connected together through any type of closed switches, including  jumpers. Topological nodes change as the current network state changes (i.e., switches, breakers, etc. change state).
For a planning model, switch statuses are not used to form topological nodes. Instead they are manually created or deleted in a model builder tool. Topological nodes maintained this way are also called "busses".

Attributes.Name: qInjection
Attributes.Description:
The reactive power injected into the bus at this location in addition to injections from equipment. Positive sign means injection into the TopologicalNode (bus).
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Attributes.Name: pInjection
Attributes.Description:
The active power injected into the bus at this location in addition to injections from equipment.  Positive sign means injection into the TopologicalNode (bus).
Starting value for a steady state solution.

DerivedEntities.Name: BusNameMarker
DerivedEntities.Description: Used to apply user standard names to TopologicalNodes. Associated with one or more terminals that are normally connected with the bus name.    The associated terminals are normally connected by non-retained switches. For a ring bus station configuration, all BusbarSection terminals in the ring are typically associated.   For a breaker and a half scheme, both BusbarSections would normally be associated.  For a ring bus, all BusbarSections would normally be associated.  For a "straight" busbar configuration, normally only the main terminal at the BusbarSection would be associated.

Attributes.Name: priority
Attributes.Description: Priority of bus name marker for use as topology bus name.  Use 0 for do not care.  Use 1 for highest priority.  Use 2 as priority is less than 1 and so on.

DerivedEntities.Name: WindMechIEC
DerivedEntities.Description:
Two mass model.
Reference: IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.2.1.

Attributes.Name: hwtr
Attributes.Description: Inertia constant of wind turbine rotor (HWTR) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kdrt
Attributes.Description: Drive train stiffness (kdrt). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: cdrt
Attributes.Description: Drive train damping (cdrt). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: hgen
Attributes.Description: Inertia constant of generator (Hgen) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCNode
DerivedEntities.Description: DC nodes are points where terminals of DC conducting equipment are connected together with zero impedance.

DerivedEntities.Name: WindAeroConstIEC
DerivedEntities.Description:
Constant aerodynamic torque model which assumes that the aerodynamic torque is constant.
Reference: IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.1.1.

DerivedEntities.Name: ModelOperationSequence
DerivedEntities.Description: A concrete sequence of operations.    For example, this may be used to describe a specific audit trail, a script or other specific set of actions on specific datasets.

DerivedEntities.Name: WindPlantFreqPcontrolIEC
DerivedEntities.Description:
Frequency and active power controller model.
Reference: IEC 61400-27-1:2015, Annex D.

Attributes.Name: tpfv
Attributes.Description: Lag time constant in reference value transfer function (Tpfv) (>= 0). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dpwprefmin
Attributes.Description: Maximum negative ramp rate for wind plant power reference (dpWPrefmin) (< WindPlantFreqPcontrolIEC.dpwprefmax). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dprefmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum ramp rate of pWTref request from the plant controller to the wind turbines (dprefmax) (> WindPlantFreqPcontrolIEC.dprefmin). It is a case-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kwppref
Attributes.Description: Power reference gain (KWPpref). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: prefmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum pWTref request from the plant controller to the wind turbines (prefmin) (< WindPlantFreqPcontrolIEC.prefmax). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kiwppmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum PI integrator term (KIWPpmax) (> WindPlantFreqPcontrolIEC.kiwppmin). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dpwprefmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum positive ramp rate for wind plant power reference (dpWPrefmax) (> WindPlantFreqPcontrolIEC.dpwprefmin). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dprefmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum (negative) ramp rate of pWTref request from the plant controller to the wind turbines (dprefmin) (< WindPlantFreqPcontrolIEC.dprefmax). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kiwppmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum PI integrator term (KIWPpmin) (< WindPlantFreqPcontrolIEC.kiwppmax). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: twppfiltp
Attributes.Description: Filter time constant for active power measurement (TWPpfiltp) (>= 0). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kiwpp
Attributes.Description: Plant P controller integral gain (KIWPp). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kpwpp
Attributes.Description: Plant P controller proportional gain (KPWPp). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: prefmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum pWTref request from the plant controller to the wind turbines (prefmax) (> WindPlantFreqPcontrolIEC.prefmin). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: twpffiltp
Attributes.Description: Filter time constant for frequency measurement (TWPffiltp) (>= 0). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tpft
Attributes.Description: Lead time constant in reference value transfer function (Tpft) (>= 0). It is a project-dependent parameter.

DerivedEntities.Name: IOPoint
DerivedEntities.Description: The class describe a measurement or control value. The purpose is to enable having attributes and associations common for measurement and control.

DerivedEntities.Name: MeasurementValue
DerivedEntities.Description: The current state for a measurement. A state value is an instance of a measurement from a specific source. Measurements can be associated with many state values, each representing a different source for the measurement.

DerivedEntities.Name: AnalogValue
DerivedEntities.Description: AnalogValue represents an analog MeasurementValue.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: The value to supervise.

DerivedEntities.Name: BaseReading
DerivedEntities.Description: Common representation for reading values. Note that a reading value may have multiple qualities, as produced by various systems ('ReadingQuality.source').

DerivedEntities.Name: IntervalReading
DerivedEntities.Description:
Data captured at regular intervals of time. Interval data could be captured as incremental data, absolute data, or relative data. The source for the data is usually a tariff quantity or an engineering quantity. Data is typically captured in time-tagged, uniform, fixed-length intervals of 5 min, 10 min, 15 min, 30 min, or 60 min.
Note: Interval Data is sometimes also called "Interval Data Readings" (IDR).

DerivedEntities.Name: Reading
DerivedEntities.Description: Specific value measured by a meter or other asset, or calculated by a system. Each Reading is associated with a specific ReadingType.

Attributes.Name: reason
Attributes.Description: Reason for this reading being taken.

Attributes.Name: position
Attributes.Description: A sequential value representing the relative position within a given time interval.

Attributes.Name: valueMissing
Attributes.Description: The indication of whether or not the quantity of this reading is missing.

Attributes.Name: source
Attributes.Description: System that originally supplied the reading (e.g., customer, AMI system, handheld reading system, another enterprise system, etc.).

Attributes.Name: reportedDateTime
Attributes.Description: (used only when there are detailed auditing requirements) Date and time at which the reading was first delivered to the metering system.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: Value of this reading.

Attributes.Name: timePeriod
Attributes.Description: Start and end of the period for those readings whose type has a time attribute such as 'billing', seasonal' or 'forTheSpecifiedPeriod'.

DerivedEntities.Name: StringMeasurementValue
DerivedEntities.Description: StringMeasurementValue represents a measurement value of type string.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnvironmentalCodedValue
DerivedEntities.Description: An environmental value described using a coded value. A triplicate of enumerated values representing intensity, coverage, type of weather is used. These may be concatenated into the string value.

Attributes.Name: coverageKind
Attributes.Description: Code representing the coverage of the weather condition.

Attributes.Name: weatherKind
Attributes.Description: Code representing the type of weather condition.

Attributes.Name: intensityKind
Attributes.Description: Code representing the intensity of the weather condition.

Attributes.Name: probabilityPercent
Attributes.Description: Probability of weather condition occurring during the time interval expressed as a percentage. Applicable only when weather condition is related to a forecast (not an observation).

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: The value to supervise.

DerivedEntities.Name: DiscreteValue
DerivedEntities.Description: DiscreteValue represents a discrete MeasurementValue.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: The value to supervise.

DerivedEntities.Name: AccumulatorValue
DerivedEntities.Description: AccumulatorValue represents an accumulated (counted) MeasurementValue.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: The value to supervise. The value is positive.

Attributes.Name: timeStamp
Attributes.Description: The time when the value was last updated.

Attributes.Name: sensorAccuracy
Attributes.Description: The limit, expressed as a percentage of the sensor maximum, that errors will not exceed when the sensor is used under  reference conditions.

DerivedEntities.Name: Control
DerivedEntities.Description: Control is used for supervisory/device control. It represents control outputs that are used to change the state in a process, e.g. close or open breaker, a set point value or a raise lower command.

DerivedEntities.Name: AnalogControl
DerivedEntities.Description: An analog control used for supervisory control.

DerivedEntities.Name: RaiseLowerCommand
DerivedEntities.Description: An analog control that increases or decreases a set point value with pulses. Unless otherwise specified, one pulse moves the set point by one.

DerivedEntities.Name: SetPoint
DerivedEntities.Description: An analog control that issues a set point value.

Attributes.Name: normalValue
Attributes.Description: Normal value for Control.value e.g. used for percentage scaling.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: The value representing the actuator output.

Attributes.Name: maxValue
Attributes.Description: Normal value range maximum for any of the Control.value. Used for scaling, e.g. in bar graphs.

Attributes.Name: minValue
Attributes.Description: Normal value range minimum for any of the Control.value. Used for scaling, e.g. in bar graphs.

DerivedEntities.Name: Command
DerivedEntities.Description: A Command is a discrete control used for supervisory control.

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: The value representing the actuator output.

Attributes.Name: normalValue
Attributes.Description: Normal value for Control.value e.g. used for percentage scaling.

DerivedEntities.Name: AccumulatorReset
DerivedEntities.Description: This command resets the counter value to zero.

Attributes.Name: operationInProgress
Attributes.Description: Indicates that a client is currently sending control commands that has not completed.

Attributes.Name: timeStamp
Attributes.Description: The last time a control output was sent.

Attributes.Name: unitMultiplier
Attributes.Description: The unit multiplier of the controlled quantity.

Attributes.Name: controlType
Attributes.Description: Specifies the type of Control, e.g. BreakerOn/Off, GeneratorVoltageSetPoint, TieLineFlow etc. The ControlType.name shall be unique among all specified types and describe the type.

Attributes.Name: unitSymbol
Attributes.Description: The unit of measure of the controlled quantity.

DerivedEntities.Name: ModelOperation
DerivedEntities.Description: An operation performed on models.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Sequence number within a operation sequence, lower is first.   Normally starts with 1.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssemblyDescription
DerivedEntities.Description: A description for how to assemble model parts for a specific purpose.

DerivedEntities.Name: ModelOperationArgDescription
DerivedEntities.Description: The type of custom operation dataset role for an operation description.

Attributes.Name: multiplicityMinimum
Attributes.Description: The minimum multiplicity of the instance arguments that should be supplied for a single operation.     Use zero to indicate optional.

Attributes.Name: multiplicityMaximum
Attributes.Description: The maximum multiplicity of the instance arguments that should be supplied for a single operation.     Use -1 to indicate unlimited.

DerivedEntities.Name: DiagramObjectStyle
DerivedEntities.Description: A reference to a style used by the originating system for a diagram object.  A diagram object style describes information such as line thickness, shape such as circle or rectangle etc, and colour.

DerivedEntities.Name: ReportingSuperGroup
DerivedEntities.Description: A reporting super group, groups reporting groups for a higher level report.

DerivedEntities.Name: ReportingGroup
DerivedEntities.Description: A reporting group is used for various ad-hoc groupings used for reporting.

DerivedEntities.Name: DiagramStyle
DerivedEntities.Description: The diagram style refers to a style used by the originating system for a diagram.  A diagram style describes information such as schematic, geographic, etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: DiagramObject
DerivedEntities.Description: An object that defines one or more points in a given space. This object can be associated with anything that specializes IdentifiedObject. For single line diagrams such objects typically include such items as analog values, breakers, disconnectors, power transformers, and transmission lines.

DerivedEntities.Name: TextDiagramObject
DerivedEntities.Description: A diagram object for placing free-text or text derived from an associated domain object.

Attributes.Name: text
Attributes.Description: The text that is displayed by this text diagram object.

Attributes.Name: offsetY
Attributes.Description:
The offset in the Y direction. This is used for defining the offset from centre for rendering an icon (the default is that a single point specifies the centre of the icon).

The offset is in per-unit with 0 indicating there is no offset from the vertical centre of the icon.  The offset direction is dependent on the orientation of the diagram, with -0.5 and 0.5 indicating an offset of +/- 50% on the vertical axis.

Attributes.Name: offsetX
Attributes.Description:
The offset in the X direction. This is used for defining the offset from centre for rendering an icon (the default is that a single point specifies the centre of the icon).

The offset is in per-unit with 0 indicating there is no offset from the horizontal centre of the icon.  -0.5 indicates it is offset by 50% to the left and 0.5 indicates an offset of 50% to the right.

Attributes.Name: rotation
Attributes.Description:
Sets the angle of rotation of the diagram object.  Zero degrees is pointing to the top of the diagram.  Rotation is clockwise.  DiagramObject.rotation=0 has the following meaning: The connection point of an element which has one terminal is pointing to the top side of the diagram. The connection point "From side" of an element which has more than one terminal is pointing to the top side of the diagram.
DiagramObject.rotation=90 has the following meaning: The connection point of an element which has one terminal is pointing to the right hand side of the diagram. The connection point "From side" of an element which has more than one terminal is pointing to the right hand side of the diagram.

Attributes.Name: drawingOrder
Attributes.Description: The drawing order of this element. The higher the number, the later the element is drawn in sequence. This is used to ensure that elements that overlap are rendered in the correct order.

Attributes.Name: isPolygon
Attributes.Description: Defines whether or not the diagram objects points define the boundaries of a polygon or the routing of a polyline. If this value is true then a receiving application should consider the first and last points to be connected.

DerivedEntities.Name: MPMTestCategory
DerivedEntities.Description: Provides a reference to the Market Power Mitigation test identifiers and methods for the results of the DA or RT markets. Specific data is the test identifier (Price, Conduct, or Impact) and the test method (System MPM, Local MPM, Alternate System MPM, or Alternate Local MPM).

Attributes.Name: purposeFlag
Attributes.Description:
Nature of threshold data:
'M' - Mitigation threshold
'R' - Reporting threshold

Attributes.Name: testMethod
Attributes.Description: The method of performing the market power monitoring. Examples are Normal (default) thresholds or Alternate thresholds.

Attributes.Name: testIdentifier
Attributes.Description:
1 - Global Price Test
2 - Global Conduct Test
3 - Global Impact Test
4 - Local Price Test
5 - Local Conduct Test
6 - Local Impact Test

DerivedEntities.Name: RatioTapChangerTable
DerivedEntities.Description: Describes a curve for how the voltage magnitude and impedance varies with the tap step.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetInfo
DerivedEntities.Description:
Set of attributes of an asset, representing typical datasheet information of a physical device that can be instantiated and shared in different data exchange contexts:
- as attributes of an asset instance (installed or in stock)
- as attributes of an asset model (product by a manufacturer)
- as attributes of a type asset (generic type of an asset as used in designs/extension planning).

DerivedEntities.Name: CurrentTransformerInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Properties of current transformer asset.

Attributes.Name: kneePointCurrent
Attributes.Description: Maximum primary current where the CT still displays linear characteristicts.

Attributes.Name: nominalRatio
Attributes.Description: Nominal ratio between the primary and secondary current; i.e. 100:5.

Attributes.Name: coreCount
Attributes.Description: Number of cores.

Attributes.Name: maxRatio
Attributes.Description: Maximum ratio between the primary and secondary current.

Attributes.Name: secondaryFlsRating
Attributes.Description: Full load secondary (FLS) rating for secondary winding.

Attributes.Name: accuracyClass
Attributes.Description: CT accuracy classification.

Attributes.Name: accuracyLimit
Attributes.Description: Accuracy limit.

Attributes.Name: secondaryRatio
Attributes.Description: Ratio for the secondary winding tap changer.

Attributes.Name: kneePointVoltage
Attributes.Description: Maximum voltage across the secondary terminals where the CT still displays linear characteristicts.

Attributes.Name: usage
Attributes.Description: Usage: eg. metering, protection, etc.

Attributes.Name: primaryFlsRating
Attributes.Description: Full load secondary (FLS) rating for primary winding.

Attributes.Name: ratedCurrent
Attributes.Description: Rated current on the primary side.

Attributes.Name: primaryRatio
Attributes.Description: Ratio for the primary winding tap changer.

Attributes.Name: tertiaryRatio
Attributes.Description: Ratio for the tertiary winding tap changer.

Attributes.Name: tertiaryFlsRating
Attributes.Description: Full load secondary (FLS) rating for tertiary winding.

DerivedEntities.Name: SurgeArresterInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Properties of surge arrester.

Attributes.Name: continuousOperatingVoltage
Attributes.Description: Maximum continuous power frequency voltage allowed on the surge arrester.

Attributes.Name: pressureReliefClass
Attributes.Description: Fault current level at which all parts of the failed arrester lie within a circle prescribed by IEC 60099.

Attributes.Name: ratedVoltage
Attributes.Description: The temporary overvoltage (TOV) level at power frequency that the surge arrester withstands for 10 seconds.

Attributes.Name: switchingImpulseDischargeVoltage
Attributes.Description: Residual voltage during a current impulse with front time of at least 30 microseconds, and magnitude specified in IEC 60099 for the line discharge class. Does not apply to line discharge class 0.

Attributes.Name: isPolymer
Attributes.Description: If true, the arrester has a polymer housing, porcelain otherwise.

Attributes.Name: lightningImpulseDischargeVoltage
Attributes.Description: Residual voltage during an 8x20 microsecond current impulse at the nominal discharge current level.

Attributes.Name: nominalDischargeCurrent
Attributes.Description: The lightning discharge current used to classify the arrester. Choices are limited to 1.5, 2.5, 5, 10, and 20 kA by IEC 60099.

Attributes.Name: steepFrontDischargeVoltage
Attributes.Description: Residual voltage during a current impulse with front time of 1 microsecond, and magnitude equal to the nominal discharge current level.

Attributes.Name: lineDischargeClass
Attributes.Description: Determines the arrester energy discharge capability.  Choices are limited to 0 (none) through 5 (highest) by IEC 60099. Classes 1..3 require a 10-kA nominal discharge current. Classes 4..5 require a 20-kA nominal discharge current. Lower nominal discharge currents must use class 0.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransformerEndInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Transformer end data.

Attributes.Name: windingInsulationKind
Attributes.Description: Type of insultation used for transformer windings.

Attributes.Name: solidInsulationWeight
Attributes.Description: Weight of solid insultation in transformer.

Attributes.Name: dayOverLoadRating
Attributes.Description: Overload rating for 24 hours.

Attributes.Name: hourOverLoadRating
Attributes.Description: Overload rating for 1 hour.

Attributes.Name: connectionKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of connection.

Attributes.Name: phaseAngleClock
Attributes.Description: Winding phase angle where 360 degrees are represented with clock hours, so the valid values are {0, ..., 11}. For example, to express the second winding in code 'Dyn11', set attributes as follows: 'endNumber'=2, 'connectionKind' = Yn and 'phaseAngleClock' = 11.

Attributes.Name: insulationU
Attributes.Description: Basic insulation level voltage rating.

Attributes.Name: ratedU
Attributes.Description: Rated voltage: phase-phase for three-phase windings, and either phase-phase or phase-neutral for single-phase windings.

Attributes.Name: ratedS
Attributes.Description: Normal apparent power rating.

Attributes.Name: endNumber
Attributes.Description: Number for this transformer end, corresponding to the end's order in the PowerTransformer.vectorGroup attribute. Highest voltage winding should be 1.

Attributes.Name: emergencyS
Attributes.Description: Apparent power that the winding can carry under emergency conditions (also called long-term emergency power).

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: DC resistance.

Attributes.Name: shortTermS
Attributes.Description: Apparent power that this winding can carry for a short period of time (in emergency).

DerivedEntities.Name: FaultIndicatorInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Parameters of fault indicator asset.

Attributes.Name: resetKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of reset mechanisim of this fault indicator.

DerivedEntities.Name: PotentialTransformerInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Properties of potential transformer asset.

Attributes.Name: tertiaryRatio
Attributes.Description: Ratio for the tertiary winding tap changer.

Attributes.Name: secondaryRatio
Attributes.Description: Ratio for the secondary winding tap changer.

Attributes.Name: primaryRatio
Attributes.Description: Ratio for the primary winding tap changer.

Attributes.Name: ratedVoltage
Attributes.Description: Rated voltage on the primary side.

DerivedEntities.Name: EndDeviceInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: End device data.

Attributes.Name: phaseCount
Attributes.Description: Number of potential phases the end device supports, typically 0, 1 or 3.

Attributes.Name: ratedVoltage
Attributes.Description: Rated voltage.

Attributes.Name: isSolidState

Attributes.Name: ctRatio

Attributes.Name: ganged

Attributes.Name: initOpMode

Attributes.Name: interruptingRating
Attributes.Description: Breaking capacity, or short circuit rating, is the maximum rated current which the device can safely interrupt at the rated voltage.

Attributes.Name: ratedVoltage

Attributes.Name: kind

Attributes.Name: switchStateCount
Attributes.Description: Number of switch states represented by the composite switch.

Attributes.Name: phaseCode

Attributes.Name: remote

Attributes.Name: ratedVoltage

Attributes.Name: ratedCurrent

DerivedEntities.Name: TapeShieldCableInfo

Attributes.Name: tapeLap
