Attributes.Name: tapeThickness
Attributes.Description: Thickness of the tape shield, before wrapping.

Attributes.Name: diameterOverInsulation
Attributes.Description: Diameter over the insulating layer, excluding outer screen.

Attributes.Name: diameterOverJacket
Attributes.Description: Diameter over the outermost jacketing layer.

Attributes.Name: outerJacketKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of outer jacket of this cable.

Attributes.Name: shieldMaterial
Attributes.Description: Material of the shield.

Attributes.Name: sheathAsNeutral
Attributes.Description: True if sheath / shield is used as a neutral (i.e., bonded).

Attributes.Name: diameterOverCore
Attributes.Description: Diameter over the core, including any semi-con screen; should be the insulating layer's inside diameter.

Attributes.Name: isStrandFill
Attributes.Description: True if wire strands are extruded in a way to fill the voids in the cable.

Attributes.Name: diameterOverScreen
Attributes.Description: Diameter over the outer screen; should be the shield's inside diameter.

Attributes.Name: constructionKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of construction of this cable.

Attributes.Name: nominalTemperature
Attributes.Description: Maximum nominal design operating temperature.

Attributes.Name: coreRadius
Attributes.Description: (if there is a different core material) Radius of the central core.

Attributes.Name: rAC25
Attributes.Description: AC resistance per unit length of the conductor at 25 C.

Attributes.Name: gmr
Attributes.Description: Geometric mean radius. If we replace the conductor by a thin walled tube of radius GMR, then its reactance is identical to the reactance of the actual conductor.

Attributes.Name: insulationMaterial
Attributes.Description: (if insulated conductor) Material used for insulation.

Attributes.Name: rAC50
Attributes.Description: AC resistance per unit length of the conductor at 50 C.

Attributes.Name: coreStrandCount
Attributes.Description: (if used) Number of strands in the steel core.

Attributes.Name: insulated
Attributes.Description: True if conductor is insulated.

Attributes.Name: radius
Attributes.Description: Outside radius of the wire.

Attributes.Name: insulationThickness
Attributes.Description: (if insulated conductor) Thickness of the insulation.

Attributes.Name: material
Attributes.Description: Conductor material.

Attributes.Name: ratedCurrent
Attributes.Description: Current carrying capacity of the wire under stated thermal conditions.

Attributes.Name: strandCount
Attributes.Description: Number of strands in the conductor.

Attributes.Name: sizeDescription
Attributes.Description: Describes the wire gauge or cross section (e.g., 4/0, #2, 336.5).

Attributes.Name: rAC75
Attributes.Description: AC resistance per unit length of the conductor at 75 C.

Attributes.Name: rDC20
Attributes.Description: DC resistance per unit length of the conductor at 20 C.

DerivedEntities.Name: BushingInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Bushing datasheet information.

Attributes.Name: c2Capacitance
Attributes.Description: Factory measured capacitance measured between the power factor tap and ground.

Attributes.Name: c1PowerFactor
Attributes.Description: Factory measured insulation power factor, measured between the power factor tap and the bushing conductor.

Attributes.Name: c2PowerFactor
Attributes.Description: Factory measured insulation power factor, measured between the power factor tap and ground.

Attributes.Name: ratedVoltage
Attributes.Description: Rated voltage. Can be referred to as Um, system voltage or class on bushing nameplate.

Attributes.Name: insulationKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of insulation.

Attributes.Name: c1Capacitance
Attributes.Description: Factory measured capacitance, measured between the power factor tap and the bushing conductor.

Attributes.Name: ratedCurrent
Attributes.Description: Rated current for bushing as installed.

Attributes.Name: ratedImpulseWithstandVoltage
Attributes.Description: Rated impulse withstand voltage, also known as BIL (Basic Impulse Level).

Attributes.Name: ratedLineToGroundVoltage
Attributes.Description: Rated line-to-ground voltage. Also referred to as Uy on bushing nameplate.

DerivedEntities.Name: SwitchInfo
DerivedEntities.Description:
<was Switch data.>
Switch datasheet information.

DerivedEntities.Name: OldSwitchInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Properties of switch assets.

DerivedEntities.Name: BreakerInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Properties of breaker assets.

Attributes.Name: phaseTrip
Attributes.Description: Phase trip rating.

DerivedEntities.Name: RecloserInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Properties of recloser assets.

Attributes.Name: groundTripNormalEnabled
Attributes.Description: True if normal status of ground trip is enabled.

Attributes.Name: groundTripCapable
Attributes.Description: True if device has ground trip capability.

Attributes.Name: phaseTripRating
Attributes.Description: Phase trip rating.

Attributes.Name: groundTripRating
Attributes.Description: Ground trip rating.

Attributes.Name: recloseLockoutCount
Attributes.Description: Total number of phase reclose operations.

Attributes.Name: remote
Attributes.Description: True if device is capable of being operated by remote control.

Attributes.Name: makingCapacity
Attributes.Description: The highest value of current the switch can make at the rated voltage under specified operating conditions without suffering significant deterioration of its performance.

Attributes.Name: minimumCurrent
Attributes.Description: The lowest value of current that the switch can make, carry and break in uninterrupted duty at the rated voltage under specified operating conditions without suffering significant deterioration of its performance.

Attributes.Name: dielectricStrength
Attributes.Description: The maximum rms voltage that may be applied across an open contact without breaking down the dielectric properties of the switch in the open position.

Attributes.Name: withstandCurrent
Attributes.Description: The highest value of current the switch can carry in the closed position at the rated voltage under specified operating conditions without suffering significant deterioration of its performance.

Attributes.Name: loadBreak
Attributes.Description: True if switch has load breaking capabiity. Unless specified false, this is always assumed to be true for breakers and reclosers.

Attributes.Name: poleCount
Attributes.Description: Number of poles (i.e. of current carrying conductors that are switched).

Attributes.Name: ratedImpulseWithstandVoltage
Attributes.Description: Rated impulse withstand voltage, also known as BIL (Basic Impulse Level).

Attributes.Name: lowPressureLockOut
Attributes.Description: Gas or air pressure below which the breaker will not open.

Attributes.Name: lowPressureAlarm
Attributes.Description: Gas or air pressure at or below which a low pressure alarm is generated.

Attributes.Name: ratedCurrent
Attributes.Description: Rated current.

Attributes.Name: oilVolumePerTank
Attributes.Description: Volume of oil in each tank of bulk oil breaker.

Attributes.Name: ratedFrequency
Attributes.Description: Frequency for which switch is rated.

Attributes.Name: ratedVoltage
Attributes.Description: Rated voltage.

Attributes.Name: gasWeightPerTank
Attributes.Description: Weight of gas in each tank of SF6 dead tank breaker.

Attributes.Name: breakingCapacity
Attributes.Description: The maximum fault current a breaking device can break safely under prescribed conditions of use.

Attributes.Name: isSinglePhase
Attributes.Description: If true, it is a single phase switch.

Attributes.Name: isUnganged
Attributes.Description: If true, the switch is not ganged (i.e., a switch phase may be operated separately from other phases).

Attributes.Name: ratedInterruptingTime
Attributes.Description: Switch rated interrupting time in seconds.

DerivedEntities.Name: WireSpacingInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Wire spacing data that associates multiple wire positions with the line segment, and allows to calculate line segment impedances. Number of phases can be derived from the number of associated wire positions whose phase is not neutral.

Attributes.Name: isCable
Attributes.Description: If true, this spacing data describes a cable.

Attributes.Name: phaseWireCount
Attributes.Description: Number of wire sub-conductors in the symmetrical bundle (typically between 1 and 4).

Attributes.Name: phaseWireSpacing
Attributes.Description: Distance between wire sub-conductors in a symmetrical bundle.

Attributes.Name: usage
Attributes.Description: Usage of the associated wires.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransformerTankInfo
DerivedEntities.Description: Set of transformer tank data, from an equipment library.

Attributes.Name: constructionKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of construction for this transformer.

Attributes.Name: coreKind
Attributes.Description: Core kind of this transformer product.

Attributes.Name: function
Attributes.Description: Function of this transformer.

Attributes.Name: neutralBIL
Attributes.Description: Basic insulation level of neutral.

Attributes.Name: oilPreservationKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of oil preservation system.

Attributes.Name: coreCoilsWeight
Attributes.Description: Weight of core and coils in transformer.

DerivedEntities.Name: Diagram
DerivedEntities.Description: The diagram being exchanged. The coordinate system is a standard Cartesian coordinate system and the orientation attribute defines the orientation. The initial view related attributes can be used to specify an initial view with the x,y coordinates of the diagonal points.

Attributes.Name: x2InitialView
Attributes.Description: X coordinate of the second corner of the initial view.

Attributes.Name: orientation
Attributes.Description: Coordinate system orientation of the diagram. A positive orientation gives standard right-hand orientation, with negative orientation indicating a left-hand orientation. For 2D diagrams, a positive orientation will result in X values increasing from left to right and Y values increasing from bottom to top. A negative orientation gives the left-hand orientation (favoured by computer graphics displays) with X values increasing from left to right and Y values increasing from top to bottom.

Attributes.Name: x1InitialView
Attributes.Description: X coordinate of the first corner of the initial view.

Attributes.Name: y2InitialView
Attributes.Description: Y coordinate of the second corner of the initial view.

Attributes.Name: y1InitialView
Attributes.Description: Y coordinate of the first corner of the initial view.

DerivedEntities.Name: Fault
DerivedEntities.Description: Abnormal condition causing current flow through conducting equipment, such as caused by equipment failure or short circuits from objects not typically modelled (for example, a tree falling on a line).

DerivedEntities.Name: LineFault
DerivedEntities.Description: A fault that occurs on an AC line segment at some point along the length.

Attributes.Name: lengthFromTerminal1
Attributes.Description: The length to the place where the fault is located starting from terminal with sequence number 1 of the faulted line segment.

DerivedEntities.Name: EquipmentFault
DerivedEntities.Description: A fault applied at the terminal, external to the equipment. This class is not used to specify faults internal to the equipment.

Attributes.Name: impedance
Attributes.Description: Fault impedance. Its usage is described by 'kind'.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: The kind of phase fault.

Attributes.Name: occurredDateTime
Attributes.Description: The date and time at which the fault occurred.

Attributes.Name: phases
Attributes.Description: The phases participating in the fault. The fault connections into these phases are further specified by the type of fault.

DerivedEntities.Name: BranchGroup
DerivedEntities.Description: A group of branch terminals whose directed flow summation is to be monitored. A branch group need not form a cutset of the network.

Attributes.Name: minimumActivePower
Attributes.Description: The minimum active power flow.

Attributes.Name: monitorActivePower
Attributes.Description: Monitor the active power flow.

Attributes.Name: maximumActivePower
Attributes.Description: The maximum active power flow.

Attributes.Name: minimumReactivePower
Attributes.Description: The minimum reactive power flow.

Attributes.Name: maximumReactivePower
Attributes.Description: The maximum reactive power flow.

Attributes.Name: monitorReactivePower
Attributes.Description: Monitor the reactive power flow.

DerivedEntities.Name: MetrologyRequirement
DerivedEntities.Description: A specification of the metering requirements for a particular point within a network.

Attributes.Name: reason
Attributes.Description: Reason for this metrology requirement being specified.

DerivedEntities.Name: Channel
DerivedEntities.Description: A single path for the collection or reporting of register values over a period of time. For example, a register which measures forward energy can have two channels, one providing bulk quantity readings and the other providing interval readings of a fixed interval size.

Attributes.Name: isVirtual
Attributes.Description: If true, the data is being calculated by an enterprise system rather than metered directly.

DerivedEntities.Name: TriggerCondition
DerivedEntities.Description: A conditions that can trigger remedial actions.

DerivedEntities.Name: Stage
DerivedEntities.Description: Stage of a remedial action scheme.

Attributes.Name: priority
Attributes.Description: The priority of the stage.   0 = don t care (default) 1 = highest priority. 2 is less than 1 and so on. A stage with higher priority needs be activated before a lower stage can be activated.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransferInterface
DerivedEntities.Description: A Transfer Interface is made up of branches such as transmission lines and transformers.

DerivedEntities.Name: ResourceGroupReq
DerivedEntities.Description: Ancillary service requirements for a market.

DerivedEntities.Name: ReserveReq
DerivedEntities.Description: Requirements for minimum amount of reserve and/or regulation to be supplied by a set of qualified resources.

DerivedEntities.Name: ServiceCategory
DerivedEntities.Description: Category of service provided to the customer.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of service.

DerivedEntities.Name: AlertTypeList
DerivedEntities.Description:
A named list of alert types.
Note:  the name of the list is reflected in the .name attribute (inherited from IdentifiedObject).

Attributes.Name: version
Attributes.Description: The version of the named list of alert types.

DerivedEntities.Name: TimePoint
DerivedEntities.Description: A point in time within a sequence of points in time relative to a time schedule.

Attributes.Name: dateTime
Attributes.Description: Absolute date and time for this time point. For calendar-based time point, it is typically manually entered, while for interval-based or sequence-based time point it is derived.

Attributes.Name: window
Attributes.Description: Interval defining the window of time that this time point is valid (for example, seasonal, only on weekends, not on weekends, only 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, etc.).

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: (if sequence-based) Relative sequence number for this time point.

Attributes.Name: relativeTimeInterval
Attributes.Description: (if interval-based) A point in time relative to scheduled start time in 'TimeSchedule.scheduleInterval.start'.

Attributes.Name: status
Attributes.Description: Status of this time point.

DerivedEntities.Name: OrgResOwnership
DerivedEntities.Description: This class model the ownership percent and type of ownership between resource and organisation.

Attributes.Name: asscType
Attributes.Description: association type for the association between Organisation and Resource:

Attributes.Name: masterSchedulingCoordinatorFlag
Attributes.Description: Flag to indicate that the SC representing the Resource is the Master SC.

Attributes.Name: ownershipPercent
Attributes.Description: ownership percentage for each resource

DerivedEntities.Name: Hazard
DerivedEntities.Description: An object or a condition that is a danger for causing loss or perils to an asset and/or people.

DerivedEntities.Name: AssetLocationHazard
DerivedEntities.Description: Potential hazard related to the location of an asset. Examples are trees growing under overhead power lines, a park being located by a substation (i.e., children climb fence to recover a ball), a lake near an overhead distribution line (fishing pole/line contacting power lines), dangerous neighbour, etc.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of hazard.

DerivedEntities.Name: IncidentHazard
DerivedEntities.Description: Hazardous situation associated with an incident. Examples are line down, gas leak, fire, etc.

Attributes.Name: status
Attributes.Description: Status of this hazard.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Type of this hazard.

DerivedEntities.Name: ModelOperationDescription
DerivedEntities.Description: The type of model operation.   This class is referenced by model operations and defines the kind of operation.

DerivedEntities.Name: ClassificationCondition
DerivedEntities.Description: A classification condition used to define preconditions that must be met by a phenomena classification.

Attributes.Name: duration
Attributes.Description: The duration of the of the condition in seconds

Attributes.Name: test
Attributes.Description: The test applied to the value.

DerivedEntities.Name: NetworkModelProjectRelationship
DerivedEntities.Description: A relationship that assists humans and software building cases by assembling project changes in the correct sequence.  This class may be specialized to create specific types of relationships.

DerivedEntities.Name: ProjectDependency
DerivedEntities.Description: Project A change sets should be applied before Project B during case creation.

DerivedEntities.Name: ProjectAlternative
DerivedEntities.Description:
Project B is an alternative to project A.  Project A is the primary alternative.
Multiple project alternatives should not be selected into a single network study case.

DerivedEntities.Name: LimitSet
DerivedEntities.Description: Specifies a set of Limits that are associated with a Measurement. A Measurement may have several LimitSets corresponding to seasonal or other changing conditions. The condition is captured in the name and description attributes. The same LimitSet may be used for several Measurements. In particular percentage limits are used this way.

DerivedEntities.Name: AccumulatorLimitSet
DerivedEntities.Description: An AccumulatorLimitSet specifies a set of Limits that are associated with an Accumulator measurement.

DerivedEntities.Name: AnalogLimitSet
DerivedEntities.Description: An AnalogLimitSet specifies a set of Limits that are associated with an Analog measurement.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktAnalogLimitSet
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC 61970:Meas:AnalogLimitSet.

Attributes.Name: ratingSet
Attributes.Description: Rating set numbers

Attributes.Name: isPercentageLimits
Attributes.Description: Tells if the limit values are in percentage of normalValue or the specified Unit for Measurements and Controls.

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadGroup
DerivedEntities.Description: The class is the third level in a hierarchical structure for grouping of loads for the purpose of load flow load scaling.

DerivedEntities.Name: ConformLoadGroup
DerivedEntities.Description: A group of loads conforming to an allocation pattern.

DerivedEntities.Name: NonConformLoadGroup
DerivedEntities.Description: Loads that do not follow a daily and seasonal load variation pattern.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCTopologicalNode
DerivedEntities.Description: DC bus.

DerivedEntities.Name: BilateralExchangeActor
DerivedEntities.Description: BilateralExchangeActor describes an actor that provides ICCP data, consumes ICCP data or both. The ICCP data provider lists the data it makes available to an ICCP data consumer.  This data is described by ProvidedBilateralPoints. The relation between an ICCP data provider and a consumer is established by a BilateralExchangeAgreement.  It is up to the ICCP data consumer to select what ProvidedBilateralPoints to use.  The selection made is not described in this information model.

DerivedEntities.Name: ICCPVirtualControlCentre
DerivedEntities.Description: This contains the information that a particular actor exposes for a particular agreed upon ICCP Bilateral Table.

Attributes.Name: applicationSecurityRequirement
Attributes.Description: Specifies the expected security mechanism, per IEC 62351-4, to be utilized.

Attributes.Name: nameOfLocalICC
Attributes.Description: Specifies the ICC scope name that the remote can use to access the information in the Bilateral Table if the information is not VCC scoped.  This value may not be null.

Attributes.Name: supportForBlock1
Attributes.Description: Per IEC 60870-6-702:  If true indicates support for basic services.  Must always be true.

Attributes.Name: supportForBlock3
Attributes.Description: Per IEC 60870-6-702:  If true indicates support for blocked transfers.

Attributes.Name: transportSecurityRequirement
Attributes.Description: If true, then transport level security as specified by IEC 62351-6 is required.

Attributes.Name: supportForDepriciatedBlock8
Attributes.Description: Per IEC 60870-6-702:  If true indicates support for accounts.  The use of this block was deprecated in Edition 3.

Attributes.Name: supportForBlock2
Attributes.Description: Per IEC 60870-6-702:  If true indicates support for extended conditions.

Attributes.Name: supportForBlock5
Attributes.Description: Per IEC 60870-6-702:  If true indicates support for device control.

Attributes.Name: calling
Attributes.Description: Used to indicate if the Provider is responsible for initiating the TASE.2 connection.  If the value is TRUE, the provider is responsible for establishing the association.  If the value is FALSE, the peer provider of the Bilateral Table will need to establish the association.

Attributes.Name: minimumUpdateInterval
Attributes.Description: Specifies the fastest update interval that can be provided for integrity information and Transfer Set creation. The value is in seconds.

Attributes.Name: clientAndServer
Attributes.Description:
If True the value indicates that the entity represented by the bilateral table is capable of issuing requests and responding to request (e.g. bidirectional support of ICCP requests).

If False, this indicates that a calling entity (e.g. calling = True) will not be able to respond to ICCP requests.  If False, and calling=False, this indicates that the entity will only respond to ICCP requests and not issue ICCP requests.

Attributes.Name: supportForBlock4
Attributes.Description: Per IEC 60870-6-702:  If true indicates support for information messages.

DerivedEntities.Name: ICCPVCC
DerivedEntities.Description: Indicates that the ICCP information is global in nature and normally is available to all authorized peers.

DerivedEntities.Name: BilateralExchangeAgreement
DerivedEntities.Description: This is the representation of the information exchange agreement between peers.

DerivedEntities.Name: TASE2BilateralTable
DerivedEntities.Description: This class describe the sending (providing) side in a bilateral ICCP data exchange. Hence the ICCP bilateral (table) descriptions are created by exchanging ICCP Provider data between the parties.

Attributes.Name: bilateralTableVersion
Attributes.Description: The Version attribute identifies a unique version of the Bilateral Table. If any changes are made to a Bilateral Table, then a new unique value for this attribute shall be generated.

Attributes.Name: bilateralTableID
Attributes.Description: Specifies the version of the Bilateral Table configuration that is being exchanged.

Attributes.Name: tase2version
Attributes.Description:
Specifies the version of the TASE.2 that is needed to access the Bilateral Table information via TASE.2.

In order for a link to be established, both sides must have the same value.

DerivedEntities.Name: Transactor
DerivedEntities.Description: The entity that ultimately executes the transaction and which is in control of the process; typically this is embodied in secure software running on a server that may employ secure hardware encryption devices for secure transaction processing.

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadDynamics
DerivedEntities.Description:
Load whose behaviour is described by reference to a standard model <font color="#0f0f0f">or by definition of a user-defined model.</font>
A standard feature of dynamic load behaviour modelling is the ability to associate the same behaviour to multiple energy consumers by means of a single load definition.  The load model is always applied to individual bus loads (energy consumers).

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadUserDefined
DerivedEntities.Description: Load whose dynamic behaviour is described by a user-defined model.

Attributes.Name: proprietary
Attributes.Description:
Behaviour is based on a proprietary model as opposed to a detailed model.
true = user-defined model is proprietary with behaviour mutually understood by sending and receiving applications and parameters passed as general attributes
false = user-defined model is explicitly defined in terms of control blocks and their input and output signals.

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadGenericNonLinear
DerivedEntities.Description: Generic non-linear dynamic (GNLD) load. This model can be used in mid-term and long-term voltage stability simulations (i.e., to study voltage collapse), as it can replace a more detailed representation of aggregate load, including induction motors, thermostatically controlled and static loads.

Attributes.Name: lt
Attributes.Description: Transient voltage index for active power (LT).

Attributes.Name: genericNonLinearLoadModelType
Attributes.Description: Type of generic non-linear load model.

Attributes.Name: bs
Attributes.Description: Steady state voltage index for reactive power (BS).

Attributes.Name: bt
Attributes.Description: Transient voltage index for reactive power (BT).

Attributes.Name: tq
Attributes.Description: Time constant of lag function of reactive power (TQ) (> 0).

Attributes.Name: ls
Attributes.Description: Steady state voltage index for active power (LS).

Attributes.Name: tp
Attributes.Description: Time constant of lag function of active power (TP) (> 0).

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadComposite
DerivedEntities.Description:
Combined static load and induction motor load effects.
The dynamics of the motor are simplified by linearizing the induction machine equations.

Attributes.Name: epvs
Attributes.Description: Active load-voltage dependence index (static) (Epvs). Typical value = 0,7.

Attributes.Name: epfs
Attributes.Description: Active load-frequency dependence index (static) (Epfs). Typical value = 1,5.

Attributes.Name: h
Attributes.Description: Inertia constant (H) (>= 0). Typical value = 2,5.

Attributes.Name: eqfs
Attributes.Description: Reactive load-frequency dependence index (static) (Eqfs). Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: eqvd
Attributes.Description: Reactive load-voltage dependence index (dynamic) (Eqvd). Typical value = 2.

Attributes.Name: epvd
Attributes.Description: Active load-voltage dependence index (dynamic) (Epvd). Typical value = 0,7.

Attributes.Name: epfd
Attributes.Description: Active load-frequency dependence index (dynamic) (Epfd). Typical value = 1,5.

Attributes.Name: pfrac
Attributes.Description: Fraction of constant-power load to be represented by this motor model (PFRAC) (>= 0,0 and <= 1,0). Typical value = 0,5.

Attributes.Name: lfac
Attributes.Description: Loading factor (Lfac). The ratio of initial P to motor MVA base. Typical value = 0,8.

Attributes.Name: eqvs
Attributes.Description: Reactive load-voltage dependence index (static) (Eqvs). Typical value = 2.

Attributes.Name: eqfd
Attributes.Description: Reactive load-frequency dependence index (dynamic) (Eqfd). Typical value = 0.

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadAggregate
DerivedEntities.Description:
Aggregate loads are used to represent all or part of the real and reactive load from one or more loads in the static (power flow) data. This load is usually the aggregation of many individual load devices and the load model is an approximate representation of the aggregate response of the load devices to system disturbances.
Standard aggregate load model comprised of static and/or dynamic components.  A static load model represents the sensitivity of the real and reactive power consumed by the load to the amplitude and frequency of the bus voltage. A dynamic load model can be used to represent the aggregate response of the motor components of the load.

DerivedEntities.Name: NetworkModelProjectState
DerivedEntities.Description: A network model project version state.  States are agreed upon by the exchange community.  Examples are "approved", "proposed", "withdrawn", "committed" etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: ValueToAlias
DerivedEntities.Description: Describes the translation of one particular value into a name, e.g. 1 as "Open".

Attributes.Name: value
Attributes.Description: The value that is mapped.

DerivedEntities.Name: ReadingQualityType
DerivedEntities.Description: Detailed description for a quality of a reading value, produced by an end device or a system. Values in attributes allow for creation of the recommended codes to be used for identifying reading value quality codes as follows: <systemId>.<category>.<subCategory>.

Attributes.Name: category
Attributes.Description: High-level nature of the reading value quality.

Attributes.Name: subCategory
Attributes.Description: More specific nature of the reading value quality, as a further sub-categorisation of 'category'.

Attributes.Name: systemId
Attributes.Description: Identification of the system which has declared the issue with the data or provided commentary on the data.

Attributes.Name: description
Attributes.Description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

Attributes.Name: name
Attributes.Description: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

Attributes.Name: mRID
Attributes.Description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

Attributes.Name: aliasName
Attributes.Description:
The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

Entities.Name: PSRType
Entities.Description: Classifying instances of the same class, e.g. overhead and underground ACLineSegments. This classification mechanism is intended to provide flexibility outside the scope of this document, i.e. provide customisation that is non standard.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktPSRType
DerivedEntities.Description: The type of a power system resource.

Attributes.Name: psrType
Attributes.Description: The coded type of a power system resource.

Entities.Name: Equipment
Entities.Description: The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanical.

DerivedEntities.Name: ConductingEquipment
DerivedEntities.Description: The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnergyConnection
DerivedEntities.Description: A connection of energy generation or consumption on the power system model.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnergyConsumer
DerivedEntities.Description:
Generic user of energy - a  point of consumption on the power system model.
EnergyConsumer.pfixed, .qfixed, .pfixedPct and .qfixedPct have meaning only if there is no LoadResponseCharacteristic associated with EnergyConsumer or if LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is set to False.

DerivedEntities.Name: ConformLoad
DerivedEntities.Description: ConformLoad represent loads that follow a daily load change pattern where the pattern can be used to scale the load with a system load.

DerivedEntities.Name: StationSupply
DerivedEntities.Description: Station supply with load derived from the station output.

DerivedEntities.Name: NonConformLoad
DerivedEntities.Description: NonConformLoad represents loads that do not follow a daily load change pattern and whose changes are not correlated with the daily load change pattern.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description:
Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Attributes.Name: grounded
Attributes.Description: Used for Yn and Zn connections. True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

Attributes.Name: customerCount
Attributes.Description: Number of individual customers represented by this demand.

Attributes.Name: pfixedPct
Attributes.Description: Fixed active power as a percentage of load group fixed active power. Used to represent the time-varying components.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description:
Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Attributes.Name: qfixedPct
Attributes.Description: Fixed reactive power as a percentage of load group fixed reactive power. Used to represent the time-varying components.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: pfixed
Attributes.Description: Active power of the load that is a fixed quantity and does not vary as load group value varies. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: phaseConnection
Attributes.Description: The type of phase connection, such as wye or delta.

Attributes.Name: qfixed
Attributes.Description: Reactive power of the load that is a fixed quantity and does not vary as load group value varies. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

DerivedEntities.Name: EnergySource
DerivedEntities.Description: A generic equivalent for an energy supplier on a transmission or distribution voltage level.

Attributes.Name: reactivePower
Attributes.Description:
High voltage source reactive injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence Thevenin resistance.

Attributes.Name: r0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence Thevenin resistance.

Attributes.Name: activePower
Attributes.Description:
High voltage source active injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

Attributes.Name: xn
Attributes.Description: Negative sequence Thevenin reactance.

Attributes.Name: nominalVoltage
Attributes.Description: Phase-to-phase nominal voltage.

Attributes.Name: pMax
Attributes.Description: This is the maximum active power that can be produced by the source. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.

Attributes.Name: pMin
Attributes.Description: This is the minimum active power that can be produced by the source. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.

Attributes.Name: rn
Attributes.Description: Negative sequence Thevenin resistance.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence Thevenin reactance.

Attributes.Name: voltageMagnitude
Attributes.Description: Phase-to-phase open circuit voltage magnitude used when voltage characteristics need to be imposed at the node associated with the terminal of the energy source, such as when voltages and angles from the transmission level are used as input to the distribution network. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: voltageAngle
Attributes.Description: Phase angle of a-phase open circuit used when voltage characteristics need to be imposed at the node associated with the terminal of the energy source, such as when voltages and angles from the transmission level are used as input to the distribution network. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: x0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence Thevenin reactance.

DerivedEntities.Name: RegulatingCondEq
DerivedEntities.Description: A type of conducting equipment that can regulate a quantity (i.e. voltage or flow) at a specific point in the network.

DerivedEntities.Name: ShuntCompensator
DerivedEntities.Description: A shunt capacitor or reactor or switchable bank of shunt capacitors or reactors. A section of a shunt compensator is an individual capacitor or reactor.  A negative value for reactivePerSection indicates that the compensator is a reactor. ShuntCompensator is a single terminal device.  Ground is implied.

DerivedEntities.Name: LinearShuntCompensator
DerivedEntities.Description: A linear shunt compensator has banks or sections with equal admittance values.

Attributes.Name: b0PerSection
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

Attributes.Name: bPerSection
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

Attributes.Name: g0PerSection
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence shunt (charging) conductance per section.

Attributes.Name: gPerSection
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence shunt (charging) conductance per section.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktShuntCompensator
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC 61970:Wires:ShuntCompensator.

DerivedEntities.Name: SVC
DerivedEntities.Description: SVC asset allows the capacitive and inductive ratings for each phase to be specified individually if required.

Attributes.Name: inductiveRating
Attributes.Description: Maximum inductive reactive power.

Attributes.Name: capacitiveRating
Attributes.Description: Maximum capacitive reactive power.

DerivedEntities.Name: NonlinearShuntCompensator
DerivedEntities.Description: A non linear shunt compensator has bank or section admittance values that differ. The attributes g, b, g0 and b0 of the associated NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint describe the total conductance and admittance of a NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint at a section number specified by NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint.sectionNumber.

Attributes.Name: nomU
Attributes.Description: The voltage at which the nominal reactive power may be calculated. This should normally be within 10% of the voltage at which the capacitor is connected to the network.

Attributes.Name: switchOnDate
Attributes.Description: The date and time when the capacitor bank was last switched on.

Attributes.Name: voltageSensitivity
Attributes.Description: Voltage sensitivity required for the device to regulate the bus voltage, in voltage/reactive power.

Attributes.Name: sections
Attributes.Description:
Shunt compensator sections in use. Starting value for steady state solution. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete shunt compensators has yet been designed, a solutions where a narrow voltage band force the sections to oscillate or accommodate for a continuous solution as input. 
For LinearShuntConpensator the value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensator.maximumSections. At value zero the shunt compensator conductance and admittance is zero. Linear interpolation of conductance and admittance between the previous and next integer section is applied in case of non-integer values.
For NonlinearShuntCompensator-s shall only be set to one of the NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint.sectionNumber. There is no interpolation between NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint-s.

Attributes.Name: switchOnCount
Attributes.Description: The switch on count since the capacitor count was last reset or initialized.

Attributes.Name: aVRDelay
Attributes.Description: An automatic voltage regulation delay (AVRDelay) which is the time delay from a change in voltage to when the capacitor is allowed to change state. This filters out temporary changes in voltage.

Attributes.Name: phaseConnection
Attributes.Description: The type of phase connection, such as wye or delta.

Attributes.Name: grounded
Attributes.Description: Used for Yn and Zn connections. True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

Attributes.Name: maximumSections
Attributes.Description: The maximum number of sections that may be switched in.

Attributes.Name: normalSections
Attributes.Description: The normal number of sections switched in. The value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensator.maximumSections.

DerivedEntities.Name: ExternalNetworkInjection
DerivedEntities.Description: This class represents the external network and it is used for IEC 60909 calculations.

Attributes.Name: maxR0ToX0Ratio
Attributes.Description: Maximum ratio of zero sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its zero sequence reactance (R(0)/X(0) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: maxInitialSymShCCurrent
Attributes.Description: Maximum initial symmetrical short-circuit currents (Ik" max) in A (Ik" = Sk"/(SQRT(3) Un)). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: governorSCD
Attributes.Description: Power Frequency Bias. This is the change in power injection divided by the change in frequency and negated.  A positive value of the power frequency bias provides additional power injection upon a drop in frequency.

Attributes.Name: maxR1ToX1Ratio
Attributes.Description: Maximum ratio of positive sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its positive sequence reactance (R(1)/X(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: minQ
Attributes.Description: Minimum reactive power limit. It is used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange and not for short circuit modelling.

Attributes.Name: maxZ0ToZ1Ratio
Attributes.Description: Maximum ratio of zero sequence impedance to its positive sequence impedance (Z(0)/Z(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: minR0ToX0Ratio
Attributes.Description: Indicates whether initial symmetrical short-circuit current and power have been calculated according to IEC (Ik"). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 6090.

Attributes.Name: minZ0ToZ1Ratio
Attributes.Description: Minimum ratio of zero sequence impedance to its positive sequence impedance (Z(0)/Z(1) min). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: voltageFactor
Attributes.Description: Voltage factor in pu, which was used to calculate short-circuit current Ik" and power Sk".  Used only if short circuit calculations are done according to superposition method.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description:
Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

Attributes.Name: referencePriority
Attributes.Description: Priority of unit for use as powerflow voltage phase angle reference bus selection. 0 = don t care (default) 1 = highest priority. 2 is less than 1 and so on.

Attributes.Name: maxP
Attributes.Description: Maximum active power of the injection.

Attributes.Name: ikSecond
Attributes.Description: Indicates whether initial symmetrical short-circuit current and power have been calculated according to IEC (Ik").  Used only if short circuit calculations are done according to superposition method.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description:
Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

Attributes.Name: minInitialSymShCCurrent
Attributes.Description: Minimum initial symmetrical short-circuit currents (Ik" min) in A (Ik" = Sk"/(SQRT(3) Un)). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: minP
Attributes.Description: Minimum active power of the injection.

Attributes.Name: minR1ToX1Ratio
Attributes.Description: Minimum ratio of positive sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its positive sequence reactance (R(1)/X(1) min). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: maxQ
Attributes.Description: Maximum reactive power limit. It is used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange and not for short circuit modelling.

DerivedEntities.Name: PowerElectronicsConnection
DerivedEntities.Description: A connection to the AC network for energy production or consumption that uses power electronics rather than rotating machines.

Attributes.Name: maxQ
Attributes.Description: Maximum reactive power limit. This is the maximum (nameplate) limit for the unit.

Attributes.Name: minQ
Attributes.Description: Minimum reactive power limit for the unit. This is the minimum (nameplate) limit for the unit.

Attributes.Name: xn
Attributes.Description: Negative sequence Thevenin reactance.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description:
Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Attributes.Name: rn
Attributes.Description: Negative sequence Thevenin resistance.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Equivalent resistance (RG) of generator. RG is considered for the calculation of all currents, except for the calculation of the peak current ip. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: x0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence Thevenin reactance.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description:
Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Attributes.Name: maxIFault
Attributes.Description: Maximum fault current this device will contribute, in per-unit of rated current, before the converter protection will trip or bypass.

Attributes.Name: ratedU
Attributes.Description:
Rated voltage (nameplate data, Ur in IEC 60909-0). It is primarily used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: r0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence resistance of the synchronous machine.

Attributes.Name: ratedS
Attributes.Description:
Nameplate apparent power rating for the unit.
The attribute shall have a positive value.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence Thevenin reactance.

DerivedEntities.Name: StaticVarCompensator
DerivedEntities.Description:
A facility for providing variable and controllable shunt reactive power. The SVC typically consists of a stepdown transformer, filter, thyristor-controlled reactor, and thyristor-switched capacitor arms.

The SVC may operate in fixed MVar output mode or in voltage control mode. When in voltage control mode, the output of the SVC will be proportional to the deviation of voltage at the controlled bus from the voltage setpoint.  The SVC characteristic slope defines the proportion.  If the voltage at the controlled bus is equal to the voltage setpoint, the SVC MVar output is zero.

Attributes.Name: capacitiveRating
Attributes.Description: Capacitive reactance at maximum capacitive reactive power.  Shall always be positive.

Attributes.Name: slope
Attributes.Description:
The characteristics slope of an SVC defines how the reactive power output changes in proportion to the difference between the regulated bus voltage and the voltage setpoint.
The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: inductiveRating
Attributes.Description: Inductive reactance at maximum inductive reactive power.  Shall always be negative.

Attributes.Name: voltageSetPoint
Attributes.Description: The reactive power output of the SVC is proportional to the difference between the voltage at the regulated bus and the voltage setpoint.  When the regulated bus voltage is equal to the voltage setpoint, the reactive power output is zero.

Attributes.Name: sVCControlMode
Attributes.Description: SVC control mode.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description:
Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

DerivedEntities.Name: FrequencyConverter
DerivedEntities.Description: A device to convert from one frequency to another (e.g., frequency F1 to F2) comprises a pair of FrequencyConverter instances. One converts from F1 to DC, the other converts the DC to F2.

Attributes.Name: maxP
Attributes.Description: The maximum active power on the DC side at which the frequency converter should operate.

Attributes.Name: minU
Attributes.Description: The minimum voltage on the DC side at which the frequency converter should operate.

Attributes.Name: minP
Attributes.Description: The minimum active power on the DC side at which the frequency converter should operate.

Attributes.Name: maxU
Attributes.Description: The maximum voltage on the DC side at which the frequency converter should operate.

Attributes.Name: frequency
Attributes.Description: Frequency on the AC side.

DerivedEntities.Name: RotatingMachine
DerivedEntities.Description: A rotating machine which may be used as a generator or motor.

DerivedEntities.Name: AsynchronousMachine
DerivedEntities.Description: A rotating machine whose shaft rotates asynchronously with the electrical field.  Also known as an induction machine with no external connection to the rotor windings, e.g. squirrel-cage induction machine.

Attributes.Name: converterFedDrive
Attributes.Description: Indicates whether the machine is a converter fed drive. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: xlr1
Attributes.Description: Damper 1 winding leakage reactance.

Attributes.Name: polePairNumber
Attributes.Description: Number of pole pairs of stator. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: iaIrRatio
Attributes.Description: Ratio of locked-rotor current to the rated current of the motor (Ia/Ir). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: reversible
Attributes.Description: Indicates for converter drive motors if the power can be reversible. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: xpp
Attributes.Description: Sub-transient reactance (unsaturated).

Attributes.Name: nominalFrequency
Attributes.Description: Nameplate data indicates if the machine is 50 Hz or 60 Hz.

Attributes.Name: xm
Attributes.Description: Magnetizing reactance.

Attributes.Name: efficiency
Attributes.Description: Efficiency of the asynchronous machine at nominal operation as a percentage. Indicator for converter drive motors. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: xp
Attributes.Description: Transient reactance (unsaturated) (greater than or equal to xpp).

Attributes.Name: rxLockedRotorRatio
Attributes.Description: Locked rotor ratio (R/X). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: tpo
Attributes.Description: Transient rotor time constant (greater than tppo).

Attributes.Name: tppo
Attributes.Description: Sub-transient rotor time constant (greater than 0).

Attributes.Name: xlr2
Attributes.Description: Damper 2 winding leakage reactance.

Attributes.Name: ratedMechanicalPower
Attributes.Description: Rated mechanical power (Pr in IEC 60909-0). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: xs
Attributes.Description: Synchronous reactance (greater than xp).

Attributes.Name: asynchronousMachineType
Attributes.Description: Indicates the type of Asynchronous Machine (motor or generator).

Attributes.Name: rr1
Attributes.Description: Damper 1 winding resistance.

Attributes.Name: rr2
Attributes.Description: Damper 2 winding resistance.

Attributes.Name: nominalSpeed
Attributes.Description: Nameplate data.  Depends on the slip and number of pole pairs.

DerivedEntities.Name: SynchronousMachine
DerivedEntities.Description: An electromechanical device that operates with shaft rotating synchronously with the network. It is a single machine operating either as a generator or synchronous condenser or pump.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Equivalent resistance (RG) of generator. RG is considered for the calculation of all currents, except for the calculation of the peak current ip. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: r0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence resistance of the synchronous machine.

Attributes.Name: satDirectSyncX
Attributes.Description: Direct-axes saturated synchronous reactance (xdsat); reciprocal of short-circuit ration. Used for short circuit data exchange, only for single fed short circuit on a generator. (4.3.4.2. in IEC 60909-0:2001).

Attributes.Name: aVRToManualLag
Attributes.Description: Time delay required when switching from Automatic Voltage Regulation (AVR) to Manual for a lagging MVAr violation.

Attributes.Name: operatingMode
Attributes.Description: Current mode of operation.

Attributes.Name: condenserP
Attributes.Description: Active power consumed when in condenser mode operation.

Attributes.Name: coolantCondition
Attributes.Description: Temperature or pressure of coolant medium.

Attributes.Name: earthing
Attributes.Description: Indicates whether or not the generator is earthed. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: manualToAVR
Attributes.Description: Time delay required when switching from Manual to Automatic Voltage Regulation. This value is used in the accelerating power reference frame for powerflow solutions.

Attributes.Name: r2
Attributes.Description: Negative sequence resistance.

Attributes.Name: x0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence reactance of the synchronous machine.

Attributes.Name: satDirectSubtransX
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis subtransient reactance saturated, also known as Xd"sat.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Modes that this synchronous machine can operate in.

Attributes.Name: minQ
Attributes.Description: Minimum reactive power limit for the unit.

Attributes.Name: earthingStarPointX
Attributes.Description: Generator star point earthing reactance (Xe). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: shortCircuitRotorType
Attributes.Description: Type of rotor, used by short circuit applications, only for single fed short circuit according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: baseQ
Attributes.Description: Default base reactive power value. This value represents the initial reactive power that can be used by any application function.

Attributes.Name: maxQ
Attributes.Description: Maximum reactive power limit. This is the maximum (nameplate) limit for the unit.

Attributes.Name: voltageRegulationRange
Attributes.Description:
Range of generator voltage regulation (PG in IEC 60909-0) used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KG defined in IEC 60909-0.
This attribute is used to describe the operating voltage of the generating unit.

Attributes.Name: x2
Attributes.Description: Negative sequence reactance.

Attributes.Name: minU
Attributes.Description: Minimum voltage  limit for the unit.

Attributes.Name: satDirectTransX
Attributes.Description: Saturated Direct-axis transient reactance. The attribute is primarily used for short circuit calculations according to ANSI.

Attributes.Name: referencePriority
Attributes.Description: Priority of unit for use as powerflow voltage phase angle reference bus selection. 0 = don t care (default) 1 = highest priority. 2 is less than 1 and so on.

Attributes.Name: earthingStarPointR
Attributes.Description: Generator star point earthing resistance (Re). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: ikk
Attributes.Description:
Steady-state short-circuit current (in A for the profile) of generator with compound excitation during 3-phase short circuit.
- Ikk=0: Generator with no compound excitation.
- Ikk<>0: Generator with compound excitation.
Ikk is used to calculate the minimum steady-state short-circuit current for generators with compound excitation.
(4.6.1.2 in IEC 60909-0:2001).
Used only for single fed short circuit on a generator. (4.3.4.2. in IEC 60909-0:2001).

Attributes.Name: maxU
Attributes.Description: Maximum voltage limit for the unit.

Attributes.Name: mu
Attributes.Description:
Factor to calculate the breaking current (Section 4.5.2.1 in IEC 60909-0).
Used only for single fed short circuit on a generator (Section 4.3.4.2. in IEC 60909-0).

Attributes.Name: coolantType
Attributes.Description: Method of cooling the machine.

Attributes.Name: qPercent
Attributes.Description: Part of the coordinated reactive control that comes from this machine. The attribute is used as a participation factor not necessarily summing up to 100% for the participating devices in the control.

Attributes.Name: aVRToManualLead
Attributes.Description: Time delay required when switching from Automatic Voltage Regulation (AVR) to Manual for a leading MVAr violation.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description:
Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Nameplate apparent power rating for the unit.
The attribute shall have a positive value.

Attributes.Name: ratedU

Rated voltage (nameplate data, Ur in IEC 60909-0). It is primarily used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description:
Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

DerivedEntities.Name: ACDCConverter
DerivedEntities.Description: A unit with valves for three phases, together with unit control equipment, essential protective and switching devices, DC storage capacitors, phase reactors and auxiliaries, if any, used for conversion.

DerivedEntities.Name: VsConverter
DerivedEntities.Description: DC side of the voltage source converter (VSC).

Attributes.Name: targetPhasePcc
Attributes.Description: Phase target at AC side, at point of common coupling. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: droop
Attributes.Description: Droop constant. The pu value is obtained as D [kV/MW] x Sb / Ubdc. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: targetQpcc
Attributes.Description: Reactive power injection target in AC grid, at point of common coupling.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: targetPWMfactor
Attributes.Description: Magnitude of pulse-modulation factor. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: qPccControl
Attributes.Description: Kind of reactive power control.

Attributes.Name: qShare
Attributes.Description: Reactive power sharing factor among parallel converters on Uac control. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: delta
Attributes.Description: Angle between VsConverter.uv and ACDCConverter.uc. It is converters state variable used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: maxModulationIndex
Attributes.Description: The maximum quotient between the AC converter voltage (Uc) and DC voltage (Ud). A factor typically less than 1. It is converters configuration data used in power flow.

Attributes.Name: uv

Attributes.Name: pPccControl
Attributes.Description: Kind of control of real power and/or DC voltage.

Attributes.Name: maxValveCurrent
Attributes.Description: The maximum current through a valve. It is converters configuration data.

Attributes.Name: droopCompensation
