Attributes.Name: targetPowerFactorPcc
Attributes.Description: Power factor target at the AC side, at point of common coupling. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: targetUpcc
Attributes.Description: Voltage target in AC grid, at point of common coupling. The attribute shall be a positive value.

DerivedEntities.Name: CsConverter
DerivedEntities.Description:
DC side of the current source converter (CSC).
The firing angle controls the dc voltage at the converter, both for rectifier and inverter. The difference between the dc voltages of the rectifier and inverter determines the dc current. The extinction angle is used to limit the dc voltage at the inverter, if needed, and is not used in active power control. The firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filters are the primary means to control a current source dc line. Higher level controls are built on top, e.g. dc voltage, dc current and active power. From a steady state perspective it is sufficient to specify the wanted active power transfer (ACDCConverter.targetPpcc) and the control functions will set the dc voltage, dc current, firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filters to meet this. Therefore attributes targetAlpha and targetGamma are not applicable in this case.
The reactive power consumed by the converter is a function of the firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filter, which can be approximated with half of the active power. The losses is a function of the dc voltage and dc current.
The attributes minAlpha and maxAlpha define the range of firing angles for rectifier operation between which no discrete tap changer action takes place. The range is typically 10-18 degrees.
The attributes minGamma and maxGamma define the range of extinction angles for inverter operation between which no discrete tap changer action takes place. The range is typically 17-20 degrees.

Attributes.Name: alpha
Attributes.Description: Firing angle that determines the dc voltage at the converter dc terminal. Typical value between 10 degrees and 18 degrees for a rectifier. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: minAlpha
Attributes.Description: Minimum firing angle. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: minIdc
Attributes.Description: The minimum direct current (Id) on the DC side at which the converter should operate. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: targetIdc
Attributes.Description: DC current target value. It is converters control variable used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: maxAlpha
Attributes.Description: Maximum firing angle. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: gamma
Attributes.Description: Extinction angle. It is used to limit the dc voltage at the inverter if needed. Typical value between 17 degrees and 20 degrees for an inverter. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: pPccControl
Attributes.Description: Kind of active power control.

Attributes.Name: ratedIdc
Attributes.Description: Rated converter DC current, also called IdN. The attribute shall be a positive value. It is converters configuration data used in power flow.

Attributes.Name: targetAlpha
Attributes.Description: Target firing angle. It is converters control variable used in power flow. It is only applicable for rectifier if continuous tap changer control is used. Allowed values are within the range minAlpha<=targetAlpha<=maxAlpha. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: maxGamma
Attributes.Description: Maximum extinction angle. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: targetGamma
Attributes.Description: Target extinction angle. It is converters control variable used in power flow. It is only applicable for inverter if continuous tap changer control is used. Allowed values are within the range minGamma<=targetGamma<=maxGamma. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: maxIdc
Attributes.Description: The maximum direct current (Id) on the DC side at which the converter should operate. It is converters configuration data use in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: minGamma
Attributes.Description: Minimum extinction angle. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: operatingMode
Attributes.Description: Indicates whether the DC pole is operating as an inverter or as a rectifier. It is converters control variable used in power flow.

Attributes.Name: maxP
Attributes.Description: Maximum active power limit. The value is overwritten by values of VsCapabilityCurve, if present.

Attributes.Name: idleLoss
Attributes.Description: Active power loss in pole at no power transfer. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: ratedUdc
Attributes.Description: Rated converter DC voltage, also called UdN. The attribute shall be a positive value. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. For instance a bipolar HVDC link with value  200 kV has a 400kV difference between the dc lines.

Attributes.Name: idc
Attributes.Description: Converter DC current, also called Id. It is converters state variable, result from power flow.

Attributes.Name: switchingLoss
Attributes.Description: Switching losses, relative to the base apparent power 'baseS'. Refer to poleLossP. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: resistiveLoss
Attributes.Description: It is converters configuration data used in power flow. Refer to poleLossP. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: targetPpcc
Attributes.Description: Real power injection target in AC grid, at point of common coupling.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: numberOfValves
Attributes.Description: Number of valves in the converter. Used in loss calculations.

Attributes.Name: uc
Attributes.Description: Line-to-line converter voltage, the voltage at the AC side of the valve. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description:
Reactive power at the point of common coupling. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution in the case a simplified power flow model is used.

Attributes.Name: minUdc
Attributes.Description: The minimum voltage on the DC side at which the converter should operate. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: valveU0
Attributes.Description: Valve threshold voltage, also called Uvalve. Forward voltage drop when the valve is conducting. Used in loss calculations, i.e. the switchLoss depend on numberOfValves * valveU0.

Attributes.Name: targetUdc
Attributes.Description: Target value for DC voltage magnitude. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: poleLossP
Attributes.Description:
The active power loss at a DC Pole 
= idleLoss + switchingLoss*|Idc| + resitiveLoss*Idc^2.
For lossless operation Pdc=Pac.
For rectifier operation with losses Pdc=Pac-lossP.
For inverter operation with losses Pdc=Pac+lossP.
It is converters state variable used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: baseS
Attributes.Description: Base apparent power of the converter pole. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: maxUdc
Attributes.Description: The maximum voltage on the DC side at which the converter should operate. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: minP
Attributes.Description: Minimum active power limit. The value is overwritten by values of VsCapabilityCurve, if present.

Attributes.Name: udc
Attributes.Description: Converter voltage at the DC side, also called Ud. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description:
Active power at the point of common coupling. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution in the case a simplified power flow model is used.

DerivedEntities.Name: PowerTransformer
DerivedEntities.Description:
An electrical device consisting of  two or more coupled windings, with or without a magnetic core, for introducing mutual coupling between electric circuits. Transformers can be used to control voltage and phase shift (active power flow).
A power transformer may be composed of separate transformer tanks that need not be identical.
A power transformer can be modelled with or without tanks and is intended for use in both balanced and unbalanced representations.   A power transformer typically has two terminals, but may have one (grounding), three or more terminals.
The inherited association ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage should not be used.  The association from TransformerEnd to BaseVoltage should be used instead.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktPowerTransformer
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC61970:Wires:PowerTransformer.

Attributes.Name: beforeShortCircuitAnglePf
Attributes.Description: The angle of power factor before short circuit (phib in IEC 60909-0). It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KT defined in IEC 60909-0. This is the worst case power factor. Used to define operating conditions.

Attributes.Name: beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingCurrent
Attributes.Description: The highest operating current (Ib in IEC 60909-0) before short circuit (depends on network configuration and relevant reliability philosophy). It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KT defined in IEC 60909-0.

Attributes.Name: vectorGroup
Attributes.Description:
Vector group of the transformer for protective relaying, e.g., Dyn1. For unbalanced transformers, this may not be simply determined from the constituent winding connections and phase angle displacements.

The vectorGroup string consists of the following components in the order listed: high voltage winding connection, mid voltage winding connection (for three winding transformers), phase displacement clock number from 0 to 11,  low voltage winding connection 
phase displacement clock number from 0 to 11.   The winding connections are D (delta), Y (wye), YN (wye with neutral), Z (zigzag), ZN (zigzag with neutral), A (auto transformer). Upper case means the high voltage, lower case mid or low. The high voltage winding always has clock position 0 and is not included in the vector group string.  Some examples: YNy0 (two winding wye to wye with no phase displacement), YNd11 (two winding wye to delta with 330 degrees phase displacement), YNyn0d5 (three winding transformer wye with neutral high voltage, wye with neutral mid voltage and no phase displacement, delta low voltage with 150 degrees displacement).

Phase displacement is defined as the angular difference between the phasors representing the voltages between the neutral point (real or imaginary) and the corresponding terminals of two windings, a positive sequence voltage system being applied to the high-voltage terminals, following each other in alphabetical sequence if they are lettered, or in numerical sequence if they are numbered: the phasors are assumed to rotate in a counter-clockwise sense.

Attributes.Name: beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingVoltage
Attributes.Description: The highest operating voltage (Ub in IEC 60909-0) before short circuit. It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KT defined in IEC 60909-0. This is worst case voltage on the low side winding (3.7.1 of IEC 60909:2001). Used to define operating conditions.

Attributes.Name: highSideMinOperatingU
Attributes.Description: The minimum operating voltage (uQmin in IEC 60909-0) at the high voltage side (Q side) of the unit transformer of the power station unit. A value well established from long-term operating experience of the system. It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KG defined in IEC 60909-0.

Attributes.Name: isPartOfGeneratorUnit
Attributes.Description: Indicates whether the machine is part of a power station unit. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.  It has an impact on how the correction factors are calculated for transformers, since the transformer is not necessarily part of a synchronous machine and generating unit. It is not always possible to derive this information from the model. This is why the attribute is necessary.

Attributes.Name: operationalValuesConsidered
Attributes.Description: It is used to define if the data (other attributes related to short circuit data exchange) defines long term operational conditions or not. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

DerivedEntities.Name: EarthFaultCompensator
DerivedEntities.Description: A conducting equipment used to represent a connection to ground which is typically used to compensate earth faults.   An earth fault compensator device modelled with a single terminal implies a second terminal solidly connected to ground.  If two terminals are modelled, the ground is not assumed and normal connection rules apply.

DerivedEntities.Name: GroundingImpedance
DerivedEntities.Description: A fixed impedance device used for grounding.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Reactance of device.

DerivedEntities.Name: PetersenCoil
DerivedEntities.Description: A variable impedance device normally used to offset line charging during single line faults in an ungrounded section of network.

Attributes.Name: xGroundNominal
Attributes.Description: The nominal reactance.  This is the operating point (normally over compensation) that is defined based on the resonance point in the healthy network condition.  The impedance is calculated based on nominal voltage divided by position current.

Attributes.Name: xGroundMax
Attributes.Description: The maximum reactance.

Attributes.Name: mode
Attributes.Description: The mode of operation of the Petersen coil.

Attributes.Name: xGroundMin
Attributes.Description: The minimum reactance.

Attributes.Name: offsetCurrent
Attributes.Description: The offset current that the Petersen coil controller is operating from the resonant point.  This is normally a fixed amount for which the controller is configured and could be positive or negative.  Typically 0 to 60 A depending on voltage and resonance conditions.

Attributes.Name: nominalU
Attributes.Description: The nominal voltage for which the coil is designed.

Attributes.Name: positionCurrent
Attributes.Description: The control current used to control the Petersen coil also known as the position current.  Typically in the range of 20 mA to 200 mA.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Nominal resistance of device.

DerivedEntities.Name: Ground
DerivedEntities.Description: A point where the system is grounded used for connecting conducting equipment to ground. The power system model can have any number of grounds.

DerivedEntities.Name: Conductor
DerivedEntities.Description: Combination of conducting material with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry current between points in the power system.

DerivedEntities.Name: ACLineSegment
DerivedEntities.Description:
A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system.
For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment.  Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances.
The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktACLineSegment
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC 61970:Wires:ACLineSegment.

Attributes.Name: r0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence series resistance of the entire line section.

Attributes.Name: shortCircuitEndTemperature
Attributes.Description: Maximum permitted temperature at the end of SC for the calculation of minimum short-circuit currents. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: bch
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.  This value represents the full charging over the full length of the line.

Attributes.Name: g0ch
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence shunt (charging) conductance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

Attributes.Name: b0ch
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

Attributes.Name: x0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence series reactance of the entire line section.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence series reactance of the entire line section.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence series resistance of the entire line section.

Attributes.Name: gch
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence shunt (charging) conductance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

DerivedEntities.Name: WireSegment
DerivedEntities.Description: A two terminal and power conducting device of negligible impedance and length represented as zero impedance device that can be used to connect auxiliary equipment to its terminals.

Attributes.Name: length
Attributes.Description: Segment length for calculating line section capabilities.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktConductingEquipment
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC 61970:Core:ConductingEquipment.

DerivedEntities.Name: SeriesCompensator
DerivedEntities.Description: A Series Compensator is a series capacitor or reactor or an AC transmission line without charging susceptance.  It is a two terminal device.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktSeriesCompensator
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC 61970:Wires:SeriesCompensator.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence reactance.

Attributes.Name: x0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence reactance.

Attributes.Name: varistorVoltageThreshold
Attributes.Description: The dc voltage at which the varistor starts conducting. It is used for short circuit calculations and exchanged only if SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent is true.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence resistance.

Attributes.Name: varistorPresent
Attributes.Description: Describe if a metal oxide varistor (mov) for over voltage protection is configured in parallel with the series compensator. It is used for short circuit calculations.

Attributes.Name: r0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence resistance.

Attributes.Name: varistorRatedCurrent
Attributes.Description:
The maximum current the varistor is designed to handle at specified duration. It is used for short circuit calculations and exchanged only if SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent is true.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

DerivedEntities.Name: Clamp
DerivedEntities.Description:
A Clamp is a galvanic connection at a line segment where other equipment is connected. A Clamp does not cut the line segment. 
A Clamp is ConductingEquipment and has one Terminal with an associated ConnectivityNode. Any other ConductingEquipment can be connected to the Clamp ConnectivityNode.

Attributes.Name: lengthFromTerminal1
Attributes.Description: The length to the place where the clamp is located starting from side one of the line segment, i.e. the line segment terminal with sequence number equal to 1.

DerivedEntities.Name: Connector
DerivedEntities.Description: A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to connect other conducting equipment within a single substation and are modelled with a single logical terminal.

DerivedEntities.Name: BusbarSection
DerivedEntities.Description:
A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to connect other conducting equipment within a single substation. 
Voltage measurements are typically obtained from voltage transformers that are connected to busbar sections. A bus bar section may have many physical terminals but for analysis is modelled with exactly one logical terminal.

Attributes.Name: ipMax
Attributes.Description:
Maximum allowable peak short-circuit current of busbar (Ipmax in IEC 60909-0). 
Mechanical limit of the busbar in the substation itself. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

DerivedEntities.Name: Junction
DerivedEntities.Description: A point where one or more conducting equipments are connected with zero resistance.

DerivedEntities.Name: Switch
DerivedEntities.Description: A generic device designed to close, or open, or both, one or more electric circuits.  All switches are two terminal devices including grounding switches. The ACDCTerminal.connected at the two sides of the switch shall not be considered for assessing switch connectivity, i.e. only Switch.open, .normalOpen and .locked are relevant.

DerivedEntities.Name: Disconnector
DerivedEntities.Description: A manually operated or motor operated mechanical switching device used for changing the connections in a circuit, or for isolating a circuit or equipment from a source of power. It is required to open or close circuits when negligible current is broken or made.

DerivedEntities.Name: Jumper
DerivedEntities.Description: A short section of conductor with negligible impedance which can be manually removed and replaced if the circuit is de-energized. Note that zero-impedance branches can potentially be modelled by other equipment types.

DerivedEntities.Name: GroundDisconnector
DerivedEntities.Description: A manually operated or motor operated mechanical switching device used for isolating a circuit or equipment from ground.

DerivedEntities.Name: Cut
DerivedEntities.Description:
A cut separates a line segment into two parts. The cut appears as a switch inserted between these two parts and connects them together. As the cut is normally open there is no galvanic connection between the two line segment parts. But it is possible to close the cut to get galvanic connection.
The cut terminals are oriented towards the line segment terminals with the same sequence number. Hence the cut terminal with sequence number equal to 1 is oriented to the line segment's terminal with sequence number equal to 1.
The cut terminals also act as connection points for jumpers and other equipment, e.g. a mobile generator. To enable this, connectivity nodes are placed at the cut terminals. Once the connectivity nodes are in place any conducting equipment can be connected at them.

Attributes.Name: lengthFromTerminal1
Attributes.Description: The length to the place where the cut is located starting from side one of the cut line segment, i.e. the line segment Terminal with sequenceNumber equal to 1.

DerivedEntities.Name: Fuse
DerivedEntities.Description: An overcurrent protective device with a circuit opening fusible part that is heated and severed by the passage of overcurrent through it. A fuse is considered a switching device because it breaks current.

DerivedEntities.Name: ProtectedSwitch
DerivedEntities.Description: A ProtectedSwitch is a switching device that can be operated by ProtectionEquipment.

DerivedEntities.Name: Breaker
DerivedEntities.Description: A mechanical switching device capable of making, carrying, and breaking currents under normal circuit conditions and also making, carrying for a specified time, and breaking currents under specified abnormal circuit conditions e.g.  those of short circuit.

DerivedEntities.Name: DisconnectingCircuitBreaker
DerivedEntities.Description: A circuit breaking device including disconnecting function, eliminating the need for separate disconnectors.

Attributes.Name: inTransitTime
Attributes.Description: The transition time from open to close.

DerivedEntities.Name: Recloser
DerivedEntities.Description: Pole-mounted fault interrupter with built-in phase and ground relays, current transformer (CT), and supplemental controls.

DerivedEntities.Name: LoadBreakSwitch
DerivedEntities.Description: A mechanical switching device capable of making, carrying, and breaking currents under normal operating conditions.

Attributes.Name: breakingCapacity
Attributes.Description: The maximum fault current a breaking device can break safely under prescribed conditions of use.

DerivedEntities.Name: Sectionaliser
DerivedEntities.Description: Automatic switch that will lock open to isolate a faulted section. It may, or may not, have load breaking capability. Its primary purpose is to provide fault sectionalising at locations where the fault current is either too high, or too low, for proper coordination of fuses.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktSwitch
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC 61970:Wires:Switch.

Attributes.Name: open
Attributes.Description: The attribute tells if the switch is considered open when used as input to topology processing.

Attributes.Name: ratedCurrent
Attributes.Description:
The maximum continuous current carrying capacity in amps governed by the device material and construction.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: locked
Attributes.Description:
If true, the switch is locked. The resulting switch state is a combination of locked and Switch.open attributes as follows:
  • locked=true and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open and locked;
  • locked=false and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open;
  • locked=false and Switch.open=false. The resulting state is closed.

Attributes.Name: switchOnDate
Attributes.Description: The date and time when the switch was last switched on.

Attributes.Name: normalOpen
Attributes.Description: The attribute is used in cases when no Measurement for the status value is present. If the Switch has a status measurement the Discrete.normalValue is expected to match with the Switch.normalOpen.

Attributes.Name: retained
Attributes.Description: Branch is retained in the topological solution.  The flow through retained switches will normally be calculated in power flow.

Attributes.Name: switchOnCount
Attributes.Description: The switch on count since the switch was last reset or initialized.

DerivedEntities.Name: EquivalentEquipment
DerivedEntities.Description: The class represents equivalent objects that are the result of a network reduction. The class is the base for equivalent objects of different types.

DerivedEntities.Name: EquivalentBranch
DerivedEntities.Description: The class represents equivalent branches. In cases where a transformer phase shift is modelled and the EquivalentBranch is spanning the same nodes, the impedance quantities for the EquivalentBranch shall consider the needed phase shift.

Attributes.Name: positiveX21
Attributes.Description:
Positive sequence series reactance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: negativeX21
Attributes.Description:
Negative sequence series reactance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
Usage: EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: zeroX12
Attributes.Description:
Zero sequence series reactance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: r21
Attributes.Description:
Resistance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1 .Used for steady state power flow. This attribute is optional and represent unbalanced network such as off-nominal phase shifter. If only EquivalentBranch.r is given, then EquivalentBranch.r21 is assumed equal to EquivalentBranch.r.
Usage rule : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: zeroX21
Attributes.Description:
Zero sequence series reactance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: positiveR12
Attributes.Description:
Positive sequence series resistance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2 . Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909. 
EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: zeroR12
Attributes.Description:
Zero sequence series resistance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: negativeR21
Attributes.Description:
Negative sequence series resistance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: x21
Attributes.Description:
Reactance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for steady state power flow. This attribute is optional and represents an unbalanced network such as off-nominal phase shifter. If only EquivalentBranch.x is given, then EquivalentBranch.x21 is assumed equal to EquivalentBranch.x.
Usage rule: EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: positiveR21
Attributes.Description:
Positive sequence series resistance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: positiveX12
Attributes.Description:
Positive sequence series reactance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: negativeX12
Attributes.Description:
Negative sequence series reactance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence series resistance of the reduced branch.

Attributes.Name: zeroR21
Attributes.Description:
Zero sequence series resistance from terminal sequence  2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: negativeR12
Attributes.Description:
Negative sequence series resistance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence series reactance of the reduced branch.

DerivedEntities.Name: EquivalentShunt
DerivedEntities.Description: The class represents equivalent shunts.

Attributes.Name: b
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence shunt susceptance.

Attributes.Name: g
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence shunt conductance.

DerivedEntities.Name: EquivalentInjection
DerivedEntities.Description: This class represents equivalent injections (generation or load).  Voltage regulation is allowed only at the point of connection.

Attributes.Name: maxP
Attributes.Description: Maximum active power of the injection.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description:
Equivalent reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

Attributes.Name: minP
Attributes.Description: Minimum active power of the injection.

Attributes.Name: r0
Attributes.Description:
Zero sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: maxQ
Attributes.Description: Maximum reactive power of the injection.  Used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange. Not used for short circuit modelling.  If maxQ and minQ are not used ReactiveCapabilityCurve can be used.

Attributes.Name: regulationCapability
Attributes.Description: Specifies whether or not the EquivalentInjection has the capability to regulate the local voltage. If true the EquivalentInjection can regulate. If false the EquivalentInjection cannot regulate. ReactiveCapabilityCurve can only be associated with EquivalentInjection  if the flag is true.

Attributes.Name: regulationStatus
Attributes.Description: Specifies the regulation status of the EquivalentInjection.  True is regulating.  False is not regulating.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description:
Positive sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: regulationTarget
Attributes.Description: The target voltage for voltage regulation. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: x2
Attributes.Description:
Negative sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description:
Positive sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: x0
Attributes.Description:
Zero sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description:
Equivalent active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

Attributes.Name: minQ
Attributes.Description: Minimum reactive power of the injection.  Used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange. Not used for short circuit modelling.  If maxQ and minQ are not used ReactiveCapabilityCurve can be used.

Attributes.Name: r2
Attributes.Description:
Negative sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

DerivedEntities.Name: CompositeSwitch
DerivedEntities.Description:
A model of a set of individual Switches normally enclosed within the same cabinet and possibly with interlocks that restrict the combination of switch positions. These are typically found in medium voltage distribution networks. 
A CompositeSwitch could represent a Ring-Main-Unit (RMU), or pad-mounted switchgear, with primitive internal devices such as an internal bus-bar plus 3 or 4 internal switches each of which may individually be open or closed. A CompositeSwitch and a set of contained Switches can also be used to represent a multi-position switch e.g. a switch that can connect a circuit to Ground, Open or Busbar.

Attributes.Name: compositeSwitchType
Attributes.Description: An alphanumeric code that can be used as a reference to extra information such as the description of the interlocking scheme if any.

DerivedEntities.Name: HydroPump
DerivedEntities.Description: A synchronous motor-driven pump, typically associated with a pumped storage plant.

Attributes.Name: pumpDischAtMaxHead
Attributes.Description: The pumping discharge under maximum head conditions, usually at full gate.

Attributes.Name: pumpDischAtMinHead
Attributes.Description: The pumping discharge under minimum head conditions, usually at full gate.

Attributes.Name: pumpPowerAtMaxHead
Attributes.Description: The pumping power under maximum head conditions, usually at full gate.

Attributes.Name: pumpPowerAtMinHead
Attributes.Description: The pumping power under minimum head conditions, usually at full gate.

DerivedEntities.Name: GeneratingUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: A single or set of synchronous machines for converting mechanical power into alternating-current power. For example, individual machines within a set may be defined for scheduling purposes while a single control signal is derived for the set. In this case there would be a GeneratingUnit for each member of the set and an additional GeneratingUnit corresponding to the set.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktGeneratingUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC61970:Production:GeneratingUnit.

DerivedEntities.Name: ThermalGeneratingUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: A generating unit whose prime mover could be a steam turbine, combustion turbine, or diesel engine.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktThermalGeneratingUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of ThermalGeneratingUnit from Production Package in IEC 61970.

Attributes.Name: oMCost
Attributes.Description: Operating and maintenance cost for the thermal unit.

DerivedEntities.Name: SolarGeneratingUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: A solar thermal generating unit, connected to the grid by means of a rotating machine.  This class does not represent photovoltaic (PV) generation.

DerivedEntities.Name: HydroGeneratingUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: A generating unit whose prime mover is a hydraulic turbine (e.g., Francis, Pelton, Kaplan).

Attributes.Name: dropHeight
Attributes.Description: The height water drops from the reservoir mid-point to the turbine.

Attributes.Name: hydroUnitWaterCost
Attributes.Description: The equivalent cost of water that drives the hydro turbine.

Attributes.Name: energyConversionCapability
Attributes.Description: Energy conversion capability for generating.

Attributes.Name: turbineType
Attributes.Description: Type of turbine.

DerivedEntities.Name: NuclearGeneratingUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: A nuclear generating unit.

DerivedEntities.Name: WindGeneratingUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: A wind driven generating unit, connected to the grid by means of a rotating machine.  May be used to represent a single turbine or an aggregation.

Attributes.Name: windGenUnitType
Attributes.Description: The kind of wind generating unit.

Attributes.Name: minimumOffTime
Attributes.Description: Minimum time interval between unit shutdown and startup.

Attributes.Name: minEconomicP
Attributes.Description: Low economic active power limit that shall be greater than or equal to the minimum operating active power limit.

Attributes.Name: ratedGrossMaxP
Attributes.Description:
The unit's gross rated maximum capacity (book value).
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: controlPulseLow
Attributes.Description: Pulse low limit which is the smallest control pulse that the unit can respond to.

Attributes.Name: genControlSource
Attributes.Description: The source of controls for a generating unit.  Defines the control status of the generating unit.

Attributes.Name: controlResponseRate
Attributes.Description: Unit response rate which specifies the active power change for a control pulse of one second in the most responsive loading level of the unit.

Attributes.Name: baseP
Attributes.Description: For dispatchable units, this value represents the economic active power basepoint, for units that are not dispatchable, this value represents the fixed generation value. The value shall be between the operating low and high limits.

Attributes.Name: nominalP
Attributes.Description:
The nominal power of the generating unit.  Used to give precise meaning to percentage based attributes such as the governor speed change droop (governorSCD attribute).
The attribute shall be a positive value equal to or less than RotatingMachine.ratedS.

Attributes.Name: highControlLimit
Attributes.Description: High limit for secondary (AGC) control.

Attributes.Name: longPF
Attributes.Description: Generating unit long term economic participation factor.

Attributes.Name: efficiency
Attributes.Description: The efficiency of the unit in converting mechanical energy, from the prime mover, into electrical energy.

Attributes.Name: genControlMode
Attributes.Description: The unit control mode.

Attributes.Name: minOperatingP
Attributes.Description: This is the minimum operating active power limit the dispatcher can enter for this unit.

Attributes.Name: lowControlLimit
Attributes.Description: Low limit for secondary (AGC) control.

Attributes.Name: ratedGrossMinP
Attributes.Description:
The gross rated minimum generation level which the unit can safely operate at while delivering power to the transmission grid.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: raiseRampRate
Attributes.Description: The normal maximum rate the generating unit active power output can be raised by control actions.

Attributes.Name: penaltyFactor
Attributes.Description: Defined as: 1 / ( 1 - Incremental Transmission Loss); with the Incremental Transmission Loss expressed as a plus or minus value. The typical range of penalty factors is (0.9 to 1.1).

Attributes.Name: governorMPL
Attributes.Description: Governor motor position limit.

Attributes.Name: totalEfficiency
Attributes.Description: The efficiency of the unit in converting the fuel into electrical energy.

Attributes.Name: maxEconomicP
Attributes.Description: Maximum high economic active power limit, that should not exceed the maximum operating active power limit.

Attributes.Name: tieLinePF
Attributes.Description: Generating unit economic participation factor.

Attributes.Name: governorSCD
Attributes.Description: Governor Speed Changer Droop.   This is the change in generator power output divided by the change in frequency normalized by the nominal power of the generator and the nominal frequency and expressed in percent and negated. A positive value of speed change droop provides additional generator output upon a drop in frequency.

Attributes.Name: variableCost
Attributes.Description: The variable cost component of production per unit of ActivePower.

Attributes.Name: maxOperatingP
Attributes.Description: This is the maximum operating active power limit the dispatcher can enter for this unit.

Attributes.Name: controlDeadband
Attributes.Description: Unit control error deadband. When a unit's desired active power change is less than this deadband, then no control pulses will be sent to the unit.

Attributes.Name: modelDetail
Attributes.Description: Detail level of the generator model data.

Attributes.Name: initialP
Attributes.Description: Default initial active power  which is used to store a powerflow result for the initial active power for this unit in this network configuration.

Attributes.Name: shortPF
Attributes.Description: Generating unit short term economic participation factor.

Attributes.Name: normalPF
Attributes.Description: Generating unit economic participation factor.  The sum of the participation factors across generating units does not have to sum to one.  It is used for representing distributed slack participation factor. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

Attributes.Name: ratedNetMaxP
Attributes.Description:
The net rated maximum capacity determined by subtracting the auxiliary power used to operate the internal plant machinery from the rated gross maximum capacity.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: lowerRampRate
Attributes.Description: The normal maximum rate the generating unit active power output can be lowered by control actions.

Attributes.Name: allocSpinResP
Attributes.Description: The planned unused capacity (spinning reserve) which can be used to support emergency load.

Attributes.Name: startupCost
Attributes.Description: The initial startup cost incurred for each start of the GeneratingUnit.

Attributes.Name: autoCntrlMarginP
Attributes.Description: The planned unused capacity which can be used to support automatic control overruns.

Attributes.Name: startupTime
Attributes.Description: Time it takes to get the unit on-line, from the time that the prime mover mechanical power is applied.

Attributes.Name: controlPulseHigh
Attributes.Description: Pulse high limit which is the largest control pulse that the unit can respond to.

Attributes.Name: maximumAllowableSpinningReserve
Attributes.Description: Maximum allowable spinning reserve. Spinning reserve will never be considered greater than this value regardless of the current operating point.

DerivedEntities.Name: TransformerTank
DerivedEntities.Description: An assembly of two or more coupled windings that transform electrical power between voltage levels. These windings are bound on a common core and placed in the same tank. Transformer tank can be used to model both single-phase and 3-phase transformers.

DerivedEntities.Name: AuxiliaryEquipment
DerivedEntities.Description:
AuxiliaryEquipment describe equipment that is not performing any primary functions but support for the equipment performing the primary function.
AuxiliaryEquipment is attached to primary equipment via an association with Terminal.

DerivedEntities.Name: Sensor
DerivedEntities.Description: This class describe devices that transform a measured quantity into signals that can be presented at displays, used in control or be recorded.

DerivedEntities.Name: PostLineSensor
DerivedEntities.Description: A sensor used mainly in overhead distribution networks as the source of both current and voltage measurements.

DerivedEntities.Name: PotentialTransformer
DerivedEntities.Description: Instrument transformer (also known as Voltage Transformer) used to measure electrical qualities of the circuit that is being protected and/or monitored. Typically used as voltage transducer for the purpose of metering, protection, or sometimes auxiliary substation supply. A typical secondary voltage rating would be 120V.

Attributes.Name: ptClass
Attributes.Description: Potential transformer (PT) classification covering burden.

Attributes.Name: nominalRatio
Attributes.Description: Nominal ratio between the primary and secondary voltage.

Attributes.Name: type
Attributes.Description: Potential transformer construction type.

Attributes.Name: accuracyClass
Attributes.Description: PT accuracy classification.

DerivedEntities.Name: CurrentTransformer
DerivedEntities.Description: Instrument transformer used to measure electrical qualities of the circuit that is being protected and/or monitored. Typically used as current transducer for the purpose of metering or protection. A typical secondary current rating would be 5A.

Attributes.Name: accuracyClass
Attributes.Description: CT accuracy classification.

Attributes.Name: coreBurden
Attributes.Description: Power burden of the CT core.

Attributes.Name: accuracyLimit
Attributes.Description: Percent of rated current for which the CT remains accurate within specified limits.

Attributes.Name: usage
Attributes.Description: Intended usage of the CT; i.e. metering, protection.

Attributes.Name: ctClass
Attributes.Description: CT classification; i.e. class 10P.

DerivedEntities.Name: WaveTrap
DerivedEntities.Description: Line traps are devices that impede high frequency power line carrier signals yet present a negligible impedance at the main power frequency.

DerivedEntities.Name: SurgeArrester
DerivedEntities.Description: Shunt device, installed on the network, usually in the proximity of electrical equipment in order to protect the said equipment against transient voltage transients caused by lightning or switching activity.

DerivedEntities.Name: FaultIndicator
DerivedEntities.Description: A FaultIndicator is typically only an indicator (which may or may not be remotely monitored), and not a piece of equipment that actually initiates a protection event. It is used for FLISR (Fault Location, Isolation and Restoration) purposes, assisting with the dispatch of crews to "most likely" part of the network (i.e. assists with determining circuit section where the fault most likely happened).

DerivedEntities.Name: PowerElectronicsUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: A generating unit or battery or aggregation that connects to the AC network using power electronics rather than rotating machines.

DerivedEntities.Name: PowerElectronicsWindUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: A wind generating unit that connects to the AC network with power electronics rather than rotating machines or an aggregation of such units.

DerivedEntities.Name: BatteryUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: An electrochemical energy storage device.

Attributes.Name: batteryState
Attributes.Description: The current state of the battery (charging, full, etc.).

Attributes.Name: ratedE
Attributes.Description: Full energy storage capacity of the battery. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: storedE
Attributes.Description: Amount of energy currently stored. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero and lower than BatteryUnit.ratedE.

DerivedEntities.Name: PhotoVoltaicUnit
DerivedEntities.Description: A photovoltaic device or an aggregation of such devices.

Attributes.Name: minP
Attributes.Description: Minimum active power limit. This is the minimum (nameplate) limit for the unit.

Attributes.Name: maxP
Attributes.Description: Maximum active power limit. This is the maximum (nameplate) limit for the unit.

DerivedEntities.Name: ProtectionEquipment
DerivedEntities.Description: An electrical device designed to respond to input conditions in a prescribed manner and after specified conditions are met to cause contact operation or similar abrupt change in associated electric control circuits, or simply to display the detected condition. Protection equipment is associated with conducting equipment and usually operate circuit breakers.

DerivedEntities.Name: SynchrocheckRelay
DerivedEntities.Description: A device that operates when two AC circuits are within the desired limits of frequency, phase angle, and voltage, to permit or to cause the paralleling of these two circuits. Used to prevent the paralleling of non-synchronous topological islands.

Attributes.Name: maxAngleDiff
Attributes.Description: The maximum allowable voltage vector phase angle difference across the open device.

Attributes.Name: maxVoltDiff
Attributes.Description: The maximum allowable difference voltage across the open device.

Attributes.Name: maxFreqDiff
Attributes.Description: The maximum allowable frequency difference across the open device.

DerivedEntities.Name: CurrentRelay
DerivedEntities.Description: A device that checks current flow values in any direction or designated direction.

Attributes.Name: currentLimit2
Attributes.Description: Current limit number 2 for inverse time pickup.

Attributes.Name: currentLimit1
Attributes.Description: Current limit number one 1 for inverse time pickup.

Attributes.Name: currentLimit3
Attributes.Description: Current limit number 3 for inverse time pickup.

Attributes.Name: inverseTimeFlag
Attributes.Description: Set true if the current relay has inverse time characteristic.

Attributes.Name: timeDelay1
Attributes.Description: Inverse time delay number 1 for current limit number 1.

Attributes.Name: timeDelay2
Attributes.Description: Inverse time delay number 2 for current limit number 2.

Attributes.Name: timeDelay3
Attributes.Description: Inverse time delay number 3 for current limit number 3.

Attributes.Name: lowLimit
Attributes.Description: The minimum allowable value.

Attributes.Name: unitMultiplier
Attributes.Description: The unit multiplier of the value.

Attributes.Name: relayDelayTime
Attributes.Description: The time delay from detection of abnormal conditions to relay operation.

Attributes.Name: highLimit
Attributes.Description: The maximum allowable value.

Attributes.Name: unitSymbol
Attributes.Description: The unit of measure of the value.

Attributes.Name: powerDirectionFlag
Attributes.Description: Direction same as positive active power flow value.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCConductingEquipment
DerivedEntities.Description: The parts of the DC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through DC terminals.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCBusbar
DerivedEntities.Description: A busbar within a DC system.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCSwitch
DerivedEntities.Description: A switch within the DC system.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCBreaker
DerivedEntities.Description: A breaker within a DC system.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCDisconnector
DerivedEntities.Description: A disconnector within a DC system.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCGround
DerivedEntities.Description: A ground within a DC system.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Resistance to ground.

Attributes.Name: inductance
Attributes.Description: Inductance to ground.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCSeriesDevice
DerivedEntities.Description: A series device within the DC system, typically a reactor used for filtering or smoothing.  Needed for transient and short circuit studies.

Attributes.Name: resistance
Attributes.Description: Resistance of the DC device.

Attributes.Name: inductance
Attributes.Description: Inductance of the device.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCShunt
DerivedEntities.Description: A shunt device within the DC system, typically used for filtering.  Needed for transient and short circuit studies.

Attributes.Name: capacitance
Attributes.Description: Capacitance of the DC shunt.

Attributes.Name: resistance
Attributes.Description: Resistance of the DC device.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCLineSegment
DerivedEntities.Description: A wire or combination of wires not insulated from one another, with consistent electrical characteristics, used to carry direct current between points in the DC region of the power system.

Attributes.Name: resistance
Attributes.Description: Resistance of the DC line segment.

Attributes.Name: length
Attributes.Description: Segment length for calculating line section capabilities.

Attributes.Name: inductance
Attributes.Description: Inductance of the DC line segment. Negligible compared with DCSeriesDevice used for smoothing.

Attributes.Name: capacitance
Attributes.Description: Capacitance of the DC line segment. Significant for cables only.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCChopper
DerivedEntities.Description: Low resistance equipment used in the internal DC circuit to balance voltages. It has typically positive and negative pole terminals and a ground.

Attributes.Name: ratedUdc
Attributes.Description: Rated DC device voltage. The attribute shall be a positive value. It is configuration data used in power flow.

Attributes.Name: aggregate
Attributes.Description:
The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

Attributes.Name: inService
Attributes.Description: Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

Attributes.Name: networkAnalysisEnabled
Attributes.Description: The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

Attributes.Name: normallyInService
Attributes.Description: Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

Entities.Name: GeographicalRegion
Entities.Description: A geographical region of a power system network model.

Entities.Name: ACDCTerminal
Entities.Description: An electrical connection point (AC or DC) to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCBaseTerminal
DerivedEntities.Description: An electrical connection point at a piece of DC conducting equipment. DC terminals are connected at one physical DC node that may have multiple DC terminals connected. A DC node is similar to an AC connectivity node. The model requires that DC connections are distinct from AC connections.

DerivedEntities.Name: ACDCConverterDCTerminal
DerivedEntities.Description: A DC electrical connection point at the AC/DC converter. The AC/DC converter is electrically connected also to the AC side. The AC connection is inherited from the AC conducting equipment in the same way as any other AC equipment. The AC/DC converter DC terminal is separate from generic DC terminal to restrict the connection with the AC side to AC/DC converter and so that no other DC conducting equipment can be connected to the AC side.

Attributes.Name: polarity
Attributes.Description:
Represents the normal network polarity condition. Depending on the converter configuration the value shall be set as follows:
- For a monopole with two converter terminals use DCPolarityKind positive and negative.
- For a bi-pole or symmetric monopole with three converter terminals use DCPolarityKind positive, middle and negative.

DerivedEntities.Name: DCTerminal
DerivedEntities.Description: An electrical connection point to generic DC conducting equipment.

DerivedEntities.Name: Terminal
DerivedEntities.Description: An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktTerminal
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC61970:Core:Terminal.

Attributes.Name: phases
Attributes.Description:
Represents the normal network phasing condition. If the attribute is missing, three phases (ABC) shall be assumed, except for terminals of grounding classes (specializations of EarthFaultCompensator, GroundDisconnector, GroundSwitch, and Ground) which will be assumed to be N. Therefore, phase code ABCN is explicitly declared when needed, e.g. for star point grounding equipment.
The phase code on terminals connecting same ConnectivityNode or same TopologicalNode as well as for equipment between two terminals shall be consistent.

Attributes.Name: connected
Attributes.Description:
The connected status is related to a bus-branch model and the topological node to terminal relation.  True implies the terminal is connected to the related topological node and false implies it is not. 
In a bus-branch model, the connected status is used to tell if equipment is disconnected without having to change the connectivity described by the topological node to terminal relation. A valid case is that conducting equipment can be connected in one end and open in the other. In particular for an AC line segment, where the reactive line charging can be significant, this is a relevant case.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: The orientation of the terminal connections for a multiple terminal conducting equipment.  The sequence numbering starts with 1 and additional terminals should follow in increasing order.   The first terminal is the "starting point" for a two terminal branch.

Entities.Name: IrregularTimePoint
Entities.Description: TimePoints for a schedule where the time between the points varies.

Attributes.Name: time
Attributes.Description: The time is relative to the schedule starting time.

Attributes.Name: value1
Attributes.Description: The first value at the time. The meaning of the value is defined by the derived type of the associated schedule.

Attributes.Name: value2
Attributes.Description: The second value at the time. The meaning of the value is defined by the derived type of the associated schedule.

Entities.Name: OperatingShare
Entities.Description: Specifies the operations contract relationship between a power system resource and a contract participant.

Attributes.Name: percentage
Attributes.Description: Percentage operational ownership between the pair (power system resource and operating participant) associated with this share. The total percentage ownership for a power system resource should add to 100%.

Entities.Name: RegularTimePoint
Entities.Description: Time point for a schedule where the time between the consecutive points is constant.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: The position of the regular time point in the sequence. Note that time points don't have to be sequential, i.e. time points may be omitted. The actual time for a RegularTimePoint is computed by multiplying the associated regular interval schedule's time step with the regular time point sequence number and adding the associated schedules start time. To specify values for the start time, use sequence number 0.  The sequence number cannot be negative.

Attributes.Name: value2
Attributes.Description: The second value at the time. The meaning of the value is defined by the derived type of the associated schedule.

Attributes.Name: value1
Attributes.Description: The first value at the time. The meaning of the value is defined by the derived type of the associated schedule.

Entities.Name: CurveData
Entities.Description: Multi-purpose data points for defining a curve.  The use of this generic class is discouraged if a more specific class can be used to specify the X and Y axis values along with their specific data types.

DerivedEntities.Name: DefaultBidCurveData
DerivedEntities.Description: Curve data for default bid curve and startup cost curve.

Attributes.Name: bidSegmentCalcType
Attributes.Description: Type of calculation basis used to define the default bid segment curve.

Attributes.Name: y2value
Attributes.Description: The data value of the second Y-axis variable (if present), depending on the Y-axis units.

Attributes.Name: y3value
Attributes.Description: The data value of the third Y-axis variable (if present), depending on the Y-axis units.

Attributes.Name: xvalue
Attributes.Description: The data value of the X-axis variable,  depending on the X-axis units.

Attributes.Name: y1value
Attributes.Description: The data value of the  first Y-axis variable, depending on the Y-axis units.

Entities.Name: SynchronousMachineKind
Entities.Description: Synchronous machine type.

Attributes.Name: generatorOrCondenserOrMotor
Attributes.Description: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a generator or as a condenser or as a motor.

Attributes.Name: motor
Attributes.Description: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a motor.

Attributes.Name: generator
Attributes.Description: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a generator.

Attributes.Name: condenser
Attributes.Description: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a condenser.

Attributes.Name: generatorOrCondenser
Attributes.Description: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a generator or as a condenser.

Attributes.Name: motorOrCondenser
Attributes.Description: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a motor or as a condenser.

Attributes.Name: generatorOrMotor
Attributes.Description: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a generator or as a motor.

Entities.Name: PhaseTapChangerLinear
Entities.Description:
Describes a tap changer with a linear relation between the tap step and the phase angle difference across the transformer. This is a mathematical model that is an approximation of a real phase tap changer.
The phase angle is computed as stepPhaseShiftIncrement times the tap position.
The voltage magnitude of both sides is the same.

Attributes.Name: stepPhaseShiftIncrement
Attributes.Description:
Phase shift per step position. A positive value indicates a positive angle variation from the Terminal at the  PowerTransformerEnd,  where the TapChanger is located, into the transformer.
The actual phase shift increment might be more accurately computed from the symmetrical or asymmetrical models or a tap step table lookup if those are available.

Attributes.Name: xMax
Attributes.Description: The reactance depends on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The maximum reactance (xMax) appears at the low and high tap positions. Depending on the u curve the attribute can be either higher or lower than PowerTransformerEnd.x.

Attributes.Name: xMin
Attributes.Description: The reactance depends on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The minimum reactance (xMin) appears at the mid tap position.  PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be consistent with PhaseTapChangerLinear.xMin and PhaseTapChangerNonLinear.xMin. In case of inconsistency, PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be used.

Entities.Name: PhaseImpedanceData
Entities.Description:
Impedance and conductance matrix element values. 
The diagonal elements are described by the elements having the same toPhase and fromPhase value and the off diagonal elements have different toPhase and fromPhase values.  The matrix can also be stored in symmetric lower triangular format using the row and column attributes, which map to ACLineSegmentPhase.sequenceNumber.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Resistance matrix element value, per length of unit.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Reactance matrix element value, per length of unit.

Attributes.Name: fromPhase
Attributes.Description: Refer to the class description.

Attributes.Name: b
Attributes.Description: Susceptance matrix element value, per length of unit.

Attributes.Name: row
Attributes.Description: The matrix elements row number, in the range 1 to PerLengthPhaseImpedance.conductorCount. Only the lower triangle needs to be stored. This row number matches ACLineSegmentPhase.sequenceNumber.

Attributes.Name: column
Attributes.Description: The matrix element's column number, in the range 1 to row. Only the lower triangle needs to be stored. This column number matches ACLineSegmentPhase.sequenceNumber.

Attributes.Name: g
Attributes.Description: Conductance matrix element value, per length of unit.

Attributes.Name: toPhase
Attributes.Description: Refer to the class description.

Entities.Name: PhaseShuntConnectionKind
Entities.Description: The configuration of phase connections for a single terminal device such as a load or capacitor.

Attributes.Name: G
Attributes.Description: Ground connection; use when explicit connection to ground needs to be expressed in combination with the phase code, such as for electrical wire/cable or for meters.

Attributes.Name: I
Attributes.Description: Independent winding, for single-phase connections.

Attributes.Name: D
Attributes.Description: Delta connection.

Attributes.Name: Yn
Attributes.Description: Wye, with neutral brought out for grounding.

Attributes.Name: Y
Attributes.Description: Wye connection.

Entities.Name: GroundingImpedance
Entities.Description: A fixed impedance device used for grounding.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Reactance of device.

Entities.Name: ExternalNetworkInjection
Entities.Description: This class represents the external network and it is used for IEC 60909 calculations.

Attributes.Name: voltageFactor
Attributes.Description: Voltage factor in pu, which was used to calculate short-circuit current Ik" and power Sk".  Used only if short circuit calculations are done according to superposition method.

Attributes.Name: maxInitialSymShCCurrent
Attributes.Description: Maximum initial symmetrical short-circuit currents (Ik" max) in A (Ik" = Sk"/(SQRT(3) Un)). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: minR1ToX1Ratio
Attributes.Description: Minimum ratio of positive sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its positive sequence reactance (R(1)/X(1) min). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: maxQ
Attributes.Description: Maximum reactive power limit. It is used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange and not for short circuit modelling.

Attributes.Name: ikSecond
Attributes.Description: Indicates whether initial symmetrical short-circuit current and power have been calculated according to IEC (Ik").  Used only if short circuit calculations are done according to superposition method.

Attributes.Name: referencePriority
Attributes.Description: Priority of unit for use as powerflow voltage phase angle reference bus selection. 0 = don t care (default) 1 = highest priority. 2 is less than 1 and so on.

Attributes.Name: maxR0ToX0Ratio
Attributes.Description: Maximum ratio of zero sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its zero sequence reactance (R(0)/X(0) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: minZ0ToZ1Ratio
Attributes.Description: Minimum ratio of zero sequence impedance to its positive sequence impedance (Z(0)/Z(1) min). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: minP
Attributes.Description: Minimum active power of the injection.

Attributes.Name: maxP
Attributes.Description: Maximum active power of the injection.

Attributes.Name: maxZ0ToZ1Ratio
Attributes.Description: Maximum ratio of zero sequence impedance to its positive sequence impedance (Z(0)/Z(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: maxR1ToX1Ratio
Attributes.Description: Maximum ratio of positive sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its positive sequence reactance (R(1)/X(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description:
Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

Attributes.Name: minInitialSymShCCurrent
Attributes.Description: Minimum initial symmetrical short-circuit currents (Ik" min) in A (Ik" = Sk"/(SQRT(3) Un)). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

Attributes.Name: minQ
Attributes.Description: Minimum reactive power limit. It is used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange and not for short circuit modelling.

Attributes.Name: governorSCD
Attributes.Description: Power Frequency Bias. This is the change in power injection divided by the change in frequency and negated.  A positive value of the power frequency bias provides additional power injection upon a drop in frequency.

Attributes.Name: q

Entities.Name: ACLineSegment
Entities.Description:
A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system.
For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment.  Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances.
The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch.

Entities.Name: PowerTransformerEnd
Entities.Description:
A PowerTransformerEnd is associated with each Terminal of a PowerTransformer.
The impedance values r, r0, x, and x0 of a PowerTransformerEnd represents a star equivalent as follows.
1) for a two Terminal PowerTransformer the high voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=1) PowerTransformerEnd has non zero values on r, r0, x, and x0 while the low voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=2) PowerTransformerEnd has zero values for r, r0, x, and x0.  Parameters are always provided, even if the PowerTransformerEnds have the same rated voltage.  In this case, the parameters are provided at the PowerTransformerEnd which has TransformerEnd.endNumber equal to 1.
2) for a three Terminal PowerTransformer the three PowerTransformerEnds represent a star equivalent with each leg in the star represented by r, r0, x, and x0 values.
3) For a three Terminal transformer each PowerTransformerEnd shall have g, g0, b and b0 values corresponding to the no load losses distributed on the three PowerTransformerEnds. The total no load loss shunt impedances may also be placed at one of the PowerTransformerEnds, preferably the end numbered 1, having the shunt values on end 1.  This is the preferred way.
4) for a PowerTransformer with more than three Terminals the PowerTransformerEnd impedance values cannot be used. Instead use the TransformerMeshImpedance or split the transformer into multiple PowerTransformers.
Each PowerTransformerEnd must be contained by a PowerTransformer. Because a PowerTransformerEnd (or any other object) can not be contained by more than one parent, a PowerTransformerEnd can not have an association to an EquipmentContainer (Substation, VoltageLevel, etc).

Attributes.Name: b0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence magnetizing branch susceptance.

Attributes.Name: g0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence magnetizing branch conductance (star-model).

Attributes.Name: phaseAngleClock
Attributes.Description: Terminal voltage phase angle displacement where 360 degrees are represented with clock hours. The valid values are 0 to 11. For example, for the secondary side end of a transformer with vector group code of 'Dyn11', specify the connection kind as wye with neutral and specify the phase angle of the clock as 11.  The clock value of the transformer end number specified as 1, is assumed to be zero.  Note the transformer end number is not assumed to be the same as the terminal sequence number.

Attributes.Name: ratedU
Attributes.Description:
Rated voltage: phase-phase for three-phase windings, and either phase-phase or phase-neutral for single-phase windings.
A high voltage side, as given by TransformerEnd.endNumber, shall have a ratedU that is greater than or equal to ratedU for the lower voltage sides.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: r0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence series resistance (star-model) of the transformer end.

Attributes.Name: b
Attributes.Description: Magnetizing branch susceptance (B mag).  The value can be positive or negative.

Attributes.Name: g
Attributes.Description: Magnetizing branch conductance.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description:
Resistance (star-model) of the transformer end.
The attribute shall be equal to or greater than zero for non-equivalent transformers.

Attributes.Name: ratedS
Attributes.Description:
Normal apparent power rating.
The attribute shall be a positive value. For a two-winding transformer the values for the high and low voltage sides shall be identical.

Attributes.Name: x0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence series reactance of the transformer end.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence series reactance (star-model) of the transformer end.

EnergyConsumer.pfixed, .qfixed, .pfixedPct and .qfixedPct have meaning only if there is no LoadResponseCharacteristic associated with EnergyConsumer or if LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is set to False.

Attributes.Name: pfixed
Attributes.Description: Active power of the load that is a fixed quantity and does not vary as load group value varies. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: phaseConnection
Attributes.Description: The type of phase connection, such as wye or delta.

Attributes.Name: qfixedPct
Attributes.Description: Fixed reactive power as a percentage of load group fixed reactive power. Used to represent the time-varying components.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

Attributes.Name: grounded

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description:
Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Attributes.Name: customerCount

Attributes.Name: pfixedPct

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description:
Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

Entities.Description:
A tap changer that changes the voltage ratio impacting the voltage magnitude but not the phase angle across the transformer.

Angle sign convention (general): Positive value indicates a positive phase shift from the winding where the tap is located to the other winding (for a two-winding transformer).

Attributes.Name: tculControlMode
Attributes.Description: Specifies the regulation control mode (voltage or reactive) of the RatioTapChanger.

Attributes.Name: stepVoltageIncrement
Attributes.Description:
Tap step increment, in per cent of rated voltage of the power transformer end, per step position.
When the increment is negative, the voltage decreases when the tap step increases.

Attributes.Name: condenser
