Entities.Name: PhaseTapChangerSymmetrical
Entities.Description: Describes a symmetrical phase shifting transformer tap model in which the voltage magnitude of both sides is the same. The difference voltage magnitude is the base in an equal-sided triangle where the sides corresponds to the primary and secondary voltages. The phase angle difference corresponds to the top angle and can be expressed as twice the arctangent of half the total difference voltage.

Entities.Name: CompositeSwitch
Entities.Description:
A model of a set of individual Switches normally enclosed within the same cabinet and possibly with interlocks that restrict the combination of switch positions. These are typically found in medium voltage distribution networks. 
A CompositeSwitch could represent a Ring-Main-Unit (RMU), or pad-mounted switchgear, with primitive internal devices such as an internal bus-bar plus 3 or 4 internal switches each of which may individually be open or closed. A CompositeSwitch and a set of contained Switches can also be used to represent a multi-position switch e.g. a switch that can connect a circuit to Ground, Open or Busbar.

Attributes.Name: compositeSwitchType
Attributes.Description: An alphanumeric code that can be used as a reference to extra information such as the description of the interlocking scheme if any.

Entities.Name: Cut
Entities.Description:
A cut separates a line segment into two parts. The cut appears as a switch inserted between these two parts and connects them together. As the cut is normally open there is no galvanic connection between the two line segment parts. But it is possible to close the cut to get galvanic connection.
The cut terminals are oriented towards the line segment terminals with the same sequence number. Hence the cut terminal with sequence number equal to 1 is oriented to the line segment's terminal with sequence number equal to 1.
The cut terminals also act as connection points for jumpers and other equipment, e.g. a mobile generator. To enable this, connectivity nodes are placed at the cut terminals. Once the connectivity nodes are in place any conducting equipment can be connected at them.

Attributes.Name: lengthFromTerminal1
Attributes.Description: The length to the place where the cut is located starting from side one of the cut line segment, i.e. the line segment Terminal with sequenceNumber equal to 1.

Entities.Name: Ground

Attributes.Name: offsetCurrent

Attributes.Name: nominalU
Attributes.Description: The nominal voltage for which the coil is designed.

Attributes.Name: xGroundMin
Attributes.Description: The minimum reactance.

Attributes.Name: positionCurrent
Attributes.Description: The control current used to control the Petersen coil also known as the position current.  Typically in the range of 20 mA to 200 mA.

Attributes.Name: xGroundMax

Attributes.Name: xGroundNominal
Attributes.Description: The nominal reactance.  This is the operating point (normally over compensation) that is defined based on the resonance point in the healthy network condition.  The impedance is calculated based on nominal voltage divided by position current.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description: Nominal resistance of device.

Entities.Name: Conductor

DerivedEntities.Name: ACLineSegment
DerivedEntities.Description:
A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system.
For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment.  Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances.
The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch.

DerivedEntities.Name: MktACLineSegment
DerivedEntities.Description: Subclass of IEC 61970:Wires:ACLineSegment.

Attributes.Name: g0ch

Attributes.Description: Maximum allowed regulated voltage on the PT secondary, regardless of line drop compensation. Sometimes referred to as first-house protection.

Attributes.Name: angle
Attributes.Description: The angle difference in degrees. A positive value indicates a positive angle variation from the Terminal at the  PowerTransformerEnd,  where the TapChanger is located, into the transformer.

DerivedEntities.Name: RatioTapChangerTablePoint
DerivedEntities.Description: Describes each tap step in the ratio tap changer tabular curve.

Attributes.Name: b
Attributes.Description:
The magnetizing branch susceptance deviation as a percentage of nominal value. The actual susceptance is calculated as follows:
calculated magnetizing susceptance = b(nominal) * (1 + b(from this class)/100).   The b(nominal) is defined as the static magnetizing susceptance on the associated power transformer end or ends.  This model assumes the star impedance (pi model) form.

Attributes.Name: g
Attributes.Description:
The magnetizing branch conductance deviation as a percentage of nominal value. The actual conductance is calculated as follows:
calculated magnetizing conductance = g(nominal) * (1 + g(from this class)/100).   The g(nominal) is defined as the static magnetizing conductance on the associated power transformer end or ends.  This model assumes the star impedance (pi model) form.

Attributes.Name: x
Attributes.Description:
The series reactance deviation as a percentage of nominal value. The actual reactance is calculated as follows:
calculated reactance = x(nominal) * (1 + x(from this class)/100).   The x(nominal) is defined as the static series reactance on the associated power transformer end or ends.  This model assumes the star impedance (pi model) form.

Attributes.Name: r
Attributes.Description:
The resistance deviation as a percentage of nominal value. The actual reactance is calculated as follows:
calculated resistance = r(nominal) * (1 + r(from this class)/100).   The r(nominal) is defined as the static resistance on the associated power transformer end or ends.  This model assumes the star impedance (pi model) form.

Attributes.Name: step
Attributes.Description: The tap step.

Attributes.Name: ratio
Attributes.Description:
The voltage at the tap step divided by rated voltage of the transformer end having the tap changer. Hence this is a value close to one.
For example, if the ratio at step 1 is 1.01, and the rated voltage of the transformer end is 110kV, then the voltage obtained by setting the tap changer to step 1 to is 111.1kV.

Entities.Name: RatioTapChangerTablePoint
Entities.Description: Describes each tap step in the ratio tap changer tabular curve.

Entities.Name: NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint
Entities.Description: A non linear shunt compensator bank or section admittance value. The number of NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint instances associated with a NonlinearShuntCompensator shall be equal to ShuntCompensator.maximumSections. ShuntCompensator.sections shall only be set to one of the NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint.sectionNumber. There is no interpolation between NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint-s.

Attributes.Name: b
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

Attributes.Name: b0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

Attributes.Name: sectionNumber
Attributes.Description: The number of the section.

Attributes.Name: g
Attributes.Description: Positive sequence shunt (charging) conductance per section.

Attributes.Name: g0
Attributes.Description: Zero sequence shunt (charging) conductance per section.

Entities.Name: PetersenCoil
Entities.Description: A variable impedance device normally used to offset line charging during single line faults in an ungrounded section of network.

Attributes.Name: positionCurrent
Attributes.Description: The control current used to control the Petersen coil also known as the position current.  Typically in the range of 20 mA to 200 mA.

Attributes.Name: xGroundMax
Attributes.Description: The maximum reactance.

Attributes.Name: nominalU
Attributes.Description: The nominal voltage for which the coil is designed.

Attributes.Name: mode
Attributes.Description: The mode of operation of the Petersen coil.

Attributes.Name: offsetCurrent
Attributes.Description: The offset current that the Petersen coil controller is operating from the resonant point.  This is normally a fixed amount for which the controller is configured and could be positive or negative.  Typically 0 to 60 A depending on voltage and resonance conditions.

Attributes.Name: xGroundNominal
Attributes.Description: The nominal reactance.  This is the operating point (normally over compensation) that is defined based on the resonance point in the healthy network condition.  The impedance is calculated based on nominal voltage divided by position current.

Attributes.Name: xGroundMin
Attributes.Description: The minimum reactance.

Attributes.Name: demandCharge
Attributes.Description: The charge related to the usage within a defined time interval, normally expressed in terms of a tariff. For example: a maximum-demand tariff will levy an additional charge on top of the consumption charge if the usage exceeds a defined limit per hour.

Attributes.Name: auxiliaryCharge
Attributes.Description: Any other charge which is not a consumptionCharge or demandCharge. For example: debt recovery, arrears, standing charge or charge for another service such as street lighting.

Attributes.Name: taxCharge
Attributes.Description: Any charge that is classified as a tax of a kind. For example: VAT, GST, TV tax, etc.

Attributes.Name: other
Attributes.Description: Other kind of charge.

Entities.Name: ConsumptionTariffInterval

Where consumption is >= startValue it falls within this interval and where consumption is < startValue it falls within the previous interval.

Attributes.Name: startValue
Attributes.Description: The lowest level of consumption that defines the starting point of this interval. The interval extends to the start of the next interval or until it is reset to the start of the first interval by TariffProfile.tariffCycle.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: A sequential reference that defines the identity of this interval and its relative position with respect to other intervals in a sequence of intervals.

Entities.Name: DCDisconnector

Entities.Name: CsConverter
Entities.Description:
DC side of the current source converter (CSC).
The firing angle controls the dc voltage at the converter, both for rectifier and inverter. The difference between the dc voltages of the rectifier and inverter determines the dc current. The extinction angle is used to limit the dc voltage at the inverter, if needed, and is not used in active power control. The firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filters are the primary means to control a current source dc line. Higher level controls are built on top, e.g. dc voltage, dc current and active power. From a steady state perspective it is sufficient to specify the wanted active power transfer (ACDCConverter.targetPpcc) and the control functions will set the dc voltage, dc current, firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filters to meet this. Therefore attributes targetAlpha and targetGamma are not applicable in this case.
The reactive power consumed by the converter is a function of the firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filter, which can be approximated with half of the active power. The losses is a function of the dc voltage and dc current.
The attributes minAlpha and maxAlpha define the range of firing angles for rectifier operation between which no discrete tap changer action takes place. The range is typically 10-18 degrees.
The attributes minGamma and maxGamma define the range of extinction angles for inverter operation between which no discrete tap changer action takes place. The range is typically 17-20 degrees.

Attributes.Name: maxIdc
Attributes.Description: The maximum direct current (Id) on the DC side at which the converter should operate. It is converters configuration data use in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: targetIdc
Attributes.Description: DC current target value. It is converters control variable used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: targetAlpha
Attributes.Description: Target firing angle. It is converters control variable used in power flow. It is only applicable for rectifier if continuous tap changer control is used. Allowed values are within the range minAlpha<=targetAlpha<=maxAlpha. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: targetGamma
Attributes.Description: Target extinction angle. It is converters control variable used in power flow. It is only applicable for inverter if continuous tap changer control is used. Allowed values are within the range minGamma<=targetGamma<=maxGamma. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: maxAlpha
Attributes.Description: Maximum firing angle. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: alpha
Attributes.Description: Firing angle that determines the dc voltage at the converter dc terminal. Typical value between 10 degrees and 18 degrees for a rectifier. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: gamma
Attributes.Description: Extinction angle. It is used to limit the dc voltage at the inverter if needed. Typical value between 17 degrees and 20 degrees for an inverter. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: maxGamma
Attributes.Description: Maximum extinction angle. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: minAlpha
Attributes.Description: Minimum firing angle. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: minGamma
Attributes.Description: Minimum extinction angle. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: minIdc
Attributes.Description: The minimum direct current (Id) on the DC side at which the converter should operate. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

Attributes.Name: operatingMode
Attributes.Description: Indicates whether the DC pole is operating as an inverter or as a rectifier. It is converters control variable used in power flow.

Attributes.Name: ratedIdc
Attributes.Description: Rated converter DC current, also called IdN. The attribute shall be a positive value. It is converters configuration data used in power flow.

Attributes.Name: pPccControl
Attributes.Description: Kind of active power control.

Entities.Name: DCPolarityKind
Entities.Description: Polarity for DC circuits.

Attributes.Name: positive
Attributes.Description: Positive pole. The converter terminal is intended to operate at a positive voltage relative the midpoint or negative terminal.

Attributes.Name: middle
Attributes.Description: Middle pole. The converter terminal is the midpoint in a bipolar or symmetric monopole configuration. The midpoint can be grounded and/or have a metallic return.

Attributes.Name: negative
Attributes.Description: Negative pole. The converter terminal is intended to operate at a negative voltage relative the midpoint or positive terminal.

Entities.Name: CsPpccControlKind
Entities.Description: Active power control modes for HVDC line operating as Current Source Converter.

Attributes.Name: activePower
Attributes.Description: Control is active power control at AC side, at point of common coupling. Target is provided by ACDCConverter.targetPpcc.

Attributes.Name: dcCurrent
Attributes.Description: Control is DC current  with target value provided by CsConverter.targetIdc.

Attributes.Name: dcVoltage
Attributes.Description: Control is DC voltage  with target value provided by ACDCConverter.targetUdc.

Entities.Name: DCConverterOperatingModeKind
Entities.Description: The operating mode of an HVDC bipole.

Attributes.Name: monopolarGroundReturn
Attributes.Description: Monopolar operation with ground return.

Attributes.Name: monopolarMetallicReturn
Attributes.Description: Monopolar operation with metallic return.

Attributes.Name: bipolar
Attributes.Description: Bipolar operation.

Entities.Name: CsOperatingModeKind
Entities.Description: Operating mode for HVDC line operating as Current Source Converter.

Attributes.Name: inverter
Attributes.Description: Operating as inverter, which is the power receiving end.

Attributes.Name: rectifier
Attributes.Description: Operating as rectifier, which is the power sending end.

Entities.Name: DCLine
Entities.Description: Overhead lines and/or cables connecting two or more HVDC substations.

Entities.Name: VsPpccControlKind
Entities.Description: Types applicable to the control of real power and/or DC voltage by voltage source converter.

Attributes.Name: pPcc
Attributes.Description: Control is real power at point of common coupling. The target value is provided by ACDCConverter.targetPpcc.

Attributes.Name: pPccAndUdcDroopWithCompensation
Attributes.Description: Control is active power at point of common coupling and compensated DC voltage, with the droop. Compensation factor is the resistance, as an approximation of the DC voltage of a common (real or virtual) node in the DC network. Targets are provided by ACDCConverter.targetPpcc, ACDCConverter.targetUdc, VsConverter.droop and VsConverter.droopCompensation.

Attributes.Name: udc
Attributes.Description: Control is DC voltage  with target value provided by ACDCConverter.targetUdc.

Attributes.Name: pPccAndUdcDroop
Attributes.Description: Control is active power at point of common coupling and local DC voltage, with the droop. Target values are provided by ACDCConverter.targetPpcc, ACDCConverter.targetUdc and VsConverter.droop.

Attributes.Name: pPccAndUdcDroopPilot
Attributes.Description: Control is active power at point of common coupling and the pilot DC voltage, with the droop. The mode is used for Multi Terminal High Voltage DC (MTDC) systems where multiple HVDC Substations are connected to the HVDC transmission lines. The pilot voltage is then used to coordinate the control the DC voltage across the HVDC substations. Targets are provided by ACDCConverter.targetPpcc, ACDCConverter.targetUdc and  VsConverter.droop.

Attributes.Name: phasePcc
Attributes.Description: Control is phase at point of common coupling. Target is provided by VsConverter.targetPhasePcc.

Entities.Name: DCBreaker
Entities.Description: A breaker within a DC system.

Entities.Name: DCShunt
Entities.Description: A shunt device within the DC system, typically used for filtering.  Needed for transient and short circuit studies.

Attributes.Name: capacitance
Attributes.Description: Capacitance of the DC shunt.

Attributes.Name: resistance
Attributes.Description: Resistance of the DC device.

Entities.Name: DCChopper
Entities.Description: Low resistance equipment used in the internal DC circuit to balance voltages. It has typically positive and negative pole terminals and a ground.

Entities.Name: WindAeroTwoDimIEC

Two-dimensional aerodynamic model.  
Reference: IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.1.3.

Attributes.Name: dpomega

Attributes.Name: dpv1
Attributes.Description: Partial derivative (dpv1). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: omegazero
Attributes.Description: Rotor speed if the wind turbine is not derated (omega0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dptheta
Attributes.Description: Partial derivative of aerodynamic power with respect to changes in pitch angle (dptheta). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: pavail
Attributes.Description: Available aerodynamic power (pavail). It is a case-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: thetazero
Attributes.Description: Pitch angle if the wind turbine is not derated (theta0). It is a case-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: thetav2
Attributes.Description: Blade angle at twice rated wind speed (thetav2). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Entities.Name: WindContPType3IEC

P control model type 3.
Reference: IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.5.4.

Attributes.Name: dprefmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum ramp rate of wind turbine reference power (dprefmax). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dpmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum wind turbine power ramp rate (dpmax). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: pdtdmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum active drive train damping power (pDTDmax). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tomegaref
Attributes.Description: Time constant in speed reference filter (Tomega,ref) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: mpuvrt
Attributes.Description: Enable UVRT power control mode (MpUVRT). It is a project-dependent parameter. true = voltage control (1 in the IEC model) false = reactive power control (0 in the IEC model).

Attributes.Name: kip
Attributes.Description: PI controller integration parameter (KIp). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dthetamaxuvrt
Attributes.Description: Limitation of torque rise rate during UVRT (dthetamaxUVRT). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: zeta
Attributes.Description: Coefficient for active drive train damping (zeta). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dthetamax
Attributes.Description: Ramp limitation of torque, required in some grid codes (dtmax). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kdtd
Attributes.Description: Gain for active drive train damping (KDTD). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tomegafiltp3
Attributes.Description: Filter time constant for generator speed measurement (Tomegafiltp3) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: dprefmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum ramp rate of wind turbine reference power (dprefmin). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: updip
Attributes.Description: Voltage dip threshold for P-control (uPdip). Part of turbine control, often different (e.g 0.8) from converter thresholds. It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: thetaemin
Attributes.Description: Minimum electrical generator torque (temin). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: omegadtd
Attributes.Description: Active drive train damping frequency (omegaDTD). It can be calculated from two mass model parameters. It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tpfiltp3
Attributes.Description: Filter time constant for power measurement (Tpfiltp3) (>= 0). It is a type-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: kpp

Attributes.Name: udvs

Attributes.Name: tdvs

Attributes.Name: thetauscale
Attributes.Description: Voltage scaling factor of reset-torque (tuscale). It is a project-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: tpord

Attributes.Name: tufiltp3

Attributes.Name: omegaoffset
Attributes.Description: Offset to reference value that limits controller action during rotor speed changes (omegaoffset). It is a case-dependent parameter.

Attributes.Name: qminu
Attributes.Description: Lookup table for voltage dependency of reactive power minimum limit (q<sub>minu</sub>(p)). It is used for the QP and QU limitation model, IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.5.10.

Attributes.Name: qmaxu
Attributes.Description: Lookup table for voltage dependency of reactive power maximum limit (q<sub>maxu</sub>(p)). It is used for the QP and QU limitation model, IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.5.10.

Attributes.Name: omegap
Attributes.Description: Power vs. speed lookup table (omega(p)). It is used for the P control model type 3, IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.5.4.

Attributes.Name: qwp

Attributes.Name: tduwt

Attributes.Name: tfunder
Attributes.Description: Disconnection time versus under-frequency lookup table (T<sub>funder</sub>(f<sub>WT</sub>)). It is used for the grid protection model, IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.6.

Attributes.Name: tuunder
Attributes.Description: Disconnection time versus under-voltage lookup table (T<sub>uunder</sub>(u<sub>WT</sub>)). It is used for the grid protection model, IEC 61400-27-1:2015, 5.6.6.

Entities.Name: SynchronousMachineDynamics
Entities.Description:
Synchronous machine whose behaviour is described by reference to a standard model expressed in one of the following forms: - simplified (or classical), where a group of generators or motors is not modelled in detail; - detailed, in equivalent circuit form; - detailed, in time constant reactance form; or - by definition of a user-defined model. It is a common practice to represent small generators by a negative load rather than by a dynamic generator model when performing dynamics simulations. In this case, a SynchronousMachine in the static model is not represented by anything in the dynamics model, instead it is treated as an ordinary load. Parameter details:
  1. Synchronous machine parameters such as Xl, Xd, Xp etc. are actually used as inductances in the models, but are commonly referred to as reactances since, at nominal frequency, the PU values are the same. However, some references use the symbol L instead of X.

DerivedEntities.Name: SynchronousMachineDetailed
SynchronousMachineEquivalentCircuit
DerivedEntities.Description: The electrical equations for all variations of the synchronous models are based on the SynchronousEquivalentCircuit diagram for the direct- and quadrature- axes. Equations for conversion between equivalent circuit and time constant reactance forms: Xd = Xad + Xl Xd = Xl + Xad x Xfd / (Xad + Xfd) Xd = Xl + Xad x Xfd x X1d / (Xad x Xfd + Xad x X1d + Xfd x X1d) Xq = Xaq + Xl Xq = Xl + Xaq x X1q / (Xaq + X1q) Xq = Xl + Xaq x X1q x X2q / (Xaq x X1q + Xaq x X2q + X1q x X2q) Tdo = (Xad + Xfd) / (omega0 x Rfd) Tdo = (Xad x Xfd + Xad x X1d + Xfd x X1d) / (omega0 x R1d x (Xad + Xfd) Tqo = (Xaq + X1q) / (omega0 x R1q) Tqo = (Xaq x X1q + Xaq x X2q + X1q x X2q) / (omega0 x R2q x (Xaq + X1q) Same equations using CIM attributes from SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance class on left of "=" and SynchronousMachineEquivalentCircuit class on right (except as noted): xDirectSync = xad + RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance xDirectTrans = RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance + xad x xfd / (xad + xfd) xDirectSubtrans = RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance + xad x xfd x x1d / (xad x xfd + xad x x1d + xfd x x1d) xQuadSync = xaq + RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance xQuadTrans = RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance + xaq x x1q / (xaq+ x1q) xQuadSubtrans = RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance + xaq x x1q x x2q / (xaq x x1q + xaq x x2q + x1q x x2q) tpdo = (xad + xfd) / (2 x pi x nominal frequency x rfd) tppdo = (xad x xfd + xad x x1d + xfd x x1d) / (2 x pi x nominal frequency x r1d x (xad + xfd) tpqo = (xaq + x1q) / (2 x pi x nominal frequency x r1q) tppqo = (xaq x x1q + xaq x x2q + x1q x x2q) / (2 x pi x nominal frequency x r2q x (xaq + x1q) These are only valid for a simplified model where "Canay" reactance is zero.

DerivedEntities.Name: SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance

Attributes.Name: xQuadSubtrans
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis subtransient reactance (X''q) (> RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance). Typical value = 0,2.

Attributes.Name: tpqo
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis transient rotor time constant (T'qo) (> SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance.tppqo). Typical value = 0,5.

Attributes.Name: xDirectTrans
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis transient reactance (unsaturated) (X'd) (>= SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance.xDirectSubtrans). Typical value = 0,5.

Attributes.Name: ks
Attributes.Description: Saturation loading correction factor (Ks) (>= 0). Used only by type J model. Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: tpdo
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis transient rotor time constant (T'do) (> SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance.tppdo). Typical value = 5.

Attributes.Name: xDirectSync
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis synchronous reactance (Xd) (>= SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance.xDirectTrans). The quotient of a sustained value of that AC component of armature voltage that is produced by the total direct-axis flux due to direct-axis armature current and the value of the AC component of this current, the machine running at rated speed. Typical value = 1,8.

Attributes.Name: xDirectSubtrans
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis subtransient reactance (unsaturated) (X''d) (> RotatingMachineDynamics.statorLeakageReactance). Typical value = 0,2.

Attributes.Name: modelType
Attributes.Description: Type of synchronous machine model used in dynamic simulation applications.

Attributes.Name: tppqo
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis subtransient rotor time constant (T''qo) (> 0). Typical value = 0,03.

Attributes.Name: rotorType
Attributes.Description: Type of rotor on physical machine.

Attributes.Name: xQuadTrans
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis transient reactance (X'q) (>= SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance.xQuadSubtrans). Typical value = 0,3.

Attributes.Name: xQuadSync
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis synchronous reactance (Xq) (>= SynchronousMachineTimeConstantReactance.xQuadTrans). The ratio of the component of reactive armature voltage, due to the quadrature-axis component of armature current, to this component of current, under steady state conditions and at rated frequency. Typical value = 1,6.

Attributes.Name: tc
Attributes.Description: Damping time constant for Canay reactance (>= 0).  Typical value = 0.

Attributes.Name: tppdo
Attributes.Description: Direct-axis subtransient rotor time constant (T''do) (> 0). Typical value = 0,03.

Attributes.Name: saturationFactor120QAxis
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis saturation factor at 120% of rated terminal voltage (S12q) (>= SynchonousMachineDetailed.saturationFactorQAxis). Typical value = 0,12.

Attributes.Name: ifdBaseType
Attributes.Description: Excitation base system mode. It should be equal to the value of WLMDV given by the user. WLMDV is the PU ratio between the field voltage and the excitation current: Efd = WLMDV x Ifd. Typical value = ifag.

Attributes.Name: saturationFactorQAxis
Attributes.Description: Quadrature-axis saturation factor at rated terminal voltage (S1q) (>= 0). Typical value = 0,02.

Attributes.Name: efdBaseRatio
Attributes.Description: Ratio (exciter voltage/generator voltage) of Efd bases of exciter and generator models (> 0). Typical value = 1.

DerivedEntities.Name: SynchronousMachineUserDefined
DerivedEntities.Description: Synchronous machine whose dynamic behaviour is described by a user-defined model.

Attributes.Name: proprietary
Attributes.Description:
Behaviour is based on a proprietary model as opposed to a detailed model.
true = user-defined model is proprietary with behaviour mutually understood by sending and receiving applications and parameters passed as general attributes
false = user-defined model is explicitly defined in terms of control blocks and their input and output signals.

Attributes.Name: subtransientTypeJ
Attributes.Description: WECC type J variant of subtransient synchronous machine model.

Entities.Name: ErpAccountKind
Entities.Description: Kind of ERP account.

Entities.Name: ErpRecDelvLineItem
Entities.Description: Of an ErpReceiveDelivery, this is an individually received good or service by the Organisation receiving goods or services. It may be used to indicate receipt of goods in conjunction with a purchase order line item.

Entities.Name: ErpIssueInventory
Entities.Description: Can be used to request an application to process an issue or request information about an issue.

Entities.Name: ErpCompetency
Entities.Description: Information that describes aptitudes of a utility employee. Unlike Skills that an ErpPerson must be certified to perform before undertaking certain type of assignments (to be able to perfrom a Craft), ErpCompetency has more to do with typical Human Resource (HR) matters such as schooling, training, etc.

Entities.Name: ErpIdentifiedObject
Entities.Description: Shadow class for IdentifiedObject, to isolate subclassing from this package. If any subclass gets normative and needs inheritance, it will inherit directly from IdentifiedObject.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpTimeEntry
DerivedEntities.Description: An individual entry on an ErpTimeSheet.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpInventoryCount
DerivedEntities.Description:
This is related to Inventory physical counts organized by AssetModel. Note that a count of a type of asset can be accomplished by the association inherited by AssetModel (from Document) to Asset.
It enables ERP applications to transfer an inventory count between ERP and the actual physical inventory location. This count may be a cycle count or a physical count.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpLedgerEntry
DerivedEntities.Description: Details of an individual entry in a ledger, which was posted from a journal on the posted date.

Attributes.Name: postedDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time this entry was posted to the ledger.

Attributes.Name: accountKind
Attributes.Description: Kind of account for this entry.

Attributes.Name: accountID
Attributes.Description: Account identifier for this entry.

Attributes.Name: amount
Attributes.Description: The amount of the debit or credit for this account.

Attributes.Name: transactionDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time journal entry was recorded.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpLedBudLineItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Individual entry of a given Ledger Budget, typically containing information such as amount, accounting date, accounting period, and is associated with the applicable general ledger account.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpReqLineItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Information that describes a requested item and its attributes.

Attributes.Name: quantity
Attributes.Description: Quantity of item requisitioned.

Attributes.Name: cost
Attributes.Description: Cost of material.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpJournalEntry
DerivedEntities.Description: Details of an individual entry in a journal, which is to be posted to a ledger on the posting date.

Attributes.Name: amount
Attributes.Description: The amount of the debit or credit for this account.

Attributes.Name: transactionDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time journal entry was recorded.

Attributes.Name: accountID
Attributes.Description: Account identifier for this entry.

Attributes.Name: postingDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time this entry is to be posted to the ledger.

Attributes.Name: sourceID
Attributes.Description: The identifer of the source for this entry.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpRecLineItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Individual entry of an ErpReceivable, it is a particular transaction representing an invoice, credit memo or debit memo to a customer.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpItemMaster
DerivedEntities.Description:
Any unique purchased part for manufactured product tracked by ERP systems for a utility.
Item, as used by the OAG, refers to the basic information about an item, including its attributes, cost, and locations. It does not include item quantities. Compare to the Inventory, which includes all quantities and other location-specific information.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpPersonnel
DerivedEntities.Description: Information that applies to the basic data about a utility person, used by ERP applications to transfer Personnel data for a worker.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpRecDelvLineItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Of an ErpReceiveDelivery, this is an individually received good or service by the Organisation receiving goods or services. It may be used to indicate receipt of goods in conjunction with a purchase order line item.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpQuoteLineItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Of an ErpQuote, the item or product quoted along with quantity, price and other descriptive information.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpInventory
DerivedEntities.Description: Utility inventory-related information about an item or part (and not for description of the item and its attributes). It is used by ERP applications to enable the synchronization of Inventory data that exists on separate Item Master databases. This data is not the master data that describes the attributes of the item such as dimensions, weight, or unit of measure - it describes the item as it exists at a specific location.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpPayableLineItem
DerivedEntities.Description: Of an ErpPayable, a line item references an ErpInvoiceLineitem or other source such as credit memos.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpIssueInventory
DerivedEntities.Description: Can be used to request an application to process an issue or request information about an issue.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpSiteLevelData
DerivedEntities.Description: For a utility, general information that describes physical locations of organizations or the location codes and their meanings. This enables ERP applications to ensure that the physical location identifiers are synchronized between the business applications.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpCompetency
DerivedEntities.Description: Information that describes aptitudes of a utility employee. Unlike Skills that an ErpPerson must be certified to perform before undertaking certain type of assignments (to be able to perfrom a Craft), ErpCompetency has more to do with typical Human Resource (HR) matters such as schooling, training, etc.

DerivedEntities.Name: ErpBomItemData
DerivedEntities.Description: An individual item on a bill of materials.

Entities.Name: ErpQuoteLineItem
Entities.Description: Of an ErpQuote, the item or product quoted along with quantity, price and other descriptive information.

Entities.Name: ErpQuote
Entities.Description: Document describing the prices of goods or services provided by a supplier. It includes the terms of the purchase, delivery proposals, identification of goods or services ordered, as well as their quantities.

Entities.Name: ErpInvoiceLineItemKind
Entities.Description: Kind of invoice line item.

Entities.Name: ErpReceivable
Entities.Description: Transaction representing an invoice, credit memo or debit memo to a customer. It is an open (unpaid) item in the Accounts Receivable ledger.

Entities.Name: ErpJournalEntry
Entities.Description: Details of an individual entry in a journal, which is to be posted to a ledger on the posting date.

Attributes.Name: postingDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time this entry is to be posted to the ledger.

Attributes.Name: accountID
Attributes.Description: Account identifier for this entry.

Attributes.Name: sourceID
Attributes.Description: The identifer of the source for this entry.

Attributes.Name: amount
Attributes.Description: The amount of the debit or credit for this account.

Attributes.Name: transactionDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time journal entry was recorded.

Entities.Name: ErpInvoiceKind
Entities.Description: Kind of ERP invoice.

Entities.Name: BillMediaKind
Entities.Description: Kind of bill media.

Entities.Name: SvTapStep
Entities.Description: State variable for transformer tap step.

Attributes.Name: position
Attributes.Description: The floating point tap position.   This is not the tap ratio, but rather the tap step position as defined by the related tap changer model and normally is constrained to be within the range of minimum and maximum tap positions.

Entities.Name: StateVariable
Entities.Description: An abstract class for state variables.

DerivedEntities.Name: SvShuntCompensatorSections
DerivedEntities.Description: State variable for the number of sections in service for a shunt compensator.

Attributes.Name: phase
Attributes.Description: The terminal phase at which the connection is applied.   If missing, the injection is assumed to be balanced among non-neutral phases.

Attributes.Name: sections
Attributes.Description: The number of sections in service as a continuous variable. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero. To get integer value scale with ShuntCompensator.bPerSection.

DerivedEntities.Name: SvTapStep
DerivedEntities.Description: State variable for transformer tap step.

Attributes.Name: position
Attributes.Description: The floating point tap position.   This is not the tap ratio, but rather the tap step position as defined by the related tap changer model and normally is constrained to be within the range of minimum and maximum tap positions.

DerivedEntities.Name: SvVoltage
DerivedEntities.Description: State variable for voltage.

Attributes.Name: angle
Attributes.Description: The voltage angle of the topological node complex voltage with respect to system reference.

Attributes.Name: phase
Attributes.Description: If specified the voltage is the line to ground voltage of the individual phase.   If unspecified, then the voltage is assumed balanced.

Attributes.Name: v
Attributes.Description: The voltage magnitude at the topological node. The attribute shall be a positive value.

DerivedEntities.Name: SvStatus
DerivedEntities.Description: State variable for status.

Attributes.Name: inService
Attributes.Description: The in service status as a result of topology processing.  It indicates if the equipment is considered as energized by the power flow. It reflects if the equipment is connected within a solvable island.  It does not necessarily reflect whether or not the island was solved by the power flow.

Attributes.Name: phase
Attributes.Description: The individual phase status.    If the attribute is unspecified, then three phase model is assumed.

DerivedEntities.Name: SvPowerFlow
DerivedEntities.Description: State variable for power flow. Load convention is used for flow direction. This means flow out from the TopologicalNode into the equipment is positive.

Attributes.Name: p
Attributes.Description: The active power flow. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.

Attributes.Name: phase
Attributes.Description: The individual phase of the flow.   If unspecified, then assumed to be balanced among phases.

Attributes.Name: q
Attributes.Description: The reactive power flow. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.

DerivedEntities.Name: SvSwitch
DerivedEntities.Description: State variable for switch.

Attributes.Name: open
Attributes.Description: The attribute tells if the computed state of the switch is considered open.

Attributes.Name: phase
Attributes.Description: The terminal phase at which the connection is applied.   If missing, the injection is assumed to be balanced among non-neutral phases.

DerivedEntities.Name: SvInjection
DerivedEntities.Description: The SvInjection reports the calculated bus injection minus the sum of the terminal flows. The terminal flow is positive out from the bus (load sign convention) and bus injection has positive flow into the bus. SvInjection may have the remainder after state estimation or slack after power flow calculation.

Attributes.Name: qInjection
Attributes.Description: The reactive power mismatch between calculated injection and initial injection.  Positive sign means injection into the TopologicalNode (bus).

Attributes.Name: pInjection
Attributes.Description: The active power mismatch between calculated injection and initial injection.  Positive sign means injection into the TopologicalNode (bus).

Attributes.Name: phase
Attributes.Description: The terminal phase at which the connection is applied.   If missing, the injection is assumed to be balanced among non-neutral phases.

Entities.Name: ModelOperationArg
Entities.Description: Describes the role a dataset plays in a model operation.   The role is applicable only in the context of a single operation.

DerivedEntities.Name: DatasetArg
DerivedEntities.Description: A model operation argument referencing a dataset instance.

DerivedEntities.Name: IncrementalDatasetArg
DerivedEntities.Description: A generic model operation argument referencing an incremental change description.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: The sequence number of the argument in an operation.  Argument entries are considered in numerical order where the operation requires an ordering.

Entities.Name: ModelOperation
Entities.Description: An operation performed on models.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Sequence number within a operation sequence, lower is first.   Normally starts with 1.

Entities.Name: ClearanceActionKind
Entities.Description: Type of clearance action.

Attributes.Name: release
Attributes.Description: Release clearance.

Attributes.Name: update
Attributes.Description: Update clearance.

Attributes.Name: issue
Attributes.Description: Issue clearance.

Entities.Name: SwitchActionKind
Entities.Description: Kind of action on switch.

Attributes.Name: close
Attributes.Description: Close the switch.

Attributes.Name: open
Attributes.Description: Open the switch.

Attributes.Name: enableReclosing
Attributes.Description: Enable (automatic) switch reclosing.

Attributes.Name: disableReclosing
Attributes.Description: Disable (automatic) switch reclosing.

Entities.Name: TempEquipActionKind
Entities.Description: Kind of action on temporary equipment (such as cut, jumper, ground, energy source).

Attributes.Name: place
Attributes.Description: Place the jumper (close) or the cut (open).

Attributes.Name: remove
Attributes.Description: Remove the jumper (open) or the cut (close).

Entities.Name: OperationalUpdatedRating
Entities.Description: Lowered capability because of deterioration or inadequacy (sometimes referred to as derating or partial outage) or other kind of operational rating change.

Attributes.Name: changeType
Attributes.Description: Type of operational updated rating, e.g. a derate, a rerate or a return to normal.

Entities.Name: TagActionKind
Entities.Description: Kind of action on tag.

Attributes.Name: remove
Attributes.Description: Remove the tag.

Attributes.Name: place
Attributes.Description: Place the tag.

Attributes.Name: verify
Attributes.Description: Verify the tag.

Entities.Name: OperationalTag
Entities.Description: Operational tag placed on a power system resource or asset in the context of switching plan execution or other work in the field.

Entities.Name: EstimatedRestorationTime
Entities.Description: The Estimated Restoration Time for a single outage

Attributes.Name: ert
Attributes.Description: estimated time the outage will be restored

Attributes.Name: ertSource
Attributes.Description: defines the source that provided the ERT value.

Attributes.Name: confidenceKind
Attributes.Description: provides the confidence level that this ERT can be accomplished.  This may be changed/updated as needed.

Entities.Name: SwitchingStepGroup
Entities.Description: A logical step, grouping atomic switching steps that are important to distinguish when they may change topology (e.g. placing a jumper between two cuts).

Attributes.Name: isFreeSequence
Attributes.Description: If true, the sequence number serves for presentation purposes only, and the activity itself may be executed at any time.

Attributes.Name: description
Attributes.Description: Descriptive information concerning the switching step group.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Order of this activity in the sequence of activities within the switching plan.

Attributes.Name: purpose
Attributes.Description: Describes the overall purpose of the steps in this switching step group.

Entities.Name: OutagePlan
Entities.Description: Document containing the definition of planned outages of equipment and/or usage points. It will reference switching plans that are used to execute the planned outage.

Attributes.Name: approvedDateTime
Attributes.Description: The date and time the outage plan was approved

Attributes.Name: plannedPeriod
Attributes.Description: planned start and end time of the planned outage.

Attributes.Name: purpose
Attributes.Description: Purpose of  this outage plan, such as whether it is to replace equipment or perform maintenance or repairs or to reconfigure network topology.

Attributes.Name: cancelledDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and Time the planned outage was canceled.

Entities.Name: SwitchingStep
Entities.Description: Atomic switching step; can be part of a switching step group, or part of a switching plan.

Attributes.Name: isFreeSequence
Attributes.Description: For a step, if isFreeSequence is set to false or is not specified, all of the steps in the group must be executed in the order defined by the sequenceNumber attribute. The sequenceNumber for a step has a different meaning when there are two or more sequential steps that have the isFreeSequence attribute set to true. Execution must still be performed in sequenceNumber order until a set of two or more steps that have isFreeSequence set to true is encountered. In this case, these steps can be executed in any sequence, until a step is encountered that has isFreeSequence set to false. All of the steps preceding this step must be executed before the step can be executed.

Attributes.Name: sequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Order of this activity in the sequence of activities within the switching plan.

Attributes.Name: subStepSequenceNumber
Attributes.Description: Supports compound switching steps that are made up of several sub steps.

Entities.Name: AreaKind
Entities.Description: Enumeration for the type of area defined; e.g., county, state, parish, zipcode, etc.

Entities.Name: ERTConfidenceKind
Entities.Description: The estimated time of restoration can have a confidence factor applied such as high or low confidence that the ERT will be accomplished.  This confidence factor may be updated as needed during the outage period - just as the actual ERT can be updated.

Attributes.Name: high
Attributes.Description: there is a high confidence that the ERT will be accomplished

Attributes.Name: low
Attributes.Description: there is a low confidence that the ERT will be accomplished.

Entities.Name: PSREventKind
Entities.Description: Kind of power system resource event.

Attributes.Name: unknown
Attributes.Description: Unknown power system resource state change.

Attributes.Name: inService
Attributes.Description: Power system resource state change to in service.

Attributes.Name: outOfService
Attributes.Description: Power system resource state change to out of service.

Attributes.Name: pendingAdd
Attributes.Description: Power system resource state change to pending add.

Attributes.Name: pendingReplace
Attributes.Description: Power system resource state change to pending replace.

Attributes.Name: other
Attributes.Description: Other power system resource state change.

Attributes.Name: pendingRemove
Attributes.Description: Power system resource state change to pending remove.

Entities.Name: ServicePointOutageSummary
Entities.Description: Summary counts of service points affected by an outage. These counts are sometimes referred to as total and critical customer count.

Attributes.Name: criticalCount
Attributes.Description: Number of critical service (delivery) points affected by an outage.

Attributes.Name: totalCount
Attributes.Description: Number of all service (delivery) points affected by an outage.

Entities.Name: OutageStatusKind
Entities.Description: This defines if the outage have been predicted or confirmed

Attributes.Name: restored
Attributes.Description: All usage points associated with the outage have been restored

Attributes.Name: confirmed
Attributes.Description: the outage has been verified

Attributes.Name: predicted
Attributes.Description: the outage may not be real since it has not been verified - it is only thought to be an outage.

Attributes.Name: partiallyRestored
Attributes.Description: Some of the usage points affected by the outage have been restored but other usage points are still out of power.

Attributes.Name: closed
Attributes.Description: The outage has been fully restored, the crews have been released and the outage is shown as closed

Entities.Name: OutageArea
Entities.Description: This defines the area covered by the Outage.

Attributes.Name: outageAreaKind
Attributes.Description: defines the type of area that has the outage - county, state, zipcode, etc.

Attributes.Name: metersServed
Attributes.Description: defines the number of meters served in the defined area.

Attributes.Name: earliestReportedTime
Attributes.Description: This is the reported time of the first outage report

Entities.Name: OutageCauseKind
Entities.Description: This enumeration describes the primary cause of the outage - planned, unplanned, etc.

Attributes.Name: animal
Attributes.Description: This outage was caused by an animal is was unplanned.  As such it is treated as a forced outage and is probably classified as "trouble" with a Trouble Ticket as well as a work/service order.  The primary difference between this and an unplanned outage is the reason for the outage.  If an animal caused this and perished as a result, the utility may have other actions that are required to be taken by the EPA or other groups with whom the utility has an agreement.

Entities.Name: Incident
Entities.Description: Description of a problem in the field that may be reported in a trouble ticket or come from another source. It may have to do with an outage.

Attributes.Name: cause
Attributes.Description: Cause of this incident.

Entities.Name: Customer
Entities.Description: Organisation receiving services from service supplier.

Attributes.Name: priority
Attributes.Description: Priority of the customer.

Attributes.Name: status
Attributes.Description: Status of this customer.

Attributes.Name: pucNumber
Attributes.Description: (if applicable) Public utilities commission (PUC) identification number.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of customer.

Attributes.Name: specialNeed
Attributes.Description: True if customer organisation has special service needs such as life support, hospitals, etc.

Attributes.Name: vip
Attributes.Description: (deprecated) (use 'priority' instead) True if this is an important customer. Importance is for matters different than those in 'specialNeed' attribute.

Attributes.Name: locale
Attributes.Description: Locale designating language to use in communications with this customer.

Entities.Name: CustomerKind
Entities.Description: Kind of customer.

Attributes.Name: windMachine
Attributes.Description: Wind machine customer.

Attributes.Name: other
Attributes.Description: Other kind of customer.

Attributes.Name: residential
Attributes.Description: Residential customer.

Attributes.Name: commercialIndustrial
Attributes.Description: Commercial industrial customer.

Attributes.Name: pumpingLoad
Attributes.Description: Pumping load customer.

Attributes.Name: residentialAndCommercial
Attributes.Description: Residential and commercial customer.

Attributes.Name: residentialAndStreetlight
Attributes.Description: Residential and streetlight customer.

Attributes.Name: residentialStreetlightOthers
Attributes.Description: Residential streetlight or other related customer.

Attributes.Name: residentialFarmService
Attributes.Description: Residential farm service customer.

Attributes.Name: energyServiceSupplier
Attributes.Description: Customer as energy service supplier.

Attributes.Name: energyServiceScheduler
Attributes.Description: Customer as energy service scheduler.

Attributes.Name: internalUse
Attributes.Description: Internal use customer.

Entities.Name: NotificationTriggerKind
Entities.Description: Kind of trigger to notify customer.

Attributes.Name: etrChange
Attributes.Description: Notify customer if estimated restoration time changes.

Attributes.Name: powerRestored
Attributes.Description: Notify customer when power has been restored.

Attributes.Name: initialEtr
Attributes.Description: Notify customer for the first time that estimated restoration time is available.

Attributes.Name: powerOut
Attributes.Description: Notify customer of planned outage.

Attributes.Name: informDispatched
Attributes.Description: Notify customer that a crew has been dispatched to investigate the problem.

Attributes.Name: reportingKind
Attributes.Description: Indicates how the customer reported trouble.

Attributes.Name: dateTimeOfReport
Attributes.Description: Date and time the trouble has been reported.

Attributes.Name: firstResponderStatus
Attributes.Description: Indicates whether the first responder such as police, fire department etc.has been notified and whether they are on site or en route.

Attributes.Name: multiplePremises
Attributes.Description: Set to true if the outage report indicated that other neighbors are also out of power.

Attributes.Name: resolvedDateTime
Attributes.Description: Date and time this trouble ticket has been resolved.

Attributes.Name: troubleCode
Attributes.Description: Trouble code (e.g., power down, flickering lights, partial power, etc).

Attributes.Name: comment
Attributes.Description: Free-form comment associated with the trouble call for example, "customer reported a large flash", etc.

Entities.Name: ServiceKind
Entities.Description: Kind of service.

Attributes.Name: tvLicence
Attributes.Description: TV license service.

Attributes.Name: refuse
Attributes.Description: Refuse (waster) service.

Attributes.Name: other
Attributes.Description: Other kind of service.

Attributes.Name: naturalGas
Attributes.Description: Natural gas service.

Attributes.Name: sewerage
Attributes.Description: Sewerage service.

Attributes.Name: rates
Attributes.Description: Rates (e.g. tax, charge, toll, duty, tariff, etc.) service.

Attributes.Name: steam
Attributes.Description: Steam service.

Attributes.Name: gas
Attributes.Description: Gas service.

Attributes.Name: propane
Attributes.Description: Propane service.

Attributes.Name: time
Attributes.Description: Time service.

Attributes.Name: internet
Attributes.Description: Internet service.

Attributes.Name: air
Attributes.Description: Air service.

Attributes.Name: heatingFluid
Attributes.Description: Heating fluid service.

Attributes.Name: water
Attributes.Description: Water service.

Attributes.Name: heat
Attributes.Description: Heat service.

Attributes.Name: electricity
Attributes.Description: Electricity service.

Entities.Name: TroubleCallKind
Entities.Description: Describes the type of Trouble, based on customer input.

Attributes.Name: powerOut
Attributes.Description: The customer is reporting an outage.

Attributes.Name: lineDown
Attributes.Description: The customer is reporting a line down

Entities.Name: PricingStructure
Entities.Description: Grouping of pricing components and prices used in the creation of customer charges and the eligibility criteria under which these terms may be offered to a customer. The reasons for grouping include state, customer classification, site characteristics, classification (i.e. fee price structure, deposit price structure, electric service price structure, etc.) and accounting requirements.

Attributes.Name: code
Attributes.Description: Unique user-allocated key for this pricing structure, used by company representatives to identify the correct price structure for allocating to a customer. For rate schedules it is often prefixed by a state code.

Attributes.Name: taxExemption
Attributes.Description: True if this pricing structure is not taxable.

Attributes.Name: dailyCeilingUsage
Attributes.Description: Absolute maximum valid non-demand usage quantity used in validating a customer's billed non-demand usage.

Attributes.Name: dailyEstimatedUsage
Attributes.Description: Used in place of actual computed estimated average when history of usage is not available, and typically manually entered by customer accounting.

Attributes.Name: revenueKind
Attributes.Description: (accounting) Kind of revenue, often used to determine the grace period allowed, before collection actions are taken on a customer (grace periods vary between revenue classes).

Attributes.Name: dailyFloorUsage
Attributes.Description: Absolute minimum valid non-demand usage quantity used in validating a customer's billed non-demand usage.

Entities.Name: TroubleReportingKind
Entities.Description: Kind of trouble reporting.

Attributes.Name: ivr
Attributes.Description: Trouble reported through interactive voice response system.

Attributes.Name: other
Attributes.Description: Trouble reported by other means.

Attributes.Name: email
Attributes.Description: Trouble reported by email.

Attributes.Name: letter
Attributes.Description: Trouble reported by letter.

Attributes.Name: call
Attributes.Description: Trouble call received by customer service representative.

Entities.Name: AccountNotification
Entities.Description: Notifications for move-in, move-out, delinquencies, etc.

Entities.Name: CustomerNotification
Entities.Description: Conditions for notifying the customer about the changes in the status of their service (e.g., outage restore, estimated restoration time, tariff or service level change, etc.)

Attributes.Name: contactType
Attributes.Description: Type of contact (e.g., phone, email, etc.).

Attributes.Name: latestDateTimeToCall
Attributes.Description: Latest date time to call the customer.

Attributes.Name: trigger
Attributes.Description: Trigger for this notification.

Attributes.Name: earliestDateTimeToCall
Attributes.Description: Earliest date time to call the customer.

Attributes.Name: contactValue
Attributes.Description: Value of contact type (e.g., phone number, email address, etc.).

Entities.Name: RevenueKind
Entities.Description: Accounting classification of the type of revenue collected for the customer agreement, typically used to break down accounts for revenue accounting.

Attributes.Name: nonResidential
Attributes.Description: Non-residential revenue.

Attributes.Name: residential
Attributes.Description: Residential revenue.

Attributes.Name: commercial
Attributes.Description: Commercial revenue.

Attributes.Name: industrial
Attributes.Description: Industrial revenue.

Attributes.Name: irrigation
Attributes.Description: Irrigation revenue.

Attributes.Name: other
Attributes.Description: Other revenue kind.

Attributes.Name: streetLight
Attributes.Description: Streetlight revenue.

Entities.Name: ReportingCapability
Entities.Description: <font color="#0f0f0f">Definition of one set of reporting capabilities for this monitoring station. The associated EnvironmentalValueSets describe the maximum range of possible environmental values the station is capable of returning.  This attribute is intended primarily to assist a utility in managing its stations. </font>

Attributes.Name: reportingIntervalPeriod
Attributes.Description: Number of units of time making up reporting period.

Attributes.Name: reportingIntervalType
Attributes.Description: Unit of time in which reporting period is expressed.

Attributes.Name: reportingMethod
Attributes.Description: Indicates how the weather station reports observations.

Entities.Name: EnvironmentalDiscrete
Entities.Description: Discrete (integer) measurement of relevance in the environmental domain.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of environmental discrete (integer).

Entities.Name: EnvironmentalPhenomenon
Entities.Description: The actual or forecast characteristics of an environmental phenomenon at a specific point in time (or during a specific time interval) that may have both a center and area/line location.

DerivedEntities.Name: SpacePhenomenon
DerivedEntities.Description: An extra-terrestrial phenomenon.

DerivedEntities.Name: MagneticStorm
DerivedEntities.Description: A magnetic storm, a temporary disturbance of the earth's magnetic field, induced by radiation and streams of charged particles from the sun.

Attributes.Name: changeDst
Attributes.Description:
Change in the disturbance  - storm time (Dst) index. The size of a geomagnetic storm is classified as:
- moderate ( -50 nT >minimum of Dst > -100 nT)
- intense (-100 nT > minimum Dst > -250 nT) or 
- super-storm ( minimum of Dst < -250 nT).

DerivedEntities.Name: GeosphericPhenomenon
DerivedEntities.Description: A geospheric phenomenon.

DerivedEntities.Name: Fire
DerivedEntities.Description: A fire, often uncontrolled, covering an area of land which typically contains combustible vegetation. Associated location information is assumed to describe the total area burned as of a specified time.

DerivedEntities.Name: LightningStrike
DerivedEntities.Description: A cloud-to-ground lightning strike at a particular location.

Attributes.Name: negativePolarity
Attributes.Description: The polarity of the strike, with T meaning negative. About 90% of all lightning strokes are negative strokes, meaning that they were initiated by a large concentration of negative charge in the cloud-base; this tends to induce an area of positive charge on the ground.

Attributes.Name: errorEllipseConfidence
Attributes.Description: Likelihood that strike fell within errorEllipse.

Attributes.Name: errorEllipseOrientation
Attributes.Description: The orientation of the major semi- axis in degrees from True North.

Attributes.Name: errorEllipseMinorSemiAxis
Attributes.Description: Length of minor semi-axis (shortest radius) of the error ellipse.

Attributes.Name: errorEllipseMajorSemiAxis
Attributes.Description: Length of major semi-axis (longest radius) of the error ellipse.

Attributes.Name: peakAmplitude
Attributes.Description: Peak current of strike.

DerivedEntities.Name: Landslide
DerivedEntities.Description: A landslide, a large mass of rocks and earth that suddenly and quickly moves down the side of a mountain or hill.

DerivedEntities.Name: Earthquake
DerivedEntities.Description: An earthquake.

Attributes.Name: magnitude
Attributes.Description: The magnitude of the earthquake as defined on the Moment Magnitude (M<sub>w</sub>) scale, which measures the size of earthquakes in terms of the energy released. Must be greater than zero.

Attributes.Name: focalDepth
Attributes.Description: The depth below the earth's surface of the earthquake's focal point.

Attributes.Name: intensity
Attributes.Description: The intensity of the earthquake as defined by the Modified Mercalli Intensity (MMI) scale. Possible values are 1-12, corresponding to I-XII.

DerivedEntities.Name: AtmosphericPhenomenon
DerivedEntities.Description: An atmospheric phenomenon with a base and altitude providing the vertical coverage (combined with the Location to provide three dimensional space).

DerivedEntities.Name: Tornado
DerivedEntities.Description: A tornado, a violent destructive whirling wind accompanied by a funnel-shaped cloud that progresses in a narrow path over the land.

Attributes.Name: fScale
Attributes.Description: Fujita scale (referred to as EF-scale starting in 2007) for the tornado.

Attributes.Name: width
Attributes.Description: Width of the tornado during the time interval.

DerivedEntities.Name: VolcanicAshCloud
DerivedEntities.Description: An ash cloud formed as a result of a volcanic eruption.

Attributes.Name: density
Attributes.Description: Particulate density of the ash cloud during the time interval.

Attributes.Name: particleSize
Attributes.Description: The diameter of the particles during the time interval.

DerivedEntities.Name: Cyclone
DerivedEntities.Description: A cyclone (or tropical cyclone), a rapidly-rotating storm system characterized by a low-pressure center, strong winds, and a spiral arrangement of thunderstorms that produce heavy rain.

DerivedEntities.Name: Hurricane
DerivedEntities.Description: A hurricane, a subtype of cyclone occurring in the North Atlantic Ocean or North-eastern Pacific Ocean whose intensity is measured using the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale.

Attributes.Name: category
Attributes.Description: The hurricane's category during the time interval, using Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale, a 1 to 5 rating based on a hurricane's sustained wind speed.

DerivedEntities.Name: TropicalCycloneAustralia
DerivedEntities.Description: A tropical cyclone, a subtype of cyclone that forms to the east of 90E in the Southern Hemisphere whose intensity is measured by the Australian tropical cyclone intensity scale.

Attributes.Name: category
Attributes.Description:
Strength of tropical cyclone during the time interval, based on Australian Bureau of Meteorology Category System where:
1 - tropical cyclone, with typical gusts over flat land 90-125 km/h
2 - tropical cyclone, with typical gusts over flat land 125-164 km/h
3 - severe tropical cyclone, with typical gusts over flat land 165-224 km/h
4 - severe tropical cyclone, with typical gusts over flat land 225-279 km/h
5 - severe tropical cyclone, with typical gusts over flat land greater  than 280 km/h.

Attributes.Name: windForce
Attributes.Description: Wind Force as classified on the Beaufort Scale (0-12) during the time interval.

Attributes.Name: centralPressure
Attributes.Description: The central pressure of the cyclone during the time interval.

Attributes.Name: maxSurfaceWindSpeed
Attributes.Description: The maximum surface wind speed of the cyclone during the time interval.

DerivedEntities.Name: CloudCondition
DerivedEntities.Description: A classified cloud phenomenon with a type.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: The type of the cloud as defined by the CloudKind enumeration.

Attributes.Name: minCoverage
Attributes.Description: The minimum percentage coverage

Attributes.Name: altitude
Attributes.Description: The maximum altitude of the phenomenon.

Attributes.Name: direction
Attributes.Description: The direction the phenomenon is moving.

Attributes.Name: base
Attributes.Description: The base altitude of the phenomenon.

Attributes.Name: maxCoverage
Attributes.Description: The maximum percentage coverage

Attributes.Name: speed
Attributes.Description: The speed of the phenomenon

DerivedEntities.Name: HydrosphericPhenomenon
DerivedEntities.Description: A hydrospheric phenomenon.

DerivedEntities.Name: Whirlpool
DerivedEntities.Description: A whirlpool, a rapidly rotating mass of water in a river or sea into which objects may be drawn, typically caused by the meeting of conflicting currents.

DerivedEntities.Name: Tsunami
DerivedEntities.Description: A tsunami (tidal wave), a long high sea wave caused by an earthquake, submarine landslide, or other disturbance.

Attributes.Name: magnitude
Attributes.Description: Tsunami magnitude in the Tsunami Magnitude Scale (Mt).  Is greater than zero.

Attributes.Name: intensity
Attributes.Description: Tsunami intensity on the Papadopoulos-Imamura tsunami intensity scale. Possible values are 1-12, corresponding to I-XII.

DerivedEntities.Name: Flood
DerivedEntities.Description: A flood, an overflowing of a large amount of water beyond its normal confines, esp. over what is normally dry land.

Attributes.Name: timeInterval
Attributes.Description: The timestamp of the phenomenon as a single point or time interval.

Entities.Name: EnvironmentalDataProvider
Entities.Description: Entity providing environmental data.  Could be an observed weather data provider, an entity providing forecasts, an authority providing alerts, etc.

Entities.Name: Observation
Entities.Description: Observed (actual non-forecast) values sets and/or phenomena characteristics.

Entities.Name: Tsunami
Entities.Description: A tsunami (tidal wave), a long high sea wave caused by an earthquake, submarine landslide, or other disturbance.

Attributes.Name: intensity
Attributes.Description: Tsunami intensity on the Papadopoulos-Imamura tsunami intensity scale. Possible values are 1-12, corresponding to I-XII.

Attributes.Name: magnitude
Attributes.Description: Tsunami magnitude in the Tsunami Magnitude Scale (Mt).  Is greater than zero.

Entities.Name: EnvironmentalDataAuthority
Entities.Description: An entity defining classifications or categories of environmental information, like phenomena or alerts.

Entities.Name: EnvironmentalLocationType
Entities.Description: Type of environmental location. Used when an environmental alert or phenomenon has multiple locations associated with it.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: The kind of location. Typical values might be center, extent, primary, secondary, etc.

Entities.Name: Hurricane
Entities.Description: A hurricane, a subtype of cyclone occurring in the North Atlantic Ocean or North-eastern Pacific Ocean whose intensity is measured using the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale.

Attributes.Name: category
Attributes.Description: The hurricane's category during the time interval, using Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale, a 1 to 5 rating based on a hurricane's sustained wind speed.

Entities.Name: HydrosphericAnalog
Entities.Description: Analog (float) measuring a hydrospheric condition.

Attributes.Name: kind
Attributes.Description: Kind of hydrospheric analog.

Entities.Name: Landslide
Entities.Description: A landslide, a large mass of rocks and earth that suddenly and quickly moves down the side of a mountain or hill.

Entities.Name: PFVArControllerType1Dynamics
Entities.Description: Power factor or VAr controller type 1 function block whose behaviour is described by reference to a standard model <font color="#0f0f0f">or by definition of a user-defined model.</font>

DerivedEntities.Name: PFVArType1IEEEVArController
DerivedEntities.Description:
IEEE VAR controller type 1 which operates by moving the voltage reference directly.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 11.3.

Attributes.Name: vvarcbw
Attributes.Description: Var controller deadband (VVARC_BW). Typical value = 0,02.

Attributes.Name: vvtmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum machine terminal voltage needed for pf/VAr controller to be enabled (VVTMAX) (> PVFArType1IEEEVArController.vvtmin).

Attributes.Name: vvar
Attributes.Description: Synchronous machine power factor (VVAR).

Attributes.Name: vvarref
Attributes.Description: Var controller reference (VVARREF).

Attributes.Name: vvtmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum machine terminal voltage needed to enable pf/var controller (VVTMIN) (< PVFArType1IEEEVArController.vvtmax).

Attributes.Name: tvarc
Attributes.Description: Var controller time delay (TVARC) (>= 0). Typical value = 5.

DerivedEntities.Name: PFVArControllerType1UserDefined
DerivedEntities.Description: Power factor or VAr controller type 1 function block whose dynamic behaviour is described by <font color="#0f0f0f">a user-defined model.</font>

Attributes.Name: proprietary
Attributes.Description:
Behaviour is based on a proprietary model as opposed to a detailed model.
true = user-defined model is proprietary with behaviour mutually understood by sending and receiving applications and parameters passed as general attributes
false = user-defined model is explicitly defined in terms of control blocks and their input and output signals.

DerivedEntities.Name: PFVArType1IEEEPFController
DerivedEntities.Description:
IEEE PF controller type 1 which operates by moving the voltage reference directly.
Reference: IEEE 421.5-2005, 11.2.

Attributes.Name: vvtmax
Attributes.Description: Maximum machine terminal voltage needed for pf/var controller to be enabled (VVTMAX) (> PFVArType1IEEEPFController.vvtmin).

Attributes.Name: vpfcbw
Attributes.Description: PF controller deadband (VPFC_BW). Typical value = 0,05.

Attributes.Name: vitmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum machine terminal current needed to enable pf/var controller (VITMIN).

Attributes.Name: vvtmin
Attributes.Description: Minimum machine terminal voltage needed to enable pf/var controller (VVTMIN) (< PFVArType1IEEEPFController.vvtmax).

Attributes.Name: ovex
Attributes.Description: Overexcitation Flag (OVEX) true = overexcited false = underexcited.

Attributes.Name: tpfc
Attributes.Description: PF controller time delay (TPFC) (>= 0). Typical value = 5.

Attributes.Name: vpf
Attributes.Description: Synchronous machine power factor (VPF).

Attributes.Name: vpfref
Attributes.Description: PF controller reference (VPFREF).

Entities.Name: Source
Entities.Description: Source gives information related to the origin of a value.

Attributes.Name: PROCESS
Attributes.Description: The value is provided by input from the process I/O or being calculated from some function.

Attributes.Name: SUBSTITUTED
Attributes.Description: The value is provided by input of an operator or by an automatic source.

Attributes.Name: DEFAULTED
Attributes.Description: The value contains a default value.

Entities.Name: RemoteUnitType
Entities.Description: Type of remote unit.

Attributes.Name: SubstationControlSystem
Attributes.Description: Substation control system.

Attributes.Name: RTU
Attributes.Description: Remote terminal unit.

Attributes.Name: IED
Attributes.Description: Intelligent electronic device (IED).

Attributes.Name: ControlCenter
Attributes.Description: Control centre.

Entities.Name: RemoteSource
Entities.Description: Remote sources are state variables that are telemetered or calculated within the remote unit.

Attributes.Name: deadband
Attributes.Description: The smallest change in value to be reported.

Attributes.Name: scanInterval
Attributes.Description: The time interval between scans.

Attributes.Name: sensorMinimum
Attributes.Description: The minimum value the telemetry item can return.

Attributes.Name: sensorMaximum
Attributes.Description: The maximum value the telemetry item can return.

Entities.Name: RemotePoint
Entities.Description: For an RTU, remote points correspond to telemetered values or control outputs. Other units (e.g. control centres) usually also contain calculated values.

DerivedEntities.Name: RemoteControl
DerivedEntities.Description: Remote controls are outputs that are sent by the remote unit to actuators in the process.

Attributes.Name: actuatorMaximum
Attributes.Description: The maximum set point value accepted by the remote control point.

Attributes.Name: actuatorMinimum
Attributes.Description: The minimum set point value accepted by the remote control point.

Attributes.Name: remoteControlled
Attributes.Description: Set to true if the actuator is remotely controlled.

Attributes.Description: Set to true if the actuator is remotely controlled.

Attributes.Name: actuatorMaximum
Attributes.Description: The maximum set point value accepted by the remote control point.

Attributes.Name: actuatorMinimum
Attributes.Description: The minimum set point value accepted by the remote control point.

Entities.Description: Kind of regulation branch for shunt impedance.

Entities.Name: TransformerFunctionKind
Entities.Description: Function of a transformer.

Entities.Name: TransformerConstructionKind
Entities.Description: Kind of transformer construction.

Entities.Name: TransformerCoreKind
Entities.Description: Kind of transformer construction.

Entities.Name: ShuntImpedanceControlKind
Entities.Description: Kind of control for shunt impedance.

Entities.Name: FaultIndicatorResetKind
Entities.Description: Kind of resetting the fault indicators.

Entities.Name: WindingInsulationKind
Entities.Description: Insulation kind for windings.

Entities.Name: OilPreservationKind
Entities.Description: Kind of oil preservation.

Entities.Name: ShuntImpedanceLocalControlKind
Entities.Description: Kind of local control for shunt impedance.
